2848  IMGUI_TEST_ENGINE_ID_INFO(id, ImGuiDataType_Pointer, ptr);
2849 #endif
2850  return id;
2851 }
2852 
2853 ImGuiID ImGuiWindow::GetIDNoKeepAlive(int n)
2854 {
2855  ImGuiID seed = IDStack.back();
2856  ImGuiID id = ImHashData(&n, sizeof(n), seed);
2857 #ifdef IMGUI_ENABLE_TEST_ENGINE
2858  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
2859  IMGUI_TEST_ENGINE_ID_INFO(id, ImGuiDataType_S32, (intptr_t)n);
2860 #endif
2861  return id;
2862 }
2863 
2864 // This is only used in rare/specific situations to manufacture an ID out of nowhere.
2865 ImGuiID ImGuiWindow::GetIDFromRectangle(const ImRect& r_abs)
2866 {
2867  ImGuiID seed = IDStack.back();
2868  const int r_rel[4] = { (int)(r_abs.Min.x - Pos.x), (int)(r_abs.Min.y - Pos.y), (int)(r_abs.Max.x - Pos.x), (int)(r_abs.Max.y - Pos.y) };
2869  ImGuiID id = ImHashData(&r_rel, sizeof(r_rel), seed);
2870  ImGui::KeepAliveID(id);
2871  return id;
2872 }
2873 
2874 static void SetCurrentWindow(ImGuiWindow* window)
2875 {
2876  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
2877  g.CurrentWindow = window;
2878  if (window)
2879  g.FontSize = g.DrawListSharedData.FontSize = window->CalcFontSize();
2880 }
2881 
2882 // Free up/compact internal window buffers, we can use this when a window becomes unused.
2883 // This is currently unused by the library, but you may call this yourself for easy GC.
2884 // Not freed:
2885 // - ImGuiWindow, ImGuiWindowSettings, Name
2886 // - StateStorage, ColumnsStorage (may hold useful data)
2887 // This should have no noticeable visual effect. When the window reappear however, expect new allocation/buffer growth/copy cost.
2888 void ImGui::GcCompactTransientWindowBuffers(ImGuiWindow* window)
2889 {
2890  window->MemoryCompacted = true;
2891  window->MemoryDrawListIdxCapacity = window->DrawList->IdxBuffer.Capacity;
2892  window->MemoryDrawListVtxCapacity = window->DrawList->VtxBuffer.Capacity;
2893  window->IDStack.clear();
2894  window->DrawList->_ClearFreeMemory();
2895  window->DC.ChildWindows.clear();
2896  window->DC.ItemFlagsStack.clear();
2897  window->DC.ItemWidthStack.clear();
2898  window->DC.TextWrapPosStack.clear();
2899  window->DC.GroupStack.clear();
2900 }
2901 
2902 void ImGui::GcAwakeTransientWindowBuffers(ImGuiWindow* window)
2903 {
2904  // We stored capacity of the ImDrawList buffer to reduce growth-caused allocation/copy when awakening.
2905  // The other buffers tends to amortize much faster.
2906  window->MemoryCompacted = false;
2907  window->DrawList->IdxBuffer.reserve(window->MemoryDrawListIdxCapacity);
2908  window->DrawList->VtxBuffer.reserve(window->MemoryDrawListVtxCapacity);
2909  window->MemoryDrawListIdxCapacity = window->MemoryDrawListVtxCapacity = 0;
2910 }
2911 
2912 void ImGui::SetActiveID(ImGuiID id, ImGuiWindow* window)
2913 {
2914  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
2915  g.ActiveIdIsJustActivated = (g.ActiveId != id);
2916  if (g.ActiveIdIsJustActivated)
2917  {
2918  g.ActiveIdTimer = 0.0f;
2919  g.ActiveIdHasBeenPressedBefore = false;
2920  g.ActiveIdHasBeenEditedBefore = false;
2921  if (id != 0)
2922  {
2923  g.LastActiveId = id;
2924  g.LastActiveIdTimer = 0.0f;
2925  }
2926  }
2927  g.ActiveId = id;
2928  g.ActiveIdAllowOverlap = false;
2929  g.ActiveIdWindow = window;
2930  g.ActiveIdHasBeenEditedThisFrame = false;
2931  if (id)
2932  {
2933  g.ActiveIdIsAlive = id;
2934  g.ActiveIdSource = (g.NavActivateId == id || g.NavInputId == id || g.NavJustTabbedId == id || g.NavJustMovedToId == id) ? ImGuiInputSource_Nav : ImGuiInputSource_Mouse;
2935  }
2936 
2937  // Clear declaration of inputs claimed by the widget
2938  // (Please note that this is WIP and not all keys/inputs are thoroughly declared by all widgets yet)
2939  g.ActiveIdUsingNavDirMask = 0x00;
2940  g.ActiveIdUsingNavInputMask = 0x00;
2941  g.ActiveIdUsingKeyInputMask = 0x00;
2942 }
2943 
2944 void ImGui::ClearActiveID()
2945 {
2946  SetActiveID(0, NULL);
2947 }
2948 
2949 void ImGui::SetHoveredID(ImGuiID id)
2950 {
2951  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
2952  g.HoveredId = id;
2953  g.HoveredIdAllowOverlap = false;
2954  if (id != 0 && g.HoveredIdPreviousFrame != id)
2955  g.HoveredIdTimer = g.HoveredIdNotActiveTimer = 0.0f;
2956 }
2957 
2958 ImGuiID ImGui::GetHoveredID()
2959 {
2960  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
2961  return g.HoveredId ? g.HoveredId : g.HoveredIdPreviousFrame;
2962 }
2963 
2964 void ImGui::KeepAliveID(ImGuiID id)
2965 {
2966  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
2967  if (g.ActiveId == id)
2968  g.ActiveIdIsAlive = id;
2969  if (g.ActiveIdPreviousFrame == id)
2970  g.ActiveIdPreviousFrameIsAlive = true;
2971 }
2972 
2973 void ImGui::MarkItemEdited(ImGuiID id)
2974 {
2975  // This marking is solely to be able to provide info for IsItemDeactivatedAfterEdit().
2976  // ActiveId might have been released by the time we call this (as in the typical press/release button behavior) but still need need to fill the data.
2977  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
2978  IM_ASSERT(g.ActiveId == id || g.ActiveId == 0 || g.DragDropActive);
2979  IM_UNUSED(id); // Avoid unused variable warnings when asserts are compiled out.
2980  //IM_ASSERT(g.CurrentWindow->DC.LastItemId == id);
2981  g.ActiveIdHasBeenEditedThisFrame = true;
2982  g.ActiveIdHasBeenEditedBefore = true;
2983  g.CurrentWindow->DC.LastItemStatusFlags |= ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Edited;
2984 }
2985 
2986 static inline bool IsWindowContentHoverable(ImGuiWindow* window, ImGuiHoveredFlags flags)
2987 {
2988  // An active popup disable hovering on other windows (apart from its own children)
2989  // FIXME-OPT: This could be cached/stored within the window.
2990  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
2991  if (g.NavWindow)
2992  if (ImGuiWindow* focused_root_window = g.NavWindow->RootWindow)
2993  if (focused_root_window->WasActive && focused_root_window != window->RootWindow)
2994  {
2995  // For the purpose of those flags we differentiate "standard popup" from "modal popup"
2996  // NB: The order of those two tests is important because Modal windows are also Popups.
2997  if (focused_root_window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Modal)
2998  return false;
2999  if ((focused_root_window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup) && !(flags & ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByPopup))
3000  return false;
3001  }
3002  return true;
3003 }
3004 
3005 // This is roughly matching the behavior of internal-facing ItemHoverable()
3006 // - we allow hovering to be true when ActiveId==window->MoveID, so that clicking on non-interactive items such as a Text() item still returns true with IsItemHovered()
3007 // - this should work even for non-interactive items that have no ID, so we cannot use LastItemId
3008 bool ImGui::IsItemHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags flags)
3009 {
3010  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3011  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
3012  if (g.NavDisableMouseHover && !g.NavDisableHighlight)
3013  return IsItemFocused();
3014 
3015  // Test for bounding box overlap, as updated as ItemAdd()
3016  if (!(window->DC.LastItemStatusFlags & ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HoveredRect))
3017  return false;
3018  IM_ASSERT((flags & (ImGuiHoveredFlags_RootWindow | ImGuiHoveredFlags_ChildWindows)) == 0); // Flags not supported by this function
3019 
3020  // Test if we are hovering the right window (our window could be behind another window)
3021  // [2017/10/16] Reverted commit 344d48be3 and testing RootWindow instead. I believe it is correct to NOT test for RootWindow but this leaves us unable to use IsItemHovered() after EndChild() itself.
3022  // Until a solution is found I believe reverting to the test from 2017/09/27 is safe since this was the test that has been running for a long while.
3023  //if (g.HoveredWindow != window)
3024  // return false;
3025  if (g.HoveredRootWindow != window->RootWindow && !(flags & ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenOverlapped))
3026  return false;
3027 
3028  // Test if another item is active (e.g. being dragged)
3029  if (!(flags & ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByActiveItem))
3030  if (g.ActiveId != 0 && g.ActiveId != window->DC.LastItemId && !g.ActiveIdAllowOverlap && g.ActiveId != window->MoveId)
3031  return false;
3032 
3033  // Test if interactions on this window are blocked by an active popup or modal.
3034  // The ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByPopup flag will be tested here.
3035  if (!IsWindowContentHoverable(window, flags))
3036  return false;
3037 
3038  // Test if the item is disabled
3039  if ((window->DC.ItemFlags & ImGuiItemFlags_Disabled) && !(flags & ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenDisabled))
3040  return false;
3041 
3042  // Special handling for the dummy item after Begin() which represent the title bar or tab.
3043  // When the window is collapsed (SkipItems==true) that last item will never be overwritten so we need to detect the case.
3044  if (window->DC.LastItemId == window->MoveId && window->WriteAccessed)
3045  return false;
3046  return true;
3047 }
3048 
3049 // Internal facing ItemHoverable() used when submitting widgets. Differs slightly from IsItemHovered().
3050 bool ImGui::ItemHoverable(const ImRect& bb, ImGuiID id)
3051 {
3052  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3053  if (g.HoveredId != 0 && g.HoveredId != id && !g.HoveredIdAllowOverlap)
3054  return false;
3055 
3056  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
3057  if (g.HoveredWindow != window)
3058  return false;
3059  if (g.ActiveId != 0 && g.ActiveId != id && !g.ActiveIdAllowOverlap)
3060  return false;
3061  if (!IsMouseHoveringRect(bb.Min, bb.Max))
3062  return false;
3063  if (g.NavDisableMouseHover || !IsWindowContentHoverable(window, ImGuiHoveredFlags_None))
3064  return false;
3065  if (window->DC.ItemFlags & ImGuiItemFlags_Disabled)
3066  return false;
3067 
3068  // We exceptionally allow this function to be called with id==0 to allow using it for easy high-level
3069  // hover test in widgets code. We could also decide to split this function is two.
3070  if (id != 0)
3071  {
3072  SetHoveredID(id);
3073 
3074  // [DEBUG] Item Picker tool!
3075  // We perform the check here because SetHoveredID() is not frequently called (1~ time a frame), making
3076  // the cost of this tool near-zero. We can get slightly better call-stack and support picking non-hovered
3077  // items if we perform the test in ItemAdd(), but that would incur a small runtime cost.
3078  // #define IMGUI_DEBUG_TOOL_ITEM_PICKER_EX in imconfig.h if you want this check to also be performed in ItemAdd().
3079  if (g.DebugItemPickerActive && g.HoveredIdPreviousFrame == id)
3080  GetForegroundDrawList()->AddRect(bb.Min, bb.Max, IM_COL32(255, 255, 0, 255));
3081  if (g.DebugItemPickerBreakId == id)
3082  IM_DEBUG_BREAK();
3083  }
3084 
3085  return true;
3086 }
3087 
3088 bool ImGui::IsClippedEx(const ImRect& bb, ImGuiID id, bool clip_even_when_logged)
3089 {
3090  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3091  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
3092  if (!bb.Overlaps(window->ClipRect))
3093  if (id == 0 || (id != g.ActiveId && id != g.NavId))
3094  if (clip_even_when_logged || !g.LogEnabled)
3095  return true;
3096  return false;
3097 }
3098 
3099 // Process TAB/Shift+TAB. Be mindful that this function may _clear_ the ActiveID when tabbing out.
3100 bool ImGui::FocusableItemRegister(ImGuiWindow* window, ImGuiID id)
3101 {
3102  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3103 
3104  // Increment counters
3105  const bool is_tab_stop = (window->DC.ItemFlags & (ImGuiItemFlags_NoTabStop | ImGuiItemFlags_Disabled)) == 0;
3106  window->DC.FocusCounterRegular++;
3107  if (is_tab_stop)
3108  window->DC.FocusCounterTabStop++;
3109 
3110  // Process TAB/Shift-TAB to tab *OUT* of the currently focused item.
3111  // (Note that we can always TAB out of a widget that doesn't allow tabbing in)
3112  if (g.ActiveId == id && g.FocusTabPressed && !IsActiveIdUsingKey(ImGuiKey_Tab) && g.FocusRequestNextWindow == NULL)
3113  {
3114  g.FocusRequestNextWindow = window;
3115  g.FocusRequestNextCounterTabStop = window->DC.FocusCounterTabStop + (g.IO.KeyShift ? (is_tab_stop ? -1 : 0) : +1); // Modulo on index will be applied at the end of frame once we've got the total counter of items.
3116  }
3117 
3118  // Handle focus requests
3119  if (g.FocusRequestCurrWindow == window)
3120  {
3121  if (window->DC.FocusCounterRegular == g.FocusRequestCurrCounterRegular)
3122  return true;
3123  if (is_tab_stop && window->DC.FocusCounterTabStop == g.FocusRequestCurrCounterTabStop)
3124  {
3125  g.NavJustTabbedId = id;
3126  return true;
3127  }
3128 
3129  // If another item is about to be focused, we clear our own active id
3130  if (g.ActiveId == id)
3131  ClearActiveID();
3132  }
3133 
3134  return false;
3135 }
3136 
3137 void ImGui::FocusableItemUnregister(ImGuiWindow* window)
3138 {
3139  window->DC.FocusCounterRegular--;
3140  window->DC.FocusCounterTabStop--;
3141 }
3142 
3143 float ImGui::CalcWrapWidthForPos(const ImVec2& pos, float wrap_pos_x)
3144 {
3145  if (wrap_pos_x < 0.0f)
3146  return 0.0f;
3147 
3148  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3149  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
3150  if (wrap_pos_x == 0.0f)
3151  {
3152  // We could decide to setup a default wrapping max point for auto-resizing windows,
3153  // or have auto-wrap (with unspecified wrapping pos) behave as a ContentSize extending function?
3154  //if (window->Hidden && (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize))
3155  // wrap_pos_x = ImMax(window->WorkRect.Min.x + g.FontSize * 10.0f, window->WorkRect.Max.x);
3156  //else
3157  wrap_pos_x = window->WorkRect.Max.x;
3158  }
3159  else if (wrap_pos_x > 0.0f)
3160  {
3161  wrap_pos_x += window->Pos.x - window->Scroll.x; // wrap_pos_x is provided is window local space
3162  }
3163 
3164  return ImMax(wrap_pos_x - pos.x, 1.0f);
3165 }
3166 
3167 // IM_ALLOC() == ImGui::MemAlloc()
3168 void* ImGui::MemAlloc(size_t size)
3169 {
3170  if (ImGuiContext* ctx = GImGui)
3171  ctx->IO.MetricsActiveAllocations++;
3172  return GImAllocatorAllocFunc(size, GImAllocatorUserData);
3173 }
3174 
3175 // IM_FREE() == ImGui::MemFree()
3176 void ImGui::MemFree(void* ptr)
3177 {
3178  if (ptr)
3179  if (ImGuiContext* ctx = GImGui)
3180  ctx->IO.MetricsActiveAllocations--;
3181  return GImAllocatorFreeFunc(ptr, GImAllocatorUserData);
3182 }
3183 
3184 const char* ImGui::GetClipboardText()
3185 {
3186  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3187  return g.IO.GetClipboardTextFn ? g.IO.GetClipboardTextFn(g.IO.ClipboardUserData) : "";
3188 }
3189 
3190 void ImGui::SetClipboardText(const char* text)
3191 {
3192  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3193  if (g.IO.SetClipboardTextFn)
3194  g.IO.SetClipboardTextFn(g.IO.ClipboardUserData, text);
3195 }
3196 
3197 const char* ImGui::GetVersion()
3198 {
3199  return IMGUI_VERSION;
3200 }
3201 
3202 // Internal state access - if you want to share Dear ImGui state between modules (e.g. DLL) or allocate it yourself
3203 // Note that we still point to some static data and members (such as GFontAtlas), so the state instance you end up using will point to the static data within its module
3204 ImGuiContext* ImGui::GetCurrentContext()
3205 {
3206  return GImGui;
3207 }
3208 
3209 void ImGui::SetCurrentContext(ImGuiContext* ctx)
3210 {
3211 #ifdef IMGUI_SET_CURRENT_CONTEXT_FUNC
3212  IMGUI_SET_CURRENT_CONTEXT_FUNC(ctx); // For custom thread-based hackery you may want to have control over this.
3213 #else
3214  GImGui = ctx;
3215 #endif
3216 }
3217 
3218 void ImGui::SetAllocatorFunctions(void* (*alloc_func)(size_t sz, void* user_data), void (*free_func)(void* ptr, void* user_data), void* user_data)
3219 {
3220  GImAllocatorAllocFunc = alloc_func;
3221  GImAllocatorFreeFunc = free_func;
3222  GImAllocatorUserData = user_data;
3223 }
3224 
3225 ImGuiContext* ImGui::CreateContext(ImFontAtlas* shared_font_atlas)
3226 {
3227  ImGuiContext* ctx = IM_NEW(ImGuiContext)(shared_font_atlas);
3228  if (GImGui == NULL)
3229  SetCurrentContext(ctx);
3230  Initialize(ctx);
3231  return ctx;
3232 }
3233 
3234 void ImGui::DestroyContext(ImGuiContext* ctx)
3235 {
3236  if (ctx == NULL)
3237  ctx = GImGui;
3238  Shutdown(ctx);
3239  if (GImGui == ctx)
3240  SetCurrentContext(NULL);
3241  IM_DELETE(ctx);
3242 }
3243 
3244 ImGuiIO& ImGui::GetIO()
3245 {
3246  IM_ASSERT(GImGui != NULL && "No current context. Did you call ImGui::CreateContext() and ImGui::SetCurrentContext() ?");
3247  return GImGui->IO;
3248 }
3249 
3250 // Same value as passed to the old io.RenderDrawListsFn function. Valid after Render() and until the next call to NewFrame()
3251 ImDrawData* ImGui::GetDrawData()
3252 {
3253  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3254  return g.DrawData.Valid ? &g.DrawData : NULL;
3255 }

3275 }
3276 
3277 ImDrawListSharedData* ImGui::GetDrawListSharedData()
3278 {
3279  return &GImGui->DrawListSharedData;
3280 }
3281 
3282 void ImGui::StartMouseMovingWindow(ImGuiWindow* window)
3283 {
3284  // Set ActiveId even if the _NoMove flag is set. Without it, dragging away from a window with _NoMove would activate hover on other windows.
3285  // We _also_ call this when clicking in a window empty space when io.ConfigWindowsMoveFromTitleBarOnly is set, but clear g.MovingWindow afterward.
3286  // This is because we want ActiveId to be set even when the window is not permitted to move.
3287  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3288  FocusWindow(window);
3289  SetActiveID(window->MoveId, window);
3290  g.NavDisableHighlight = true;
3291  g.ActiveIdClickOffset = g.IO.MousePos - window->RootWindow->Pos;
3292 
3293  bool can_move_window = true;
3294  if ((window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMove) || (window->RootWindow->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMove))
3295  can_move_window = false;
3296  if (can_move_window)
3297  g.MovingWindow = window;
3298 }
3299 
3300 // Handle mouse moving window
3301 // Note: moving window with the navigation keys (Square + d-pad / CTRL+TAB + Arrows) are processed in NavUpdateWindowing()
3302 // FIXME: We don't have strong guarantee that g.MovingWindow stay synched with g.ActiveId == g.MovingWindow->MoveId.
3303 // This is currently enforced by the fact that BeginDragDropSource() is setting all g.ActiveIdUsingXXXX flags to inhibit navigation inputs,
3304 // but if we should more thoroughly test cases where g.ActiveId or g.MovingWindow gets changed and not the other.
3305 void ImGui::UpdateMouseMovingWindowNewFrame()
3306 {
3307  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3308  if (g.MovingWindow != NULL)
3309  {
3310  // We actually want to move the root window. g.MovingWindow == window we clicked on (could be a child window).
3311  // We track it to preserve Focus and so that generally ActiveIdWindow == MovingWindow and ActiveId == MovingWindow->MoveId for consistency.
3312  KeepAliveID(g.ActiveId);
3313  IM_ASSERT(g.MovingWindow && g.MovingWindow->RootWindow);
3314  ImGuiWindow* moving_window = g.MovingWindow->RootWindow;
3315  if (g.IO.MouseDown[0] && IsMousePosValid(&g.IO.MousePos))
3316  {
3317  ImVec2 pos = g.IO.MousePos - g.ActiveIdClickOffset;
3318  if (moving_window->Pos.x != pos.x || moving_window->Pos.y != pos.y)
3319  {
3320  MarkIniSettingsDirty(moving_window);
3321  SetWindowPos(moving_window, pos, ImGuiCond_Always);
3322  }
3323  FocusWindow(g.MovingWindow);
3324  }
3325  else
3326  {
3327  ClearActiveID();
3328  g.MovingWindow = NULL;
3329  }
3330  }
3331  else
3332  {
3333  // When clicking/dragging from a window that has the _NoMove flag, we still set the ActiveId in order to prevent hovering others.
3334  if (g.ActiveIdWindow && g.ActiveIdWindow->MoveId == g.ActiveId)
3335  {
3336  KeepAliveID(g.ActiveId);
3337  if (!g.IO.MouseDown[0])
3338  ClearActiveID();
3339  }
3340  }
3341 }
3342 
3343 // Initiate moving window when clicking on empty space or title bar.
3344 // Handle left-click and right-click focus.
3345 void ImGui::UpdateMouseMovingWindowEndFrame()
3346 {
3347  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3348  if (g.ActiveId != 0 || g.HoveredId != 0)
3349  return;
3350 
3351  // Unless we just made a window/popup appear
3352  if (g.NavWindow && g.NavWindow->Appearing)
3353  return;
3354 
3355  // Click on empty space to focus window and start moving (after we're done with all our widgets)
3356  if (g.IO.MouseClicked[0])
3357  {
3358  // Handle the edge case of a popup being closed while clicking in its empty space.
3359  // If we try to focus it, FocusWindow() > ClosePopupsOverWindow() will accidentally close any parent popups because they are not linked together any more.
3360  ImGuiWindow* root_window = g.HoveredRootWindow;
3361  const bool is_closed_popup = root_window && (root_window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup) && !IsPopupOpen(root_window->PopupId, ImGuiPopupFlags_AnyPopupLevel);
3362 
3363  if (root_window != NULL && !is_closed_popup)
3364  {
3365  StartMouseMovingWindow(g.HoveredWindow);
3366  if (g.IO.ConfigWindowsMoveFromTitleBarOnly && !(root_window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar))
3367  if (!root_window->TitleBarRect().Contains(g.IO.MouseClickedPos[0]))
3368  g.MovingWindow = NULL;
3369  }
3370  else if (root_window == NULL && g.NavWindow != NULL && GetTopMostPopupModal() == NULL)
3371  {
3372  // Clicking on void disable focus
3373  FocusWindow(NULL);
3374  }
3375  }
3376 
3377  // With right mouse button we close popups without changing focus based on where the mouse is aimed
3378  // Instead, focus will be restored to the window under the bottom-most closed popup.
3379  // (The left mouse button path calls FocusWindow on the hovered window, which will lead NewFrame->ClosePopupsOverWindow to trigger)
3380  if (g.IO.MouseClicked[1])
3381  {
3382  // Find the top-most window between HoveredWindow and the top-most Modal Window.
3383  // This is where we can trim the popup stack.
3384  ImGuiWindow* modal = GetTopMostPopupModal();
3385  bool hovered_window_above_modal = false;
3386  if (modal == NULL)
3387  hovered_window_above_modal = true;
3388  for (int i = g.Windows.Size - 1; i >= 0 && hovered_window_above_modal == false; i--)
3389  {
3390  ImGuiWindow* window = g.Windows[i];
3391  if (window == modal)
3392  break;
3393  if (window == g.HoveredWindow)
3394  hovered_window_above_modal = true;
3395  }
3396  ClosePopupsOverWindow(hovered_window_above_modal ? g.HoveredWindow : modal, true);
3397  }
3398 }
3399 
3400 static bool IsWindowActiveAndVisible(ImGuiWindow* window)
3401 {
3402  return (window->Active) && (!window->Hidden);
3403 }
3404 
3405 static void ImGui::UpdateMouseInputs()
3406 {
3407  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3408 
3409  // Round mouse position to avoid spreading non-rounded position (e.g. UpdateManualResize doesn't support them well)
3410  if (IsMousePosValid(&g.IO.MousePos))
3411  g.IO.MousePos = g.LastValidMousePos = ImFloor(g.IO.MousePos);
3412 
3413  // If mouse just appeared or disappeared (usually denoted by -FLT_MAX components) we cancel out movement in MouseDelta
3414  if (IsMousePosValid(&g.IO.MousePos) && IsMousePosValid(&g.IO.MousePosPrev))
3415  g.IO.MouseDelta = g.IO.MousePos - g.IO.MousePosPrev;
3416  else
3417  g.IO.MouseDelta = ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f);
3418  if (g.IO.MouseDelta.x != 0.0f || g.IO.MouseDelta.y != 0.0f)
3419  g.NavDisableMouseHover = false;
3420 
3421  g.IO.MousePosPrev = g.IO.MousePos;
3422  for (int i = 0; i < IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.IO.MouseDown); i++)
3423  {
3424  g.IO.MouseClicked[i] = g.IO.MouseDown[i] && g.IO.MouseDownDuration[i] < 0.0f;
3425  g.IO.MouseReleased[i] = !g.IO.MouseDown[i] && g.IO.MouseDownDuration[i] >= 0.0f;
3426  g.IO.MouseDownDurationPrev[i] = g.IO.MouseDownDuration[i];
3427  g.IO.MouseDownDuration[i] = g.IO.MouseDown[i] ? (g.IO.MouseDownDuration[i] < 0.0f ? 0.0f : g.IO.MouseDownDuration[i] + g.IO.DeltaTime) : -1.0f;
3428  g.IO.MouseDoubleClicked[i] = false;
3429  if (g.IO.MouseClicked[i])
3430  {
3431  if ((float)(g.Time - g.IO.MouseClickedTime[i]) < g.IO.MouseDoubleClickTime)
3432  {
3433  ImVec2 delta_from_click_pos = IsMousePosValid(&g.IO.MousePos) ? (g.IO.MousePos - g.IO.MouseClickedPos[i]) : ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f);
3434  if (ImLengthSqr(delta_from_click_pos) < g.IO.MouseDoubleClickMaxDist * g.IO.MouseDoubleClickMaxDist)
3435  g.IO.MouseDoubleClicked[i] = true;
3436  g.IO.MouseClickedTime[i] = -g.IO.MouseDoubleClickTime * 2.0f; // Mark as "old enough" so the third click isn't turned into a double-click
3437  }
3438  else
3439  {
3440  g.IO.MouseClickedTime[i] = g.Time;
3441  }
3442  g.IO.MouseClickedPos[i] = g.IO.MousePos;
3443  g.IO.MouseDownWasDoubleClick[i] = g.IO.MouseDoubleClicked[i];
3444  g.IO.MouseDragMaxDistanceAbs[i] = ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f);
3445  g.IO.MouseDragMaxDistanceSqr[i] = 0.0f;
3446  }
3447  else if (g.IO.MouseDown[i])
3448  {
3449  // Maintain the maximum distance we reaching from the initial click position, which is used with dragging threshold
3450  ImVec2 delta_from_click_pos = IsMousePosValid(&g.IO.MousePos) ? (g.IO.MousePos - g.IO.MouseClickedPos[i]) : ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f);
3451  g.IO.MouseDragMaxDistanceSqr[i] = ImMax(g.IO.MouseDragMaxDistanceSqr[i], ImLengthSqr(delta_from_click_pos));
3452  g.IO.MouseDragMaxDistanceAbs[i].x = ImMax(g.IO.MouseDragMaxDistanceAbs[i].x, delta_from_click_pos.x < 0.0f ? -delta_from_click_pos.x : delta_from_click_pos.x);
3453  g.IO.MouseDragMaxDistanceAbs[i].y = ImMax(g.IO.MouseDragMaxDistanceAbs[i].y, delta_from_click_pos.y < 0.0f ? -delta_from_click_pos.y : delta_from_click_pos.y);
3454  }
3455  if (!g.IO.MouseDown[i] && !g.IO.MouseReleased[i])
3456  g.IO.MouseDownWasDoubleClick[i] = false;
3457  if (g.IO.MouseClicked[i]) // Clicking any mouse button reactivate mouse hovering which may have been deactivated by gamepad/keyboard navigation
3458  g.NavDisableMouseHover = false;
3459  }
3460 }
3461 
3462 static void StartLockWheelingWindow(ImGuiWindow* window)
3463 {
3464  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3465  if (g.WheelingWindow == window)
3466  return;
3467  g.WheelingWindow = window;
3468  g.WheelingWindowRefMousePos = g.IO.MousePos;
3469  g.WheelingWindowTimer = WINDOWS_MOUSE_WHEEL_SCROLL_LOCK_TIMER;
3470 }
3471 
3472 void ImGui::UpdateMouseWheel()
3473 {
3474  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3475 
3476  // Reset the locked window if we move the mouse or after the timer elapses
3477  if (g.WheelingWindow != NULL)
3478  {
3479  g.WheelingWindowTimer -= g.IO.DeltaTime;
3480  if (IsMousePosValid() && ImLengthSqr(g.IO.MousePos - g.WheelingWindowRefMousePos) > g.IO.MouseDragThreshold * g.IO.MouseDragThreshold)
3481  g.WheelingWindowTimer = 0.0f;
3482  if (g.WheelingWindowTimer <= 0.0f)
3483  {
3484  g.WheelingWindow = NULL;
3485  g.WheelingWindowTimer = 0.0f;
3486  }
3487  }
3488 
3489  if (g.IO.MouseWheel == 0.0f && g.IO.MouseWheelH == 0.0f)
3490  return;
3491 
3492  ImGuiWindow* window = g.WheelingWindow ? g.WheelingWindow : g.HoveredWindow;
3493  if (!window || window->Collapsed)
3494  return;
3495 
3496  // Zoom / Scale window
3497  // FIXME-OBSOLETE: This is an old feature, it still works but pretty much nobody is using it and may be best redesigned.
3498  if (g.IO.MouseWheel != 0.0f && g.IO.KeyCtrl && g.IO.FontAllowUserScaling)
3499  {
3500  StartLockWheelingWindow(window);
3501  const float new_font_scale = ImClamp(window->FontWindowScale + g.IO.MouseWheel * 0.10f, 0.50f, 2.50f);
3502  const float scale = new_font_scale / window->FontWindowScale;
3503  window->FontWindowScale = new_font_scale;
3504  if (!(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow))
3505  {
3506  const ImVec2 offset = window->Size * (1.0f - scale) * (g.IO.MousePos - window->Pos) / window->Size;
3507  SetWindowPos(window, window->Pos + offset, 0);
3508  window->Size = ImFloor(window->Size * scale);
3509  window->SizeFull = ImFloor(window->SizeFull * scale);
3510  }
3511  return;
3512  }
3513 
3514  // Mouse wheel scrolling
3515  // If a child window has the ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollWithMouse flag, we give a chance to scroll its parent
3516 
3517  // Vertical Mouse Wheel scrolling
3518  const float wheel_y = (g.IO.MouseWheel != 0.0f && !g.IO.KeyShift) ? g.IO.MouseWheel : 0.0f;
3519  if (wheel_y != 0.0f && !g.IO.KeyCtrl)
3520  {
3521  StartLockWheelingWindow(window);
3522  while ((window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) && ((window->ScrollMax.y == 0.0f) || ((window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollWithMouse) && !(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMouseInputs))))
3523  window = window->ParentWindow;
3524  if (!(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollWithMouse) && !(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMouseInputs))
3525  {
3526  float max_step = window->InnerRect.GetHeight() * 0.67f;
3527  float scroll_step = ImFloor(ImMin(5 * window->CalcFontSize(), max_step));
3528  SetScrollY(window, window->Scroll.y - wheel_y * scroll_step);
3529  }
3530  }
3531 
3532  // Horizontal Mouse Wheel scrolling, or Vertical Mouse Wheel w/ Shift held
3533  const float wheel_x = (g.IO.MouseWheelH != 0.0f && !g.IO.KeyShift) ? g.IO.MouseWheelH : (g.IO.MouseWheel != 0.0f && g.IO.KeyShift) ? g.IO.MouseWheel : 0.0f;
3534  if (wheel_x != 0.0f && !g.IO.KeyCtrl)
3535  {
3536  StartLockWheelingWindow(window);
3537  while ((window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) && ((window->ScrollMax.x == 0.0f) || ((window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollWithMouse) && !(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMouseInputs))))
3538  window = window->ParentWindow;
3539  if (!(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollWithMouse) && !(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMouseInputs))
3540  {
3541  float max_step = window->InnerRect.GetWidth() * 0.67f;
3542  float scroll_step = ImFloor(ImMin(2 * window->CalcFontSize(), max_step));
3543  SetScrollX(window, window->Scroll.x - wheel_x * scroll_step);
3544  }
3545  }
3546 }
3547 
3548 void ImGui::UpdateTabFocus()
3549 {
3550  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3551 
3552  // Pressing TAB activate widget focus
3553  g.FocusTabPressed = (g.NavWindow && g.NavWindow->Active && !(g.NavWindow->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavInputs) && !g.IO.KeyCtrl && IsKeyPressedMap(ImGuiKey_Tab));
3554  if (g.ActiveId == 0 && g.FocusTabPressed)
3555  {
3556  // Note that SetKeyboardFocusHere() sets the Next fields mid-frame. To be consistent we also
3557  // manipulate the Next fields even, even though they will be turned into Curr fields by the code below.
3558  g.FocusRequestNextWindow = g.NavWindow;
3559  g.FocusRequestNextCounterRegular = INT_MAX;
3560  if (g.NavId != 0 && g.NavIdTabCounter != INT_MAX)
3561  g.FocusRequestNextCounterTabStop = g.NavIdTabCounter + 1 + (g.IO.KeyShift ? -1 : 1);
3562  else
3563  g.FocusRequestNextCounterTabStop = g.IO.KeyShift ? -1 : 0;
3564  }
3565 
3566  // Turn queued focus request into current one
3567  g.FocusRequestCurrWindow = NULL;
3568  g.FocusRequestCurrCounterRegular = g.FocusRequestCurrCounterTabStop = INT_MAX;
3569  if (g.FocusRequestNextWindow != NULL)
3570  {
3571  ImGuiWindow* window = g.FocusRequestNextWindow;
3572  g.FocusRequestCurrWindow = window;
3573  if (g.FocusRequestNextCounterRegular != INT_MAX && window->DC.FocusCounterRegular != -1)
3574  g.FocusRequestCurrCounterRegular = ImModPositive(g.FocusRequestNextCounterRegular, window->DC.FocusCounterRegular + 1);
3575  if (g.FocusRequestNextCounterTabStop != INT_MAX && window->DC.FocusCounterTabStop != -1)
3576  g.FocusRequestCurrCounterTabStop = ImModPositive(g.FocusRequestNextCounterTabStop, window->DC.FocusCounterTabStop + 1);
3577  g.FocusRequestNextWindow = NULL;
3578  g.FocusRequestNextCounterRegular = g.FocusRequestNextCounterTabStop = INT_MAX;
3579  }
3580 
3581  g.NavIdTabCounter = INT_MAX;
3582 }
3583 
3584 // The reason this is exposed in imgui_internal.h is: on touch-based system that don't have hovering, we want to dispatch inputs to the right target (imgui vs imgui+app)
3585 void ImGui::UpdateHoveredWindowAndCaptureFlags()
3586 {
3587  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3588 
3589  // Find the window hovered by mouse:
3590  // - Child windows can extend beyond the limit of their parent so we need to derive HoveredRootWindow from HoveredWindow.
3591  // - When moving a window we can skip the search, which also conveniently bypasses the fact that window->WindowRectClipped is lagging as this point of the frame.
3592  // - We also support the moved window toggling the NoInputs flag after moving has started in order to be able to detect windows below it, which is useful for e.g. docking mechanisms.
3593  FindHoveredWindow();
3594 
3595  // Modal windows prevents cursor from hovering behind them.
3596  ImGuiWindow* modal_window = GetTopMostPopupModal();
3597  if (modal_window)
3598  if (g.HoveredRootWindow && !IsWindowChildOf(g.HoveredRootWindow, modal_window))
3599  g.HoveredRootWindow = g.HoveredWindow = NULL;
3600 
3601  // Disabled mouse?
3602  if (g.IO.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_NoMouse)
3603  g.HoveredWindow = g.HoveredRootWindow = NULL;
3604 
3605  // We track click ownership. When clicked outside of a window the click is owned by the application and won't report hovering nor request capture even while dragging over our windows afterward.
3606  int mouse_earliest_button_down = -1;
3607  bool mouse_any_down = false;
3608  for (int i = 0; i < IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.IO.MouseDown); i++)
3609  {
3610  if (g.IO.MouseClicked[i])
3611  g.IO.MouseDownOwned[i] = (g.HoveredWindow != NULL) || (g.OpenPopupStack.Size > 0);
3612  mouse_any_down |= g.IO.MouseDown[i];
3613  if (g.IO.MouseDown[i])
3614  if (mouse_earliest_button_down == -1 || g.IO.MouseClickedTime[i] < g.IO.MouseClickedTime[mouse_earliest_button_down])
3615  mouse_earliest_button_down = i;
3616  }
3617  const bool mouse_avail_to_imgui = (mouse_earliest_button_down == -1) || g.IO.MouseDownOwned[mouse_earliest_button_down];
3618 
3619  // If mouse was first clicked outside of ImGui bounds we also cancel out hovering.
3620  // FIXME: For patterns of drag and drop across OS windows, we may need to rework/remove this test (first committed 311c0ca9 on 2015/02)
3621  const bool mouse_dragging_extern_payload = g.DragDropActive && (g.DragDropSourceFlags & ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceExtern) != 0;
3622  if (!mouse_avail_to_imgui && !mouse_dragging_extern_payload)
3623  g.HoveredWindow = g.HoveredRootWindow = NULL;
3624 
3625  // Update io.WantCaptureMouse for the user application (true = dispatch mouse info to imgui, false = dispatch mouse info to Dear ImGui + app)
3626  if (g.WantCaptureMouseNextFrame != -1)
3627  g.IO.WantCaptureMouse = (g.WantCaptureMouseNextFrame != 0);
3628  else
3629  g.IO.WantCaptureMouse = (mouse_avail_to_imgui && (g.HoveredWindow != NULL || mouse_any_down)) || (g.OpenPopupStack.Size > 0);
3630 
3631  // Update io.WantCaptureKeyboard for the user application (true = dispatch keyboard info to imgui, false = dispatch keyboard info to Dear ImGui + app)
3632  if (g.WantCaptureKeyboardNextFrame != -1)
3633  g.IO.WantCaptureKeyboard = (g.WantCaptureKeyboardNextFrame != 0);
3634  else
3635  g.IO.WantCaptureKeyboard = (g.ActiveId != 0) || (modal_window != NULL);
3636  if (g.IO.NavActive && (g.IO.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableKeyboard) && !(g.IO.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_NavNoCaptureKeyboard))
3637  g.IO.WantCaptureKeyboard = true;
3638 
3639  // Update io.WantTextInput flag, this is to allow systems without a keyboard (e.g. mobile, hand-held) to show a software keyboard if possible
3640  g.IO.WantTextInput = (g.WantTextInputNextFrame != -1) ? (g.WantTextInputNextFrame != 0) : false;
3641 }
3642 
3643 ImGuiKeyModFlags ImGui::GetMergedKeyModFlags()
3644 {
3645  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3646  ImGuiKeyModFlags key_mod_flags = ImGuiKeyModFlags_None;
3647  if (g.IO.KeyCtrl) { key_mod_flags |= ImGuiKeyModFlags_Ctrl; }
3648  if (g.IO.KeyShift) { key_mod_flags |= ImGuiKeyModFlags_Shift; }
3649  if (g.IO.KeyAlt) { key_mod_flags |= ImGuiKeyModFlags_Alt; }
3650  if (g.IO.KeySuper) { key_mod_flags |= ImGuiKeyModFlags_Super; }
3651  return key_mod_flags;
3652 }
3653 
3654 void ImGui::NewFrame()
3655 {
3656  IM_ASSERT(GImGui != NULL && "No current context. Did you call ImGui::CreateContext() and ImGui::SetCurrentContext() ?");
3657  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3658 
3659 #ifdef IMGUI_ENABLE_TEST_ENGINE
3660  ImGuiTestEngineHook_PreNewFrame(&g);
3661 #endif
3662 
3663  // Check and assert for various common IO and Configuration mistakes
3664  ErrorCheckNewFrameSanityChecks();
3665 
3666  // Load settings on first frame, save settings when modified (after a delay)
3667  UpdateSettings();
3668 
3669  g.Time += g.IO.DeltaTime;
3670  g.WithinFrameScope = true;
3671  g.FrameCount += 1;
3672  g.TooltipOverrideCount = 0;
3673  g.WindowsActiveCount = 0;
3674  g.MenusIdSubmittedThisFrame.resize(0);
3675 
3676  // Calculate frame-rate for the user, as a purely luxurious feature
3677  g.FramerateSecPerFrameAccum += g.IO.DeltaTime - g.FramerateSecPerFrame[g.FramerateSecPerFrameIdx];
3678  g.FramerateSecPerFrame[g.FramerateSecPerFrameIdx] = g.IO.DeltaTime;
3679  g.FramerateSecPerFrameIdx = (g.FramerateSecPerFrameIdx + 1) % IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.FramerateSecPerFrame);
3680  g.IO.Framerate = (g.FramerateSecPerFrameAccum > 0.0f) ? (1.0f / (g.FramerateSecPerFrameAccum / (float)IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.FramerateSecPerFrame))) : FLT_MAX;
3681 
3682  // Setup current font and draw list shared data
3683  g.IO.Fonts->Locked = true;
3684  SetCurrentFont(GetDefaultFont());
3685  IM_ASSERT(g.Font->IsLoaded());
3686  g.DrawListSharedData.ClipRectFullscreen = ImVec4(0.0f, 0.0f, g.IO.DisplaySize.x, g.IO.DisplaySize.y);
3687  g.DrawListSharedData.CurveTessellationTol = g.Style.CurveTessellationTol;
3688  g.DrawListSharedData.SetCircleSegmentMaxError(g.Style.CircleSegmentMaxError);
3689  g.DrawListSharedData.InitialFlags = ImDrawListFlags_None;
3690  if (g.Style.AntiAliasedLines)
3691  g.DrawListSharedData.InitialFlags |= ImDrawListFlags_AntiAliasedLines;
3692  if (g.Style.AntiAliasedLinesUseTex && !(g.Font->ContainerAtlas->Flags & ImFontAtlasFlags_NoBakedLines))
3693  g.DrawListSharedData.InitialFlags |= ImDrawListFlags_AntiAliasedLinesUseTex;
3694  if (g.Style.AntiAliasedFill)
3695  g.DrawListSharedData.InitialFlags |= ImDrawListFlags_AntiAliasedFill;
3696  if (g.IO.BackendFlags & ImGuiBackendFlags_RendererHasVtxOffset)
3697  g.DrawListSharedData.InitialFlags |= ImDrawListFlags_AllowVtxOffset;
3698 
3699  g.BackgroundDrawList._ResetForNewFrame();
3700  g.BackgroundDrawList.PushTextureID(g.IO.Fonts->TexID);
3701  g.BackgroundDrawList.PushClipRectFullScreen();
3702 
3703  g.ForegroundDrawList._ResetForNewFrame();
3704  g.ForegroundDrawList.PushTextureID(g.IO.Fonts->TexID);
3705  g.ForegroundDrawList.PushClipRectFullScreen();
3706 
3707  // Mark rendering data as invalid to prevent user who may have a handle on it to use it.
3708  g.DrawData.Clear();
3709 
3710  // Drag and drop keep the source ID alive so even if the source disappear our state is consistent
3711  if (g.DragDropActive && g.DragDropPayload.SourceId == g.ActiveId)
3712  KeepAliveID(g.DragDropPayload.SourceId);
3713 
3714  // Update HoveredId data
3715  if (!g.HoveredIdPreviousFrame)
3716  g.HoveredIdTimer = 0.0f;
3717  if (!g.HoveredIdPreviousFrame || (g.HoveredId && g.ActiveId == g.HoveredId))
3718  g.HoveredIdNotActiveTimer = 0.0f;
3719  if (g.HoveredId)
3720  g.HoveredIdTimer += g.IO.DeltaTime;
3721  if (g.HoveredId && g.ActiveId != g.HoveredId)
3722  g.HoveredIdNotActiveTimer += g.IO.DeltaTime;
3723  g.HoveredIdPreviousFrame = g.HoveredId;
3724  g.HoveredId = 0;
3725  g.HoveredIdAllowOverlap = false;
3726 
3727  // Update ActiveId data (clear reference to active widget if the widget isn't alive anymore)
3728  if (g.ActiveIdIsAlive != g.ActiveId && g.ActiveIdPreviousFrame == g.ActiveId && g.ActiveId != 0)
3729  ClearActiveID();
3730  if (g.ActiveId)
3731  g.ActiveIdTimer += g.IO.DeltaTime;
3732  g.LastActiveIdTimer += g.IO.DeltaTime;
3733  g.ActiveIdPreviousFrame = g.ActiveId;
3734  g.ActiveIdPreviousFrameWindow = g.ActiveIdWindow;
3735  g.ActiveIdPreviousFrameHasBeenEditedBefore = g.ActiveIdHasBeenEditedBefore;
3736  g.ActiveIdIsAlive = 0;
3737  g.ActiveIdHasBeenEditedThisFrame = false;
3738  g.ActiveIdPreviousFrameIsAlive = false;
3739  g.ActiveIdIsJustActivated = false;
3740  if (g.TempInputId != 0 && g.ActiveId != g.TempInputId)
3741  g.TempInputId = 0;
3742  if (g.ActiveId == 0)
3743  {
3744  g.ActiveIdUsingNavDirMask = 0x00;
3745  g.ActiveIdUsingNavInputMask = 0x00;
3746  g.ActiveIdUsingKeyInputMask = 0x00;
3747  }
3748 
3749  // Drag and drop
3750  g.DragDropAcceptIdPrev = g.DragDropAcceptIdCurr;
3751  g.DragDropAcceptIdCurr = 0;
3752  g.DragDropAcceptIdCurrRectSurface = FLT_MAX;
3753  g.DragDropWithinSource = false;
3754  g.DragDropWithinTarget = false;
3755  g.DragDropHoldJustPressedId = 0;
3756 
3757  // Update keyboard input state
3758  // Synchronize io.KeyMods with individual modifiers io.KeyXXX bools
3759  g.IO.KeyMods = GetMergedKeyModFlags();
3760  memcpy(g.IO.KeysDownDurationPrev, g.IO.KeysDownDuration, sizeof(g.IO.KeysDownDuration));
3761  for (int i = 0; i < IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.IO.KeysDown); i++)
3762  g.IO.KeysDownDuration[i] = g.IO.KeysDown[i] ? (g.IO.KeysDownDuration[i] < 0.0f ? 0.0f : g.IO.KeysDownDuration[i] + g.IO.DeltaTime) : -1.0f;
3763 
3764  // Update gamepad/keyboard navigation
3765  NavUpdate();
3766 
3767  // Update mouse input state
3768  UpdateMouseInputs();
3769 
3770  // Find hovered window
3771  // (needs to be before UpdateMouseMovingWindowNewFrame so we fill g.HoveredWindowUnderMovingWindow on the mouse release frame)
3772  UpdateHoveredWindowAndCaptureFlags();
3773 
3774  // Handle user moving window with mouse (at the beginning of the frame to avoid input lag or sheering)
3775  UpdateMouseMovingWindowNewFrame();
3776 
3777  // Background darkening/whitening
3778  if (GetTopMostPopupModal() != NULL || (g.NavWindowingTarget != NULL && g.NavWindowingHighlightAlpha > 0.0f))
3779  g.DimBgRatio = ImMin(g.DimBgRatio + g.IO.DeltaTime * 6.0f, 1.0f);
3780  else
3781  g.DimBgRatio = ImMax(g.DimBgRatio - g.IO.DeltaTime * 10.0f, 0.0f);
3782 
3783  g.MouseCursor = ImGuiMouseCursor_Arrow;
3784  g.WantCaptureMouseNextFrame = g.WantCaptureKeyboardNextFrame = g.WantTextInputNextFrame = -1;
3785  g.PlatformImePos = ImVec2(1.0f, 1.0f); // OS Input Method Editor showing on top-left of our window by default
3786 
3787  // Mouse wheel scrolling, scale
3788  UpdateMouseWheel();
3789 
3790  // Update legacy TAB focus
3791  UpdateTabFocus();
3792 
3793  // Mark all windows as not visible and compact unused memory.
3794  IM_ASSERT(g.WindowsFocusOrder.Size == g.Windows.Size);
3795  const float memory_compact_start_time = (g.IO.ConfigWindowsMemoryCompactTimer >= 0.0f) ? (float)g.Time - g.IO.ConfigWindowsMemoryCompactTimer : FLT_MAX;
3796  for (int i = 0; i != g.Windows.Size; i++)
3797  {
3798  ImGuiWindow* window = g.Windows[i];
3799  window->WasActive = window->Active;
3800  window->BeginCount = 0;
3801  window->Active = false;
3802  window->WriteAccessed = false;
3803 
3804  // Garbage collect transient buffers of recently unused windows
3805  if (!window->WasActive && !window->MemoryCompacted && window->LastTimeActive < memory_compact_start_time)
3806  GcCompactTransientWindowBuffers(window);
3807  }
3808 
3809  // Closing the focused window restore focus to the first active root window in descending z-order
3810  if (g.NavWindow && !g.NavWindow->WasActive)
3811  FocusTopMostWindowUnderOne(NULL, NULL);
3812 
3813  // No window should be open at the beginning of the frame.
3814  // But in order to allow the user to call NewFrame() multiple times without calling Render(), we are doing an explicit clear.
3815  g.CurrentWindowStack.resize(0);
3816  g.BeginPopupStack.resize(0);
3817  ClosePopupsOverWindow(g.NavWindow, false);
3818 
3819  // [DEBUG] Item picker tool - start with DebugStartItemPicker() - useful to visually select an item and break into its call-stack.
3820  UpdateDebugToolItemPicker();
3821 
3822  // Create implicit/fallback window - which we will only render it if the user has added something to it.
3823  // We don't use "Debug" to avoid colliding with user trying to create a "Debug" window with custom flags.
3824  // This fallback is particularly important as it avoid ImGui:: calls from crashing.
3825  g.WithinFrameScopeWithImplicitWindow = true;
3826  SetNextWindowSize(ImVec2(400, 400), ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver);
3827  Begin("Debug##Default");
3828  IM_ASSERT(g.CurrentWindow->IsFallbackWindow == true);
3829 
3830 #ifdef IMGUI_ENABLE_TEST_ENGINE
3831  ImGuiTestEngineHook_PostNewFrame(&g);
3832 #endif
3833 }
3834 
3835 // [DEBUG] Item picker tool - start with DebugStartItemPicker() - useful to visually select an item and break into its call-stack.
3836 void ImGui::UpdateDebugToolItemPicker()
3837 {
3838  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3839  g.DebugItemPickerBreakId = 0;
3840  if (g.DebugItemPickerActive)
3841  {
3842  const ImGuiID hovered_id = g.HoveredIdPreviousFrame;
3843  ImGui::SetMouseCursor(ImGuiMouseCursor_Hand);
3844  if (ImGui::IsKeyPressedMap(ImGuiKey_Escape))
3845  g.DebugItemPickerActive = false;
3846  if (ImGui::IsMouseClicked(0) && hovered_id)
3847  {
3848  g.DebugItemPickerBreakId = hovered_id;
3849  g.DebugItemPickerActive = false;
3850  }
3851  ImGui::SetNextWindowBgAlpha(0.60f);
3852  ImGui::BeginTooltip();
3853  ImGui::Text("HoveredId: 0x%08X", hovered_id);
3854  ImGui::Text("Press ESC to abort picking.");
3855  ImGui::TextColored(GetStyleColorVec4(hovered_id ? ImGuiCol_Text : ImGuiCol_TextDisabled), "Click to break in debugger!");
3856  ImGui::EndTooltip();
3857  }
3858 }
3859 
3860 void ImGui::Initialize(ImGuiContext* context)
3861 {
3862  ImGuiContext& g = *context;
3863  IM_ASSERT(!g.Initialized && !g.SettingsLoaded);
3864 
3865  // Add .ini handle for ImGuiWindow type
3866  {
3867  ImGuiSettingsHandler ini_handler;
3868  ini_handler.TypeName = "Window";
3869  ini_handler.TypeHash = ImHashStr("Window");
3870  ini_handler.ClearAllFn = WindowSettingsHandler_ClearAll;
3871  ini_handler.ReadOpenFn = WindowSettingsHandler_ReadOpen;
3872  ini_handler.ReadLineFn = WindowSettingsHandler_ReadLine;
3873  ini_handler.ApplyAllFn = WindowSettingsHandler_ApplyAll;
3874  ini_handler.WriteAllFn = WindowSettingsHandler_WriteAll;
3875  g.SettingsHandlers.push_back(ini_handler);
3876  }
3877 
3878 #ifdef IMGUI_HAS_TABLE
3879  // Add .ini handle for ImGuiTable type
3880  {
3881  ImGuiSettingsHandler ini_handler;
3882  ini_handler.TypeName = "Table";
3883  ini_handler.TypeHash = ImHashStr("Table");
3884  ini_handler.ReadOpenFn = TableSettingsHandler_ReadOpen;
3885  ini_handler.ReadLineFn = TableSettingsHandler_ReadLine;
3886  ini_handler.WriteAllFn = TableSettingsHandler_WriteAll;
3887  g.SettingsHandlers.push_back(ini_handler);
3888  }
3889 #endif // #ifdef IMGUI_HAS_TABLE
3890 
3891 #ifdef IMGUI_HAS_DOCK
3892 #endif // #ifdef IMGUI_HAS_DOCK
3893 
3894  g.Initialized = true;
3895 }
3896 
3897 // This function is merely here to free heap allocations.
3898 void ImGui::Shutdown(ImGuiContext* context)
3899 {
3900  // The fonts atlas can be used prior to calling NewFrame(), so we clear it even if g.Initialized is FALSE (which would happen if we never called NewFrame)
3901  ImGuiContext& g = *context;
3902  if (g.IO.Fonts && g.FontAtlasOwnedByContext)
3903  {
3904  g.IO.Fonts->Locked = false;
3905  IM_DELETE(g.IO.Fonts);
3906  }
3907  g.IO.Fonts = NULL;
3908 
3909  // Cleanup of other data are conditional on actually having initialized Dear ImGui.
3910  if (!g.Initialized)
3911  return;
3912 
3913  // Save settings (unless we haven't attempted to load them: CreateContext/DestroyContext without a call to NewFrame shouldn't save an empty file)
3914  if (g.SettingsLoaded && g.IO.IniFilename != NULL)
3915  {
3916  ImGuiContext* backup_context = GImGui;
3917  SetCurrentContext(context);
3918  SaveIniSettingsToDisk(g.IO.IniFilename);
3919  SetCurrentContext(backup_context);
3920  }
3921 
3922  // Notify hooked test engine, if any
3923 #ifdef IMGUI_ENABLE_TEST_ENGINE
3924  ImGuiTestEngineHook_Shutdown(context);
3925 #endif
3926 
3927  // Clear everything else
3928  for (int i = 0; i < g.Windows.Size; i++)
3929  IM_DELETE(g.Windows[i]);
3930  g.Windows.clear();
3931  g.WindowsFocusOrder.clear();
3932  g.WindowsTempSortBuffer.clear();
3933  g.CurrentWindow = NULL;
3934  g.CurrentWindowStack.clear();
3935  g.WindowsById.Clear();
3936  g.NavWindow = NULL;
3937  g.HoveredWindow = g.HoveredRootWindow = NULL;
3938  g.ActiveIdWindow = g.ActiveIdPreviousFrameWindow = NULL;
3939  g.MovingWindow = NULL;
3940  g.ColorModifiers.clear();
3941  g.StyleModifiers.clear();
3942  g.FontStack.clear();
3943  g.OpenPopupStack.clear();
3944  g.BeginPopupStack.clear();
3945  g.DrawDataBuilder.ClearFreeMemory();
3946  g.BackgroundDrawList._ClearFreeMemory();
3947  g.ForegroundDrawList._ClearFreeMemory();
3948 
3949  g.TabBars.Clear();
3950  g.CurrentTabBarStack.clear();
3951  g.ShrinkWidthBuffer.clear();
3952 
3953  g.ClipboardHandlerData.clear();
3954  g.MenusIdSubmittedThisFrame.clear();
3955  g.InputTextState.ClearFreeMemory();
3956 
3957  g.SettingsWindows.clear();
3958  g.SettingsHandlers.clear();
3959 
3960  if (g.LogFile)
3961  {
3962 #ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_TTY_FUNCTIONS
3963  if (g.LogFile != stdout)
3964 #endif
3965  ImFileClose(g.LogFile);
3966  g.LogFile = NULL;
3967  }
3968  g.LogBuffer.clear();
3969 
3970  g.Initialized = false;
3971 }
3972 
3973 // FIXME: Add a more explicit sort order in the window structure.
3974 static int IMGUI_CDECL ChildWindowComparer(const void* lhs, const void* rhs)
3975 {
3976  const ImGuiWindow* const a = *(const ImGuiWindow* const *)lhs;
3977  const ImGuiWindow* const b = *(const ImGuiWindow* const *)rhs;
3978  if (int d = (a->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup) - (b->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup))
3979  return d;
3980  if (int d = (a->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip) - (b->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip))
3981  return d;
3982  return (a->BeginOrderWithinParent - b->BeginOrderWithinParent);
3983 }
3984 
3985 static void AddWindowToSortBuffer(ImVector<ImGuiWindow*>* out_sorted_windows, ImGuiWindow* window)
3986 {
3987  out_sorted_windows->push_back(window);
3988  if (window->Active)
3989  {
3990  int count = window->DC.ChildWindows.Size;
3991  if (count > 1)
3992  ImQsort(window->DC.ChildWindows.Data, (size_t)count, sizeof(ImGuiWindow*), ChildWindowComparer);
3993  for (int i = 0; i < count; i++)
3994  {
3995  ImGuiWindow* child = window->DC.ChildWindows[i];
3996  if (child->Active)
3997  AddWindowToSortBuffer(out_sorted_windows, child);
3998  }
3999  }
4000 }
4001 
4002 static void AddDrawListToDrawData(ImVector<ImDrawList*>* out_list, ImDrawList* draw_list)
4003 {
4004  // Remove trailing command if unused.
4005  // Technically we could return directly instead of popping, but this make things looks neat in Metrics window as well.
4006  draw_list->_PopUnusedDrawCmd();
4007  if (draw_list->CmdBuffer.Size == 0)
4008  return;
4009 
4010  // Draw list sanity check. Detect mismatch between PrimReserve() calls and incrementing _VtxCurrentIdx, _VtxWritePtr etc.
4011  // May trigger for you if you are using PrimXXX functions incorrectly.
4012  IM_ASSERT(draw_list->VtxBuffer.Size == 0 || draw_list->_VtxWritePtr == draw_list->VtxBuffer.Data + draw_list->VtxBuffer.Size);
4013  IM_ASSERT(draw_list->IdxBuffer.Size == 0 || draw_list->_IdxWritePtr == draw_list->IdxBuffer.Data + draw_list->IdxBuffer.Size);
4014  if (!(draw_list->Flags & ImDrawListFlags_AllowVtxOffset))
4015  IM_ASSERT((int)draw_list->_VtxCurrentIdx == draw_list->VtxBuffer.Size);
4016 
4017  // Check that draw_list doesn't use more vertices than indexable (default ImDrawIdx = unsigned short = 2 bytes = 64K vertices per ImDrawList = per window)
4018  // If this assert triggers because you are drawing lots of stuff manually:
4019  // - First, make sure you are coarse clipping yourself and not trying to draw many things outside visible bounds.
4020  // Be mindful that the ImDrawList API doesn't filter vertices. Use the Metrics window to inspect draw list contents.
4021  // - If you want large meshes with more than 64K vertices, you can either:
4022  // (A) Handle the ImDrawCmd::VtxOffset value in your renderer back-end, and set 'io.BackendFlags |= ImGuiBackendFlags_RendererHasVtxOffset'.
4023  // Most example back-ends already support this from 1.71. Pre-1.71 back-ends won't.
4024  // Some graphics API such as GL ES 1/2 don't have a way to offset the starting vertex so it is not supported for them.
4025  // (B) Or handle 32-bit indices in your renderer back-end, and uncomment '#define ImDrawIdx unsigned int' line in imconfig.h.
4026  // Most example back-ends already support this. For example, the OpenGL example code detect index size at compile-time:
4027  // glDrawElements(GL_TRIANGLES, (GLsizei)pcmd->ElemCount, sizeof(ImDrawIdx) == 2 ? GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT : GL_UNSIGNED_INT, idx_buffer_offset);
4028  // Your own engine or render API may use different parameters or function calls to specify index sizes.
4029  // 2 and 4 bytes indices are generally supported by most graphics API.
4030  // - If for some reason neither of those solutions works for you, a workaround is to call BeginChild()/EndChild() before reaching
4031  // the 64K limit to split your draw commands in multiple draw lists.
4032  if (sizeof(ImDrawIdx) == 2)
4033  IM_ASSERT(draw_list->_VtxCurrentIdx < (1 << 16) && "Too many vertices in ImDrawList using 16-bit indices. Read comment above");
4034 
4035  out_list->push_back(draw_list);
4036 }
4037 
4038 static void AddWindowToDrawData(ImVector<ImDrawList*>* out_render_list, ImGuiWindow* window)
4039 {
4040  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4041  g.IO.MetricsRenderWindows++;
4042  AddDrawListToDrawData(out_render_list, window->DrawList);
4043  for (int i = 0; i < window->DC.ChildWindows.Size; i++)
4044  {
4045  ImGuiWindow* child = window->DC.ChildWindows[i];
4046  if (IsWindowActiveAndVisible(child)) // clipped children may have been marked not active
4047  AddWindowToDrawData(out_render_list, child);
4048  }
4049 }
4050 
4051 // Layer is locked for the root window, however child windows may use a different viewport (e.g. extruding menu)
4052 static void AddRootWindowToDrawData(ImGuiWindow* window)
4053 {
4054  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4055  int layer = (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip) ? 1 : 0;
4056  AddWindowToDrawData(&g.DrawDataBuilder.Layers[layer], window);
4057 }
4058 
4059 void ImDrawDataBuilder::FlattenIntoSingleLayer()
4060 {
4061  int n = Layers[0].Size;
4062  int size = n;
4063  for (int i = 1; i < IM_ARRAYSIZE(Layers); i++)
4064  size += Layers[i].Size;
4065  Layers[0].resize(size);
4066  for (int layer_n = 1; layer_n < IM_ARRAYSIZE(Layers); layer_n++)
4067  {
4068  ImVector<ImDrawList*>& layer = Layers[layer_n];
4069  if (layer.empty())
4070  continue;
4071  memcpy(&Layers[0][n], &layer[0], layer.Size * sizeof(ImDrawList*));
4072  n += layer.Size;
4073  layer.resize(0);
4074  }
4075 }
4076 
4077 static void SetupDrawData(ImVector<ImDrawList*>* draw_lists, ImDrawData* draw_data)
4078 {
4079  ImGuiIO& io = ImGui::GetIO();
4080  draw_data->Valid = true;
4081  draw_data->CmdLists = (draw_lists->Size > 0) ? draw_lists->Data : NULL;
4082  draw_data->CmdListsCount = draw_lists->Size;
4083  draw_data->TotalVtxCount = draw_data->TotalIdxCount = 0;
4084  draw_data->DisplayPos = ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f);
4085  draw_data->DisplaySize = io.DisplaySize;
4086  draw_data->FramebufferScale = io.DisplayFramebufferScale;
4087  for (int n = 0; n < draw_lists->Size; n++)
4088  {
4089  draw_data->TotalVtxCount += draw_lists->Data[n]->VtxBuffer.Size;
4090  draw_data->TotalIdxCount += draw_lists->Data[n]->IdxBuffer.Size;
4091  }
4092 }
4093 
4094 // Push a clipping rectangle for both ImGui logic (hit-testing etc.) and low-level ImDrawList rendering.
4095 // - When using this function it is sane to ensure that float are perfectly rounded to integer values,
4096 // so that e.g. (int)(max.x-min.x) in user's render produce correct result.
4097 // - If the code here changes, may need to update code of functions like NextColumn() and PushColumnClipRect():
4098 // some frequently called functions which to modify both channels and clipping simultaneously tend to use the
4099 // more specialized SetWindowClipRectBeforeSetChannel() to avoid extraneous updates of underlying ImDrawCmds.
4100 void ImGui::PushClipRect(const ImVec2& clip_rect_min, const ImVec2& clip_rect_max, bool intersect_with_current_clip_rect)
4101 {
4102  ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
4103  window->DrawList->PushClipRect(clip_rect_min, clip_rect_max, intersect_with_current_clip_rect);
4104  window->ClipRect = window->DrawList->_ClipRectStack.back();
4105 }
4106 
4107 void ImGui::PopClipRect()
4108 {
4109  ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
4110  window->DrawList->PopClipRect();
4111  window->ClipRect = window->DrawList->_ClipRectStack.back();
4112 }
4113 
4114 // This is normally called by Render(). You may want to call it directly if you want to avoid calling Render() but the gain will be very minimal.
4115 void ImGui::EndFrame()
4116 {
4117  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4118  IM_ASSERT(g.Initialized);
4119 
4120  // Don't process EndFrame() multiple times.
4121  if (g.FrameCountEnded == g.FrameCount)
4122  return;
4123  IM_ASSERT(g.WithinFrameScope && "Forgot to call ImGui::NewFrame()?");
4124 
4125  ErrorCheckEndFrameSanityChecks();
4126 
4127  // Notify OS when our Input Method Editor cursor has moved (e.g. CJK inputs using Microsoft IME)
4128  if (g.IO.ImeSetInputScreenPosFn && (g.PlatformImeLastPos.x == FLT_MAX || ImLengthSqr(g.PlatformImeLastPos - g.PlatformImePos) > 0.0001f))
4129  {
4130  g.IO.ImeSetInputScreenPosFn((int)g.PlatformImePos.x, (int)g.PlatformImePos.y);
4131  g.PlatformImeLastPos = g.PlatformImePos;
4132  }
4133 
4134  // Hide implicit/fallback "Debug" window if it hasn't been used
4135  g.WithinFrameScopeWithImplicitWindow = false;
4136  if (g.CurrentWindow && !g.CurrentWindow->WriteAccessed)
4137  g.CurrentWindow->Active = false;
4138  End();
4139 
4140  // Update navigation: CTRL+Tab, wrap-around requests
4141  NavEndFrame();
4142 
4143  // Drag and Drop: Elapse payload (if delivered, or if source stops being submitted)
4144  if (g.DragDropActive)
4145  {
4146  bool is_delivered = g.DragDropPayload.Delivery;
4147  bool is_elapsed = (g.DragDropPayload.DataFrameCount + 1 < g.FrameCount) && ((g.DragDropSourceFlags & ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceAutoExpirePayload) || !IsMouseDown(g.DragDropMouseButton));
4148  if (is_delivered || is_elapsed)
4149  ClearDragDrop();
4150  }
4151 
4152  // Drag and Drop: Fallback for source tooltip. This is not ideal but better than nothing.
4153  if (g.DragDropActive && g.DragDropSourceFrameCount < g.FrameCount && !(g.DragDropSourceFlags & ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceNoPreviewTooltip))
4154  {
4155  g.DragDropWithinSource = true;
4156  SetTooltip("...");
4157  g.DragDropWithinSource = false;
4158  }
4159 
4160  // End frame
4161  g.WithinFrameScope = false;
4162  g.FrameCountEnded = g.FrameCount;
4163 
4164  // Initiate moving window + handle left-click and right-click focus
4165  UpdateMouseMovingWindowEndFrame();
4166 
4167  // Sort the window list so that all child windows are after their parent
4168  // We cannot do that on FocusWindow() because children may not exist yet
4169  g.WindowsTempSortBuffer.resize(0);
4170  g.WindowsTempSortBuffer.reserve(g.Windows.Size);
4171  for (int i = 0; i != g.Windows.Size; i++)
4172  {
4173  ImGuiWindow* window = g.Windows[i];
4174  if (window->Active && (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow)) // if a child is active its parent will add it
4175  continue;
4176  AddWindowToSortBuffer(&g.WindowsTempSortBuffer, window);
4177  }
4178 
4179  // This usually assert if there is a mismatch between the ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow / ParentWindow values and DC.ChildWindows[] in parents, aka we've done something wrong.
4180  IM_ASSERT(g.Windows.Size == g.WindowsTempSortBuffer.Size);
4181  g.Windows.swap(g.WindowsTempSortBuffer);
4182  g.IO.MetricsActiveWindows = g.WindowsActiveCount;
4183 
4184  // Unlock font atlas
4185  g.IO.Fonts->Locked = false;
4186 
4187  // Clear Input data for next frame
4188  g.IO.MouseWheel = g.IO.MouseWheelH = 0.0f;
4189  g.IO.InputQueueCharacters.resize(0);
4190  memset(g.IO.NavInputs, 0, sizeof(g.IO.NavInputs));
4191 }
4192 
4193 void ImGui::Render()
4194 {
4195  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4196  IM_ASSERT(g.Initialized);
4197 
4198  if (g.FrameCountEnded != g.FrameCount)
4199  EndFrame();
4200  g.FrameCountRendered = g.FrameCount;
4201  g.IO.MetricsRenderWindows = 0;
4202  g.DrawDataBuilder.Clear();
4203 
4204  // Add background ImDrawList
4205  if (!g.BackgroundDrawList.VtxBuffer.empty())
4206  AddDrawListToDrawData(&g.DrawDataBuilder.Layers[0], &g.BackgroundDrawList);
4207 
4208  // Add ImDrawList to render
4209  ImGuiWindow* windows_to_render_top_most[2];
4210  windows_to_render_top_most[0] = (g.NavWindowingTarget && !(g.NavWindowingTarget->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoBringToFrontOnFocus)) ? g.NavWindowingTarget->RootWindow : NULL;
4211  windows_to_render_top_most[1] = (g.NavWindowingTarget ? g.NavWindowingListWindow : NULL);
4212  for (int n = 0; n != g.Windows.Size; n++)
4213  {
4214  ImGuiWindow* window = g.Windows[n];
4215  if (IsWindowActiveAndVisible(window) && (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) == 0 && window != windows_to_render_top_most[0] && window != windows_to_render_top_most[1])
4216  AddRootWindowToDrawData(window);
4217  }
4218  for (int n = 0; n < IM_ARRAYSIZE(windows_to_render_top_most); n++)
4219  if (windows_to_render_top_most[n] && IsWindowActiveAndVisible(windows_to_render_top_most[n])) // NavWindowingTarget is always temporarily displayed as the top-most window
4220  AddRootWindowToDrawData(windows_to_render_top_most[n]);
4221  g.DrawDataBuilder.FlattenIntoSingleLayer();
4222 
4223  // Draw software mouse cursor if requested
4224  if (g.IO.MouseDrawCursor)
4225  RenderMouseCursor(&g.ForegroundDrawList, g.IO.MousePos, g.Style.MouseCursorScale, g.MouseCursor, IM_COL32_WHITE, IM_COL32_BLACK, IM_COL32(0, 0, 0, 48));
4226 
4227  // Add foreground ImDrawList
4228  if (!g.ForegroundDrawList.VtxBuffer.empty())
4229  AddDrawListToDrawData(&g.DrawDataBuilder.Layers[0], &g.ForegroundDrawList);
4230 
4231  // Setup ImDrawData structure for end-user
4232  SetupDrawData(&g.DrawDataBuilder.Layers[0], &g.DrawData);
4233  g.IO.MetricsRenderVertices = g.DrawData.TotalVtxCount;
4234  g.IO.MetricsRenderIndices = g.DrawData.TotalIdxCount;
4235 
4236  // (Legacy) Call the Render callback function. The current prefer way is to let the user retrieve GetDrawData() and call the render function themselves.
4237 #ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_FUNCTIONS
4238  if (g.DrawData.CmdListsCount > 0 && g.IO.RenderDrawListsFn != NULL)
4239  g.IO.RenderDrawListsFn(&g.DrawData);
4240 #endif
4241 }
4242 
4243 // Calculate text size. Text can be multi-line. Optionally ignore text after a ## marker.
4244 // CalcTextSize("") should return ImVec2(0.0f, g.FontSize)
4245 ImVec2 ImGui::CalcTextSize(const char* text, const char* text_end, bool hide_text_after_double_hash, float wrap_width)
4246 {
4247  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4248 
4249  const char* text_display_end;
4250  if (hide_text_after_double_hash)
4251  text_display_end = FindRenderedTextEnd(text, text_end); // Hide anything after a '##' string
4252  else
4253  text_display_end = text_end;
4254 
4255  ImFont* font = g.Font;
4256  const float font_size = g.FontSize;
4257  if (text == text_display_end)
4258  return ImVec2(0.0f, font_size);
4259  ImVec2 text_size = font->CalcTextSizeA(font_size, FLT_MAX, wrap_width, text, text_display_end, NULL);
4260 
4261  // Round
4262  text_size.x = IM_FLOOR(text_size.x + 0.95f);
4263 
4264  return text_size;
4265 }
4266 
4267 // Find window given position, search front-to-back
4268 // FIXME: Note that we have an inconsequential lag here: OuterRectClipped is updated in Begin(), so windows moved programmatically
4269 // with SetWindowPos() and not SetNextWindowPos() will have that rectangle lagging by a frame at the time FindHoveredWindow() is
4270 // called, aka before the next Begin(). Moving window isn't affected.
4271 static void FindHoveredWindow()
4272 {
4273  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4274 
4275  ImGuiWindow* hovered_window = NULL;
4276  if (g.MovingWindow && !(g.MovingWindow->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMouseInputs))
4277  hovered_window = g.MovingWindow;
4278 
4279  ImVec2 padding_regular = g.Style.TouchExtraPadding;
4280  ImVec2 padding_for_resize_from_edges = g.IO.ConfigWindowsResizeFromEdges ? ImMax(g.Style.TouchExtraPadding, ImVec2(WINDOWS_RESIZE_FROM_EDGES_HALF_THICKNESS, WINDOWS_RESIZE_FROM_EDGES_HALF_THICKNESS)) : padding_regular;
4281  for (int i = g.Windows.Size - 1; i >= 0; i--)
4282  {
4283  ImGuiWindow* window = g.Windows[i];
4284  if (!window->Active || window->Hidden)
4285  continue;
4286  if (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMouseInputs)
4287  continue;
4288 
4289  // Using the clipped AABB, a child window will typically be clipped by its parent (not always)
4290  ImRect bb(window->OuterRectClipped);
4291  if (window->Flags & (ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoResize | ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize))
4292  bb.Expand(padding_regular);
4293  else
4294  bb.Expand(padding_for_resize_from_edges);
4295  if (!bb.Contains(g.IO.MousePos))
4296  continue;
4297 
4298  // Those seemingly unnecessary extra tests are because the code here is a little different in viewport/docking branches.
4299  if (hovered_window == NULL)
4300  hovered_window = window;
4301  if (hovered_window)
4302  break;
4303  }
4304 
4305  g.HoveredWindow = hovered_window;
4306  g.HoveredRootWindow = g.HoveredWindow ? g.HoveredWindow->RootWindow : NULL;
4307 
4308 }
4309 
4310 // Test if mouse cursor is hovering given rectangle
4311 // NB- Rectangle is clipped by our current clip setting
4312 // NB- Expand the rectangle to be generous on imprecise inputs systems (g.Style.TouchExtraPadding)
4313 bool ImGui::IsMouseHoveringRect(const ImVec2& r_min, const ImVec2& r_max, bool clip)
4314 {
4315  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4316 
4317  // Clip
4318  ImRect rect_clipped(r_min, r_max);
4319  if (clip)
4320  rect_clipped.ClipWith(g.CurrentWindow->ClipRect);
4321 
4322  // Expand for touch input
4323  const ImRect rect_for_touch(rect_clipped.Min - g.Style.TouchExtraPadding, rect_clipped.Max + g.Style.TouchExtraPadding);
4324  if (!rect_for_touch.Contains(g.IO.MousePos))
4325  return false;
4326  return true;
4327 }
4328 
4329 int ImGui::GetKeyIndex(ImGuiKey imgui_key)
4330 {
4331  IM_ASSERT(imgui_key >= 0 && imgui_key < ImGuiKey_COUNT);
4332  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4333  return g.IO.KeyMap[imgui_key];
4334 }
4335 
4336 // Note that dear imgui doesn't know the semantic of each entry of io.KeysDown[]!
4337 // Use your own indices/enums according to how your back-end/engine stored them into io.KeysDown[]!
4338 bool ImGui::IsKeyDown(int user_key_index)
4339 {
4340  if (user_key_index < 0)
4341  return false;
4342  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4343  IM_ASSERT(user_key_index >= 0 && user_key_index < IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.IO.KeysDown));
4344  return g.IO.KeysDown[user_key_index];
4345 }
4346 
4347 // t0 = previous time (e.g.: g.Time - g.IO.DeltaTime)
4348 // t1 = current time (e.g.: g.Time)
4349 // An event is triggered at:
4350 // t = 0.0f t = repeat_delay, t = repeat_delay + repeat_rate*N
4351 int ImGui::CalcTypematicRepeatAmount(float t0, float t1, float repeat_delay, float repeat_rate)
4352 {
4353  if (t1 == 0.0f)
4354  return 1;
4355  if (t0 >= t1)
4356  return 0;
4357  if (repeat_rate <= 0.0f)
4358  return (t0 < repeat_delay) && (t1 >= repeat_delay);
4359  const int count_t0 = (t0 < repeat_delay) ? -1 : (int)((t0 - repeat_delay) / repeat_rate);
4360  const int count_t1 = (t1 < repeat_delay) ? -1 : (int)((t1 - repeat_delay) / repeat_rate);
4361  const int count = count_t1 - count_t0;
4362  return count;
4363 }
4364 
4365 int ImGui::GetKeyPressedAmount(int key_index, float repeat_delay, float repeat_rate)
4366 {
4367  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4368  if (key_index < 0)
4369  return 0;
4370  IM_ASSERT(key_index >= 0 && key_index < IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.IO.KeysDown));
4371  const float t = g.IO.KeysDownDuration[key_index];
4372  return CalcTypematicRepeatAmount(t - g.IO.DeltaTime, t, repeat_delay, repeat_rate);
4373 }
4374 
4375 bool ImGui::IsKeyPressed(int user_key_index, bool repeat)
4376 {
4377  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4378  if (user_key_index < 0)
4379  return false;
4380  IM_ASSERT(user_key_index >= 0 && user_key_index < IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.IO.KeysDown));
4381  const float t = g.IO.KeysDownDuration[user_key_index];
4382  if (t == 0.0f)
4383  return true;
4384  if (repeat && t > g.IO.KeyRepeatDelay)
4385  return GetKeyPressedAmount(user_key_index, g.IO.KeyRepeatDelay, g.IO.KeyRepeatRate) > 0;
4386  return false;
4387 }
4388 
4389 bool ImGui::IsKeyReleased(int user_key_index)
4390 {
4391  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4392  if (user_key_index < 0) return false;
4393  IM_ASSERT(user_key_index >= 0 && user_key_index < IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.IO.KeysDown));
4394  return g.IO.KeysDownDurationPrev[user_key_index] >= 0.0f && !g.IO.KeysDown[user_key_index];
4395 }
4396 
4397 bool ImGui::IsMouseDown(ImGuiMouseButton button)
4398 {
4399  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4400  IM_ASSERT(button >= 0 && button < IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.IO.MouseDown));
4401  return g.IO.MouseDown[button];
4402 }
4403 
4404 bool ImGui::IsMouseClicked(ImGuiMouseButton button, bool repeat)
4405 {
4406  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4407  IM_ASSERT(button >= 0 && button < IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.IO.MouseDown));
4408  const float t = g.IO.MouseDownDuration[button];
4409  if (t == 0.0f)
4410  return true;
4411 
4412  if (repeat && t > g.IO.KeyRepeatDelay)
4413  {
4414  // FIXME: 2019/05/03: Our old repeat code was wrong here and led to doubling the repeat rate, which made it an ok rate for repeat on mouse hold.
4415  int amount = CalcTypematicRepeatAmount(t - g.IO.DeltaTime, t, g.IO.KeyRepeatDelay, g.IO.KeyRepeatRate * 0.50f);
4416  if (amount > 0)
4417  return true;
4418  }
4419  return false;
4420 }
4421 
4422 bool ImGui::IsMouseReleased(ImGuiMouseButton button)
4423 {
4424  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4425  IM_ASSERT(button >= 0 && button < IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.IO.MouseDown));
4426  return g.IO.MouseReleased[button];
4427 }
4428 
4429 bool ImGui::IsMouseDoubleClicked(ImGuiMouseButton button)
4430 {
4431  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4432  IM_ASSERT(button >= 0 && button < IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.IO.MouseDown));
4433  return g.IO.MouseDoubleClicked[button];
4434 }
4435 
4436 // [Internal] This doesn't test if the button is pressed
4437 bool ImGui::IsMouseDragPastThreshold(ImGuiMouseButton button, float lock_threshold)
4438 {
4439  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4440  IM_ASSERT(button >= 0 && button < IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.IO.MouseDown));
4441  if (lock_threshold < 0.0f)
4442  lock_threshold = g.IO.MouseDragThreshold;
4443  return g.IO.MouseDragMaxDistanceSqr[button] >= lock_threshold * lock_threshold;
4444 }
4445 
4446 bool ImGui::IsMouseDragging(ImGuiMouseButton button, float lock_threshold)
4447 {
4448  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4449  IM_ASSERT(button >= 0 && button < IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.IO.MouseDown));
4450  if (!g.IO.MouseDown[button])
4451  return false;
4452  return IsMouseDragPastThreshold(button, lock_threshold);
4453 }
4454 
4455 ImVec2 ImGui::GetMousePos()
4456 {
4457  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4458  return g.IO.MousePos;
4459 }
4460 
4461 // NB: prefer to call right after BeginPopup(). At the time Selectable/MenuItem is activated, the popup is already closed!
4462 ImVec2 ImGui::GetMousePosOnOpeningCurrentPopup()
4463 {
4464  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4465  if (g.BeginPopupStack.Size > 0)
4466  return g.OpenPopupStack[g.BeginPopupStack.Size - 1].OpenMousePos;
4467  return g.IO.MousePos;
4468 }
4469 
4470 // We typically use ImVec2(-FLT_MAX,-FLT_MAX) to denote an invalid mouse position.
4471 bool ImGui::IsMousePosValid(const ImVec2* mouse_pos)
4472 {
4473  // The assert is only to silence a false-positive in XCode Static Analysis.
4474  // Because GImGui is not dereferenced in every code path, the static analyzer assume that it may be NULL (which it doesn't for other functions).
4475  IM_ASSERT(GImGui != NULL);
4476  const float MOUSE_INVALID = -256000.0f;
4477  ImVec2 p = mouse_pos ? *mouse_pos : GImGui->IO.MousePos;
4478  return p.x >= MOUSE_INVALID && p.y >= MOUSE_INVALID;
4479 }
4480 
4481 bool ImGui::IsAnyMouseDown()
4482 {
4483  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4484  for (int n = 0; n < IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.IO.MouseDown); n++)
4485  if (g.IO.MouseDown[n])
4486  return true;
4487  return false;
4488 }
4489 
4490 // Return the delta from the initial clicking position while the mouse button is clicked or was just released.
4491 // This is locked and return 0.0f until the mouse moves past a distance threshold at least once.
4492 // NB: This is only valid if IsMousePosValid(). Back-ends in theory should always keep mouse position valid when dragging even outside the client window.
4493 ImVec2 ImGui::GetMouseDragDelta(ImGuiMouseButton button, float lock_threshold)
4494 {
4495  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4496  IM_ASSERT(button >= 0 && button < IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.IO.MouseDown));
4497  if (lock_threshold < 0.0f)
4498  lock_threshold = g.IO.MouseDragThreshold;
4499  if (g.IO.MouseDown[button] || g.IO.MouseReleased[button])
4500  if (g.IO.MouseDragMaxDistanceSqr[button] >= lock_threshold * lock_threshold)
4501  if (IsMousePosValid(&g.IO.MousePos) && IsMousePosValid(&g.IO.MouseClickedPos[button]))
4502  return g.IO.MousePos - g.IO.MouseClickedPos[button];
4503  return ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f);
4504 }
4505 
4506 void ImGui::ResetMouseDragDelta(ImGuiMouseButton button)
4507 {
4508  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4509  IM_ASSERT(button >= 0 && button < IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.IO.MouseDown));
4510  // NB: We don't need to reset g.IO.MouseDragMaxDistanceSqr
4511  g.IO.MouseClickedPos[button] = g.IO.MousePos;
4512 }
4513 
4514 ImGuiMouseCursor ImGui::GetMouseCursor()
4515 {
4516  return GImGui->MouseCursor;
4517 }
4518 
4519 void ImGui::SetMouseCursor(ImGuiMouseCursor cursor_type)
4520 {
4521  GImGui->MouseCursor = cursor_type;
4522 }
4523 
4524 void ImGui::CaptureKeyboardFromApp(bool capture)
4525 {
4526  GImGui->WantCaptureKeyboardNextFrame = capture ? 1 : 0;
4527 }
4528 
4529 void ImGui::CaptureMouseFromApp(bool capture)
4530 {
4531  GImGui->WantCaptureMouseNextFrame = capture ? 1 : 0;
4532 }
4533 
4534 bool ImGui::IsItemActive()
4535 {
4536  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4537  if (g.ActiveId)
4538  {
4539  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
4540  return g.ActiveId == window->DC.LastItemId;
4541  }
4542  return false;
4543 }
4544 
4545 bool ImGui::IsItemActivated()
4546 {
4547  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4548  if (g.ActiveId)
4549  {
4550  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
4551  if (g.ActiveId == window->DC.LastItemId && g.ActiveIdPreviousFrame != window->DC.LastItemId)
4552  return true;
4553  }
4554  return false;
4555 }
4556 
4557 bool ImGui::IsItemDeactivated()
4558 {
4559  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4560  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
4561  if (window->DC.LastItemStatusFlags & ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HasDeactivated)
4562  return (window->DC.LastItemStatusFlags & ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Deactivated) != 0;
4563  return (g.ActiveIdPreviousFrame == window->DC.LastItemId && g.ActiveIdPreviousFrame != 0 && g.ActiveId != window->DC.LastItemId);
4564 }
4565 
4566 bool ImGui::IsItemDeactivatedAfterEdit()
4567 {
4568  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4569  return IsItemDeactivated() && (g.ActiveIdPreviousFrameHasBeenEditedBefore || (g.ActiveId == 0 && g.ActiveIdHasBeenEditedBefore));
4570 }
4571 
4572 bool ImGui::IsItemFocused()
4573 {
4574  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4575  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
4576 
4577  if (g.NavId == 0 || g.NavDisableHighlight || g.NavId != window->DC.LastItemId)
4578  return false;
4579  return true;
4580 }
4581 
4582 bool ImGui::IsItemClicked(ImGuiMouseButton mouse_button)
4583 {
4584  return IsMouseClicked(mouse_button) && IsItemHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_None);
4585 }
4586 
4587 bool ImGui::IsItemToggledOpen()
4588 {
4589  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4590  return (g.CurrentWindow->DC.LastItemStatusFlags & ImGuiItemStatusFlags_ToggledOpen) ? true : false;
4591 }
4592 
4593 bool ImGui::IsItemToggledSelection()
4594 {
4595  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4596  return (g.CurrentWindow->DC.LastItemStatusFlags & ImGuiItemStatusFlags_ToggledSelection) ? true : false;
4597 }
4598 
4599 bool ImGui::IsAnyItemHovered()
4600 {
4601  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4602  return g.HoveredId != 0 || g.HoveredIdPreviousFrame != 0;
4603 }
4604 
4605 bool ImGui::IsAnyItemActive()
4606 {
4607  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4608  return g.ActiveId != 0;
4609 }
4610 
4611 bool ImGui::IsAnyItemFocused()
4612 {
4613  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4614  return g.NavId != 0 && !g.NavDisableHighlight;
4615 }
4616 
4617 bool ImGui::IsItemVisible()
4618 {
4619  ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindowRead();
4620  return window->ClipRect.Overlaps(window->DC.LastItemRect);
4621 }
4622 
4623 bool ImGui::IsItemEdited()
4624 {
4625  ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindowRead();
4626  return (window->DC.LastItemStatusFlags & ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Edited) != 0;
4627 }
4628 
4629 // Allow last item to be overlapped by a subsequent item. Both may be activated during the same frame before the later one takes priority.
4630 void ImGui::SetItemAllowOverlap()
4631 {
4632  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4633  if (g.HoveredId == g.CurrentWindow->DC.LastItemId)
4634  g.HoveredIdAllowOverlap = true;
4635  if (g.ActiveId == g.CurrentWindow->DC.LastItemId)
4636  g.ActiveIdAllowOverlap = true;
4637 }
4638 
4639 ImVec2 ImGui::GetItemRectMin()
4640 {
4641  ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindowRead();
4642  return window->DC.LastItemRect.Min;
4643 }
4644 
4645 ImVec2 ImGui::GetItemRectMax()
4646 {
4647  ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindowRead();
4648  return window->DC.LastItemRect.Max;
4649 }
4650 
4651 ImVec2 ImGui::GetItemRectSize()
4652 {
4653  ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindowRead();
4654  return window->DC.LastItemRect.GetSize();
4655 }
4656 
4657 static ImRect GetViewportRect()
4658 {
4659  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4660  return ImRect(0.0f, 0.0f, g.IO.DisplaySize.x, g.IO.DisplaySize.y);
4661 }
4662 
4663 bool ImGui::BeginChildEx(const char* name, ImGuiID id, const ImVec2& size_arg, bool border, ImGuiWindowFlags flags)
4664 {
4665  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4666  ImGuiWindow* parent_window = g.CurrentWindow;
4667 
4668  flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoResize | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoSavedSettings | ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow;
4669  flags |= (parent_window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMove); // Inherit the NoMove flag
4670 
4671  // Size
4672  const ImVec2 content_avail = GetContentRegionAvail();
4673  ImVec2 size = ImFloor(size_arg);
4674  const int auto_fit_axises = ((size.x == 0.0f) ? (1 << ImGuiAxis_X) : 0x00) | ((size.y == 0.0f) ? (1 << ImGuiAxis_Y) : 0x00);
4675  if (size.x <= 0.0f)
4676  size.x = ImMax(content_avail.x + size.x, 4.0f); // Arbitrary minimum child size (0.0f causing too much issues)
4677  if (size.y <= 0.0f)
4678  size.y = ImMax(content_avail.y + size.y, 4.0f);
4679  SetNextWindowSize(size);
4680 
4681  // Build up name. If you need to append to a same child from multiple location in the ID stack, use BeginChild(ImGuiID id) with a stable value.
4682  char title[256];
4683  if (name)
4684  ImFormatString(title, IM_ARRAYSIZE(title), "%s/%s_%08X", parent_window->Name, name, id);
4685  else
4686  ImFormatString(title, IM_ARRAYSIZE(title), "%s/%08X", parent_window->Name, id);
4687 
4688  const float backup_border_size = g.Style.ChildBorderSize;
4689  if (!border)
4690  g.Style.ChildBorderSize = 0.0f;
4691  bool ret = Begin(title, NULL, flags);
4692  g.Style.ChildBorderSize = backup_border_size;
4693 
4694  ImGuiWindow* child_window = g.CurrentWindow;
4695  child_window->ChildId = id;
4696  child_window->AutoFitChildAxises = (ImS8)auto_fit_axises;
4697 
4698  // Set the cursor to handle case where the user called SetNextWindowPos()+BeginChild() manually.
4699  // While this is not really documented/defined, it seems that the expected thing to do.
4700  if (child_window->BeginCount == 1)
4701  parent_window->DC.CursorPos = child_window->Pos;
4702 
4703  // Process navigation-in immediately so NavInit can run on first frame
4704  if (g.NavActivateId == id && !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NavFlattened) && (child_window->DC.NavLayerActiveMask != 0 || child_window->DC.NavHasScroll))
4705  {
4706  FocusWindow(child_window);
4707  NavInitWindow(child_window, false);
