4708  SetActiveID(id + 1, child_window); // Steal ActiveId with a dummy id so that key-press won't activate child item
4709  g.ActiveIdSource = ImGuiInputSource_Nav;
4710  }
4711  return ret;
4712 }
4713 
4714 bool ImGui::BeginChild(const char* str_id, const ImVec2& size_arg, bool border, ImGuiWindowFlags extra_flags)
4715 {
4716  ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
4717  return BeginChildEx(str_id, window->GetID(str_id), size_arg, border, extra_flags);
4718 }
4719 
4720 bool ImGui::BeginChild(ImGuiID id, const ImVec2& size_arg, bool border, ImGuiWindowFlags extra_flags)
4721 {
4722  IM_ASSERT(id != 0);
4723  return BeginChildEx(NULL, id, size_arg, border, extra_flags);
4724 }
4725 
4726 void ImGui::EndChild()
4727 {
4728  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4729  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
4730 
4731  IM_ASSERT(g.WithinEndChild == false);
4732  IM_ASSERT(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow); // Mismatched BeginChild()/EndChild() calls
4733 
4734  g.WithinEndChild = true;
4735  if (window->BeginCount > 1)
4736  {
4737  End();
4738  }
4739  else
4740  {
4741  ImVec2 sz = window->Size;
4742  if (window->AutoFitChildAxises & (1 << ImGuiAxis_X)) // Arbitrary minimum zero-ish child size of 4.0f causes less trouble than a 0.0f
4743  sz.x = ImMax(4.0f, sz.x);
4744  if (window->AutoFitChildAxises & (1 << ImGuiAxis_Y))
4745  sz.y = ImMax(4.0f, sz.y);
4746  End();
4747 
4748  ImGuiWindow* parent_window = g.CurrentWindow;
4749  ImRect bb(parent_window->DC.CursorPos, parent_window->DC.CursorPos + sz);
4750  ItemSize(sz);
4751  if ((window->DC.NavLayerActiveMask != 0 || window->DC.NavHasScroll) && !(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NavFlattened))
4752  {
4753  ItemAdd(bb, window->ChildId);
4754  RenderNavHighlight(bb, window->ChildId);
4755 
4756  // When browsing a window that has no activable items (scroll only) we keep a highlight on the child
4757  if (window->DC.NavLayerActiveMask == 0 && window == g.NavWindow)
4758  RenderNavHighlight(ImRect(bb.Min - ImVec2(2, 2), bb.Max + ImVec2(2, 2)), g.NavId, ImGuiNavHighlightFlags_TypeThin);
4759  }
4760  else
4761  {
4762  // Not navigable into
4763  ItemAdd(bb, 0);
4764  }
4765  }
4766  g.WithinEndChild = false;
4767 }
4768 
4769 // Helper to create a child window / scrolling region that looks like a normal widget frame.
4770 bool ImGui::BeginChildFrame(ImGuiID id, const ImVec2& size, ImGuiWindowFlags extra_flags)
4771 {
4772  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4773  const ImGuiStyle& style = g.Style;
4774  PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_ChildBg, style.Colors[ImGuiCol_FrameBg]);
4775  PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_ChildRounding, style.FrameRounding);
4776  PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_ChildBorderSize, style.FrameBorderSize);
4777  PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_WindowPadding, style.FramePadding);
4778  bool ret = BeginChild(id, size, true, ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMove | ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysUseWindowPadding | extra_flags);
4779  PopStyleVar(3);
4780  PopStyleColor();
4781  return ret;
4782 }
4783 
4784 void ImGui::EndChildFrame()
4785 {
4786  EndChild();
4787 }
4788 
4789 static void SetWindowConditionAllowFlags(ImGuiWindow* window, ImGuiCond flags, bool enabled)
4790 {
4791  window->SetWindowPosAllowFlags = enabled ? (window->SetWindowPosAllowFlags | flags) : (window->SetWindowPosAllowFlags & ~flags);
4792  window->SetWindowSizeAllowFlags = enabled ? (window->SetWindowSizeAllowFlags | flags) : (window->SetWindowSizeAllowFlags & ~flags);
4793  window->SetWindowCollapsedAllowFlags = enabled ? (window->SetWindowCollapsedAllowFlags | flags) : (window->SetWindowCollapsedAllowFlags & ~flags);
4794 }
4795 
4796 ImGuiWindow* ImGui::FindWindowByID(ImGuiID id)
4797 {
4798  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4799  return (ImGuiWindow*)g.WindowsById.GetVoidPtr(id);
4800 }
4801 
4802 ImGuiWindow* ImGui::FindWindowByName(const char* name)
4803 {
4804  ImGuiID id = ImHashStr(name);
4805  return FindWindowByID(id);
4806 }
4807 
4808 static void ApplyWindowSettings(ImGuiWindow* window, ImGuiWindowSettings* settings)
4809 {
4810  window->Pos = ImFloor(ImVec2(settings->Pos.x, settings->Pos.y));
4811  if (settings->Size.x > 0 && settings->Size.y > 0)
4812  window->Size = window->SizeFull = ImFloor(ImVec2(settings->Size.x, settings->Size.y));
4813  window->Collapsed = settings->Collapsed;
4814 }
4815 
4816 static ImGuiWindow* CreateNewWindow(const char* name, ImGuiWindowFlags flags)
4817 {
4818  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4819  //IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG("CreateNewWindow '%s', flags = 0x%08X\n", name, flags);
4820 
4821  // Create window the first time
4822  ImGuiWindow* window = IM_NEW(ImGuiWindow)(&g, name);
4823  window->Flags = flags;
4824  g.WindowsById.SetVoidPtr(window->ID, window);
4825 
4826  // Default/arbitrary window position. Use SetNextWindowPos() with the appropriate condition flag to change the initial position of a window.
4827  window->Pos = ImVec2(60, 60);
4828 
4829  // User can disable loading and saving of settings. Tooltip and child windows also don't store settings.
4830  if (!(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoSavedSettings))
4831  if (ImGuiWindowSettings* settings = ImGui::FindWindowSettings(window->ID))
4832  {
4833  // Retrieve settings from .ini file
4834  window->SettingsOffset = g.SettingsWindows.offset_from_ptr(settings);
4835  SetWindowConditionAllowFlags(window, ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver, false);
4836  ApplyWindowSettings(window, settings);
4837  }
4838  window->DC.CursorStartPos = window->DC.CursorMaxPos = window->Pos; // So first call to CalcContentSize() doesn't return crazy values
4839 
4840  if ((flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize) != 0)
4841  {
4842  window->AutoFitFramesX = window->AutoFitFramesY = 2;
4843  window->AutoFitOnlyGrows = false;
4844  }
4845  else
4846  {
4847  if (window->Size.x <= 0.0f)
4848  window->AutoFitFramesX = 2;
4849  if (window->Size.y <= 0.0f)
4850  window->AutoFitFramesY = 2;
4851  window->AutoFitOnlyGrows = (window->AutoFitFramesX > 0) || (window->AutoFitFramesY > 0);
4852  }
4853 
4854  g.WindowsFocusOrder.push_back(window);
4855  if (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoBringToFrontOnFocus)
4856  g.Windows.push_front(window); // Quite slow but rare and only once
4857  else
4858  g.Windows.push_back(window);
4859  return window;
4860 }
4861 
4862 static ImVec2 CalcWindowSizeAfterConstraint(ImGuiWindow* window, ImVec2 new_size)
4863 {
4864  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4865  if (g.NextWindowData.Flags & ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasSizeConstraint)
4866  {
4867  // Using -1,-1 on either X/Y axis to preserve the current size.
4868  ImRect cr = g.NextWindowData.SizeConstraintRect;
4869  new_size.x = (cr.Min.x >= 0 && cr.Max.x >= 0) ? ImClamp(new_size.x, cr.Min.x, cr.Max.x) : window->SizeFull.x;
4870  new_size.y = (cr.Min.y >= 0 && cr.Max.y >= 0) ? ImClamp(new_size.y, cr.Min.y, cr.Max.y) : window->SizeFull.y;
4871  if (g.NextWindowData.SizeCallback)
4872  {
4873  ImGuiSizeCallbackData data;
4874  data.UserData = g.NextWindowData.SizeCallbackUserData;
4875  data.Pos = window->Pos;
4876  data.CurrentSize = window->SizeFull;
4877  data.DesiredSize = new_size;
4878  g.NextWindowData.SizeCallback(&data);
4879  new_size = data.DesiredSize;
4880  }
4881  new_size.x = IM_FLOOR(new_size.x);
4882  new_size.y = IM_FLOOR(new_size.y);
4883  }
4884 
4885  // Minimum size
4886  if (!(window->Flags & (ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow | ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize)))
4887  {
4888  ImGuiWindow* window_for_height = window;
4889  new_size = ImMax(new_size, g.Style.WindowMinSize);
4890  new_size.y = ImMax(new_size.y, window_for_height->TitleBarHeight() + window_for_height->MenuBarHeight() + ImMax(0.0f, g.Style.WindowRounding - 1.0f)); // Reduce artifacts with very small windows
4891  }
4892  return new_size;
4893 }
4894 
4895 static ImVec2 CalcWindowContentSize(ImGuiWindow* window)
4896 {
4897  if (window->Collapsed)
4898  if (window->AutoFitFramesX <= 0 && window->AutoFitFramesY <= 0)
4899  return window->ContentSize;
4900  if (window->Hidden && window->HiddenFramesCannotSkipItems == 0 && window->HiddenFramesCanSkipItems > 0)
4901  return window->ContentSize;
4902 
4903  ImVec2 sz;
4904  sz.x = IM_FLOOR((window->ContentSizeExplicit.x != 0.0f) ? window->ContentSizeExplicit.x : window->DC.CursorMaxPos.x - window->DC.CursorStartPos.x);
4905  sz.y = IM_FLOOR((window->ContentSizeExplicit.y != 0.0f) ? window->ContentSizeExplicit.y : window->DC.CursorMaxPos.y - window->DC.CursorStartPos.y);
4906  return sz;
4907 }
4908 
4909 static ImVec2 CalcWindowAutoFitSize(ImGuiWindow* window, const ImVec2& size_contents)
4910 {
4911  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4912  ImGuiStyle& style = g.Style;
4913  ImVec2 size_decorations = ImVec2(0.0f, window->TitleBarHeight() + window->MenuBarHeight());
4914  ImVec2 size_pad = window->WindowPadding * 2.0f;
4915  ImVec2 size_desired = size_contents + size_pad + size_decorations;
4916  if (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip)
4917  {
4918  // Tooltip always resize
4919  return size_desired;
4920  }
4921  else
4922  {
4923  // Maximum window size is determined by the viewport size or monitor size
4924  const bool is_popup = (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup) != 0;
4925  const bool is_menu = (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildMenu) != 0;
4926  ImVec2 size_min = style.WindowMinSize;
4927  if (is_popup || is_menu) // Popups and menus bypass style.WindowMinSize by default, but we give then a non-zero minimum size to facilitate understanding problematic cases (e.g. empty popups)
4928  size_min = ImMin(size_min, ImVec2(4.0f, 4.0f));
4929  ImVec2 size_auto_fit = ImClamp(size_desired, size_min, ImMax(size_min, g.IO.DisplaySize - style.DisplaySafeAreaPadding * 2.0f));
4930 
4931  // When the window cannot fit all contents (either because of constraints, either because screen is too small),
4932  // we are growing the size on the other axis to compensate for expected scrollbar. FIXME: Might turn bigger than ViewportSize-WindowPadding.
4933  ImVec2 size_auto_fit_after_constraint = CalcWindowSizeAfterConstraint(window, size_auto_fit);
4934  bool will_have_scrollbar_x = (size_auto_fit_after_constraint.x - size_pad.x - size_decorations.x < size_contents.x && !(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollbar) && (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_HorizontalScrollbar)) || (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysHorizontalScrollbar);
4935  bool will_have_scrollbar_y = (size_auto_fit_after_constraint.y - size_pad.y - size_decorations.y < size_contents.y && !(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollbar)) || (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysVerticalScrollbar);
4936  if (will_have_scrollbar_x)
4937  size_auto_fit.y += style.ScrollbarSize;
4938  if (will_have_scrollbar_y)
4939  size_auto_fit.x += style.ScrollbarSize;
4940  return size_auto_fit;
4941  }
4942 }
4943 
4944 ImVec2 ImGui::CalcWindowExpectedSize(ImGuiWindow* window)
4945 {
4946  ImVec2 size_contents = CalcWindowContentSize(window);
4947  ImVec2 size_auto_fit = CalcWindowAutoFitSize(window, size_contents);
4948  ImVec2 size_final = CalcWindowSizeAfterConstraint(window, size_auto_fit);
4949  return size_final;
4950 }
4951 
4952 static ImGuiCol GetWindowBgColorIdxFromFlags(ImGuiWindowFlags flags)
4953 {
4954  if (flags & (ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip | ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup))
4955  return ImGuiCol_PopupBg;
4956  if (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow)
4957  return ImGuiCol_ChildBg;
4958  return ImGuiCol_WindowBg;
4959 }
4960 
4961 static void CalcResizePosSizeFromAnyCorner(ImGuiWindow* window, const ImVec2& corner_target, const ImVec2& corner_norm, ImVec2* out_pos, ImVec2* out_size)
4962 {
4963  ImVec2 pos_min = ImLerp(corner_target, window->Pos, corner_norm); // Expected window upper-left
4964  ImVec2 pos_max = ImLerp(window->Pos + window->Size, corner_target, corner_norm); // Expected window lower-right
4965  ImVec2 size_expected = pos_max - pos_min;
4966  ImVec2 size_constrained = CalcWindowSizeAfterConstraint(window, size_expected);
4967  *out_pos = pos_min;
4968  if (corner_norm.x == 0.0f)
4969  out_pos->x -= (size_constrained.x - size_expected.x);
4970  if (corner_norm.y == 0.0f)
4971  out_pos->y -= (size_constrained.y - size_expected.y);
4972  *out_size = size_constrained;
4973 }
4974 
4975 struct ImGuiResizeGripDef
4976 {
4977  ImVec2 CornerPosN;
4978  ImVec2 InnerDir;
4979  int AngleMin12, AngleMax12;
4980 };
4981 
4982 static const ImGuiResizeGripDef resize_grip_def[4] =
4983 {
4984  { ImVec2(1, 1), ImVec2(-1, -1), 0, 3 }, // Lower-right
4985  { ImVec2(0, 1), ImVec2(+1, -1), 3, 6 }, // Lower-left
4986  { ImVec2(0, 0), ImVec2(+1, +1), 6, 9 }, // Upper-left (Unused)
4987  { ImVec2(1, 0), ImVec2(-1, +1), 9, 12 }, // Upper-right (Unused)
4988 };
4989 
4990 struct ImGuiResizeBorderDef
4991 {
4992  ImVec2 InnerDir;
4993  ImVec2 CornerPosN1, CornerPosN2;
4994  float OuterAngle;
4995 };
4996 
4997 static const ImGuiResizeBorderDef resize_border_def[4] =
4998 {
4999  { ImVec2(0, +1), ImVec2(0, 0), ImVec2(1, 0), IM_PI * 1.50f }, // Top
5000  { ImVec2(-1, 0), ImVec2(1, 0), ImVec2(1, 1), IM_PI * 0.00f }, // Right
5001  { ImVec2(0, -1), ImVec2(1, 1), ImVec2(0, 1), IM_PI * 0.50f }, // Bottom
5002  { ImVec2(+1, 0), ImVec2(0, 1), ImVec2(0, 0), IM_PI * 1.00f } // Left
5003 };
5004 
5005 static ImRect GetResizeBorderRect(ImGuiWindow* window, int border_n, float perp_padding, float thickness)
5006 {
5007  ImRect rect = window->Rect();
5008  if (thickness == 0.0f) rect.Max -= ImVec2(1, 1);
5009  if (border_n == 0) { return ImRect(rect.Min.x + perp_padding, rect.Min.y - thickness, rect.Max.x - perp_padding, rect.Min.y + thickness); } // Top
5010  if (border_n == 1) { return ImRect(rect.Max.x - thickness, rect.Min.y + perp_padding, rect.Max.x + thickness, rect.Max.y - perp_padding); } // Right
5011  if (border_n == 2) { return ImRect(rect.Min.x + perp_padding, rect.Max.y - thickness, rect.Max.x - perp_padding, rect.Max.y + thickness); } // Bottom
5012  if (border_n == 3) { return ImRect(rect.Min.x - thickness, rect.Min.y + perp_padding, rect.Min.x + thickness, rect.Max.y - perp_padding); } // Left
5013  IM_ASSERT(0);
5014  return ImRect();
5015 }
5016 
5017 // 0..3: corners (Lower-right, Lower-left, Unused, Unused)
5018 // 4..7: borders (Top, Right, Bottom, Left)
5019 ImGuiID ImGui::GetWindowResizeID(ImGuiWindow* window, int n)
5020 {
5021  IM_ASSERT(n >= 0 && n <= 7);
5022  ImGuiID id = window->ID;
5023  id = ImHashStr("#RESIZE", 0, id);
5024  id = ImHashData(&n, sizeof(int), id);
5025  return id;
5026 }
5027 
5028 // Handle resize for: Resize Grips, Borders, Gamepad
5029 // Return true when using auto-fit (double click on resize grip)
5030 static bool ImGui::UpdateWindowManualResize(ImGuiWindow* window, const ImVec2& size_auto_fit, int* border_held, int resize_grip_count, ImU32 resize_grip_col[4], const ImRect& visibility_rect)
5031 {
5032  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5033  ImGuiWindowFlags flags = window->Flags;
5034 
5035  if ((flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoResize) || (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize) || window->AutoFitFramesX > 0 || window->AutoFitFramesY > 0)
5036  return false;
5037  if (window->WasActive == false) // Early out to avoid running this code for e.g. an hidden implicit/fallback Debug window.
5038  return false;
5039 
5040  bool ret_auto_fit = false;
5041  const int resize_border_count = g.IO.ConfigWindowsResizeFromEdges ? 4 : 0;
5042  const float grip_draw_size = IM_FLOOR(ImMax(g.FontSize * 1.35f, window->WindowRounding + 1.0f + g.FontSize * 0.2f));
5043  const float grip_hover_inner_size = IM_FLOOR(grip_draw_size * 0.75f);
5044  const float grip_hover_outer_size = g.IO.ConfigWindowsResizeFromEdges ? WINDOWS_RESIZE_FROM_EDGES_HALF_THICKNESS : 0.0f;
5045 
5046  ImVec2 pos_target(FLT_MAX, FLT_MAX);
5047  ImVec2 size_target(FLT_MAX, FLT_MAX);
5048 
5049  // Resize grips and borders are on layer 1
5050  window->DC.NavLayerCurrent = ImGuiNavLayer_Menu;
5051  window->DC.NavLayerCurrentMask = (1 << ImGuiNavLayer_Menu);
5052 
5053  // Manual resize grips
5054  PushID("#RESIZE");
5055  for (int resize_grip_n = 0; resize_grip_n < resize_grip_count; resize_grip_n++)
5056  {
5057  const ImGuiResizeGripDef& grip = resize_grip_def[resize_grip_n];
5058  const ImVec2 corner = ImLerp(window->Pos, window->Pos + window->Size, grip.CornerPosN);
5059 
5060  // Using the FlattenChilds button flag we make the resize button accessible even if we are hovering over a child window
5061  ImRect resize_rect(corner - grip.InnerDir * grip_hover_outer_size, corner + grip.InnerDir * grip_hover_inner_size);
5062  if (resize_rect.Min.x > resize_rect.Max.x) ImSwap(resize_rect.Min.x, resize_rect.Max.x);
5063  if (resize_rect.Min.y > resize_rect.Max.y) ImSwap(resize_rect.Min.y, resize_rect.Max.y);
5064  bool hovered, held;
5065  ButtonBehavior(resize_rect, window->GetID(resize_grip_n), &hovered, &held, ImGuiButtonFlags_FlattenChildren | ImGuiButtonFlags_NoNavFocus);
5066  //GetForegroundDrawList(window)->AddRect(resize_rect.Min, resize_rect.Max, IM_COL32(255, 255, 0, 255));
5067  if (hovered || held)
5068  g.MouseCursor = (resize_grip_n & 1) ? ImGuiMouseCursor_ResizeNESW : ImGuiMouseCursor_ResizeNWSE;
5069 
5070  if (held && g.IO.MouseDoubleClicked[0] && resize_grip_n == 0)
5071  {
5072  // Manual auto-fit when double-clicking
5073  size_target = CalcWindowSizeAfterConstraint(window, size_auto_fit);
5074  ret_auto_fit = true;
5075  ClearActiveID();
5076  }
5077  else if (held)
5078  {
5079  // Resize from any of the four corners
5080  // We don't use an incremental MouseDelta but rather compute an absolute target size based on mouse position
5081  ImVec2 corner_target = g.IO.MousePos - g.ActiveIdClickOffset + ImLerp(grip.InnerDir * grip_hover_outer_size, grip.InnerDir * -grip_hover_inner_size, grip.CornerPosN); // Corner of the window corresponding to our corner grip
5082  ImVec2 clamp_min = ImVec2(grip.CornerPosN.x == 1.0f ? visibility_rect.Min.x : -FLT_MAX, grip.CornerPosN.y == 1.0f ? visibility_rect.Min.y : -FLT_MAX);
5083  ImVec2 clamp_max = ImVec2(grip.CornerPosN.x == 0.0f ? visibility_rect.Max.x : +FLT_MAX, grip.CornerPosN.y == 0.0f ? visibility_rect.Max.y : +FLT_MAX);
5084  corner_target = ImClamp(corner_target, clamp_min, clamp_max);
5085  CalcResizePosSizeFromAnyCorner(window, corner_target, grip.CornerPosN, &pos_target, &size_target);
5086  }
5087  if (resize_grip_n == 0 || held || hovered)
5088  resize_grip_col[resize_grip_n] = GetColorU32(held ? ImGuiCol_ResizeGripActive : hovered ? ImGuiCol_ResizeGripHovered : ImGuiCol_ResizeGrip);
5089  }
5090  for (int border_n = 0; border_n < resize_border_count; border_n++)
5091  {
5092  bool hovered, held;
5093  ImRect border_rect = GetResizeBorderRect(window, border_n, grip_hover_inner_size, WINDOWS_RESIZE_FROM_EDGES_HALF_THICKNESS);
5094  ButtonBehavior(border_rect, window->GetID(border_n + 4), &hovered, &held, ImGuiButtonFlags_FlattenChildren);
5095  //GetForegroundDrawLists(window)->AddRect(border_rect.Min, border_rect.Max, IM_COL32(255, 255, 0, 255));
5096  if ((hovered && g.HoveredIdTimer > WINDOWS_RESIZE_FROM_EDGES_FEEDBACK_TIMER) || held)
5097  {
5098  g.MouseCursor = (border_n & 1) ? ImGuiMouseCursor_ResizeEW : ImGuiMouseCursor_ResizeNS;
5099  if (held)
5100  *border_held = border_n;
5101  }
5102  if (held)
5103  {
5104  ImVec2 border_target = window->Pos;
5105  ImVec2 border_posn;
5106  if (border_n == 0) { border_posn = ImVec2(0, 0); border_target.y = (g.IO.MousePos.y - g.ActiveIdClickOffset.y + WINDOWS_RESIZE_FROM_EDGES_HALF_THICKNESS); } // Top
5107  if (border_n == 1) { border_posn = ImVec2(1, 0); border_target.x = (g.IO.MousePos.x - g.ActiveIdClickOffset.x + WINDOWS_RESIZE_FROM_EDGES_HALF_THICKNESS); } // Right
5108  if (border_n == 2) { border_posn = ImVec2(0, 1); border_target.y = (g.IO.MousePos.y - g.ActiveIdClickOffset.y + WINDOWS_RESIZE_FROM_EDGES_HALF_THICKNESS); } // Bottom
5109  if (border_n == 3) { border_posn = ImVec2(0, 0); border_target.x = (g.IO.MousePos.x - g.ActiveIdClickOffset.x + WINDOWS_RESIZE_FROM_EDGES_HALF_THICKNESS); } // Left
5110  ImVec2 clamp_min = ImVec2(border_n == 1 ? visibility_rect.Min.x : -FLT_MAX, border_n == 2 ? visibility_rect.Min.y : -FLT_MAX);
5111  ImVec2 clamp_max = ImVec2(border_n == 3 ? visibility_rect.Max.x : +FLT_MAX, border_n == 0 ? visibility_rect.Max.y : +FLT_MAX);
5112  border_target = ImClamp(border_target, clamp_min, clamp_max);
5113  CalcResizePosSizeFromAnyCorner(window, border_target, border_posn, &pos_target, &size_target);
5114  }
5115  }
5116  PopID();
5117 
5118  // Restore nav layer
5119  window->DC.NavLayerCurrent = ImGuiNavLayer_Main;
5120  window->DC.NavLayerCurrentMask = (1 << ImGuiNavLayer_Main);
5121 
5122  // Navigation resize (keyboard/gamepad)
5123  if (g.NavWindowingTarget && g.NavWindowingTarget->RootWindow == window)
5124  {
5125  ImVec2 nav_resize_delta;
5126  if (g.NavInputSource == ImGuiInputSource_NavKeyboard && g.IO.KeyShift)
5127  nav_resize_delta = GetNavInputAmount2d(ImGuiNavDirSourceFlags_Keyboard, ImGuiInputReadMode_Down);
5128  if (g.NavInputSource == ImGuiInputSource_NavGamepad)
5129  nav_resize_delta = GetNavInputAmount2d(ImGuiNavDirSourceFlags_PadDPad, ImGuiInputReadMode_Down);
5130  if (nav_resize_delta.x != 0.0f || nav_resize_delta.y != 0.0f)
5131  {
5132  const float NAV_RESIZE_SPEED = 600.0f;
5133  nav_resize_delta *= ImFloor(NAV_RESIZE_SPEED * g.IO.DeltaTime * ImMin(g.IO.DisplayFramebufferScale.x, g.IO.DisplayFramebufferScale.y));
5134  nav_resize_delta = ImMax(nav_resize_delta, visibility_rect.Min - window->Pos - window->Size);
5135  g.NavWindowingToggleLayer = false;
5136  g.NavDisableMouseHover = true;
5137  resize_grip_col[0] = GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_ResizeGripActive);
5138  // FIXME-NAV: Should store and accumulate into a separate size buffer to handle sizing constraints properly, right now a constraint will make us stuck.
5139  size_target = CalcWindowSizeAfterConstraint(window, window->SizeFull + nav_resize_delta);
5140  }
5141  }
5142 
5143  // Apply back modified position/size to window
5144  if (size_target.x != FLT_MAX)
5145  {
5146  window->SizeFull = size_target;
5147  MarkIniSettingsDirty(window);
5148  }
5149  if (pos_target.x != FLT_MAX)
5150  {
5151  window->Pos = ImFloor(pos_target);
5152  MarkIniSettingsDirty(window);
5153  }
5154 
5155  window->Size = window->SizeFull;
5156  return ret_auto_fit;
5157 }
5158 
5159 static inline void ClampWindowRect(ImGuiWindow* window, const ImRect& visibility_rect)
5160 {
5161  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5162  ImVec2 size_for_clamping = window->Size;
5163  if (g.IO.ConfigWindowsMoveFromTitleBarOnly && !(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar))
5164  size_for_clamping.y = window->TitleBarHeight();
5165  window->Pos = ImClamp(window->Pos, visibility_rect.Min - size_for_clamping, visibility_rect.Max);
5166 }
5167 
5168 static void ImGui::RenderWindowOuterBorders(ImGuiWindow* window)
5169 {
5170  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5171  float rounding = window->WindowRounding;
5172  float border_size = window->WindowBorderSize;
5173  if (border_size > 0.0f && !(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoBackground))
5174  window->DrawList->AddRect(window->Pos, window->Pos + window->Size, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Border), rounding, ImDrawCornerFlags_All, border_size);
5175 
5176  int border_held = window->ResizeBorderHeld;
5177  if (border_held != -1)
5178  {
5179  const ImGuiResizeBorderDef& def = resize_border_def[border_held];
5180  ImRect border_r = GetResizeBorderRect(window, border_held, rounding, 0.0f);
5181  window->DrawList->PathArcTo(ImLerp(border_r.Min, border_r.Max, def.CornerPosN1) + ImVec2(0.5f, 0.5f) + def.InnerDir * rounding, rounding, def.OuterAngle - IM_PI * 0.25f, def.OuterAngle);
5182  window->DrawList->PathArcTo(ImLerp(border_r.Min, border_r.Max, def.CornerPosN2) + ImVec2(0.5f, 0.5f) + def.InnerDir * rounding, rounding, def.OuterAngle, def.OuterAngle + IM_PI * 0.25f);
5183  window->DrawList->PathStroke(GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_SeparatorActive), false, ImMax(2.0f, border_size)); // Thicker than usual
5184  }
5185  if (g.Style.FrameBorderSize > 0 && !(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar))
5186  {
5187  float y = window->Pos.y + window->TitleBarHeight() - 1;
5188  window->DrawList->AddLine(ImVec2(window->Pos.x + border_size, y), ImVec2(window->Pos.x + window->Size.x - border_size, y), GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Border), g.Style.FrameBorderSize);
5189  }
5190 }
5191 
5192 // Draw background and borders
5193 // Draw and handle scrollbars
5194 void ImGui::RenderWindowDecorations(ImGuiWindow* window, const ImRect& title_bar_rect, bool title_bar_is_highlight, int resize_grip_count, const ImU32 resize_grip_col[4], float resize_grip_draw_size)
5195 {
5196  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5197  ImGuiStyle& style = g.Style;
5198  ImGuiWindowFlags flags = window->Flags;
5199 
5200  // Ensure that ScrollBar doesn't read last frame's SkipItems
5201  window->SkipItems = false;
5202 
5203  // Draw window + handle manual resize
5204  // As we highlight the title bar when want_focus is set, multiple reappearing windows will have have their title bar highlighted on their reappearing frame.
5205  const float window_rounding = window->WindowRounding;
5206  const float window_border_size = window->WindowBorderSize;
5207  if (window->Collapsed)
5208  {
5209  // Title bar only
5210  float backup_border_size = style.FrameBorderSize;
5211  g.Style.FrameBorderSize = window->WindowBorderSize;
5212  ImU32 title_bar_col = GetColorU32((title_bar_is_highlight && !g.NavDisableHighlight) ? ImGuiCol_TitleBgActive : ImGuiCol_TitleBgCollapsed);
5213  RenderFrame(title_bar_rect.Min, title_bar_rect.Max, title_bar_col, true, window_rounding);
5214  g.Style.FrameBorderSize = backup_border_size;
5215  }
5216  else
5217  {
5218  // Window background
5219  if (!(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoBackground))
5220  {
5221  ImU32 bg_col = GetColorU32(GetWindowBgColorIdxFromFlags(flags));
5222  bool override_alpha = false;
5223  float alpha = 1.0f;
5224  if (g.NextWindowData.Flags & ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasBgAlpha)
5225  {
5226  alpha = g.NextWindowData.BgAlphaVal;
5227  override_alpha = true;
5228  }
5229  if (override_alpha)
5230  bg_col = (bg_col & ~IM_COL32_A_MASK) | (IM_F32_TO_INT8_SAT(alpha) << IM_COL32_A_SHIFT);
5231  window->DrawList->AddRectFilled(window->Pos + ImVec2(0, window->TitleBarHeight()), window->Pos + window->Size, bg_col, window_rounding, (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar) ? ImDrawCornerFlags_All : ImDrawCornerFlags_Bot);
5232  }
5233 
5234  // Title bar
5235  if (!(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar))
5236  {
5237  ImU32 title_bar_col = GetColorU32(title_bar_is_highlight ? ImGuiCol_TitleBgActive : ImGuiCol_TitleBg);
5238  window->DrawList->AddRectFilled(title_bar_rect.Min, title_bar_rect.Max, title_bar_col, window_rounding, ImDrawCornerFlags_Top);
5239  }
5240 
5241  // Menu bar
5242  if (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_MenuBar)
5243  {
5244  ImRect menu_bar_rect = window->MenuBarRect();
5245  menu_bar_rect.ClipWith(window->Rect()); // Soft clipping, in particular child window don't have minimum size covering the menu bar so this is useful for them.
5246  window->DrawList->AddRectFilled(menu_bar_rect.Min + ImVec2(window_border_size, 0), menu_bar_rect.Max - ImVec2(window_border_size, 0), GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_MenuBarBg), (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar) ? window_rounding : 0.0f, ImDrawCornerFlags_Top);
5247  if (style.FrameBorderSize > 0.0f && menu_bar_rect.Max.y < window->Pos.y + window->Size.y)
5248  window->DrawList->AddLine(menu_bar_rect.GetBL(), menu_bar_rect.GetBR(), GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Border), style.FrameBorderSize);
5249  }
5250 
5251  // Scrollbars
5252  if (window->ScrollbarX)
5253  Scrollbar(ImGuiAxis_X);
5254  if (window->ScrollbarY)
5255  Scrollbar(ImGuiAxis_Y);
5256 
5257  // Render resize grips (after their input handling so we don't have a frame of latency)
5258  if (!(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoResize))
5259  {
5260  for (int resize_grip_n = 0; resize_grip_n < resize_grip_count; resize_grip_n++)
5261  {
5262  const ImGuiResizeGripDef& grip = resize_grip_def[resize_grip_n];
5263  const ImVec2 corner = ImLerp(window->Pos, window->Pos + window->Size, grip.CornerPosN);
5264  window->DrawList->PathLineTo(corner + grip.InnerDir * ((resize_grip_n & 1) ? ImVec2(window_border_size, resize_grip_draw_size) : ImVec2(resize_grip_draw_size, window_border_size)));
5265  window->DrawList->PathLineTo(corner + grip.InnerDir * ((resize_grip_n & 1) ? ImVec2(resize_grip_draw_size, window_border_size) : ImVec2(window_border_size, resize_grip_draw_size)));
5266  window->DrawList->PathArcToFast(ImVec2(corner.x + grip.InnerDir.x * (window_rounding + window_border_size), corner.y + grip.InnerDir.y * (window_rounding + window_border_size)), window_rounding, grip.AngleMin12, grip.AngleMax12);
5267  window->DrawList->PathFillConvex(resize_grip_col[resize_grip_n]);
5268  }
5269  }
5270 
5271  // Borders
5272  RenderWindowOuterBorders(window);
5273  }
5274 }
5275 
5276 // Render title text, collapse button, close button
5277 void ImGui::RenderWindowTitleBarContents(ImGuiWindow* window, const ImRect& title_bar_rect, const char* name, bool* p_open)
5278 {
5279  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5280  ImGuiStyle& style = g.Style;
5281  ImGuiWindowFlags flags = window->Flags;
5282 
5283  const bool has_close_button = (p_open != NULL);
5284  const bool has_collapse_button = !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoCollapse) && (style.WindowMenuButtonPosition != ImGuiDir_None);
5285 
5286  // Close & Collapse button are on the Menu NavLayer and don't default focus (unless there's nothing else on that layer)
5287  const ImGuiItemFlags item_flags_backup = window->DC.ItemFlags;
5288  window->DC.ItemFlags |= ImGuiItemFlags_NoNavDefaultFocus;
5289  window->DC.NavLayerCurrent = ImGuiNavLayer_Menu;
5290  window->DC.NavLayerCurrentMask = (1 << ImGuiNavLayer_Menu);
5291 
5292  // Layout buttons
5293  // FIXME: Would be nice to generalize the subtleties expressed here into reusable code.
5294  float pad_l = style.FramePadding.x;
5295  float pad_r = style.FramePadding.x;
5296  float button_sz = g.FontSize;
5297  ImVec2 close_button_pos;
5298  ImVec2 collapse_button_pos;
5299  if (has_close_button)
5300  {
5301  pad_r += button_sz;
5302  close_button_pos = ImVec2(title_bar_rect.Max.x - pad_r - style.FramePadding.x, title_bar_rect.Min.y);
5303  }
5304  if (has_collapse_button && style.WindowMenuButtonPosition == ImGuiDir_Right)
5305  {
5306  pad_r += button_sz;
5307  collapse_button_pos = ImVec2(title_bar_rect.Max.x - pad_r - style.FramePadding.x, title_bar_rect.Min.y);
5308  }
5309  if (has_collapse_button && style.WindowMenuButtonPosition == ImGuiDir_Left)
5310  {
5311  collapse_button_pos = ImVec2(title_bar_rect.Min.x + pad_l - style.FramePadding.x, title_bar_rect.Min.y);
5312  pad_l += button_sz;
5313  }
5314 
5315  // Collapse button (submitting first so it gets priority when choosing a navigation init fallback)
5316  if (has_collapse_button)
5317  if (CollapseButton(window->GetID("#COLLAPSE"), collapse_button_pos))
5318  window->WantCollapseToggle = true; // Defer actual collapsing to next frame as we are too far in the Begin() function
5319 
5320  // Close button
5321  if (has_close_button)
5322  if (CloseButton(window->GetID("#CLOSE"), close_button_pos))
5323  *p_open = false;
5324 
5325  window->DC.NavLayerCurrent = ImGuiNavLayer_Main;
5326  window->DC.NavLayerCurrentMask = (1 << ImGuiNavLayer_Main);
5327  window->DC.ItemFlags = item_flags_backup;
5328 
5329  // Title bar text (with: horizontal alignment, avoiding collapse/close button, optional "unsaved document" marker)
5330  // FIXME: Refactor text alignment facilities along with RenderText helpers, this is WAY too much messy code..
5331  const char* UNSAVED_DOCUMENT_MARKER = "*";
5332  const float marker_size_x = (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_UnsavedDocument) ? CalcTextSize(UNSAVED_DOCUMENT_MARKER, NULL, false).x : 0.0f;
5333  const ImVec2 text_size = CalcTextSize(name, NULL, true) + ImVec2(marker_size_x, 0.0f);
5334 
5335  // As a nice touch we try to ensure that centered title text doesn't get affected by visibility of Close/Collapse button,
5336  // while uncentered title text will still reach edges correct.
5337  if (pad_l > style.FramePadding.x)
5338  pad_l += g.Style.ItemInnerSpacing.x;
5339  if (pad_r > style.FramePadding.x)
5340  pad_r += g.Style.ItemInnerSpacing.x;
5341  if (style.WindowTitleAlign.x > 0.0f && style.WindowTitleAlign.x < 1.0f)
5342  {
5343  float centerness = ImSaturate(1.0f - ImFabs(style.WindowTitleAlign.x - 0.5f) * 2.0f); // 0.0f on either edges, 1.0f on center
5344  float pad_extend = ImMin(ImMax(pad_l, pad_r), title_bar_rect.GetWidth() - pad_l - pad_r - text_size.x);
5345  pad_l = ImMax(pad_l, pad_extend * centerness);
5346  pad_r = ImMax(pad_r, pad_extend * centerness);
5347  }
5348 
5349  ImRect layout_r(title_bar_rect.Min.x + pad_l, title_bar_rect.Min.y, title_bar_rect.Max.x - pad_r, title_bar_rect.Max.y);
5350  ImRect clip_r(layout_r.Min.x, layout_r.Min.y, layout_r.Max.x + g.Style.ItemInnerSpacing.x, layout_r.Max.y);
5351  //if (g.IO.KeyCtrl) window->DrawList->AddRect(layout_r.Min, layout_r.Max, IM_COL32(255, 128, 0, 255)); // [DEBUG]
5352  RenderTextClipped(layout_r.Min, layout_r.Max, name, NULL, &text_size, style.WindowTitleAlign, &clip_r);
5353  if (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_UnsavedDocument)
5354  {
5355  ImVec2 marker_pos = ImVec2(ImMax(layout_r.Min.x, layout_r.Min.x + (layout_r.GetWidth() - text_size.x) * style.WindowTitleAlign.x) + text_size.x, layout_r.Min.y) + ImVec2(2 - marker_size_x, 0.0f);
5356  ImVec2 off = ImVec2(0.0f, IM_FLOOR(-g.FontSize * 0.25f));
5357  RenderTextClipped(marker_pos + off, layout_r.Max + off, UNSAVED_DOCUMENT_MARKER, NULL, NULL, ImVec2(0, style.WindowTitleAlign.y), &clip_r);
5358  }
5359 }
5360 
5361 void ImGui::UpdateWindowParentAndRootLinks(ImGuiWindow* window, ImGuiWindowFlags flags, ImGuiWindow* parent_window)
5362 {
5363  window->ParentWindow = parent_window;
5364  window->RootWindow = window->RootWindowForTitleBarHighlight = window->RootWindowForNav = window;
5365  if (parent_window && (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) && !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip))
5366  window->RootWindow = parent_window->RootWindow;
5367  if (parent_window && !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Modal) && (flags & (ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow | ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup)))
5368  window->RootWindowForTitleBarHighlight = parent_window->RootWindowForTitleBarHighlight;
5369  while (window->RootWindowForNav->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NavFlattened)
5370  {
5371  IM_ASSERT(window->RootWindowForNav->ParentWindow != NULL);
5372  window->RootWindowForNav = window->RootWindowForNav->ParentWindow;
5373  }
5374 }
5375 
5376 // Push a new Dear ImGui window to add widgets to.
5377 // - A default window called "Debug" is automatically stacked at the beginning of every frame so you can use widgets without explicitly calling a Begin/End pair.
5378 // - Begin/End can be called multiple times during the frame with the same window name to append content.
5379 // - The window name is used as a unique identifier to preserve window information across frames (and save rudimentary information to the .ini file).
5380 // You can use the "##" or "###" markers to use the same label with different id, or same id with different label. See documentation at the top of this file.
5381 // - Return false when window is collapsed, so you can early out in your code. You always need to call ImGui::End() even if false is returned.
5382 // - Passing 'bool* p_open' displays a Close button on the upper-right corner of the window, the pointed value will be set to false when the button is pressed.
5383 bool ImGui::Begin(const char* name, bool* p_open, ImGuiWindowFlags flags)
5384 {
5385  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5386  const ImGuiStyle& style = g.Style;
5387  IM_ASSERT(name != NULL && name[0] != '\0'); // Window name required
5388  IM_ASSERT(g.WithinFrameScope); // Forgot to call ImGui::NewFrame()
5389  IM_ASSERT(g.FrameCountEnded != g.FrameCount); // Called ImGui::Render() or ImGui::EndFrame() and haven't called ImGui::NewFrame() again yet
5390 
5391  // Find or create
5392  ImGuiWindow* window = FindWindowByName(name);
5393  const bool window_just_created = (window == NULL);
5394  if (window_just_created)
5395  window = CreateNewWindow(name, flags);
5396 
5397  // Automatically disable manual moving/resizing when NoInputs is set
5398  if ((flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoInputs) == ImGuiWindowFlags_NoInputs)
5399  flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMove | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoResize;
5400 
5401  if (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NavFlattened)
5402  IM_ASSERT(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow);
5403 
5404  const int current_frame = g.FrameCount;
5405  const bool first_begin_of_the_frame = (window->LastFrameActive != current_frame);
5406  window->IsFallbackWindow = (g.CurrentWindowStack.Size == 0 && g.WithinFrameScopeWithImplicitWindow);
5407 
5408  // Update the Appearing flag
5409  bool window_just_activated_by_user = (window->LastFrameActive < current_frame - 1); // Not using !WasActive because the implicit "Debug" window would always toggle off->on
5410  const bool window_just_appearing_after_hidden_for_resize = (window->HiddenFramesCannotSkipItems > 0);
5411  if (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup)
5412  {
5413  ImGuiPopupData& popup_ref = g.OpenPopupStack[g.BeginPopupStack.Size];
5414  window_just_activated_by_user |= (window->PopupId != popup_ref.PopupId); // We recycle popups so treat window as activated if popup id changed
5415  window_just_activated_by_user |= (window != popup_ref.Window);
5416  }
5417  window->Appearing = (window_just_activated_by_user || window_just_appearing_after_hidden_for_resize);
5418  if (window->Appearing)
5419  SetWindowConditionAllowFlags(window, ImGuiCond_Appearing, true);
5420 
5421  // Update Flags, LastFrameActive, BeginOrderXXX fields
5422  if (first_begin_of_the_frame)
5423  {
5424  window->Flags = (ImGuiWindowFlags)flags;
5425  window->LastFrameActive = current_frame;
5426  window->LastTimeActive = (float)g.Time;
5427  window->BeginOrderWithinParent = 0;
5428  window->BeginOrderWithinContext = (short)(g.WindowsActiveCount++);
5429  }
5430  else
5431  {
5432  flags = window->Flags;
5433  }
5434 
5435  // Parent window is latched only on the first call to Begin() of the frame, so further append-calls can be done from a different window stack
5436  ImGuiWindow* parent_window_in_stack = g.CurrentWindowStack.empty() ? NULL : g.CurrentWindowStack.back();
5437  ImGuiWindow* parent_window = first_begin_of_the_frame ? ((flags & (ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow | ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup)) ? parent_window_in_stack : NULL) : window->ParentWindow;
5438  IM_ASSERT(parent_window != NULL || !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow));
5439 
5440  // We allow window memory to be compacted so recreate the base stack when needed.
5441  if (window->IDStack.Size == 0)
5442  window->IDStack.push_back(window->ID);
5443 
5444  // Add to stack
5445  // We intentionally set g.CurrentWindow to NULL to prevent usage until when the viewport is set, then will call SetCurrentWindow()
5446  g.CurrentWindowStack.push_back(window);
5447  g.CurrentWindow = NULL;
5448  ErrorCheckBeginEndCompareStacksSize(window, true);
5449  if (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup)
5450  {
5451  ImGuiPopupData& popup_ref = g.OpenPopupStack[g.BeginPopupStack.Size];
5452  popup_ref.Window = window;
5453  g.BeginPopupStack.push_back(popup_ref);
5454  window->PopupId = popup_ref.PopupId;
5455  }
5456 
5457  if (window_just_appearing_after_hidden_for_resize && !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow))
5458  window->NavLastIds[0] = 0;
5459 
5460  // Update ->RootWindow and others pointers (before any possible call to FocusWindow)
5461  if (first_begin_of_the_frame)
5462  UpdateWindowParentAndRootLinks(window, flags, parent_window);
5463 
5464  // Process SetNextWindow***() calls
5465  // (FIXME: Consider splitting the HasXXX flags into X/Y components
5466  bool window_pos_set_by_api = false;
5467  bool window_size_x_set_by_api = false, window_size_y_set_by_api = false;
5468  if (g.NextWindowData.Flags & ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasPos)
5469  {
5470  window_pos_set_by_api = (window->SetWindowPosAllowFlags & g.NextWindowData.PosCond) != 0;
5471  if (window_pos_set_by_api && ImLengthSqr(g.NextWindowData.PosPivotVal) > 0.00001f)
5472  {
5473  // May be processed on the next frame if this is our first frame and we are measuring size
5474  // FIXME: Look into removing the branch so everything can go through this same code path for consistency.
5475  window->SetWindowPosVal = g.NextWindowData.PosVal;
5476  window->SetWindowPosPivot = g.NextWindowData.PosPivotVal;
5477  window->SetWindowPosAllowFlags &= ~(ImGuiCond_Once | ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver | ImGuiCond_Appearing);
5478  }
5479  else
5480  {
5481  SetWindowPos(window, g.NextWindowData.PosVal, g.NextWindowData.PosCond);
5482  }
5483  }
5484  if (g.NextWindowData.Flags & ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasSize)
5485  {
5486  window_size_x_set_by_api = (window->SetWindowSizeAllowFlags & g.NextWindowData.SizeCond) != 0 && (g.NextWindowData.SizeVal.x > 0.0f);
5487  window_size_y_set_by_api = (window->SetWindowSizeAllowFlags & g.NextWindowData.SizeCond) != 0 && (g.NextWindowData.SizeVal.y > 0.0f);
5488  SetWindowSize(window, g.NextWindowData.SizeVal, g.NextWindowData.SizeCond);
5489  }
5490  if (g.NextWindowData.Flags & ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasScroll)
5491  {
5492  if (g.NextWindowData.ScrollVal.x >= 0.0f)
5493  {
5494  window->ScrollTarget.x = g.NextWindowData.ScrollVal.x;
5495  window->ScrollTargetCenterRatio.x = 0.0f;
5496  }
5497  if (g.NextWindowData.ScrollVal.y >= 0.0f)
5498  {
5499  window->ScrollTarget.y = g.NextWindowData.ScrollVal.y;
5500  window->ScrollTargetCenterRatio.y = 0.0f;
5501  }
5502  }
5503  if (g.NextWindowData.Flags & ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasContentSize)
5504  window->ContentSizeExplicit = g.NextWindowData.ContentSizeVal;
5505  else if (first_begin_of_the_frame)
5506  window->ContentSizeExplicit = ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f);
5507  if (g.NextWindowData.Flags & ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasCollapsed)
5508  SetWindowCollapsed(window, g.NextWindowData.CollapsedVal, g.NextWindowData.CollapsedCond);
5509  if (g.NextWindowData.Flags & ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasFocus)
5510  FocusWindow(window);
5511  if (window->Appearing)
5512  SetWindowConditionAllowFlags(window, ImGuiCond_Appearing, false);
5513 
5514  // When reusing window again multiple times a frame, just append content (don't need to setup again)
5515  if (first_begin_of_the_frame)
5516  {
5517  // Initialize
5518  const bool window_is_child_tooltip = (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) && (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip); // FIXME-WIP: Undocumented behavior of Child+Tooltip for pinned tooltip (#1345)
5519  window->Active = true;
5520  window->HasCloseButton = (p_open != NULL);
5521  window->ClipRect = ImVec4(-FLT_MAX, -FLT_MAX, +FLT_MAX, +FLT_MAX);
5522  window->IDStack.resize(1);
5523  window->DrawList->_ResetForNewFrame();
5524 
5525  // Restore buffer capacity when woken from a compacted state, to avoid
5526  if (window->MemoryCompacted)
5527  GcAwakeTransientWindowBuffers(window);
5528 
5529  // Update stored window name when it changes (which can _only_ happen with the "###" operator, so the ID would stay unchanged).
5530  // The title bar always display the 'name' parameter, so we only update the string storage if it needs to be visible to the end-user elsewhere.
5531  bool window_title_visible_elsewhere = false;
5532  if (g.NavWindowingListWindow != NULL && (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavFocus) == 0) // Window titles visible when using CTRL+TAB
5533  window_title_visible_elsewhere = true;
5534  if (window_title_visible_elsewhere && !window_just_created && strcmp(name, window->Name) != 0)
5535  {
5536  size_t buf_len = (size_t)window->NameBufLen;
5537  window->Name = ImStrdupcpy(window->Name, &buf_len, name);
5538  window->NameBufLen = (int)buf_len;
5539  }
5540 
5541  // UPDATE CONTENTS SIZE, UPDATE HIDDEN STATUS
5542 
5543  // Update contents size from last frame for auto-fitting (or use explicit size)
5544  window->ContentSize = CalcWindowContentSize(window);
5545  if (window->HiddenFramesCanSkipItems > 0)
5546  window->HiddenFramesCanSkipItems--;
5547  if (window->HiddenFramesCannotSkipItems > 0)
5548  window->HiddenFramesCannotSkipItems--;
5549 
5550  // Hide new windows for one frame until they calculate their size
5551  if (window_just_created && (!window_size_x_set_by_api || !window_size_y_set_by_api))
5552  window->HiddenFramesCannotSkipItems = 1;
5553 
5554  // Hide popup/tooltip window when re-opening while we measure size (because we recycle the windows)
5555  // We reset Size/ContentSize for reappearing popups/tooltips early in this function, so further code won't be tempted to use the old size.
5556  if (window_just_activated_by_user && (flags & (ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup | ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip)) != 0)
5557  {
5558  window->HiddenFramesCannotSkipItems = 1;
5559  if (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize)
5560  {
5561  if (!window_size_x_set_by_api)
5562  window->Size.x = window->SizeFull.x = 0.f;
5563  if (!window_size_y_set_by_api)
5564  window->Size.y = window->SizeFull.y = 0.f;
5565  window->ContentSize = ImVec2(0.f, 0.f);
5566  }
5567  }
5568 
5569  // SELECT VIEWPORT
5570  // FIXME-VIEWPORT: In the docking/viewport branch, this is the point where we select the current viewport (which may affect the style)
5571  SetCurrentWindow(window);
5572 
5573  // LOCK BORDER SIZE AND PADDING FOR THE FRAME (so that altering them doesn't cause inconsistencies)
5574 
5575  if (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow)
5576  window->WindowBorderSize = style.ChildBorderSize;
5577  else
5578  window->WindowBorderSize = ((flags & (ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup | ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip)) && !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Modal)) ? style.PopupBorderSize : style.WindowBorderSize;
5579  window->WindowPadding = style.WindowPadding;
5580  if ((flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) && !(flags & (ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysUseWindowPadding | ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup)) && window->WindowBorderSize == 0.0f)
5581  window->WindowPadding = ImVec2(0.0f, (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_MenuBar) ? style.WindowPadding.y : 0.0f);
5582 
5583  // Collapse window by double-clicking on title bar
5584  // At this point we don't have a clipping rectangle setup yet, so we can use the title bar area for hit detection and drawing
5585  if (!(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar) && !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoCollapse))
5586  {
5587  // We don't use a regular button+id to test for double-click on title bar (mostly due to legacy reason, could be fixed), so verify that we don't have items over the title bar.
5588  ImRect title_bar_rect = window->TitleBarRect();
5589  if (g.HoveredWindow == window && g.HoveredId == 0 && g.HoveredIdPreviousFrame == 0 && IsMouseHoveringRect(title_bar_rect.Min, title_bar_rect.Max) && g.IO.MouseDoubleClicked[0])
5590  window->WantCollapseToggle = true;
5591  if (window->WantCollapseToggle)
5592  {
5593  window->Collapsed = !window->Collapsed;
5594  MarkIniSettingsDirty(window);
5595  FocusWindow(window);
5596  }
5597  }
5598  else
5599  {
5600  window->Collapsed = false;
5601  }
5602  window->WantCollapseToggle = false;
5603 
5604  // SIZE
5605 
5606  // Calculate auto-fit size, handle automatic resize
5607  const ImVec2 size_auto_fit = CalcWindowAutoFitSize(window, window->ContentSize);
5608  bool use_current_size_for_scrollbar_x = window_just_created;
5609  bool use_current_size_for_scrollbar_y = window_just_created;
5610  if ((flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize) && !window->Collapsed)
5611  {
5612  // Using SetNextWindowSize() overrides ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize, so it can be used on tooltips/popups, etc.
5613  if (!window_size_x_set_by_api)
5614  {
5615  window->SizeFull.x = size_auto_fit.x;
5616  use_current_size_for_scrollbar_x = true;
5617  }
5618  if (!window_size_y_set_by_api)
5619  {
5620  window->SizeFull.y = size_auto_fit.y;
5621  use_current_size_for_scrollbar_y = true;
5622  }
5623  }
5624  else if (window->AutoFitFramesX > 0 || window->AutoFitFramesY > 0)
5625  {
5626  // Auto-fit may only grow window during the first few frames
5627  // We still process initial auto-fit on collapsed windows to get a window width, but otherwise don't honor ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize when collapsed.
5628  if (!window_size_x_set_by_api && window->AutoFitFramesX > 0)
5629  {
5630  window->SizeFull.x = window->AutoFitOnlyGrows ? ImMax(window->SizeFull.x, size_auto_fit.x) : size_auto_fit.x;
5631  use_current_size_for_scrollbar_x = true;
5632  }
5633  if (!window_size_y_set_by_api && window->AutoFitFramesY > 0)
5634  {
5635  window->SizeFull.y = window->AutoFitOnlyGrows ? ImMax(window->SizeFull.y, size_auto_fit.y) : size_auto_fit.y;
5636  use_current_size_for_scrollbar_y = true;
5637  }
5638  if (!window->Collapsed)
5639  MarkIniSettingsDirty(window);
5640  }
5641 
5642  // Apply minimum/maximum window size constraints and final size
5643  window->SizeFull = CalcWindowSizeAfterConstraint(window, window->SizeFull);
5644  window->Size = window->Collapsed && !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) ? window->TitleBarRect().GetSize() : window->SizeFull;
5645 
5646  // Decoration size
5647  const float decoration_up_height = window->TitleBarHeight() + window->MenuBarHeight();
5648 
5649  // POSITION
5650 
5651  // Popup latch its initial position, will position itself when it appears next frame
5652  if (window_just_activated_by_user)
5653  {
5654  window->AutoPosLastDirection = ImGuiDir_None;
5655  if ((flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup) != 0 && !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Modal) && !window_pos_set_by_api) // FIXME: BeginPopup() could use SetNextWindowPos()
5656  window->Pos = g.BeginPopupStack.back().OpenPopupPos;
5657  }
5658 
5659  // Position child window
5660  if (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow)
5661  {
5662  IM_ASSERT(parent_window && parent_window->Active);
5663  window->BeginOrderWithinParent = (short)parent_window->DC.ChildWindows.Size;
5664  parent_window->DC.ChildWindows.push_back(window);
5665  if (!(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup) && !window_pos_set_by_api && !window_is_child_tooltip)
5666  window->Pos = parent_window->DC.CursorPos;
5667  }
5668 
5669  const bool window_pos_with_pivot = (window->SetWindowPosVal.x != FLT_MAX && window->HiddenFramesCannotSkipItems == 0);
5670  if (window_pos_with_pivot)
5671  SetWindowPos(window, window->SetWindowPosVal - window->SizeFull * window->SetWindowPosPivot, 0); // Position given a pivot (e.g. for centering)
5672  else if ((flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildMenu) != 0)
5673  window->Pos = FindBestWindowPosForPopup(window);
5674  else if ((flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup) != 0 && !window_pos_set_by_api && window_just_appearing_after_hidden_for_resize)
5675  window->Pos = FindBestWindowPosForPopup(window);
5676  else if ((flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip) != 0 && !window_pos_set_by_api && !window_is_child_tooltip)
5677  window->Pos = FindBestWindowPosForPopup(window);
5678 
5679  // Calculate the range of allowed position for that window (to be movable and visible past safe area padding)
5680  // When clamping to stay visible, we will enforce that window->Pos stays inside of visibility_rect.
5681  ImRect viewport_rect(GetViewportRect());
5682  ImVec2 visibility_padding = ImMax(style.DisplayWindowPadding, style.DisplaySafeAreaPadding);
5683  ImRect visibility_rect(viewport_rect.Min + visibility_padding, viewport_rect.Max - visibility_padding);
5684 
5685  // Clamp position/size so window stays visible within its viewport or monitor
5686  // Ignore zero-sized display explicitly to avoid losing positions if a window manager reports zero-sized window when initializing or minimizing.
5687  if (!window_pos_set_by_api && !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) && window->AutoFitFramesX <= 0 && window->AutoFitFramesY <= 0)
5688  if (viewport_rect.GetWidth() > 0.0f && viewport_rect.GetHeight() > 0.0f)
5689  ClampWindowRect(window, visibility_rect);
5690  window->Pos = ImFloor(window->Pos);
5691 
5692  // Lock window rounding for the frame (so that altering them doesn't cause inconsistencies)
5693  // Large values tend to lead to variety of artifacts and are not recommended.
5694  window->WindowRounding = (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) ? style.ChildRounding : ((flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup) && !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Modal)) ? style.PopupRounding : style.WindowRounding;
5695 
5696  // For windows with title bar or menu bar, we clamp to FrameHeight(FontSize + FramePadding.y * 2.0f) to completely hide artifacts.
5697  //if ((window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_MenuBar) || !(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar))
5698  // window->WindowRounding = ImMin(window->WindowRounding, g.FontSize + style.FramePadding.y * 2.0f);
5699 
5700  // Apply window focus (new and reactivated windows are moved to front)
5701  bool want_focus = false;
5702  if (window_just_activated_by_user && !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoFocusOnAppearing))
5703  {
5704  if (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup)
5705  want_focus = true;
5706  else if ((flags & (ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow | ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip)) == 0)
5707  want_focus = true;
5708  }
5709 
5710  // Handle manual resize: Resize Grips, Borders, Gamepad
5711  int border_held = -1;
5712  ImU32 resize_grip_col[4] = {};
5713  const int resize_grip_count = g.IO.ConfigWindowsResizeFromEdges ? 2 : 1; // Allow resize from lower-left if we have the mouse cursor feedback for it.
5714  const float resize_grip_draw_size = IM_FLOOR(ImMax(g.FontSize * 1.35f, window->WindowRounding + 1.0f + g.FontSize * 0.2f));
5715  if (!window->Collapsed)
5716  if (UpdateWindowManualResize(window, size_auto_fit, &border_held, resize_grip_count, &resize_grip_col[0], visibility_rect))
5717  use_current_size_for_scrollbar_x = use_current_size_for_scrollbar_y = true;
5718  window->ResizeBorderHeld = (signed char)border_held;
5719 
5720  // SCROLLBAR VISIBILITY
5721 
5722  // Update scrollbar visibility (based on the Size that was effective during last frame or the auto-resized Size).
5723  if (!window->Collapsed)
5724  {
5725  // When reading the current size we need to read it after size constraints have been applied.
5726  // When we use InnerRect here we are intentionally reading last frame size, same for ScrollbarSizes values before we set them again.
5727  ImVec2 avail_size_from_current_frame = ImVec2(window->SizeFull.x, window->SizeFull.y - decoration_up_height);
5728  ImVec2 avail_size_from_last_frame = window->InnerRect.GetSize() + window->ScrollbarSizes;
5729  ImVec2 needed_size_from_last_frame = window_just_created ? ImVec2(0, 0) : window->ContentSize + window->WindowPadding * 2.0f;
5730  float size_x_for_scrollbars = use_current_size_for_scrollbar_x ? avail_size_from_current_frame.x : avail_size_from_last_frame.x;
5731  float size_y_for_scrollbars = use_current_size_for_scrollbar_y ? avail_size_from_current_frame.y : avail_size_from_last_frame.y;
5732  //bool scrollbar_y_from_last_frame = window->ScrollbarY; // FIXME: May want to use that in the ScrollbarX expression? How many pros vs cons?
5733  window->ScrollbarY = (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysVerticalScrollbar) || ((needed_size_from_last_frame.y > size_y_for_scrollbars) && !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollbar));
5734  window->ScrollbarX = (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysHorizontalScrollbar) || ((needed_size_from_last_frame.x > size_x_for_scrollbars - (window->ScrollbarY ? style.ScrollbarSize : 0.0f)) && !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollbar) && (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_HorizontalScrollbar));
5735  if (window->ScrollbarX && !window->ScrollbarY)
5736  window->ScrollbarY = (needed_size_from_last_frame.y > size_y_for_scrollbars) && !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollbar);
5737  window->ScrollbarSizes = ImVec2(window->ScrollbarY ? style.ScrollbarSize : 0.0f, window->ScrollbarX ? style.ScrollbarSize : 0.0f);
5738  }
5739 
5740  // UPDATE RECTANGLES (1- THOSE NOT AFFECTED BY SCROLLING)
5741  // Update various regions. Variables they depends on should be set above in this function.
5742  // We set this up after processing the resize grip so that our rectangles doesn't lag by a frame.
5743 
5744  // Outer rectangle
5745  // Not affected by window border size. Used by:
5746  // - FindHoveredWindow() (w/ extra padding when border resize is enabled)
5747  // - Begin() initial clipping rect for drawing window background and borders.
5748  // - Begin() clipping whole child
5749  const ImRect host_rect = ((flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) && !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup) && !window_is_child_tooltip) ? parent_window->ClipRect : viewport_rect;
5750  const ImRect outer_rect = window->Rect();
5751  const ImRect title_bar_rect = window->TitleBarRect();
5752  window->OuterRectClipped = outer_rect;
5753  window->OuterRectClipped.ClipWith(host_rect);
5754 
5755  // Inner rectangle
5756  // Not affected by window border size. Used by:
5757  // - InnerClipRect
5758  // - ScrollToBringRectIntoView()
5759  // - NavUpdatePageUpPageDown()
5760  // - Scrollbar()
5761  window->InnerRect.Min.x = window->Pos.x;
5762  window->InnerRect.Min.y = window->Pos.y + decoration_up_height;
5763  window->InnerRect.Max.x = window->Pos.x + window->Size.x - window->ScrollbarSizes.x;
5764  window->InnerRect.Max.y = window->Pos.y + window->Size.y - window->ScrollbarSizes.y;
5765 
5766  // Inner clipping rectangle.
5767  // Will extend a little bit outside the normal work region.
5768  // This is to allow e.g. Selectable or CollapsingHeader or some separators to cover that space.
5769  // Force round operator last to ensure that e.g. (int)(max.x-min.x) in user's render code produce correct result.
5770  // Note that if our window is collapsed we will end up with an inverted (~null) clipping rectangle which is the correct behavior.
5771  // Affected by window/frame border size. Used by:
5772  // - Begin() initial clip rect
5773  float top_border_size = (((flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_MenuBar) || !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar)) ? style.FrameBorderSize : window->WindowBorderSize);
5774  window->InnerClipRect.Min.x = ImFloor(0.5f + window->InnerRect.Min.x + ImMax(ImFloor(window->WindowPadding.x * 0.5f), window->WindowBorderSize));
5775  window->InnerClipRect.Min.y = ImFloor(0.5f + window->InnerRect.Min.y + top_border_size);
5776  window->InnerClipRect.Max.x = ImFloor(0.5f + window->InnerRect.Max.x - ImMax(ImFloor(window->WindowPadding.x * 0.5f), window->WindowBorderSize));
5777  window->InnerClipRect.Max.y = ImFloor(0.5f + window->InnerRect.Max.y - window->WindowBorderSize);
5778  window->InnerClipRect.ClipWithFull(host_rect);
5779 
5780  // Default item width. Make it proportional to window size if window manually resizes
5781  if (window->Size.x > 0.0f && !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip) && !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize))
5782  window->ItemWidthDefault = ImFloor(window->Size.x * 0.65f);
5783  else
5784  window->ItemWidthDefault = ImFloor(g.FontSize * 16.0f);
5785 
5786  // SCROLLING
5787 
5788  // Lock down maximum scrolling
5789  // The value of ScrollMax are ahead from ScrollbarX/ScrollbarY which is intentionally using InnerRect from previous rect in order to accommodate
5790  // for right/bottom aligned items without creating a scrollbar.
5791  window->ScrollMax.x = ImMax(0.0f, window->ContentSize.x + window->WindowPadding.x * 2.0f - window->InnerRect.GetWidth());
5792  window->ScrollMax.y = ImMax(0.0f, window->ContentSize.y + window->WindowPadding.y * 2.0f - window->InnerRect.GetHeight());
5793 
5794  // Apply scrolling
5795  window->Scroll = CalcNextScrollFromScrollTargetAndClamp(window, true);
5796  window->ScrollTarget = ImVec2(FLT_MAX, FLT_MAX);
5797 
5798  // DRAWING
5799 
5800  // Setup draw list and outer clipping rectangle
5801  IM_ASSERT(window->DrawList->CmdBuffer.Size == 1 && window->DrawList->CmdBuffer[0].ElemCount == 0);
5802  window->DrawList->PushTextureID(g.Font->ContainerAtlas->TexID);
5803  PushClipRect(host_rect.Min, host_rect.Max, false);
5804 
5805  // Draw modal window background (darkens what is behind them, all viewports)
5806  const bool dim_bg_for_modal = (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Modal) && window == GetTopMostPopupModal() && window->HiddenFramesCannotSkipItems <= 0;
5807  const bool dim_bg_for_window_list = g.NavWindowingTargetAnim && (window == g.NavWindowingTargetAnim->RootWindow);
5808  if (dim_bg_for_modal || dim_bg_for_window_list)
5809  {
5810  const ImU32 dim_bg_col = GetColorU32(dim_bg_for_modal ? ImGuiCol_ModalWindowDimBg : ImGuiCol_NavWindowingDimBg, g.DimBgRatio);
5811  window->DrawList->AddRectFilled(viewport_rect.Min, viewport_rect.Max, dim_bg_col);
5812  }
5813 
5814  // Draw navigation selection/windowing rectangle background
5815  if (dim_bg_for_window_list && window == g.NavWindowingTargetAnim)
5816  {
5817  ImRect bb = window->Rect();
5818  bb.Expand(g.FontSize);
5819  if (!bb.Contains(viewport_rect)) // Avoid drawing if the window covers all the viewport anyway
5820  window->DrawList->AddRectFilled(bb.Min, bb.Max, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_NavWindowingHighlight, g.NavWindowingHighlightAlpha * 0.25f), g.Style.WindowRounding);
5821  }
5822 
5823  // Since 1.71, child window can render their decoration (bg color, border, scrollbars, etc.) within their parent to save a draw call.
5824  // When using overlapping child windows, this will break the assumption that child z-order is mapped to submission order.
5825  // We disable this when the parent window has zero vertices, which is a common pattern leading to laying out multiple overlapping child.
5826  // We also disabled this when we have dimming overlay behind this specific one child.
5827  // FIXME: More code may rely on explicit sorting of overlapping child window and would need to disable this somehow. Please get in contact if you are affected.
5828  {
5829  bool render_decorations_in_parent = false;
5830  if ((flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) && !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup) && !window_is_child_tooltip)
5831  if (window->DrawList->CmdBuffer.back().ElemCount == 0 && parent_window->DrawList->VtxBuffer.Size > 0)
5832  render_decorations_in_parent = true;
5833  if (render_decorations_in_parent)
5834  window->DrawList = parent_window->DrawList;
5835 
5836  // Handle title bar, scrollbar, resize grips and resize borders
5837  const ImGuiWindow* window_to_highlight = g.NavWindowingTarget ? g.NavWindowingTarget : g.NavWindow;
5838  const bool title_bar_is_highlight = want_focus || (window_to_highlight && window->RootWindowForTitleBarHighlight == window_to_highlight->RootWindowForTitleBarHighlight);
5839  RenderWindowDecorations(window, title_bar_rect, title_bar_is_highlight, resize_grip_count, resize_grip_col, resize_grip_draw_size);
5840 
5841  if (render_decorations_in_parent)
5842  window->DrawList = &window->DrawListInst;
5843  }
5844 
5845  // Draw navigation selection/windowing rectangle border
5846  if (g.NavWindowingTargetAnim == window)
5847  {
5848  float rounding = ImMax(window->WindowRounding, g.Style.WindowRounding);
5849  ImRect bb = window->Rect();
5850  bb.Expand(g.FontSize);
5851  if (bb.Contains(viewport_rect)) // If a window fits the entire viewport, adjust its highlight inward
5852  {
5853  bb.Expand(-g.FontSize - 1.0f);
5854  rounding = window->WindowRounding;
5855  }
5856  window->DrawList->AddRect(bb.Min, bb.Max, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_NavWindowingHighlight, g.NavWindowingHighlightAlpha), rounding, ~0, 3.0f);
5857  }
5858 
5859  // UPDATE RECTANGLES (2- THOSE AFFECTED BY SCROLLING)
5860 
5861  // Work rectangle.
5862  // Affected by window padding and border size. Used by:
5863  // - Columns() for right-most edge
5864  // - TreeNode(), CollapsingHeader() for right-most edge
5865  // - BeginTabBar() for right-most edge
5866  const bool allow_scrollbar_x = !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollbar) && (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_HorizontalScrollbar);
5867  const bool allow_scrollbar_y = !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollbar);
5868  const float work_rect_size_x = (window->ContentSizeExplicit.x != 0.0f ? window->ContentSizeExplicit.x : ImMax(allow_scrollbar_x ? window->ContentSize.x : 0.0f, window->Size.x - window->WindowPadding.x * 2.0f - window->ScrollbarSizes.x));
5869  const float work_rect_size_y = (window->ContentSizeExplicit.y != 0.0f ? window->ContentSizeExplicit.y : ImMax(allow_scrollbar_y ? window->ContentSize.y : 0.0f, window->Size.y - window->WindowPadding.y * 2.0f - decoration_up_height - window->ScrollbarSizes.y));
5870  window->WorkRect.Min.x = ImFloor(window->InnerRect.Min.x - window->Scroll.x + ImMax(window->WindowPadding.x, window->WindowBorderSize));
5871  window->WorkRect.Min.y = ImFloor(window->InnerRect.Min.y - window->Scroll.y + ImMax(window->WindowPadding.y, window->WindowBorderSize));
5872  window->WorkRect.Max.x = window->WorkRect.Min.x + work_rect_size_x;
5873  window->WorkRect.Max.y = window->WorkRect.Min.y + work_rect_size_y;
5874 
5875  // [LEGACY] Content Region
5876  // FIXME-OBSOLETE: window->ContentRegionRect.Max is currently very misleading / partly faulty, but some BeginChild() patterns relies on it.
5877  // Used by:
5878  // - Mouse wheel scrolling + many other things
5879  window->ContentRegionRect.Min.x = window->Pos.x - window->Scroll.x + window->WindowPadding.x;
5880  window->ContentRegionRect.Min.y = window->Pos.y - window->Scroll.y + window->WindowPadding.y + decoration_up_height;
5881  window->ContentRegionRect.Max.x = window->ContentRegionRect.Min.x + (window->ContentSizeExplicit.x != 0.0f ? window->ContentSizeExplicit.x : (window->Size.x - window->WindowPadding.x * 2.0f - window->ScrollbarSizes.x));
5882  window->ContentRegionRect.Max.y = window->ContentRegionRect.Min.y + (window->ContentSizeExplicit.y != 0.0f ? window->ContentSizeExplicit.y : (window->Size.y - window->WindowPadding.y * 2.0f - decoration_up_height - window->ScrollbarSizes.y));
5883 
5884  // Setup drawing context
5885  // (NB: That term "drawing context / DC" lost its meaning a long time ago. Initially was meant to hold transient data only. Nowadays difference between window-> and window->DC-> is dubious.)
5886  window->DC.Indent.x = 0.0f + window->WindowPadding.x - window->Scroll.x;
5887  window->DC.GroupOffset.x = 0.0f;
5888  window->DC.ColumnsOffset.x = 0.0f;
5889  window->DC.CursorStartPos = window->Pos + ImVec2(window->DC.Indent.x + window->DC.ColumnsOffset.x, decoration_up_height + window->WindowPadding.y - window->Scroll.y);
5890  window->DC.CursorPos = window->DC.CursorStartPos;
5891  window->DC.CursorPosPrevLine = window->DC.CursorPos;
5892  window->DC.CursorMaxPos = window->DC.CursorStartPos;
5893  window->DC.CurrLineSize = window->DC.PrevLineSize = ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f);
5894  window->DC.CurrLineTextBaseOffset = window->DC.PrevLineTextBaseOffset = 0.0f;
5895 
5896  window->DC.NavLayerCurrent = ImGuiNavLayer_Main;
5897  window->DC.NavLayerCurrentMask = (1 << ImGuiNavLayer_Main);
5898  window->DC.NavLayerActiveMask = window->DC.NavLayerActiveMaskNext;
5899  window->DC.NavLayerActiveMaskNext = 0x00;
5900  window->DC.NavFocusScopeIdCurrent = (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) ? parent_window->DC.NavFocusScopeIdCurrent : 0; // -V595
5901  window->DC.NavHideHighlightOneFrame = false;
5902  window->DC.NavHasScroll = (window->ScrollMax.y > 0.0f);
5903 
5904  window->DC.MenuBarAppending = false;
5905  window->DC.MenuBarOffset.x = ImMax(ImMax(window->WindowPadding.x, style.ItemSpacing.x), g.NextWindowData.MenuBarOffsetMinVal.x);
5906  window->DC.MenuBarOffset.y = g.NextWindowData.MenuBarOffsetMinVal.y;
5907  window->DC.MenuColumns.Update(3, style.ItemSpacing.x, window_just_activated_by_user);
5908  window->DC.TreeDepth = 0;
5909  window->DC.TreeJumpToParentOnPopMask = 0x00;
5910  window->DC.ChildWindows.resize(0);
5911  window->DC.StateStorage = &window->StateStorage;
5912  window->DC.CurrentColumns = NULL;
5913  window->DC.LayoutType = ImGuiLayoutType_Vertical;
5914  window->DC.ParentLayoutType = parent_window ? parent_window->DC.LayoutType : ImGuiLayoutType_Vertical;
5915  window->DC.FocusCounterRegular = window->DC.FocusCounterTabStop = -1;
5916 
5917  window->DC.ItemWidth = window->ItemWidthDefault;
5918  window->DC.TextWrapPos = -1.0f; // disabled
5919  window->DC.ItemFlagsStack.resize(0);
5920  window->DC.ItemWidthStack.resize(0);
5921  window->DC.TextWrapPosStack.resize(0);
5922  window->DC.GroupStack.resize(0);
5923  window->DC.ItemFlags = parent_window ? parent_window->DC.ItemFlags : ImGuiItemFlags_Default_;
5924  if (parent_window)
5925  window->DC.ItemFlagsStack.push_back(window->DC.ItemFlags);
5926 
5927  if (window->AutoFitFramesX > 0)
5928  window->AutoFitFramesX--;
5929  if (window->AutoFitFramesY > 0)
5930  window->AutoFitFramesY--;
5931 
5932  // Apply focus (we need to call FocusWindow() AFTER setting DC.CursorStartPos so our initial navigation reference rectangle can start around there)
5933  if (want_focus)
5934  {
5935  FocusWindow(window);
5936  NavInitWindow(window, false);
5937  }
5938 
5939  // Title bar
5940  if (!(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar))
5941  RenderWindowTitleBarContents(window, title_bar_rect, name, p_open);
5942 
5943  // Pressing CTRL+C while holding on a window copy its content to the clipboard
5944  // This works but 1. doesn't handle multiple Begin/End pairs, 2. recursing into another Begin/End pair - so we need to work that out and add better logging scope.
5945  // Maybe we can support CTRL+C on every element?
5946  /*
5947  if (g.ActiveId == move_id)
5948  if (g.IO.KeyCtrl && IsKeyPressedMap(ImGuiKey_C))
5949  LogToClipboard();
5950  */
5951 
5952  // We fill last item data based on Title Bar/Tab, in order for IsItemHovered() and IsItemActive() to be usable after Begin().
5953  // This is useful to allow creating context menus on title bar only, etc.
5954  window->DC.LastItemId = window->MoveId;
5955  window->DC.LastItemStatusFlags = IsMouseHoveringRect(title_bar_rect.Min, title_bar_rect.Max, false) ? ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HoveredRect : 0;
5956  window->DC.LastItemRect = title_bar_rect;
5957 #ifdef IMGUI_ENABLE_TEST_ENGINE
5958  if (!(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar))
5959  IMGUI_TEST_ENGINE_ITEM_ADD(window->DC.LastItemRect, window->DC.LastItemId);
5960 #endif
5961  }
5962  else
5963  {
5964  // Append
5965  SetCurrentWindow(window);
5966  }
5967 
5968  PushClipRect(window->InnerClipRect.Min, window->InnerClipRect.Max, true);
5969 
5970  // Clear 'accessed' flag last thing (After PushClipRect which will set the flag. We want the flag to stay false when the default "Debug" window is unused)
5971  if (first_begin_of_the_frame)
5972  window->WriteAccessed = false;
5973 
5974  window->BeginCount++;
5975  g.NextWindowData.ClearFlags();
5976 
5977  if (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow)
5978  {
5979  // Child window can be out of sight and have "negative" clip windows.
5980  // Mark them as collapsed so commands are skipped earlier (we can't manually collapse them because they have no title bar).
5981  IM_ASSERT((flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar) != 0);
5982  if (!(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize) && window->AutoFitFramesX <= 0 && window->AutoFitFramesY <= 0)
5983  if (window->OuterRectClipped.Min.x >= window->OuterRectClipped.Max.x || window->OuterRectClipped.Min.y >= window->OuterRectClipped.Max.y)
5984  window->HiddenFramesCanSkipItems = 1;
5985 
5986  // Hide along with parent or if parent is collapsed
5987  if (parent_window && (parent_window->Collapsed || parent_window->HiddenFramesCanSkipItems > 0))
5988  window->HiddenFramesCanSkipItems = 1;
5989  if (parent_window && (parent_window->Collapsed || parent_window->HiddenFramesCannotSkipItems > 0))
5990  window->HiddenFramesCannotSkipItems = 1;
5991  }
5992 
5993  // Don't render if style alpha is 0.0 at the time of Begin(). This is arbitrary and inconsistent but has been there for a long while (may remove at some point)
5994  if (style.Alpha <= 0.0f)
5995  window->HiddenFramesCanSkipItems = 1;
5996 
5997  // Update the Hidden flag
5998  window->Hidden = (window->HiddenFramesCanSkipItems > 0) || (window->HiddenFramesCannotSkipItems > 0);
5999 
6000  // Update the SkipItems flag, used to early out of all items functions (no layout required)
6001  bool skip_items = false;
6002  if (window->Collapsed || !window->Active || window->Hidden)
6003  if (window->AutoFitFramesX <= 0 && window->AutoFitFramesY <= 0 && window->HiddenFramesCannotSkipItems <= 0)
6004  skip_items = true;
6005  window->SkipItems = skip_items;
6006 
6007  return !skip_items;
6008 }
6009 
6010 void ImGui::End()
6011 {
6012  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
6013  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
6014 
6015  // Error checking: verify that user hasn't called End() too many times!
6016  if (g.CurrentWindowStack.Size <= 1 && g.WithinFrameScopeWithImplicitWindow)
6017  {
6018  IM_ASSERT_USER_ERROR(g.CurrentWindowStack.Size > 1, "Calling End() too many times!");
6019  return;
6020  }
6021  IM_ASSERT(g.CurrentWindowStack.Size > 0);
6022 
6023  // Error checking: verify that user doesn't directly call End() on a child window.
6024  if (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow)
6025  IM_ASSERT_USER_ERROR(g.WithinEndChild, "Must call EndChild() and not End()!");
6026 
6027  // Close anything that is open
6028  if (window->DC.CurrentColumns)
6029  EndColumns();
6030  PopClipRect(); // Inner window clip rectangle
6031 
6032  // Stop logging
6033  if (!(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow)) // FIXME: add more options for scope of logging
6034  LogFinish();
6035 
6036  // Pop from window stack
6037  g.CurrentWindowStack.pop_back();
6038  if (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup)
6039  g.BeginPopupStack.pop_back();
6040  ErrorCheckBeginEndCompareStacksSize(window, false);
6041  SetCurrentWindow(g.CurrentWindowStack.empty() ? NULL : g.CurrentWindowStack.back());
6042 }
6043 
6044 void ImGui::BringWindowToFocusFront(ImGuiWindow* window)
6045 {
6046  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
6047  if (g.WindowsFocusOrder.back() == window)
6048  return;
6049  for (int i = g.WindowsFocusOrder.Size - 2; i >= 0; i--) // We can ignore the top-most window
6050  if (g.WindowsFocusOrder[i] == window)
6051  {
6052  memmove(&g.WindowsFocusOrder[i], &g.WindowsFocusOrder[i + 1], (size_t)(g.WindowsFocusOrder.Size - i - 1) * sizeof(ImGuiWindow*));
6053  g.WindowsFocusOrder[g.WindowsFocusOrder.Size - 1] = window;
6054  break;
6055  }
6056 }
6057 
6058 void ImGui::BringWindowToDisplayFront(ImGuiWindow* window)
6059 {
6060  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
6061  ImGuiWindow* current_front_window = g.Windows.back();
6062  if (current_front_window == window || current_front_window->RootWindow == window)
6063  return;
6064  for (int i = g.Windows.Size - 2; i >= 0; i--) // We can ignore the top-most window
6065  if (g.Windows[i] == window)
6066  {
6067  memmove(&g.Windows[i], &g.Windows[i + 1], (size_t)(g.Windows.Size - i - 1) * sizeof(ImGuiWindow*));
6068  g.Windows[g.Windows.Size - 1] = window;
6069  break;
6070  }
6071 }
6072 
6073 void ImGui::BringWindowToDisplayBack(ImGuiWindow* window)
6074 {
6075  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
6076  if (g.Windows[0] == window)
6077  return;
6078  for (int i = 0; i < g.Windows.Size; i++)
6079  if (g.Windows[i] == window)
6080  {
6081  memmove(&g.Windows[1], &g.Windows[0], (size_t)i * sizeof(ImGuiWindow*));
6082  g.Windows[0] = window;
6083  break;
6084  }
6085 }
6086 
6087 // Moving window to front of display and set focus (which happens to be back of our sorted list)
6088 void ImGui::FocusWindow(ImGuiWindow* window)
6089 {
6090  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
6091 
6092  if (g.NavWindow != window)
6093  {
6094  g.NavWindow = window;
6095  if (window && g.NavDisableMouseHover)
6096  g.NavMousePosDirty = true;
6097  g.NavInitRequest = false;
6098  g.NavId = window ? window->NavLastIds[0] : 0; // Restore NavId
6099  g.NavFocusScopeId = 0;
6100  g.NavIdIsAlive = false;
6101  g.NavLayer = ImGuiNavLayer_Main;
6102  //IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG("FocusWindow(\"%s\")\n", window ? window->Name : NULL);
6103  }
6104 
6105  // Close popups if any
6106  ClosePopupsOverWindow(window, false);
6107 
6108  // Move the root window to the top of the pile
6109  IM_ASSERT(window == NULL || window->RootWindow != NULL);
6110  ImGuiWindow* focus_front_window = window ? window->RootWindow : NULL; // NB: In docking branch this is window->RootWindowDockStop
6111  ImGuiWindow* display_front_window = window ? window->RootWindow : NULL;
6112 
6113  // Steal focus on active widgets
6114  if (g.ActiveId != 0 && g.ActiveIdWindow && g.ActiveIdWindow->RootWindow != focus_front_window)
6115  ClearActiveID();
6116 
6117  // Passing NULL allow to disable keyboard focus
6118  if (!window)
6119  return;
6120 
6121  // Bring to front
6122  BringWindowToFocusFront(focus_front_window);
6123  if (((window->Flags | display_front_window->Flags) & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoBringToFrontOnFocus) == 0)
6124  BringWindowToDisplayFront(display_front_window);
6125 }
6126 
6127 void ImGui::FocusTopMostWindowUnderOne(ImGuiWindow* under_this_window, ImGuiWindow* ignore_window)
6128 {
6129  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
6130 
6131  int start_idx = g.WindowsFocusOrder.Size - 1;
6132  if (under_this_window != NULL)
6133  {
6134  int under_this_window_idx = FindWindowFocusIndex(under_this_window);
6135  if (under_this_window_idx != -1)
6136  start_idx = under_this_window_idx - 1;
6137  }
6138  for (int i = start_idx; i >= 0; i--)
6139  {
6140  // We may later decide to test for different NoXXXInputs based on the active navigation input (mouse vs nav) but that may feel more confusing to the user.
6141  ImGuiWindow* window = g.WindowsFocusOrder[i];
6142  if (window != ignore_window && window->WasActive && !(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow))
6143  if ((window->Flags & (ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMouseInputs | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavInputs)) != (ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMouseInputs | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavInputs))
6144  {
6145  ImGuiWindow* focus_window = NavRestoreLastChildNavWindow(window);
6146  FocusWindow(focus_window);
6147  return;
6148  }
6149  }
6150  FocusWindow(NULL);
6151 }
6152 
6153 void ImGui::SetCurrentFont(ImFont* font)
6154 {
6155  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
6156  IM_ASSERT(font && font->IsLoaded()); // Font Atlas not created. Did you call io.Fonts->GetTexDataAsRGBA32 / GetTexDataAsAlpha8 ?
6157  IM_ASSERT(font->Scale > 0.0f);
6158  g.Font = font;
6159  g.FontBaseSize = ImMax(1.0f, g.IO.FontGlobalScale * g.Font->FontSize * g.Font->Scale);
6160  g.FontSize = g.CurrentWindow ? g.CurrentWindow->CalcFontSize() : 0.0f;
6161 
6162  ImFontAtlas* atlas = g.Font->ContainerAtlas;
6163  g.DrawListSharedData.TexUvWhitePixel = atlas->TexUvWhitePixel;
6164  g.DrawListSharedData.TexUvLines = atlas->TexUvLines;
6165  g.DrawListSharedData.Font = g.Font;
6166  g.DrawListSharedData.FontSize = g.FontSize;
6167 }
6168 
6169 void ImGui::PushFont(ImFont* font)
6170 {
6171  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
6172  if (!font)
6173  font = GetDefaultFont();
6174  SetCurrentFont(font);
6175  g.FontStack.push_back(font);
6176  g.CurrentWindow->DrawList->PushTextureID(font->ContainerAtlas->TexID);
6177 }
6178 
6179 void ImGui::PopFont()
6180 {
6181  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
6182  g.CurrentWindow->DrawList->PopTextureID();
6183  g.FontStack.pop_back();
6184  SetCurrentFont(g.FontStack.empty() ? GetDefaultFont() : g.FontStack.back());
6185 }
6186 
6187 void ImGui::PushItemFlag(ImGuiItemFlags option, bool enabled)
6188 {
6189  ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
6190  if (enabled)
6191  window->DC.ItemFlags |= option;
6192  else
6193  window->DC.ItemFlags &= ~option;
6194  window->DC.ItemFlagsStack.push_back(window->DC.ItemFlags);
6195 }
6196 
6197 void ImGui::PopItemFlag()
6198 {
6199  ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
6200  window->DC.ItemFlagsStack.pop_back();
6201  window->DC.ItemFlags = window->DC.ItemFlagsStack.empty() ? ImGuiItemFlags_Default_ : window->DC.ItemFlagsStack.back();
6202 }
6203 
6204 // FIXME: Look into renaming this once we have settled the new Focus/Activation/TabStop system.
6205 void ImGui::PushAllowKeyboardFocus(bool allow_keyboard_focus)
6206 {
6207  PushItemFlag(ImGuiItemFlags_NoTabStop, !allow_keyboard_focus);
6208 }
6209 
6210 void ImGui::PopAllowKeyboardFocus()
6211 {
6212  PopItemFlag();
6213 }
6214
