6215 void ImGui::PushButtonRepeat(bool repeat)
6216 {
6217  PushItemFlag(ImGuiItemFlags_ButtonRepeat, repeat);
6218 }
6219 
6220 void ImGui::PopButtonRepeat()
6221 {
6222  PopItemFlag();
6223 }
6224 
6225 void ImGui::PushTextWrapPos(float wrap_pos_x)
6226 {
6227  ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
6228  window->DC.TextWrapPos = wrap_pos_x;
6229  window->DC.TextWrapPosStack.push_back(wrap_pos_x);
6230 }
6231 
6232 void ImGui::PopTextWrapPos()
6233 {
6234  ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
6235  window->DC.TextWrapPosStack.pop_back();
6236  window->DC.TextWrapPos = window->DC.TextWrapPosStack.empty() ? -1.0f : window->DC.TextWrapPosStack.back();
6237 }
6238 
6239 bool ImGui::IsWindowChildOf(ImGuiWindow* window, ImGuiWindow* potential_parent)
6240 {
6241  if (window->RootWindow == potential_parent)
6242  return true;
6243  while (window != NULL)
6244  {
6245  if (window == potential_parent)
6246  return true;
6247  window = window->ParentWindow;
6248  }
6249  return false;
6250 }
6251 
6252 bool ImGui::IsWindowHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags flags)
6253 {
6254  IM_ASSERT((flags & ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenOverlapped) == 0); // Flags not supported by this function
6255  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
6256 
6257  if (flags & ImGuiHoveredFlags_AnyWindow)
6258  {
6259  if (g.HoveredWindow == NULL)
6260  return false;
6261  }
6262  else
6263  {
6264  switch (flags & (ImGuiHoveredFlags_RootWindow | ImGuiHoveredFlags_ChildWindows))
6265  {
6266  case ImGuiHoveredFlags_RootWindow | ImGuiHoveredFlags_ChildWindows:
6267  if (g.HoveredRootWindow != g.CurrentWindow->RootWindow)
6268  return false;
6269  break;
6270  case ImGuiHoveredFlags_RootWindow:
6271  if (g.HoveredWindow != g.CurrentWindow->RootWindow)
6272  return false;
6273  break;
6274  case ImGuiHoveredFlags_ChildWindows:
6275  if (g.HoveredWindow == NULL || !IsWindowChildOf(g.HoveredWindow, g.CurrentWindow))
6276  return false;
6277  break;
6278  default:
6279  if (g.HoveredWindow != g.CurrentWindow)
6280  return false;
6281  break;
6282  }
6283  }
6284 
6285  if (!IsWindowContentHoverable(g.HoveredWindow, flags))
6286  return false;
6287  if (!(flags & ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByActiveItem))
6288  if (g.ActiveId != 0 && !g.ActiveIdAllowOverlap && g.ActiveId != g.HoveredWindow->MoveId)
6289  return false;
6290  return true;
6291 }
6292 
6293 bool ImGui::IsWindowFocused(ImGuiFocusedFlags flags)
6294 {
6295  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
6296 
6297  if (flags & ImGuiFocusedFlags_AnyWindow)
6298  return g.NavWindow != NULL;
6299 
6300  IM_ASSERT(g.CurrentWindow); // Not inside a Begin()/End()
6301  switch (flags & (ImGuiFocusedFlags_RootWindow | ImGuiFocusedFlags_ChildWindows))
6302  {
6303  case ImGuiFocusedFlags_RootWindow | ImGuiFocusedFlags_ChildWindows:
6304  return g.NavWindow && g.NavWindow->RootWindow == g.CurrentWindow->RootWindow;
6305  case ImGuiFocusedFlags_RootWindow:
6306  return g.NavWindow == g.CurrentWindow->RootWindow;
6307  case ImGuiFocusedFlags_ChildWindows:
6308  return g.NavWindow && IsWindowChildOf(g.NavWindow, g.CurrentWindow);
6309  default:
6310  return g.NavWindow == g.CurrentWindow;
6311  }
6312 }
6313 
6314 // Can we focus this window with CTRL+TAB (or PadMenu + PadFocusPrev/PadFocusNext)
6315 // Note that NoNavFocus makes the window not reachable with CTRL+TAB but it can still be focused with mouse or programmatically.
6316 // If you want a window to never be focused, you may use the e.g. NoInputs flag.
6317 bool ImGui::IsWindowNavFocusable(ImGuiWindow* window)
6318 {
6319  return window->Active && window == window->RootWindow && !(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavFocus);
6320 }
6321 
6322 float ImGui::GetWindowWidth()
6323 {
6324  ImGuiWindow* window = GImGui->CurrentWindow;
6325  return window->Size.x;
6326 }
6327 
6328 float ImGui::GetWindowHeight()
6329 {
6330  ImGuiWindow* window = GImGui->CurrentWindow;
6331  return window->Size.y;
6332 }
6333 
6334 ImVec2 ImGui::GetWindowPos()
6335 {
6336  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
6337  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
6338  return window->Pos;
6339 }
6340 
6341 void ImGui::SetWindowPos(ImGuiWindow* window, const ImVec2& pos, ImGuiCond cond)
6342 {
6343  // Test condition (NB: bit 0 is always true) and clear flags for next time
6344  if (cond && (window->SetWindowPosAllowFlags & cond) == 0)
6345  return;
6346 
6347  IM_ASSERT(cond == 0 || ImIsPowerOfTwo(cond)); // Make sure the user doesn't attempt to combine multiple condition flags.
6348  window->SetWindowPosAllowFlags &= ~(ImGuiCond_Once | ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver | ImGuiCond_Appearing);
6349  window->SetWindowPosVal = ImVec2(FLT_MAX, FLT_MAX);
6350 
6351  // Set
6352  const ImVec2 old_pos = window->Pos;
6353  window->Pos = ImFloor(pos);
6354  ImVec2 offset = window->Pos - old_pos;
6355  window->DC.CursorPos += offset; // As we happen to move the window while it is being appended to (which is a bad idea - will smear) let's at least offset the cursor
6356  window->DC.CursorMaxPos += offset; // And more importantly we need to offset CursorMaxPos/CursorStartPos this so ContentSize calculation doesn't get affected.
6357  window->DC.CursorStartPos += offset;
6358 }
6359 
6360 void ImGui::SetWindowPos(const ImVec2& pos, ImGuiCond cond)
6361 {
6362  ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindowRead();
6363  SetWindowPos(window, pos, cond);
6364 }
6365 
6366 void ImGui::SetWindowPos(const char* name, const ImVec2& pos, ImGuiCond cond)
6367 {
6368  if (ImGuiWindow* window = FindWindowByName(name))
6369  SetWindowPos(window, pos, cond);
6370 }
6371 
6372 ImVec2 ImGui::GetWindowSize()
6373 {
6374  ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindowRead();
6375  return window->Size;
6376 }
6377 
6378 void ImGui::SetWindowSize(ImGuiWindow* window, const ImVec2& size, ImGuiCond cond)
6379 {
6380  // Test condition (NB: bit 0 is always true) and clear flags for next time
6381  if (cond && (window->SetWindowSizeAllowFlags & cond) == 0)
6382  return;
6383 
6384  IM_ASSERT(cond == 0 || ImIsPowerOfTwo(cond)); // Make sure the user doesn't attempt to combine multiple condition flags.
6385  window->SetWindowSizeAllowFlags &= ~(ImGuiCond_Once | ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver | ImGuiCond_Appearing);
6386 
6387  // Set
6388  if (size.x > 0.0f)
6389  {
6390  window->AutoFitFramesX = 0;
6391  window->SizeFull.x = IM_FLOOR(size.x);
6392  }
6393  else
6394  {
6395  window->AutoFitFramesX = 2;
6396  window->AutoFitOnlyGrows = false;
6397  }
6398  if (size.y > 0.0f)
6399  {
6400  window->AutoFitFramesY = 0;
6401  window->SizeFull.y = IM_FLOOR(size.y);
6402  }
6403  else
6404  {
6405  window->AutoFitFramesY = 2;
6406  window->AutoFitOnlyGrows = false;
6407  }
6408 }
6409 
6410 void ImGui::SetWindowSize(const ImVec2& size, ImGuiCond cond)
6411 {
6412  SetWindowSize(GImGui->CurrentWindow, size, cond);
6413 }
6414 
6415 void ImGui::SetWindowSize(const char* name, const ImVec2& size, ImGuiCond cond)
6416 {
6417  if (ImGuiWindow* window = FindWindowByName(name))
6418  SetWindowSize(window, size, cond);
6419 }
6420 
6421 void ImGui::SetWindowCollapsed(ImGuiWindow* window, bool collapsed, ImGuiCond cond)
6422 {
6423  // Test condition (NB: bit 0 is always true) and clear flags for next time
6424  if (cond && (window->SetWindowCollapsedAllowFlags & cond) == 0)
6425  return;
6426  window->SetWindowCollapsedAllowFlags &= ~(ImGuiCond_Once | ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver | ImGuiCond_Appearing);
6427 
6428  // Set
6429  window->Collapsed = collapsed;
6430 }
6431 
6432 void ImGui::SetWindowCollapsed(bool collapsed, ImGuiCond cond)
6433 {
6434  SetWindowCollapsed(GImGui->CurrentWindow, collapsed, cond);
6435 }
6436 
6437 bool ImGui::IsWindowCollapsed()
6438 {
6439  ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindowRead();
6440  return window->Collapsed;
6441 }
6442 
6443 bool ImGui::IsWindowAppearing()
6444 {
6445  ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindowRead();
6446  return window->Appearing;
6447 }
6448 
6449 void ImGui::SetWindowCollapsed(const char* name, bool collapsed, ImGuiCond cond)
6450 {
6451  if (ImGuiWindow* window = FindWindowByName(name))
6452  SetWindowCollapsed(window, collapsed, cond);
6453 }
6454 
6455 void ImGui::SetWindowFocus()
6456 {
6457  FocusWindow(GImGui->CurrentWindow);
6458 }
6459 
6460 void ImGui::SetWindowFocus(const char* name)
6461 {
6462  if (name)
6463  {
6464  if (ImGuiWindow* window = FindWindowByName(name))
6465  FocusWindow(window);
6466  }
6467  else
6468  {
6469  FocusWindow(NULL);
6470  }
6471 }
6472 
6473 void ImGui::SetNextWindowPos(const ImVec2& pos, ImGuiCond cond, const ImVec2& pivot)
6474 {
6475  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
6476  IM_ASSERT(cond == 0 || ImIsPowerOfTwo(cond)); // Make sure the user doesn't attempt to combine multiple condition flags.
6477  g.NextWindowData.Flags |= ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasPos;
6478  g.NextWindowData.PosVal = pos;
6479  g.NextWindowData.PosPivotVal = pivot;
6480  g.NextWindowData.PosCond = cond ? cond : ImGuiCond_Always;
6481 }
6482 
6483 void ImGui::SetNextWindowSize(const ImVec2& size, ImGuiCond cond)
6484 {
6485  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
6486  IM_ASSERT(cond == 0 || ImIsPowerOfTwo(cond)); // Make sure the user doesn't attempt to combine multiple condition flags.
6487  g.NextWindowData.Flags |= ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasSize;
6488  g.NextWindowData.SizeVal = size;
6489  g.NextWindowData.SizeCond = cond ? cond : ImGuiCond_Always;
6490 }
6491 
6492 void ImGui::SetNextWindowSizeConstraints(const ImVec2& size_min, const ImVec2& size_max, ImGuiSizeCallback custom_callback, void* custom_callback_user_data)
6493 {
6494  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
6495  g.NextWindowData.Flags |= ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasSizeConstraint;
6496  g.NextWindowData.SizeConstraintRect = ImRect(size_min, size_max);
6497  g.NextWindowData.SizeCallback = custom_callback;
6498  g.NextWindowData.SizeCallbackUserData = custom_callback_user_data;
6499 }
6500 
6501 // Content size = inner scrollable rectangle, padded with WindowPadding.
6502 // SetNextWindowContentSize(ImVec2(100,100) + ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize will always allow submitting a 100x100 item.
6503 void ImGui::SetNextWindowContentSize(const ImVec2& size)
6504 {
6505  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
6506  g.NextWindowData.Flags |= ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasContentSize;
6507  g.NextWindowData.ContentSizeVal = size;
6508 }
6509

6512  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
6513  g.NextWindowData.Flags |= ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasScroll;
6514  g.NextWindowData.ScrollVal = scroll;
6515 }
6516 
6517 void ImGui::SetNextWindowCollapsed(bool collapsed, ImGuiCond cond)
6518 {
6519  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
6520  IM_ASSERT(cond == 0 || ImIsPowerOfTwo(cond)); // Make sure the user doesn't attempt to combine multiple condition flags.
6521  g.NextWindowData.Flags |= ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasCollapsed;
6522  g.NextWindowData.CollapsedVal = collapsed;
6523  g.NextWindowData.CollapsedCond = cond ? cond : ImGuiCond_Always;
6524 }

6574 
6575 // Note: this is storing in same stack as IDStack, so Push/Pop mismatch will be reported there.
6576 void ImGui::PushFocusScope(ImGuiID id)
6577 {
6578  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
6579  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
6580  window->IDStack.push_back(window->DC.NavFocusScopeIdCurrent);
6581  window->DC.NavFocusScopeIdCurrent = id;
6582 }
6583 
6584 void ImGui::PopFocusScope()
6585 {
6586  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
6587  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
6588  window->DC.NavFocusScopeIdCurrent = window->IDStack.back();
6589  window->IDStack.pop_back();
6590 }
6591 
6592 void ImGui::SetKeyboardFocusHere(int offset)
6593 {
6594  IM_ASSERT(offset >= -1); // -1 is allowed but not below
6595  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
6596  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
6597  g.FocusRequestNextWindow = window;
6598  g.FocusRequestNextCounterRegular = window->DC.FocusCounterRegular + 1 + offset;
6599  g.FocusRequestNextCounterTabStop = INT_MAX;
6600 }
6601 
6602 void ImGui::SetItemDefaultFocus()
6603 {
6604  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
6605  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
6606  if (!window->Appearing)
6607  return;
6608  if (g.NavWindow == window->RootWindowForNav && (g.NavInitRequest || g.NavInitResultId != 0) && g.NavLayer == g.NavWindow->DC.NavLayerCurrent)
6609  {
6610  g.NavInitRequest = false;
6611  g.NavInitResultId = g.NavWindow->DC.LastItemId;
6612  g.NavInitResultRectRel = ImRect(g.NavWindow->DC.LastItemRect.Min - g.NavWindow->Pos, g.NavWindow->DC.LastItemRect.Max - g.NavWindow->Pos);
6613  NavUpdateAnyRequestFlag();
6614  if (!IsItemVisible())
6615  SetScrollHereY();
6616  }
6617 }

6623 }

6699 }

6701 bool ImGui::IsRectVisible(const ImVec2& rect_min, const ImVec2& rect_max)
6702 {
6703  ImGuiWindow* window = GImGui->CurrentWindow;
6704  return window->ClipRect.Overlaps(ImRect(rect_min, rect_max));
6705 }
6706 
6707 
6708 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
6709 // [SECTION] ERROR CHECKING
6710 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
6711 
6712 // Helper function to verify ABI compatibility between caller code and compiled version of Dear ImGui.
6713 // Verify that the type sizes are matching between the calling file's compilation unit and imgui.cpp's compilation unit
6714 // If the user has inconsistent compilation settings, imgui configuration #define, packing pragma, etc. your user code
6715 // may see different structures than what imgui.cpp sees, which is problematic.
6716 // We usually require settings to be in imconfig.h to make sure that they are accessible to all compilation units involved with Dear ImGui.
6717 bool ImGui::DebugCheckVersionAndDataLayout(const char* version, size_t sz_io, size_t sz_style, size_t sz_vec2, size_t sz_vec4, size_t sz_vert, size_t sz_idx)
6718 {
6719  bool error = false;
6720  if (strcmp(version, IMGUI_VERSION) != 0) { error = true; IM_ASSERT(strcmp(version, IMGUI_VERSION) == 0 && "Mismatched version string!"); }
6721  if (sz_io != sizeof(ImGuiIO)) { error = true; IM_ASSERT(sz_io == sizeof(ImGuiIO) && "Mismatched struct layout!"); }
6722  if (sz_style != sizeof(ImGuiStyle)) { error = true; IM_ASSERT(sz_style == sizeof(ImGuiStyle) && "Mismatched struct layout!"); }
6723  if (sz_vec2 != sizeof(ImVec2)) { error = true; IM_ASSERT(sz_vec2 == sizeof(ImVec2) && "Mismatched struct layout!"); }
6724  if (sz_vec4 != sizeof(ImVec4)) { error = true; IM_ASSERT(sz_vec4 == sizeof(ImVec4) && "Mismatched struct layout!"); }
6725  if (sz_vert != sizeof(ImDrawVert)) { error = true; IM_ASSERT(sz_vert == sizeof(ImDrawVert) && "Mismatched struct layout!"); }
6726  if (sz_idx != sizeof(ImDrawIdx)) { error = true; IM_ASSERT(sz_idx == sizeof(ImDrawIdx) && "Mismatched struct layout!"); }
6727  return !error;
6728 }
6729 
6730 static void ImGui::ErrorCheckNewFrameSanityChecks()
6731 {
6732  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
6733 
6734  // Check user IM_ASSERT macro
6735  // (IF YOU GET A WARNING OR COMPILE ERROR HERE: it means you assert macro is incorrectly defined!
6736  // If your macro uses multiple statements, it NEEDS to be surrounded by a 'do { ... } while (0)' block.
6737  // This is a common C/C++ idiom to allow multiple statements macros to be used in control flow blocks.)
6738  // #define IM_ASSERT(EXPR) SomeCode(EXPR); SomeMoreCode(); // Wrong!
6739  // #define IM_ASSERT(EXPR) do { SomeCode(EXPR); SomeMoreCode(); } while (0) // Correct!
6740  if (true) IM_ASSERT(1); else IM_ASSERT(0);
6741 
6742  // Check user data
6743  // (We pass an error message in the assert expression to make it visible to programmers who are not using a debugger, as most assert handlers display their argument)
6744  IM_ASSERT(g.Initialized);
6745  IM_ASSERT((g.IO.DeltaTime > 0.0f || g.FrameCount == 0) && "Need a positive DeltaTime!");
6746  IM_ASSERT((g.FrameCount == 0 || g.FrameCountEnded == g.FrameCount) && "Forgot to call Render() or EndFrame() at the end of the previous frame?");
6747  IM_ASSERT(g.IO.DisplaySize.x >= 0.0f && g.IO.DisplaySize.y >= 0.0f && "Invalid DisplaySize value!");
6748  IM_ASSERT(g.IO.Fonts->Fonts.Size > 0 && "Font Atlas not built. Did you call io.Fonts->GetTexDataAsRGBA32() / GetTexDataAsAlpha8() ?");
6749  IM_ASSERT(g.IO.Fonts->Fonts[0]->IsLoaded() && "Font Atlas not built. Did you call io.Fonts->GetTexDataAsRGBA32() / GetTexDataAsAlpha8() ?");
6750  IM_ASSERT(g.Style.CurveTessellationTol > 0.0f && "Invalid style setting!");
6751  IM_ASSERT(g.Style.CircleSegmentMaxError > 0.0f && "Invalid style setting!");
6752  IM_ASSERT(g.Style.Alpha >= 0.0f && g.Style.Alpha <= 1.0f && "Invalid style setting. Alpha cannot be negative (allows us to avoid a few clamps in color computations)!");
6753  IM_ASSERT(g.Style.WindowMinSize.x >= 1.0f && g.Style.WindowMinSize.y >= 1.0f && "Invalid style setting.");
6754  IM_ASSERT(g.Style.WindowMenuButtonPosition == ImGuiDir_None || g.Style.WindowMenuButtonPosition == ImGuiDir_Left || g.Style.WindowMenuButtonPosition == ImGuiDir_Right);
6755  for (int n = 0; n < ImGuiKey_COUNT; n++)
6756  IM_ASSERT(g.IO.KeyMap[n] >= -1 && g.IO.KeyMap[n] < IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.IO.KeysDown) && "io.KeyMap[] contains an out of bound value (need to be 0..512, or -1 for unmapped key)");
6757 
6758  // Perform simple check: required key mapping (we intentionally do NOT check all keys to not pressure user into setting up everything, but Space is required and was only recently added in 1.60 WIP)
6759  if (g.IO.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableKeyboard)
6760  IM_ASSERT(g.IO.KeyMap[ImGuiKey_Space] != -1 && "ImGuiKey_Space is not mapped, required for keyboard navigation.");
6761 
6762  // Perform simple check: the beta io.ConfigWindowsResizeFromEdges option requires back-end to honor mouse cursor changes and set the ImGuiBackendFlags_HasMouseCursors flag accordingly.
6763  if (g.IO.ConfigWindowsResizeFromEdges && !(g.IO.BackendFlags & ImGuiBackendFlags_HasMouseCursors))
6764  g.IO.ConfigWindowsResizeFromEdges = false;
6765 }
6766 
6767 static void ImGui::ErrorCheckEndFrameSanityChecks()
6768 {
6769  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
6770 
6771  // Verify that io.KeyXXX fields haven't been tampered with. Key mods should not be modified between NewFrame() and EndFrame()
6772  // One possible reason leading to this assert is that your back-ends update inputs _AFTER_ NewFrame().
6773  const ImGuiKeyModFlags expected_key_mod_flags = GetMergedKeyModFlags();
6774  IM_ASSERT(g.IO.KeyMods == expected_key_mod_flags && "Mismatching io.KeyCtrl/io.KeyShift/io.KeyAlt/io.KeySuper vs io.KeyMods");
6775  IM_UNUSED(expected_key_mod_flags);
6776 
6777  // Report when there is a mismatch of Begin/BeginChild vs End/EndChild calls. Important: Remember that the Begin/BeginChild API requires you
6778  // to always call End/EndChild even if Begin/BeginChild returns false! (this is unfortunately inconsistent with most other Begin* API).
6779  if (g.CurrentWindowStack.Size != 1)
6780  {
6781  if (g.CurrentWindowStack.Size > 1)
6782  {
6783  IM_ASSERT_USER_ERROR(g.CurrentWindowStack.Size == 1, "Mismatched Begin/BeginChild vs End/EndChild calls: did you forget to call End/EndChild?");
6784  while (g.CurrentWindowStack.Size > 1)
6785  End();
6786  }
6787  else
6788  {
6789  IM_ASSERT_USER_ERROR(g.CurrentWindowStack.Size == 1, "Mismatched Begin/BeginChild vs End/EndChild calls: did you call End/EndChild too much?");
6790  }
6791  }
6792 }
6793 
6794 // Save and compare stack sizes on Begin()/End() to detect usage errors
6795 // Begin() calls this with write=true
6796 // End() calls this with write=false
6797 static void ImGui::ErrorCheckBeginEndCompareStacksSize(ImGuiWindow* window, bool write)
6798 {
6799  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
6800  short* p = &window->DC.StackSizesBackup[0];
6801 
6802  // Window stacks
6803  // NOT checking: DC.ItemWidth, DC.AllowKeyboardFocus, DC.ButtonRepeat, DC.TextWrapPos (per window) to allow user to conveniently push once and not pop (they are cleared on Begin)
6804  { int n = window->IDStack.Size; if (write) *p = (short)n; else IM_ASSERT(*p == n && "PushID/PopID or TreeNode/TreePop Mismatch!"); p++; } // Too few or too many PopID()/TreePop()
6805  { int n = window->DC.GroupStack.Size; if (write) *p = (short)n; else IM_ASSERT(*p == n && "BeginGroup/EndGroup Mismatch!"); p++; } // Too few or too many EndGroup()
6806 
6807  // Global stacks
6808  // For color, style and font stacks there is an incentive to use Push/Begin/Pop/.../End patterns, so we relax our checks a little to allow them.
6809  { int n = g.BeginPopupStack.Size; if (write) *p = (short)n; else IM_ASSERT(*p == n && "BeginMenu/EndMenu or BeginPopup/EndPopup Mismatch!"); p++; }// Too few or too many EndMenu()/EndPopup()
6810  { int n = g.ColorModifiers.Size; if (write) *p = (short)n; else IM_ASSERT(*p >= n && "PushStyleColor/PopStyleColor Mismatch!"); p++; } // Too few or too many PopStyleColor()
6811  { int n = g.StyleModifiers.Size; if (write) *p = (short)n; else IM_ASSERT(*p >= n && "PushStyleVar/PopStyleVar Mismatch!"); p++; } // Too few or too many PopStyleVar()
6812  { int n = g.FontStack.Size; if (write) *p = (short)n; else IM_ASSERT(*p >= n && "PushFont/PopFont Mismatch!"); p++; } // Too few or too many PopFont()
6813  IM_ASSERT(p == window->DC.StackSizesBackup + IM_ARRAYSIZE(window->DC.StackSizesBackup));
6814 }
6815 
6816 
6817 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
6818 // [SECTION] LAYOUT
6819 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
6820 // - ItemSize()
6821 // - ItemAdd()
6822 // - SameLine()
6823 // - GetCursorScreenPos()
6824 // - SetCursorScreenPos()
6825 // - GetCursorPos(), GetCursorPosX(), GetCursorPosY()
6826 // - SetCursorPos(), SetCursorPosX(), SetCursorPosY()
6827 // - GetCursorStartPos()
6828 // - Indent()
6829 // - Unindent()
6830 // - SetNextItemWidth()
6831 // - PushItemWidth()
6832 // - PushMultiItemsWidths()
6833 // - PopItemWidth()
6834 // - CalcItemWidth()
6835 // - CalcItemSize()
6836 // - GetTextLineHeight()
6837 // - GetTextLineHeightWithSpacing()
6838 // - GetFrameHeight()
6839 // - GetFrameHeightWithSpacing()
6840 // - GetContentRegionMax()
6841 // - GetContentRegionMaxAbs() [Internal]
6842 // - GetContentRegionAvail(),
6843 // - GetWindowContentRegionMin(), GetWindowContentRegionMax()
6844 // - GetWindowContentRegionWidth()
6845 // - BeginGroup()
6846 // - EndGroup()
6847 // Also see in imgui_widgets: tab bars, columns.
6848 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
6849 
6850 // Advance cursor given item size for layout.
6851 // Register minimum needed size so it can extend the bounding box used for auto-fit calculation.
6852 // See comments in ItemAdd() about how/why the size provided to ItemSize() vs ItemAdd() may often different.
6853 void ImGui::ItemSize(const ImVec2& size, float text_baseline_y)
6854 {
6855  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
6856  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
6857  if (window->SkipItems)
6858  return;
6859 
6860  // We increase the height in this function to accommodate for baseline offset.
6861  // In theory we should be offsetting the starting position (window->DC.CursorPos), that will be the topic of a larger refactor,
6862  // but since ItemSize() is not yet an API that moves the cursor (to handle e.g. wrapping) enlarging the height has the same effect.
6863  const float offset_to_match_baseline_y = (text_baseline_y >= 0) ? ImMax(0.0f, window->DC.CurrLineTextBaseOffset - text_baseline_y) : 0.0f;
6864  const float line_height = ImMax(window->DC.CurrLineSize.y, size.y + offset_to_match_baseline_y);
6865 
6866  // Always align ourselves on pixel boundaries
6867  //if (g.IO.KeyAlt) window->DrawList->AddRect(window->DC.CursorPos, window->DC.CursorPos + ImVec2(size.x, line_height), IM_COL32(255,0,0,200)); // [DEBUG]
6868  window->DC.CursorPosPrevLine.x = window->DC.CursorPos.x + size.x;
6869  window->DC.CursorPosPrevLine.y = window->DC.CursorPos.y;
6870  window->DC.CursorPos.x = IM_FLOOR(window->Pos.x + window->DC.Indent.x + window->DC.ColumnsOffset.x); // Next line
6871  window->DC.CursorPos.y = IM_FLOOR(window->DC.CursorPos.y + line_height + g.Style.ItemSpacing.y); // Next line
6872  window->DC.CursorMaxPos.x = ImMax(window->DC.CursorMaxPos.x, window->DC.CursorPosPrevLine.x);
6873  window->DC.CursorMaxPos.y = ImMax(window->DC.CursorMaxPos.y, window->DC.CursorPos.y - g.Style.ItemSpacing.y);
6874  //if (g.IO.KeyAlt) window->DrawList->AddCircle(window->DC.CursorMaxPos, 3.0f, IM_COL32(255,0,0,255), 4); // [DEBUG]
6875 
6876  window->DC.PrevLineSize.y = line_height;
6877  window->DC.CurrLineSize.y = 0.0f;
6878  window->DC.PrevLineTextBaseOffset = ImMax(window->DC.CurrLineTextBaseOffset, text_baseline_y);
6879  window->DC.CurrLineTextBaseOffset = 0.0f;
6880 
6881  // Horizontal layout mode
6882  if (window->DC.LayoutType == ImGuiLayoutType_Horizontal)
6883  SameLine();
6884 }
6885 
6886 void ImGui::ItemSize(const ImRect& bb, float text_baseline_y)
6887 {
6888  ItemSize(bb.GetSize(), text_baseline_y);
6889 }
6890 
6891 // Declare item bounding box for clipping and interaction.
6892 // Note that the size can be different than the one provided to ItemSize(). Typically, widgets that spread over available surface
6893 // declare their minimum size requirement to ItemSize() and provide a larger region to ItemAdd() which is used drawing/interaction.
6894 bool ImGui::ItemAdd(const ImRect& bb, ImGuiID id, const ImRect* nav_bb_arg)
6895 {
6896  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
6897  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
6898 
6899  if (id != 0)
6900  {
6901  // Navigation processing runs prior to clipping early-out
6902  // (a) So that NavInitRequest can be honored, for newly opened windows to select a default widget
6903  // (b) So that we can scroll up/down past clipped items. This adds a small O(N) cost to regular navigation requests
6904  // unfortunately, but it is still limited to one window. It may not scale very well for windows with ten of
6905  // thousands of item, but at least NavMoveRequest is only set on user interaction, aka maximum once a frame.
6906  // We could early out with "if (is_clipped && !g.NavInitRequest) return false;" but when we wouldn't be able
6907  // to reach unclipped widgets. This would work if user had explicit scrolling control (e.g. mapped on a stick).
6908  // We intentionally don't check if g.NavWindow != NULL because g.NavAnyRequest should only be set when it is non null.
6909  // If we crash on a NULL g.NavWindow we need to fix the bug elsewhere.
6910  window->DC.NavLayerActiveMaskNext |= window->DC.NavLayerCurrentMask;
6911  if (g.NavId == id || g.NavAnyRequest)
6912  if (g.NavWindow->RootWindowForNav == window->RootWindowForNav)
6913  if (window == g.NavWindow || ((window->Flags | g.NavWindow->Flags) & ImGuiWindowFlags_NavFlattened))
6914  NavProcessItem(window, nav_bb_arg ? *nav_bb_arg : bb, id);
6915 
6916  // [DEBUG] Item Picker tool, when enabling the "extended" version we perform the check in ItemAdd()
6917 #ifdef IMGUI_DEBUG_TOOL_ITEM_PICKER_EX
6918  if (id == g.DebugItemPickerBreakId)
6919  {
6920  IM_DEBUG_BREAK();
6921  g.DebugItemPickerBreakId = 0;
6922  }
6923 #endif
6924  }
6925 
6926  window->DC.LastItemId = id;
6927  window->DC.LastItemRect = bb;
6928  window->DC.LastItemStatusFlags = ImGuiItemStatusFlags_None;
6929  g.NextItemData.Flags = ImGuiNextItemDataFlags_None;
6930 
6931 #ifdef IMGUI_ENABLE_TEST_ENGINE
6932  if (id != 0)
6933  IMGUI_TEST_ENGINE_ITEM_ADD(nav_bb_arg ? *nav_bb_arg : bb, id);
6934 #endif
6935 
6936  // Clipping test
6937  const bool is_clipped = IsClippedEx(bb, id, false);
6938  if (is_clipped)
6939  return false;
6940  //if (g.IO.KeyAlt) window->DrawList->AddRect(bb.Min, bb.Max, IM_COL32(255,255,0,120)); // [DEBUG]
6941 
6942  // We need to calculate this now to take account of the current clipping rectangle (as items like Selectable may change them)
6943  if (IsMouseHoveringRect(bb.Min, bb.Max))
6944  window->DC.LastItemStatusFlags |= ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HoveredRect;
6945  return true;
6946 }
6947 
6948 // Gets back to previous line and continue with horizontal layout
6949 // offset_from_start_x == 0 : follow right after previous item
6950 // offset_from_start_x != 0 : align to specified x position (relative to window/group left)
6951 // spacing_w < 0 : use default spacing if pos_x == 0, no spacing if pos_x != 0
6952 // spacing_w >= 0 : enforce spacing amount
6953 void ImGui::SameLine(float offset_from_start_x, float spacing_w)
6954 {
6955  ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
6956  if (window->SkipItems)
6957  return;
6958 
6959  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
6960  if (offset_from_start_x != 0.0f)
6961  {
6962  if (spacing_w < 0.0f) spacing_w = 0.0f;
6963  window->DC.CursorPos.x = window->Pos.x - window->Scroll.x + offset_from_start_x + spacing_w + window->DC.GroupOffset.x + window->DC.ColumnsOffset.x;
6964  window->DC.CursorPos.y = window->DC.CursorPosPrevLine.y;
6965  }
6966  else
6967  {
6968  if (spacing_w < 0.0f) spacing_w = g.Style.ItemSpacing.x;
6969  window->DC.CursorPos.x = window->DC.CursorPosPrevLine.x + spacing_w;
6970  window->DC.CursorPos.y = window->DC.CursorPosPrevLine.y;
6971  }
6972  window->DC.CurrLineSize = window->DC.PrevLineSize;
6973  window->DC.CurrLineTextBaseOffset = window->DC.PrevLineTextBaseOffset;
6974 }
6975 
6976 ImVec2 ImGui::GetCursorScreenPos()
6977 {
6978  ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindowRead();
6979  return window->DC.CursorPos;
6980 }
6981 
6982 void ImGui::SetCursorScreenPos(const ImVec2& pos)
6983 {
6984  ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
6985  window->DC.CursorPos = pos;
6986  window->DC.CursorMaxPos = ImMax(window->DC.CursorMaxPos, window->DC.CursorPos);
6987 }
6988 
6989 // User generally sees positions in window coordinates. Internally we store CursorPos in absolute screen coordinates because it is more convenient.
6990 // Conversion happens as we pass the value to user, but it makes our naming convention confusing because GetCursorPos() == (DC.CursorPos - window.Pos). May want to rename 'DC.CursorPos'.
6991 ImVec2 ImGui::GetCursorPos()
6992 {
6993  ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindowRead();
6994  return window->DC.CursorPos - window->Pos + window->Scroll;
6995 }
6996 
6997 float ImGui::GetCursorPosX()
6998 {
6999  ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindowRead();
7000  return window->DC.CursorPos.x - window->Pos.x + window->Scroll.x;
7001 }
7002 
7003 float ImGui::GetCursorPosY()
7004 {
7005  ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindowRead();
7006  return window->DC.CursorPos.y - window->Pos.y + window->Scroll.y;
7007 }
7008 
7009 void ImGui::SetCursorPos(const ImVec2& local_pos)
7010 {
7011  ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
7012  window->DC.CursorPos = window->Pos - window->Scroll + local_pos;
7013  window->DC.CursorMaxPos = ImMax(window->DC.CursorMaxPos, window->DC.CursorPos);
7014 }
7015 
7016 void ImGui::SetCursorPosX(float x)
7017 {
7018  ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
7019  window->DC.CursorPos.x = window->Pos.x - window->Scroll.x + x;
7020  window->DC.CursorMaxPos.x = ImMax(window->DC.CursorMaxPos.x, window->DC.CursorPos.x);
7021 }
7022 
7023 void ImGui::SetCursorPosY(float y)
7024 {
7025  ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
7026  window->DC.CursorPos.y = window->Pos.y - window->Scroll.y + y;
7027  window->DC.CursorMaxPos.y = ImMax(window->DC.CursorMaxPos.y, window->DC.CursorPos.y);
7028 }
7029 
7030 ImVec2 ImGui::GetCursorStartPos()
7031 {
7032  ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindowRead();
7033  return window->DC.CursorStartPos - window->Pos;
7034 }
7035 
7036 void ImGui::Indent(float indent_w)
7037 {
7038  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7039  ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
7040  window->DC.Indent.x += (indent_w != 0.0f) ? indent_w : g.Style.IndentSpacing;
7041  window->DC.CursorPos.x = window->Pos.x + window->DC.Indent.x + window->DC.ColumnsOffset.x;
7042 }
7043 
7044 void ImGui::Unindent(float indent_w)
7045 {
7046  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7047  ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
7048  window->DC.Indent.x -= (indent_w != 0.0f) ? indent_w : g.Style.IndentSpacing;
7049  window->DC.CursorPos.x = window->Pos.x + window->DC.Indent.x + window->DC.ColumnsOffset.x;
7050 }
7051 
7052 // Affect large frame+labels widgets only.
7053 void ImGui::SetNextItemWidth(float item_width)
7054 {
7055  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7056  g.NextItemData.Flags |= ImGuiNextItemDataFlags_HasWidth;
7057  g.NextItemData.Width = item_width;
7058 }
7059 
7060 void ImGui::PushItemWidth(float item_width)
7061 {
7062  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7063  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
7064  window->DC.ItemWidth = (item_width == 0.0f ? window->ItemWidthDefault : item_width);
7065  window->DC.ItemWidthStack.push_back(window->DC.ItemWidth);
7066  g.NextItemData.Flags &= ~ImGuiNextItemDataFlags_HasWidth;
7067 }
7068 
7069 void ImGui::PushMultiItemsWidths(int components, float w_full)
7070 {
7071  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7072  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
7073  const ImGuiStyle& style = g.Style;
7074  const float w_item_one = ImMax(1.0f, IM_FLOOR((w_full - (style.ItemInnerSpacing.x) * (components - 1)) / (float)components));
7075  const float w_item_last = ImMax(1.0f, IM_FLOOR(w_full - (w_item_one + style.ItemInnerSpacing.x) * (components - 1)));
7076  window->DC.ItemWidthStack.push_back(w_item_last);
7077  for (int i = 0; i < components - 1; i++)
7078  window->DC.ItemWidthStack.push_back(w_item_one);
7079  window->DC.ItemWidth = window->DC.ItemWidthStack.back();
7080  g.NextItemData.Flags &= ~ImGuiNextItemDataFlags_HasWidth;
7081 }
7082 
7083 void ImGui::PopItemWidth()
7084 {
7085  ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
7086  window->DC.ItemWidthStack.pop_back();
7087  window->DC.ItemWidth = window->DC.ItemWidthStack.empty() ? window->ItemWidthDefault : window->DC.ItemWidthStack.back();
7088 }
7089 
7090 // Calculate default item width given value passed to PushItemWidth() or SetNextItemWidth().
7091 // The SetNextItemWidth() data is generally cleared/consumed by ItemAdd() or NextItemData.ClearFlags()
7092 float ImGui::CalcItemWidth()
7093 {
7094  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7095  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
7096  float w;
7097  if (g.NextItemData.Flags & ImGuiNextItemDataFlags_HasWidth)
7098  w = g.NextItemData.Width;
7099  else
7100  w = window->DC.ItemWidth;
7101  if (w < 0.0f)
7102  {
7103  float region_max_x = GetContentRegionMaxAbs().x;
7104  w = ImMax(1.0f, region_max_x - window->DC.CursorPos.x + w);
7105  }
7106  w = IM_FLOOR(w);
7107  return w;
7108 }
7109 
7110 // [Internal] Calculate full item size given user provided 'size' parameter and default width/height. Default width is often == CalcItemWidth().
7111 // Those two functions CalcItemWidth vs CalcItemSize are awkwardly named because they are not fully symmetrical.
7112 // Note that only CalcItemWidth() is publicly exposed.
7113 // The 4.0f here may be changed to match CalcItemWidth() and/or BeginChild() (right now we have a mismatch which is harmless but undesirable)
7114 ImVec2 ImGui::CalcItemSize(ImVec2 size, float default_w, float default_h)
7115 {
7116  ImGuiWindow* window = GImGui->CurrentWindow;
7117 
7118  ImVec2 region_max;
7119  if (size.x < 0.0f || size.y < 0.0f)
7120  region_max = GetContentRegionMaxAbs();
7121 
7122  if (size.x == 0.0f)
7123  size.x = default_w;
7124  else if (size.x < 0.0f)
7125  size.x = ImMax(4.0f, region_max.x - window->DC.CursorPos.x + size.x);
7126 
7127  if (size.y == 0.0f)
7128  size.y = default_h;
7129  else if (size.y < 0.0f)
7130  size.y = ImMax(4.0f, region_max.y - window->DC.CursorPos.y + size.y);
7131 
7132  return size;
7133 }
7134 
7135 float ImGui::GetTextLineHeight()
7136 {
7137  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7138  return g.FontSize;
7139 }
7140 
7141 float ImGui::GetTextLineHeightWithSpacing()
7142 {
7143  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7144  return g.FontSize + g.Style.ItemSpacing.y;
7145 }
7146 
7147 float ImGui::GetFrameHeight()
7148 {
7149  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7150  return g.FontSize + g.Style.FramePadding.y * 2.0f;
7151 }
7152 
7153 float ImGui::GetFrameHeightWithSpacing()
7154 {
7155  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7156  return g.FontSize + g.Style.FramePadding.y * 2.0f + g.Style.ItemSpacing.y;
7157 }
7158 
7159 // FIXME: All the Contents Region function are messy or misleading. WE WILL AIM TO OBSOLETE ALL OF THEM WITH A NEW "WORK RECT" API. Thanks for your patience!
7160 
7161 // FIXME: This is in window space (not screen space!).
7162 ImVec2 ImGui::GetContentRegionMax()
7163 {
7164  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7165  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
7166  ImVec2 mx = window->ContentRegionRect.Max - window->Pos;
7167  if (window->DC.CurrentColumns)
7168  mx.x = window->WorkRect.Max.x - window->Pos.x;
7169  return mx;
7170 }
7171 
7172 // [Internal] Absolute coordinate. Saner. This is not exposed until we finishing refactoring work rect features.
7173 ImVec2 ImGui::GetContentRegionMaxAbs()
7174 {
7175  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7176  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
7177  ImVec2 mx = window->ContentRegionRect.Max;
7178  if (window->DC.CurrentColumns)
7179  mx.x = window->WorkRect.Max.x;
7180  return mx;
7181 }
7182 
7183 ImVec2 ImGui::GetContentRegionAvail()
7184 {
7185  ImGuiWindow* window = GImGui->CurrentWindow;
7186  return GetContentRegionMaxAbs() - window->DC.CursorPos;
7187 }
7188 
7189 // In window space (not screen space!)
7190 ImVec2 ImGui::GetWindowContentRegionMin()
7191 {
7192  ImGuiWindow* window = GImGui->CurrentWindow;
7193  return window->ContentRegionRect.Min - window->Pos;
7194 }
7195 
7196 ImVec2 ImGui::GetWindowContentRegionMax()
7197 {
7198  ImGuiWindow* window = GImGui->CurrentWindow;
7199  return window->ContentRegionRect.Max - window->Pos;
7200 }
7201 
7202 float ImGui::GetWindowContentRegionWidth()
7203 {
7204  ImGuiWindow* window = GImGui->CurrentWindow;
7205  return window->ContentRegionRect.GetWidth();
7206 }
7207 
7208 // Lock horizontal starting position + capture group bounding box into one "item" (so you can use IsItemHovered() or layout primitives such as SameLine() on whole group, etc.)
7209 void ImGui::BeginGroup()
7210 {
7211  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7212  ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
7213 
7214  window->DC.GroupStack.resize(window->DC.GroupStack.Size + 1);
7215  ImGuiGroupData& group_data = window->DC.GroupStack.back();
7216  group_data.BackupCursorPos = window->DC.CursorPos;
7217  group_data.BackupCursorMaxPos = window->DC.CursorMaxPos;
7218  group_data.BackupIndent = window->DC.Indent;
7219  group_data.BackupGroupOffset = window->DC.GroupOffset;
7220  group_data.BackupCurrLineSize = window->DC.CurrLineSize;
7221  group_data.BackupCurrLineTextBaseOffset = window->DC.CurrLineTextBaseOffset;
7222  group_data.BackupActiveIdIsAlive = g.ActiveIdIsAlive;
7223  group_data.BackupActiveIdPreviousFrameIsAlive = g.ActiveIdPreviousFrameIsAlive;
7224  group_data.EmitItem = true;
7225 
7226  window->DC.GroupOffset.x = window->DC.CursorPos.x - window->Pos.x - window->DC.ColumnsOffset.x;
7227  window->DC.Indent = window->DC.GroupOffset;
7228  window->DC.CursorMaxPos = window->DC.CursorPos;
7229  window->DC.CurrLineSize = ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f);
7230  if (g.LogEnabled)
7231  g.LogLinePosY = -FLT_MAX; // To enforce Log carriage return
7232 }
7233 
7234 void ImGui::EndGroup()
7235 {
7236  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7237  ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
7238  IM_ASSERT(!window->DC.GroupStack.empty()); // Mismatched BeginGroup()/EndGroup() calls
7239 
7240  ImGuiGroupData& group_data = window->DC.GroupStack.back();
7241 
7242  ImRect group_bb(group_data.BackupCursorPos, ImMax(window->DC.CursorMaxPos, group_data.BackupCursorPos));
7243 
7244  window->DC.CursorPos = group_data.BackupCursorPos;
7245  window->DC.CursorMaxPos = ImMax(group_data.BackupCursorMaxPos, window->DC.CursorMaxPos);
7246  window->DC.Indent = group_data.BackupIndent;
7247  window->DC.GroupOffset = group_data.BackupGroupOffset;
7248  window->DC.CurrLineSize = group_data.BackupCurrLineSize;
7249  window->DC.CurrLineTextBaseOffset = group_data.BackupCurrLineTextBaseOffset;
7250  if (g.LogEnabled)
7251  g.LogLinePosY = -FLT_MAX; // To enforce Log carriage return
7252 
7253  if (!group_data.EmitItem)
7254  {
7255  window->DC.GroupStack.pop_back();
7256  return;
7257  }
7258 
7259  window->DC.CurrLineTextBaseOffset = ImMax(window->DC.PrevLineTextBaseOffset, group_data.BackupCurrLineTextBaseOffset); // FIXME: Incorrect, we should grab the base offset from the *first line* of the group but it is hard to obtain now.
7260  ItemSize(group_bb.GetSize());
7261  ItemAdd(group_bb, 0);
7262 
7263  // If the current ActiveId was declared within the boundary of our group, we copy it to LastItemId so IsItemActive(), IsItemDeactivated() etc. will be functional on the entire group.
7264  // It would be be neater if we replaced window.DC.LastItemId by e.g. 'bool LastItemIsActive', but would put a little more burden on individual widgets.
7265  // Also if you grep for LastItemId you'll notice it is only used in that context.
7266  // (The tests not symmetrical because ActiveIdIsAlive is an ID itself, in order to be able to handle ActiveId being overwritten during the frame.)
7267  const bool group_contains_curr_active_id = (group_data.BackupActiveIdIsAlive != g.ActiveId) && (g.ActiveIdIsAlive == g.ActiveId) && g.ActiveId;
7268  const bool group_contains_prev_active_id = !group_data.BackupActiveIdPreviousFrameIsAlive && g.ActiveIdPreviousFrameIsAlive;
7269  if (group_contains_curr_active_id)
7270  window->DC.LastItemId = g.ActiveId;
7271  else if (group_contains_prev_active_id)
7272  window->DC.LastItemId = g.ActiveIdPreviousFrame;
7273  window->DC.LastItemRect = group_bb;
7274 
7275  // Forward Edited flag
7276  if (group_contains_curr_active_id && g.ActiveIdHasBeenEditedThisFrame)
7277  window->DC.LastItemStatusFlags |= ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Edited;
7278 
7279  // Forward Deactivated flag
7280  window->DC.LastItemStatusFlags |= ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HasDeactivated;
7281  if (group_contains_prev_active_id && g.ActiveId != g.ActiveIdPreviousFrame)
7282  window->DC.LastItemStatusFlags |= ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Deactivated;
7283 
7284  window->DC.GroupStack.pop_back();
7285  //window->DrawList->AddRect(group_bb.Min, group_bb.Max, IM_COL32(255,0,255,255)); // [Debug]
7286 }
7287 
7288 
7289 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
7290 // [SECTION] SCROLLING
7291 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
7292 
7293 static ImVec2 CalcNextScrollFromScrollTargetAndClamp(ImGuiWindow* window, bool snap_on_edges)
7294 {
7295  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7296  ImVec2 scroll = window->Scroll;
7297  if (window->ScrollTarget.x < FLT_MAX)
7298  {
7299  float cr_x = window->ScrollTargetCenterRatio.x;
7300  float target_x = window->ScrollTarget.x;
7301  if (snap_on_edges && cr_x <= 0.0f && target_x <= window->WindowPadding.x)
7302  target_x = 0.0f;
7303  else if (snap_on_edges && cr_x >= 1.0f && target_x >= window->ContentSize.x + window->WindowPadding.x + g.Style.ItemSpacing.x)
7304  target_x = window->ContentSize.x + window->WindowPadding.x * 2.0f;
7305  scroll.x = target_x - cr_x * (window->SizeFull.x - window->ScrollbarSizes.x);
7306  }
7307  if (window->ScrollTarget.y < FLT_MAX)
7308  {
7309  // 'snap_on_edges' allows for a discontinuity at the edge of scrolling limits to take account of WindowPadding so that scrolling to make the last item visible scroll far enough to see the padding.
7310  float decoration_up_height = window->TitleBarHeight() + window->MenuBarHeight();
7311  float cr_y = window->ScrollTargetCenterRatio.y;
7312  float target_y = window->ScrollTarget.y;
7313  if (snap_on_edges && cr_y <= 0.0f && target_y <= window->WindowPadding.y)
7314  target_y = 0.0f;
7315  if (snap_on_edges && cr_y >= 1.0f && target_y >= window->ContentSize.y + window->WindowPadding.y + g.Style.ItemSpacing.y)
7316  target_y = window->ContentSize.y + window->WindowPadding.y * 2.0f;
7317  scroll.y = target_y - cr_y * (window->SizeFull.y - window->ScrollbarSizes.y - decoration_up_height);
7318  }
7319  scroll.x = IM_FLOOR(ImMax(scroll.x, 0.0f));
7320  scroll.y = IM_FLOOR(ImMax(scroll.y, 0.0f));
7321  if (!window->Collapsed && !window->SkipItems)
7322  {
7323  scroll.x = ImMin(scroll.x, window->ScrollMax.x);
7324  scroll.y = ImMin(scroll.y, window->ScrollMax.y);
7325  }
7326  return scroll;
7327 }
7328 
7329 // Scroll to keep newly navigated item fully into view
7330 ImVec2 ImGui::ScrollToBringRectIntoView(ImGuiWindow* window, const ImRect& item_rect)
7331 {
7332  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7333  ImRect window_rect(window->InnerRect.Min - ImVec2(1, 1), window->InnerRect.Max + ImVec2(1, 1));
7334  //GetForegroundDrawList(window)->AddRect(window_rect.Min, window_rect.Max, IM_COL32_WHITE); // [DEBUG]
7335 
7336  ImVec2 delta_scroll;
7337  if (!window_rect.Contains(item_rect))
7338  {
7339  if (window->ScrollbarX && item_rect.Min.x < window_rect.Min.x)
7340  SetScrollFromPosX(window, item_rect.Min.x - window->Pos.x + g.Style.ItemSpacing.x, 0.0f);
7341  else if (window->ScrollbarX && item_rect.Max.x >= window_rect.Max.x)
7342  SetScrollFromPosX(window, item_rect.Max.x - window->Pos.x + g.Style.ItemSpacing.x, 1.0f);
7343  if (item_rect.Min.y < window_rect.Min.y)
7344  SetScrollFromPosY(window, item_rect.Min.y - window->Pos.y - g.Style.ItemSpacing.y, 0.0f);
7345  else if (item_rect.Max.y >= window_rect.Max.y)
7346  SetScrollFromPosY(window, item_rect.Max.y - window->Pos.y + g.Style.ItemSpacing.y, 1.0f);
7347 
7348  ImVec2 next_scroll = CalcNextScrollFromScrollTargetAndClamp(window, false);
7349  delta_scroll = next_scroll - window->Scroll;
7350  }
7351 
7352  // Also scroll parent window to keep us into view if necessary
7353  if (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow)
7354  delta_scroll += ScrollToBringRectIntoView(window->ParentWindow, ImRect(item_rect.Min - delta_scroll, item_rect.Max - delta_scroll));
7355 
7356  return delta_scroll;
7357 }
7358 
7359 float ImGui::GetScrollX()
7360 {
7361  ImGuiWindow* window = GImGui->CurrentWindow;
7362  return window->Scroll.x;
7363 }
7364 
7365 float ImGui::GetScrollY()
7366 {
7367  ImGuiWindow* window = GImGui->CurrentWindow;
7368  return window->Scroll.y;
7369 }
7370 
7371 float ImGui::GetScrollMaxX()
7372 {
7373  ImGuiWindow* window = GImGui->CurrentWindow;
7374  return window->ScrollMax.x;
7375 }
7376 
7377 float ImGui::GetScrollMaxY()
7378 {
7379  ImGuiWindow* window = GImGui->CurrentWindow;
7380  return window->ScrollMax.y;
7381 }
7382 
7383 void ImGui::SetScrollX(float scroll_x)
7384 {
7385  ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
7386  window->ScrollTarget.x = scroll_x;
7387  window->ScrollTargetCenterRatio.x = 0.0f;
7388 }
7389 
7390 void ImGui::SetScrollY(float scroll_y)
7391 {
7392  ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
7393  window->ScrollTarget.y = scroll_y;
7394  window->ScrollTargetCenterRatio.y = 0.0f;
7395 }
7396 
7397 void ImGui::SetScrollX(ImGuiWindow* window, float new_scroll_x)
7398 {
7399  window->ScrollTarget.x = new_scroll_x;
7400  window->ScrollTargetCenterRatio.x = 0.0f;
7401 }
7402 
7403 void ImGui::SetScrollY(ImGuiWindow* window, float new_scroll_y)
7404 {
7405  window->ScrollTarget.y = new_scroll_y;
7406  window->ScrollTargetCenterRatio.y = 0.0f;
7407 }
7408 
7409 
7410 void ImGui::SetScrollFromPosX(ImGuiWindow* window, float local_x, float center_x_ratio)
7411 {
7412  // We store a target position so centering can occur on the next frame when we are guaranteed to have a known window size
7413  IM_ASSERT(center_x_ratio >= 0.0f && center_x_ratio <= 1.0f);
7414  window->ScrollTarget.x = IM_FLOOR(local_x + window->Scroll.x);
7415  window->ScrollTargetCenterRatio.x = center_x_ratio;
7416 }
7417 
7418 void ImGui::SetScrollFromPosY(ImGuiWindow* window, float local_y, float center_y_ratio)
7419 {
7420  // We store a target position so centering can occur on the next frame when we are guaranteed to have a known window size
7421  IM_ASSERT(center_y_ratio >= 0.0f && center_y_ratio <= 1.0f);
7422  const float decoration_up_height = window->TitleBarHeight() + window->MenuBarHeight();
7423  local_y -= decoration_up_height;
7424  window->ScrollTarget.y = IM_FLOOR(local_y + window->Scroll.y);
7425  window->ScrollTargetCenterRatio.y = center_y_ratio;
7426 }
7427 
7428 void ImGui::SetScrollFromPosX(float local_x, float center_x_ratio)
7429 {
7430  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7431  SetScrollFromPosX(g.CurrentWindow, local_x, center_x_ratio);
7432 }
7433 
7434 void ImGui::SetScrollFromPosY(float local_y, float center_y_ratio)
7435 {
7436  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7437  SetScrollFromPosY(g.CurrentWindow, local_y, center_y_ratio);
7438 }
7439 
7440 // center_x_ratio: 0.0f left of last item, 0.5f horizontal center of last item, 1.0f right of last item.
7441 void ImGui::SetScrollHereX(float center_x_ratio)
7442 {
7443  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7444  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
7445  float target_x = window->DC.LastItemRect.Min.x - window->Pos.x; // Left of last item, in window space
7446  float last_item_width = window->DC.LastItemRect.GetWidth();
7447  target_x += (last_item_width * center_x_ratio) + (g.Style.ItemSpacing.x * (center_x_ratio - 0.5f) * 2.0f); // Precisely aim before, in the middle or after the last item.
7448  SetScrollFromPosX(target_x, center_x_ratio);
7449 }
7450 
7451 // center_y_ratio: 0.0f top of last item, 0.5f vertical center of last item, 1.0f bottom of last item.
7452 void ImGui::SetScrollHereY(float center_y_ratio)
7453 {
7454  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7455  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
7456  float target_y = window->DC.CursorPosPrevLine.y - window->Pos.y; // Top of last item, in window space
7457  target_y += (window->DC.PrevLineSize.y * center_y_ratio) + (g.Style.ItemSpacing.y * (center_y_ratio - 0.5f) * 2.0f); // Precisely aim above, in the middle or below the last line.
7458  SetScrollFromPosY(target_y, center_y_ratio);
7459 }
7460 
7461 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
7462 // [SECTION] TOOLTIPS
7463 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
7464 
7465 void ImGui::BeginTooltip()
7466 {
7467  BeginTooltipEx(ImGuiWindowFlags_None, ImGuiTooltipFlags_None);
7468 }
7469 
7470 void ImGui::BeginTooltipEx(ImGuiWindowFlags extra_flags, ImGuiTooltipFlags tooltip_flags)
7471 {
7472  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7473 
7474  if (g.DragDropWithinSource || g.DragDropWithinTarget)
7475  {
7476  // The default tooltip position is a little offset to give space to see the context menu (it's also clamped within the current viewport/monitor)
7477  // In the context of a dragging tooltip we try to reduce that offset and we enforce following the cursor.
7478  // Whatever we do we want to call SetNextWindowPos() to enforce a tooltip position and disable clipping the tooltip without our display area, like regular tooltip do.
7479  //ImVec2 tooltip_pos = g.IO.MousePos - g.ActiveIdClickOffset - g.Style.WindowPadding;
7480  ImVec2 tooltip_pos = g.IO.MousePos + ImVec2(16 * g.Style.MouseCursorScale, 8 * g.Style.MouseCursorScale);
7481  SetNextWindowPos(tooltip_pos);
7482  SetNextWindowBgAlpha(g.Style.Colors[ImGuiCol_PopupBg].w * 0.60f);
7483  //PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_Alpha, g.Style.Alpha * 0.60f); // This would be nice but e.g ColorButton with checkboard has issue with transparent colors :(
7484  tooltip_flags |= ImGuiTooltipFlags_OverridePreviousTooltip;
7485  }
7486 
7487  char window_name[16];
7488  ImFormatString(window_name, IM_ARRAYSIZE(window_name), "##Tooltip_%02d", g.TooltipOverrideCount);
7489  if (tooltip_flags & ImGuiTooltipFlags_OverridePreviousTooltip)
7490  if (ImGuiWindow* window = FindWindowByName(window_name))
7491  if (window->Active)
7492  {
7493  // Hide previous tooltip from being displayed. We can't easily "reset" the content of a window so we create a new one.
7494  window->Hidden = true;
7495  window->HiddenFramesCanSkipItems = 1;
7496  ImFormatString(window_name, IM_ARRAYSIZE(window_name), "##Tooltip_%02d", ++g.TooltipOverrideCount);
7497  }
7498  ImGuiWindowFlags flags = ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoInputs | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMove | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoResize | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoSavedSettings | ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize;
7499  Begin(window_name, NULL, flags | extra_flags);
7500 }
7501 
7502 void ImGui::EndTooltip()
7503 {
7504  IM_ASSERT(GetCurrentWindowRead()->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip); // Mismatched BeginTooltip()/EndTooltip() calls
7505  End();
7506 }
7507 
7508 void ImGui::SetTooltipV(const char* fmt, va_list args)
7509 {
7510  BeginTooltipEx(0, ImGuiTooltipFlags_OverridePreviousTooltip);
7511  TextV(fmt, args);
7512  EndTooltip();
7513 }
7514 
7515 void ImGui::SetTooltip(const char* fmt, ...)
7516 {
7517  va_list args;
7518  va_start(args, fmt);
7519  SetTooltipV(fmt, args);
7520  va_end(args);
7521 }
7522 
7523 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
7524 // [SECTION] POPUPS
7525 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
7526 
7527 // Supported flags: ImGuiPopupFlags_AnyPopupId, ImGuiPopupFlags_AnyPopupLevel
7528 bool ImGui::IsPopupOpen(ImGuiID id, ImGuiPopupFlags popup_flags)
7529 {
7530  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7531  if (popup_flags & ImGuiPopupFlags_AnyPopupId)
7532  {
7533  // Return true if any popup is open at the current BeginPopup() level of the popup stack
7534  // This may be used to e.g. test for another popups already opened to handle popups priorities at the same level.
7535  IM_ASSERT(id == 0);
7536  if (popup_flags & ImGuiPopupFlags_AnyPopupLevel)
7537  return g.OpenPopupStack.Size > 0;
7538  else
7539  return g.OpenPopupStack.Size > g.BeginPopupStack.Size;
7540  }
7541  else
7542  {
7543  if (popup_flags & ImGuiPopupFlags_AnyPopupLevel)
7544  {
7545  // Return true if the popup is open anywhere in the popup stack
7546  for (int n = 0; n < g.OpenPopupStack.Size; n++)
7547  if (g.OpenPopupStack[n].PopupId == id)
7548  return true;
7549  return false;
7550  }
7551  else
7552  {
7553  // Return true if the popup is open at the current BeginPopup() level of the popup stack (this is the most-common query)
7554  return g.OpenPopupStack.Size > g.BeginPopupStack.Size && g.OpenPopupStack[g.BeginPopupStack.Size].PopupId == id;
7555  }
7556  }
7557 }
7558 
7559 bool ImGui::IsPopupOpen(const char* str_id, ImGuiPopupFlags popup_flags)
7560 {
7561  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7562  ImGuiID id = (popup_flags & ImGuiPopupFlags_AnyPopupId) ? 0 : g.CurrentWindow->GetID(str_id);
7563  if ((popup_flags & ImGuiPopupFlags_AnyPopupLevel) && id != 0)
7564  IM_ASSERT(0 && "Cannot use IsPopupOpen() with a string id and ImGuiPopupFlags_AnyPopupLevel."); // But non-string version is legal and used internally
7565  return IsPopupOpen(id, popup_flags);
7566 }
7567 
7568 ImGuiWindow* ImGui::GetTopMostPopupModal()
7569 {
7570  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7571  for (int n = g.OpenPopupStack.Size - 1; n >= 0; n--)
7572  if (ImGuiWindow* popup = g.OpenPopupStack.Data[n].Window)
7573  if (popup->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Modal)
7574  return popup;
7575  return NULL;
7576 }
7577 
7578 void ImGui::OpenPopup(const char* str_id, ImGuiPopupFlags popup_flags)
7579 {
7580  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7581  OpenPopupEx(g.CurrentWindow->GetID(str_id), popup_flags);
7582 }
7583 
7584 // Mark popup as open (toggle toward open state).
7585 // Popups are closed when user click outside, or activate a pressable item, or CloseCurrentPopup() is called within a BeginPopup()/EndPopup() block.
7586 // Popup identifiers are relative to the current ID-stack (so OpenPopup and BeginPopup needs to be at the same level).
7587 // One open popup per level of the popup hierarchy (NB: when assigning we reset the Window member of ImGuiPopupRef to NULL)
7588 void ImGui::OpenPopupEx(ImGuiID id, ImGuiPopupFlags popup_flags)
7589 {
7590  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7591  ImGuiWindow* parent_window = g.CurrentWindow;
7592  const int current_stack_size = g.BeginPopupStack.Size;
7593 
7594  if (popup_flags & ImGuiPopupFlags_NoOpenOverExistingPopup)
7595  if (IsPopupOpen(0u, ImGuiPopupFlags_AnyPopupId))
7596  return;
7597 
7598  ImGuiPopupData popup_ref; // Tagged as new ref as Window will be set back to NULL if we write this into OpenPopupStack.
7599  popup_ref.PopupId = id;
7600  popup_ref.Window = NULL;
7601  popup_ref.SourceWindow = g.NavWindow;
7602  popup_ref.OpenFrameCount = g.FrameCount;
7603  popup_ref.OpenParentId = parent_window->IDStack.back();
7604  popup_ref.OpenPopupPos = NavCalcPreferredRefPos();
7605  popup_ref.OpenMousePos = IsMousePosValid(&g.IO.MousePos) ? g.IO.MousePos : popup_ref.OpenPopupPos;
7606 
7607  //IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG("OpenPopupEx(0x%08X)\n", g.FrameCount, id);
7608  if (g.OpenPopupStack.Size < current_stack_size + 1)
7609  {
7610  g.OpenPopupStack.push_back(popup_ref);
7611  }
7612  else
7613  {
7614  // Gently handle the user mistakenly calling OpenPopup() every frame. It is a programming mistake! However, if we were to run the regular code path, the ui
7615  // would become completely unusable because the popup will always be in hidden-while-calculating-size state _while_ claiming focus. Which would be a very confusing
7616  // situation for the programmer. Instead, we silently allow the popup to proceed, it will keep reappearing and the programming error will be more obvious to understand.
7617  if (g.OpenPopupStack[current_stack_size].PopupId == id && g.OpenPopupStack[current_stack_size].OpenFrameCount == g.FrameCount - 1)
7618  {
7619  g.OpenPopupStack[current_stack_size].OpenFrameCount = popup_ref.OpenFrameCount;
7620  }
7621  else
7622  {
7623  // Close child popups if any, then flag popup for open/reopen
7624  ClosePopupToLevel(current_stack_size, false);
7625  g.OpenPopupStack.push_back(popup_ref);
7626  }
7627 
7628  // When reopening a popup we first refocus its parent, otherwise if its parent is itself a popup it would get closed by ClosePopupsOverWindow().
7629  // This is equivalent to what ClosePopupToLevel() does.
7630  //if (g.OpenPopupStack[current_stack_size].PopupId == id)
7631  // FocusWindow(parent_window);
7632  }
7633 }
7634 
7635 void ImGui::ClosePopupsOverWindow(ImGuiWindow* ref_window, bool restore_focus_to_window_under_popup)
7636 {
7637  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7638  if (g.OpenPopupStack.Size == 0)
7639  return;
7640 
7641  // When popups are stacked, clicking on a lower level popups puts focus back to it and close popups above it.
7642  // Don't close our own child popup windows.
7643  int popup_count_to_keep = 0;
7644  if (ref_window)
7645  {
7646  // Find the highest popup which is a descendant of the reference window (generally reference window = NavWindow)
7647  for (; popup_count_to_keep < g.OpenPopupStack.Size; popup_count_to_keep++)
7648  {
7649  ImGuiPopupData& popup = g.OpenPopupStack[popup_count_to_keep];
7650  if (!popup.Window)
7651  continue;
7652  IM_ASSERT((popup.Window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup) != 0);
7653  if (popup.Window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow)
7654  continue;
7655 
7656  // Trim the stack when popups are not direct descendant of the reference window (the reference window is often the NavWindow)
7657  bool popup_or_descendent_is_ref_window = false;
7658  for (int m = popup_count_to_keep; m < g.OpenPopupStack.Size && !popup_or_descendent_is_ref_window; m++)
7659  if (ImGuiWindow* popup_window = g.OpenPopupStack[m].Window)
7660  if (popup_window->RootWindow == ref_window->RootWindow)
7661  popup_or_descendent_is_ref_window = true;
7662  if (!popup_or_descendent_is_ref_window)
7663  break;
7664  }
7665  }
7666  if (popup_count_to_keep < g.OpenPopupStack.Size) // This test is not required but it allows to set a convenient breakpoint on the statement below
7667  {
7668  //IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG("ClosePopupsOverWindow(%s) -> ClosePopupToLevel(%d)\n", ref_window->Name, popup_count_to_keep);
7669  ClosePopupToLevel(popup_count_to_keep, restore_focus_to_window_under_popup);
7670  }
7671 }
7672 
7673 void ImGui::ClosePopupToLevel(int remaining, bool restore_focus_to_window_under_popup)
7674 {
7675  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7676  IM_ASSERT(remaining >= 0 && remaining < g.OpenPopupStack.Size);
7677 
7678  // Trim open popup stack
7679  ImGuiWindow* focus_window = g.OpenPopupStack[remaining].SourceWindow;
7680  ImGuiWindow* popup_window = g.OpenPopupStack[remaining].Window;
7681  g.OpenPopupStack.resize(remaining);
7682 
7683  if (restore_focus_to_window_under_popup)
7684  {
7685  if (focus_window && !focus_window->WasActive && popup_window)
7686  {
7687  // Fallback
7688  FocusTopMostWindowUnderOne(popup_window, NULL);
7689  }
7690  else
7691  {
7692  if (g.NavLayer == ImGuiNavLayer_Main && focus_window)
7693  focus_window = NavRestoreLastChildNavWindow(focus_window);
7694  FocusWindow(focus_window);
7695  }
7696  }
7697 }
7698 
7699 // Close the popup we have begin-ed into.
7700 void ImGui::CloseCurrentPopup()
7701 {
7702  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7703  int popup_idx = g.BeginPopupStack.Size - 1;
7704  if (popup_idx < 0 || popup_idx >= g.OpenPopupStack.Size || g.BeginPopupStack[popup_idx].PopupId != g.OpenPopupStack[popup_idx].PopupId)
7705  return;
7706 
7707  // Closing a menu closes its top-most parent popup (unless a modal)
7708  while (popup_idx > 0)
7709  {
7710  ImGuiWindow* popup_window = g.OpenPopupStack[popup_idx].Window;
7711  ImGuiWindow* parent_popup_window = g.OpenPopupStack[popup_idx - 1].Window;
7712  bool close_parent = false;
7713  if (popup_window && (popup_window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildMenu))
7714  if (parent_popup_window == NULL || !(parent_popup_window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Modal))
7715  close_parent = true;
7716  if (!close_parent)
7717  break;
7718  popup_idx--;
7719  }
7720  //IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG("CloseCurrentPopup %d -> %d\n", g.BeginPopupStack.Size - 1, popup_idx);
7721  ClosePopupToLevel(popup_idx, true);
7722 
7723  // A common pattern is to close a popup when selecting a menu item/selectable that will open another window.
7724  // To improve this usage pattern, we avoid nav highlight for a single frame in the parent window.
7725  // Similarly, we could avoid mouse hover highlight in this window but it is less visually problematic.
7726  if (ImGuiWindow* window = g.NavWindow)
7727  window->DC.NavHideHighlightOneFrame = true;
7728 }
7729 
7730 // Attention! BeginPopup() adds default flags which BeginPopupEx()!
7731 bool ImGui::BeginPopupEx(ImGuiID id, ImGuiWindowFlags flags)
7732 {
7733  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7734  if (!IsPopupOpen(id, ImGuiPopupFlags_None))
7735  {
7736  g.NextWindowData.ClearFlags(); // We behave like Begin() and need to consume those values
7737  return false;
7738  }
7739 
7740  char name[20];
7741  if (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildMenu)
7742  ImFormatString(name, IM_ARRAYSIZE(name), "##Menu_%02d", g.BeginPopupStack.Size); // Recycle windows based on depth
7743  else
7744  ImFormatString(name, IM_ARRAYSIZE(name), "##Popup_%08x", id); // Not recycling, so we can close/open during the same frame
7745 
7746  flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup;
7747  bool is_open = Begin(name, NULL, flags);
7748  if (!is_open) // NB: Begin can return false when the popup is completely clipped (e.g. zero size display)
7749  EndPopup();
7750 
7751  return is_open;
7752 }
7753 
7754 bool ImGui::BeginPopup(const char* str_id, ImGuiWindowFlags flags)
7755 {
7756  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7757  if (g.OpenPopupStack.Size <= g.BeginPopupStack.Size) // Early out for performance
7758  {
7759  g.NextWindowData.ClearFlags(); // We behave like Begin() and need to consume those values
7760  return false;
7761  }
7762  flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoSavedSettings;
7763  return BeginPopupEx(g.CurrentWindow->GetID(str_id), flags);
7764 }
7765 
7766 // If 'p_open' is specified for a modal popup window, the popup will have a regular close button which will close the popup.
7767 // Note that popup visibility status is owned by Dear ImGui (and manipulated with e.g. OpenPopup) so the actual value of *p_open is meaningless here.
7768 bool ImGui::BeginPopupModal(const char* name, bool* p_open, ImGuiWindowFlags flags)
7769 {
7770  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7771  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
7772  const ImGuiID id = window->GetID(name);
7773  if (!IsPopupOpen(id, ImGuiPopupFlags_None))
7774  {
7775  g.NextWindowData.ClearFlags(); // We behave like Begin() and need to consume those values
7776  return false;
7777  }
7778 
7779  // Center modal windows by default for increased visibility
7780  // (this won't really last as settings will kick in, and is mostly for backward compatibility. user may do the same themselves)
7781  // FIXME: Should test for (PosCond & window->SetWindowPosAllowFlags) with the upcoming window.
7782  if ((g.NextWindowData.Flags & ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasPos) == 0)
7783  SetNextWindowPos(g.IO.DisplaySize * 0.5f, ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver, ImVec2(0.5f, 0.5f));
7784 
7785  flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup | ImGuiWindowFlags_Modal | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoCollapse;
7786  const bool is_open = Begin(name, p_open, flags);
7787  if (!is_open || (p_open && !*p_open)) // NB: is_open can be 'false' when the popup is completely clipped (e.g. zero size display)
7788  {
7789  EndPopup();
7790  if (is_open)
7791  ClosePopupToLevel(g.BeginPopupStack.Size, true);
7792  return false;
7793  }
7794  return is_open;
7795 }
7796 
7797 void ImGui::EndPopup()
7798 {
7799  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7800  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
7801  IM_ASSERT(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup); // Mismatched BeginPopup()/EndPopup() calls
7802  IM_ASSERT(g.BeginPopupStack.Size > 0);
7803 
7804  // Make all menus and popups wrap around for now, may need to expose that policy.
7805  if (g.NavWindow == window)
7806  NavMoveRequestTryWrapping(window, ImGuiNavMoveFlags_LoopY);
7807 
7808  // Child-popups don't need to be laid out
7809  IM_ASSERT(g.WithinEndChild == false);
7810  if (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow)
7811  g.WithinEndChild = true;
7812  End();
7813  g.WithinEndChild = false;
7814 }
7815 
7816 bool ImGui::OpenPopupContextItem(const char* str_id, ImGuiPopupFlags popup_flags)
7817 {
7818  ImGuiWindow* window = GImGui->CurrentWindow;
7819  int mouse_button = (popup_flags & ImGuiPopupFlags_MouseButtonMask_);
7820  if (IsMouseReleased(mouse_button) && IsItemHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByPopup))
7821  {
7822  ImGuiID id = str_id ? window->GetID(str_id) : window->DC.LastItemId; // If user hasn't passed an ID, we can use the LastItemID. Using LastItemID as a Popup ID won't conflict!
7823  IM_ASSERT(id != 0); // You cannot pass a NULL str_id if the last item has no identifier (e.g. a Text() item)
7824  OpenPopupEx(id, popup_flags);
7825  return true;
7826  }
7827  return false;
7828 }
7829 
7830 // This is a helper to handle the simplest case of associating one named popup to one given widget.
7831 // - You can pass a NULL str_id to use the identifier of the last item.
7832 // - You may want to handle this on user side if you have specific needs (e.g. tweaking IsItemHovered() parameters).
7833 // - This is essentially the same as calling OpenPopupContextItem() + BeginPopup() but written to avoid
7834 // computing the ID twice because BeginPopupContextXXX functions are called very frequently.
7835 bool ImGui::BeginPopupContextItem(const char* str_id, ImGuiPopupFlags popup_flags)
7836 {
7837  ImGuiWindow* window = GImGui->CurrentWindow;
7838  if (window->SkipItems)
7839  return false;
7840  ImGuiID id = str_id ? window->GetID(str_id) : window->DC.LastItemId; // If user hasn't passed an ID, we can use the LastItemID. Using LastItemID as a Popup ID won't conflict!
7841  IM_ASSERT(id != 0); // You cannot pass a NULL str_id if the last item has no identifier (e.g. a Text() item)
7842  int mouse_button = (popup_flags & ImGuiPopupFlags_MouseButtonMask_);
7843  if (IsMouseReleased(mouse_button) && IsItemHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByPopup))
7844  OpenPopupEx(id, popup_flags);
7845  return BeginPopupEx(id, ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoSavedSettings);
7846 }
7847 
7848 bool ImGui::BeginPopupContextWindow(const char* str_id, ImGuiPopupFlags popup_flags)
7849 {
7850  ImGuiWindow* window = GImGui->CurrentWindow;
7851  if (!str_id)
7852  str_id = "window_context";
7853  ImGuiID id = window->GetID(str_id);
7854  int mouse_button = (popup_flags & ImGuiPopupFlags_MouseButtonMask_);
7855  if (IsMouseReleased(mouse_button) && IsWindowHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByPopup))
7856  if (!(popup_flags & ImGuiPopupFlags_NoOpenOverItems) || !IsAnyItemHovered())
7857  OpenPopupEx(id, popup_flags);
7858  return BeginPopupEx(id, ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoSavedSettings);
7859 }
7860 
7861 bool ImGui::BeginPopupContextVoid(const char* str_id, ImGuiPopupFlags popup_flags)
7862 {
7863  ImGuiWindow* window = GImGui->CurrentWindow;
7864  if (!str_id)
7865  str_id = "void_context";
7866  ImGuiID id = window->GetID(str_id);
7867  int mouse_button = (popup_flags & ImGuiPopupFlags_MouseButtonMask_);
7868  if (IsMouseReleased(mouse_button) && !IsWindowHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_AnyWindow))
7869  if (GetTopMostPopupModal() == NULL)
7870  OpenPopupEx(id, popup_flags);
7871  return BeginPopupEx(id, ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoSavedSettings);
7872 }
7873 
7874 // r_avoid = the rectangle to avoid (e.g. for tooltip it is a rectangle around the mouse cursor which we want to avoid. for popups it's a small point around the cursor.)
7875 // r_outer = the visible area rectangle, minus safe area padding. If our popup size won't fit because of safe area padding we ignore it.
7876 ImVec2 ImGui::FindBestWindowPosForPopupEx(const ImVec2& ref_pos, const ImVec2& size, ImGuiDir* last_dir, const ImRect& r_outer, const ImRect& r_avoid, ImGuiPopupPositionPolicy policy)
7877 {
7878  ImVec2 base_pos_clamped = ImClamp(ref_pos, r_outer.Min, r_outer.Max - size);
7879  //GetForegroundDrawList()->AddRect(r_avoid.Min, r_avoid.Max, IM_COL32(255,0,0,255));
7880  //GetForegroundDrawList()->AddRect(r_outer.Min, r_outer.Max, IM_COL32(0,255,0,255));
7881 
7882  // Combo Box policy (we want a connecting edge)
7883  if (policy == ImGuiPopupPositionPolicy_ComboBox)
7884  {
7885  const ImGuiDir dir_prefered_order[ImGuiDir_COUNT] = { ImGuiDir_Down, ImGuiDir_Right, ImGuiDir_Left, ImGuiDir_Up };
7886  for (int n = (*last_dir != ImGuiDir_None) ? -1 : 0; n < ImGuiDir_COUNT; n++)
7887  {
7888  const ImGuiDir dir = (n == -1) ? *last_dir : dir_prefered_order[n];
7889  if (n != -1 && dir == *last_dir) // Already tried this direction?
7890  continue;
7891  ImVec2 pos;
7892  if (dir == ImGuiDir_Down) pos = ImVec2(r_avoid.Min.x, r_avoid.Max.y); // Below, Toward Right (default)
7893  if (dir == ImGuiDir_Right) pos = ImVec2(r_avoid.Min.x, r_avoid.Min.y - size.y); // Above, Toward Right
7894  if (dir == ImGuiDir_Left) pos = ImVec2(r_avoid.Max.x - size.x, r_avoid.Max.y); // Below, Toward Left
7895  if (dir == ImGuiDir_Up) pos = ImVec2(r_avoid.Max.x - size.x, r_avoid.Min.y - size.y); // Above, Toward Left
7896  if (!r_outer.Contains(ImRect(pos, pos + size)))
7897  continue;
7898  *last_dir = dir;
7899  return pos;
7900  }
7901  }
7902 
7903  // Default popup policy
7904  const ImGuiDir dir_prefered_order[ImGuiDir_COUNT] = { ImGuiDir_Right, ImGuiDir_Down, ImGuiDir_Up, ImGuiDir_Left };
7905  for (int n = (*last_dir != ImGuiDir_None) ? -1 : 0; n < ImGuiDir_COUNT; n++)
7906  {
7907  const ImGuiDir dir = (n == -1) ? *last_dir : dir_prefered_order[n];
7908  if (n != -1 && dir == *last_dir) // Already tried this direction?
7909  continue;
7910  float avail_w = (dir == ImGuiDir_Left ? r_avoid.Min.x : r_outer.Max.x) - (dir == ImGuiDir_Right ? r_avoid.Max.x : r_outer.Min.x);
7911  float avail_h = (dir == ImGuiDir_Up ? r_avoid.Min.y : r_outer.Max.y) - (dir == ImGuiDir_Down ? r_avoid.Max.y : r_outer.Min.y);
7912  if (avail_w < size.x || avail_h < size.y)
7913  continue;
7914  ImVec2 pos;
7915  pos.x = (dir == ImGuiDir_Left) ? r_avoid.Min.x - size.x : (dir == ImGuiDir_Right) ? r_avoid.Max.x : base_pos_clamped.x;
7916  pos.y = (dir == ImGuiDir_Up) ? r_avoid.Min.y - size.y : (dir == ImGuiDir_Down) ? r_avoid.Max.y : base_pos_clamped.y;
7917  *last_dir = dir;
7918  return pos;
7919  }
7920 
7921  // Fallback, try to keep within display
7922  *last_dir = ImGuiDir_None;
7923  ImVec2 pos = ref_pos;
7924  pos.x = ImMax(ImMin(pos.x + size.x, r_outer.Max.x) - size.x, r_outer.Min.x);
7925  pos.y = ImMax(ImMin(pos.y + size.y, r_outer.Max.y) - size.y, r_outer.Min.y);
7926  return pos;
7927 }
7928 
7929 ImRect ImGui::GetWindowAllowedExtentRect(ImGuiWindow* window)
7930 {
7931  IM_UNUSED(window);
7932  ImVec2 padding = GImGui->Style.DisplaySafeAreaPadding;
7933  ImRect r_screen = GetViewportRect();
7934  r_screen.Expand(ImVec2((r_screen.GetWidth() > padding.x * 2) ? -padding.x : 0.0f, (r_screen.GetHeight() > padding.y * 2) ? -padding.y : 0.0f));
7935  return r_screen;
7936 }
7937 
7938 ImVec2 ImGui::FindBestWindowPosForPopup(ImGuiWindow* window)
7939 {
7940  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7941 
7942  ImRect r_outer = GetWindowAllowedExtentRect(window);
7943  if (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildMenu)
7944  {
7945  // Child menus typically request _any_ position within the parent menu item, and then we move the new menu outside the parent bounds.
7946  // This is how we end up with child menus appearing (most-commonly) on the right of the parent menu.
7947  IM_ASSERT(g.CurrentWindow == window);
7948  ImGuiWindow* parent_window = g.CurrentWindowStack[g.CurrentWindowStack.Size - 2];
7949  float horizontal_overlap = g.Style.ItemInnerSpacing.x; // We want some overlap to convey the relative depth of each menu (currently the amount of overlap is hard-coded to style.ItemSpacing.x).
7950  ImRect r_avoid;
7951  if (parent_window->DC.MenuBarAppending)
7952  r_avoid = ImRect(-FLT_MAX, parent_window->ClipRect.Min.y, FLT_MAX, parent_window->ClipRect.Max.y); // Avoid parent menu-bar. If we wanted multi-line menu-bar, we may instead want to have the calling window setup e.g. a NextWindowData.PosConstraintAvoidRect field
7953  else
7954  r_avoid = ImRect(parent_window->Pos.x + horizontal_overlap, -FLT_MAX, parent_window->Pos.x + parent_window->Size.x - horizontal_overlap - parent_window->ScrollbarSizes.x, FLT_MAX);
7955  return FindBestWindowPosForPopupEx(window->Pos, window->Size, &window->AutoPosLastDirection, r_outer, r_avoid);
7956  }
7957  if (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup)
7958  {
7959  ImRect r_avoid = ImRect(window->Pos.x - 1, window->Pos.y - 1, window->Pos.x + 1, window->Pos.y + 1);
7960  return FindBestWindowPosForPopupEx(window->Pos, window->Size, &window->AutoPosLastDirection, r_outer, r_avoid);
7961  }
7962  if (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip)
7963  {
7964  // Position tooltip (always follows mouse)
7965  float sc = g.Style.MouseCursorScale;
7966  ImVec2 ref_pos = NavCalcPreferredRefPos();
7967  ImRect r_avoid;
7968  if (!g.NavDisableHighlight && g.NavDisableMouseHover && !(g.IO.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableSetMousePos))
7969  r_avoid = ImRect(ref_pos.x - 16, ref_pos.y - 8, ref_pos.x + 16, ref_pos.y + 8);
7970  else
7971  r_avoid = ImRect(ref_pos.x - 16, ref_pos.y - 8, ref_pos.x + 24 * sc, ref_pos.y + 24 * sc); // FIXME: Hard-coded based on mouse cursor shape expectation. Exact dimension not very important.
7972  ImVec2 pos = FindBestWindowPosForPopupEx(ref_pos, window->Size, &window->AutoPosLastDirection, r_outer, r_avoid);
7973  if (window->AutoPosLastDirection == ImGuiDir_None)
7974  pos = ref_pos + ImVec2(2, 2); // If there's not enough room, for tooltip we prefer avoiding the cursor at all cost even if it means that part of the tooltip won't be visible.
7975  return pos;
7976  }
7977  IM_ASSERT(0);
7978  return window->Pos;
7979 }
7980 
7981 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
7982 // [SECTION] KEYBOARD/GAMEPAD NAVIGATION
7983 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
7984 
7985 // FIXME-NAV: The existence of SetNavID vs SetNavIDWithRectRel vs SetFocusID is incredibly messy and confusing,
7986 // and needs some explanation or serious refactoring.
7987 void ImGui::SetNavID(ImGuiID id, int nav_layer, ImGuiID focus_scope_id)
7988 {
7989  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7990  IM_ASSERT(g.NavWindow);
7991  IM_ASSERT(nav_layer == 0 || nav_layer == 1);
7992  g.NavId = id;
7993  g.NavFocusScopeId = focus_scope_id;
7994  g.NavWindow->NavLastIds[nav_layer] = id;
7995 }
7996 
7997 void ImGui::SetNavIDWithRectRel(ImGuiID id, int nav_layer, ImGuiID focus_scope_id, const ImRect& rect_rel)
7998 {
7999  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8000  SetNavID(id, nav_layer, focus_scope_id);
8001  g.NavWindow->NavRectRel[nav_layer] = rect_rel;
8002  g.NavMousePosDirty = true;
8003  g.NavDisableHighlight = false;
8004  g.NavDisableMouseHover = true;
8005 }
8006 
8007 void ImGui::SetFocusID(ImGuiID id, ImGuiWindow* window)
8008 {
8009  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8010  IM_ASSERT(id != 0);
8011 
8012  // Assume that SetFocusID() is called in the context where its window->DC.NavLayerCurrent and window->DC.NavFocusScopeIdCurrent are valid.
8013  // Note that window may be != g.CurrentWindow (e.g. SetFocusID call in InputTextEx for multi-line text)
8014  const ImGuiNavLayer nav_layer = window->DC.NavLayerCurrent;
8015  if (g.NavWindow != window)
8016  g.NavInitRequest = false;
8017  g.NavWindow = window;
8018  g.NavId = id;
8019  g.NavLayer = nav_layer;
8020  g.NavFocusScopeId = window->DC.NavFocusScopeIdCurrent;
8021  window->NavLastIds[nav_layer] = id;
8022  if (window->DC.LastItemId == id)
8023  window->NavRectRel[nav_layer] = ImRect(window->DC.LastItemRect.Min - window->Pos, window->DC.LastItemRect.Max - window->Pos);
8024 
8025  if (g.ActiveIdSource == ImGuiInputSource_Nav)
8026  g.NavDisableMouseHover = true;
8027  else
8028  g.NavDisableHighlight = true;
8029 }
8030 
8031 ImGuiDir ImGetDirQuadrantFromDelta(float dx, float dy)
8032 {
8033  if (ImFabs(dx) > ImFabs(dy))
8034  return (dx > 0.0f) ? ImGuiDir_Right : ImGuiDir_Left;
8035  return (dy > 0.0f) ? ImGuiDir_Down : ImGuiDir_Up;
8036 }
8037 
8038 static float inline NavScoreItemDistInterval(float a0, float a1, float b0, float b1)
8039 {
8040  if (a1 < b0)
8041  return a1 - b0;
8042  if (b1 < a0)
8043  return a0 - b1;
8044  return 0.0f;
8045 }
8046 
8047 static void inline NavClampRectToVisibleAreaForMoveDir(ImGuiDir move_dir, ImRect& r, const ImRect& clip_rect)
8048 {
8049  if (move_dir == ImGuiDir_Left || move_dir == ImGuiDir_Right)
8050  {
8051  r.Min.y = ImClamp(r.Min.y, clip_rect.Min.y, clip_rect.Max.y);
8052  r.Max.y = ImClamp(r.Max.y, clip_rect.Min.y, clip_rect.Max.y);
8053  }
8054  else
8055  {
8056  r.Min.x = ImClamp(r.Min.x, clip_rect.Min.x, clip_rect.Max.x);
8057  r.Max.x = ImClamp(r.Max.x, clip_rect.Min.x, clip_rect.Max.x);
8058  }
8059 }
8060 
8061 // Scoring function for gamepad/keyboard directional navigation. Based on https://gist.github.com/rygorous/6981057
8062 static bool ImGui::NavScoreItem(ImGuiNavMoveResult* result, ImRect cand)
8063 {
8064  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8065  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
8066  if (g.NavLayer != window->DC.NavLayerCurrent)
8067  return false;
8068 
8069  const ImRect& curr = g.NavScoringRect; // Current modified source rect (NB: we've applied Max.x = Min.x in NavUpdate() to inhibit the effect of having varied item width)
8070  g.NavScoringCount++;
8071 
8072  // When entering through a NavFlattened border, we consider child window items as fully clipped for scoring
8073  if (window->ParentWindow == g.NavWindow)
8074  {
8075  IM_ASSERT((window->Flags | g.NavWindow->Flags) & ImGuiWindowFlags_NavFlattened);
8076  if (!window->ClipRect.Overlaps(cand))
8077  return false;
8078  cand.ClipWithFull(window->ClipRect); // This allows the scored item to not overlap other candidates in the parent window
8079  }
8080
