8081  // We perform scoring on items bounding box clipped by the current clipping rectangle on the other axis (clipping on our movement axis would give us equal scores for all clipped items)
8082  // For example, this ensure that items in one column are not reached when moving vertically from items in another column.
8083  NavClampRectToVisibleAreaForMoveDir(g.NavMoveClipDir, cand, window->ClipRect);
8084 
8085  // Compute distance between boxes
8086  // FIXME-NAV: Introducing biases for vertical navigation, needs to be removed.
8087  float dbx = NavScoreItemDistInterval(cand.Min.x, cand.Max.x, curr.Min.x, curr.Max.x);
8088  float dby = NavScoreItemDistInterval(ImLerp(cand.Min.y, cand.Max.y, 0.2f), ImLerp(cand.Min.y, cand.Max.y, 0.8f), ImLerp(curr.Min.y, curr.Max.y, 0.2f), ImLerp(curr.Min.y, curr.Max.y, 0.8f)); // Scale down on Y to keep using box-distance for vertically touching items
8089  if (dby != 0.0f && dbx != 0.0f)
8090  dbx = (dbx / 1000.0f) + ((dbx > 0.0f) ? +1.0f : -1.0f);
8091  float dist_box = ImFabs(dbx) + ImFabs(dby);
8092 
8093  // Compute distance between centers (this is off by a factor of 2, but we only compare center distances with each other so it doesn't matter)
8094  float dcx = (cand.Min.x + cand.Max.x) - (curr.Min.x + curr.Max.x);
8095  float dcy = (cand.Min.y + cand.Max.y) - (curr.Min.y + curr.Max.y);
8096  float dist_center = ImFabs(dcx) + ImFabs(dcy); // L1 metric (need this for our connectedness guarantee)
8097 
8098  // Determine which quadrant of 'curr' our candidate item 'cand' lies in based on distance
8099  ImGuiDir quadrant;
8100  float dax = 0.0f, day = 0.0f, dist_axial = 0.0f;
8101  if (dbx != 0.0f || dby != 0.0f)
8102  {
8103  // For non-overlapping boxes, use distance between boxes
8104  dax = dbx;
8105  day = dby;
8106  dist_axial = dist_box;
8107  quadrant = ImGetDirQuadrantFromDelta(dbx, dby);
8108  }
8109  else if (dcx != 0.0f || dcy != 0.0f)
8110  {
8111  // For overlapping boxes with different centers, use distance between centers
8112  dax = dcx;
8113  day = dcy;
8114  dist_axial = dist_center;
8115  quadrant = ImGetDirQuadrantFromDelta(dcx, dcy);
8116  }
8117  else
8118  {
8119  // Degenerate case: two overlapping buttons with same center, break ties arbitrarily (note that LastItemId here is really the _previous_ item order, but it doesn't matter)
8120  quadrant = (window->DC.LastItemId < g.NavId) ? ImGuiDir_Left : ImGuiDir_Right;
8121  }
8122 
8123 #if IMGUI_DEBUG_NAV_SCORING
8124  char buf[128];
8125  if (IsMouseHoveringRect(cand.Min, cand.Max))
8126  {
8127  ImFormatString(buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf), "dbox (%.2f,%.2f->%.4f)\ndcen (%.2f,%.2f->%.4f)\nd (%.2f,%.2f->%.4f)\nnav %c, quadrant %c", dbx, dby, dist_box, dcx, dcy, dist_center, dax, day, dist_axial, "WENS"[g.NavMoveDir], "WENS"[quadrant]);
8128  ImDrawList* draw_list = GetForegroundDrawList(window);
8129  draw_list->AddRect(curr.Min, curr.Max, IM_COL32(255,200,0,100));
8130  draw_list->AddRect(cand.Min, cand.Max, IM_COL32(255,255,0,200));
8131  draw_list->AddRectFilled(cand.Max - ImVec2(4, 4), cand.Max + CalcTextSize(buf) + ImVec2(4, 4), IM_COL32(40,0,0,150));
8132  draw_list->AddText(g.IO.FontDefault, 13.0f, cand.Max, ~0U, buf);
8133  }
8134  else if (g.IO.KeyCtrl) // Hold to preview score in matching quadrant. Press C to rotate.
8135  {
8136  if (IsKeyPressedMap(ImGuiKey_C)) { g.NavMoveDirLast = (ImGuiDir)((g.NavMoveDirLast + 1) & 3); g.IO.KeysDownDuration[g.IO.KeyMap[ImGuiKey_C]] = 0.01f; }
8137  if (quadrant == g.NavMoveDir)
8138  {
8139  ImFormatString(buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf), "%.0f/%.0f", dist_box, dist_center);
8140  ImDrawList* draw_list = GetForegroundDrawList(window);
8141  draw_list->AddRectFilled(cand.Min, cand.Max, IM_COL32(255, 0, 0, 200));
8142  draw_list->AddText(g.IO.FontDefault, 13.0f, cand.Min, IM_COL32(255, 255, 255, 255), buf);
8143  }
8144  }
8145 #endif
8146 
8147  // Is it in the quadrant we're interesting in moving to?
8148  bool new_best = false;
8149  if (quadrant == g.NavMoveDir)
8150  {
8151  // Does it beat the current best candidate?
8152  if (dist_box < result->DistBox)
8153  {
8154  result->DistBox = dist_box;
8155  result->DistCenter = dist_center;
8156  return true;
8157  }
8158  if (dist_box == result->DistBox)
8159  {
8160  // Try using distance between center points to break ties
8161  if (dist_center < result->DistCenter)
8162  {
8163  result->DistCenter = dist_center;
8164  new_best = true;
8165  }
8166  else if (dist_center == result->DistCenter)
8167  {
8168  // Still tied! we need to be extra-careful to make sure everything gets linked properly. We consistently break ties by symbolically moving "later" items
8169  // (with higher index) to the right/downwards by an infinitesimal amount since we the current "best" button already (so it must have a lower index),
8170  // this is fairly easy. This rule ensures that all buttons with dx==dy==0 will end up being linked in order of appearance along the x axis.
8171  if (((g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Up || g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Down) ? dby : dbx) < 0.0f) // moving bj to the right/down decreases distance
8172  new_best = true;
8173  }
8174  }
8175  }
8176 
8177  // Axial check: if 'curr' has no link at all in some direction and 'cand' lies roughly in that direction, add a tentative link. This will only be kept if no "real" matches
8178  // are found, so it only augments the graph produced by the above method using extra links. (important, since it doesn't guarantee strong connectedness)
8179  // This is just to avoid buttons having no links in a particular direction when there's a suitable neighbor. you get good graphs without this too.
8180  // 2017/09/29: FIXME: This now currently only enabled inside menu bars, ideally we'd disable it everywhere. Menus in particular need to catch failure. For general navigation it feels awkward.
8181  // Disabling it may lead to disconnected graphs when nodes are very spaced out on different axis. Perhaps consider offering this as an option?
8182  if (result->DistBox == FLT_MAX && dist_axial < result->DistAxial) // Check axial match
8183  if (g.NavLayer == ImGuiNavLayer_Menu && !(g.NavWindow->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildMenu))
8184  if ((g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Left && dax < 0.0f) || (g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Right && dax > 0.0f) || (g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Up && day < 0.0f) || (g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Down && day > 0.0f))
8185  {
8186  result->DistAxial = dist_axial;
8187  new_best = true;
8188  }
8189 
8190  return new_best;
8191 }
8192 
8193 // We get there when either NavId == id, or when g.NavAnyRequest is set (which is updated by NavUpdateAnyRequestFlag above)
8194 static void ImGui::NavProcessItem(ImGuiWindow* window, const ImRect& nav_bb, const ImGuiID id)
8195 {
8196  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8197  //if (!g.IO.NavActive) // [2017/10/06] Removed this possibly redundant test but I am not sure of all the side-effects yet. Some of the feature here will need to work regardless of using a _NoNavInputs flag.
8198  // return;
8199 
8200  const ImGuiItemFlags item_flags = window->DC.ItemFlags;
8201  const ImRect nav_bb_rel(nav_bb.Min - window->Pos, nav_bb.Max - window->Pos);
8202 
8203  // Process Init Request
8204  if (g.NavInitRequest && g.NavLayer == window->DC.NavLayerCurrent)
8205  {
8206  // Even if 'ImGuiItemFlags_NoNavDefaultFocus' is on (typically collapse/close button) we record the first ResultId so they can be used as a fallback
8207  if (!(item_flags & ImGuiItemFlags_NoNavDefaultFocus) || g.NavInitResultId == 0)
8208  {
8209  g.NavInitResultId = id;
8210  g.NavInitResultRectRel = nav_bb_rel;
8211  }
8212  if (!(item_flags & ImGuiItemFlags_NoNavDefaultFocus))
8213  {
8214  g.NavInitRequest = false; // Found a match, clear request
8215  NavUpdateAnyRequestFlag();
8216  }
8217  }
8218 
8219  // Process Move Request (scoring for navigation)
8220  // FIXME-NAV: Consider policy for double scoring (scoring from NavScoringRectScreen + scoring from a rect wrapped according to current wrapping policy)
8221  if ((g.NavId != id || (g.NavMoveRequestFlags & ImGuiNavMoveFlags_AllowCurrentNavId)) && !(item_flags & (ImGuiItemFlags_Disabled | ImGuiItemFlags_NoNav)))
8222  {
8223  ImGuiNavMoveResult* result = (window == g.NavWindow) ? &g.NavMoveResultLocal : &g.NavMoveResultOther;
8224 #if IMGUI_DEBUG_NAV_SCORING
8225  // [DEBUG] Score all items in NavWindow at all times
8226  if (!g.NavMoveRequest)
8227  g.NavMoveDir = g.NavMoveDirLast;
8228  bool new_best = NavScoreItem(result, nav_bb) && g.NavMoveRequest;
8229 #else
8230  bool new_best = g.NavMoveRequest && NavScoreItem(result, nav_bb);
8231 #endif
8232  if (new_best)
8233  {
8234  result->Window = window;
8235  result->ID = id;
8236  result->FocusScopeId = window->DC.NavFocusScopeIdCurrent;
8237  result->RectRel = nav_bb_rel;
8238  }
8239 
8240  // Features like PageUp/PageDown need to maintain a separate score for the visible set of items.
8241  const float VISIBLE_RATIO = 0.70f;
8242  if ((g.NavMoveRequestFlags & ImGuiNavMoveFlags_AlsoScoreVisibleSet) && window->ClipRect.Overlaps(nav_bb))
8243  if (ImClamp(nav_bb.Max.y, window->ClipRect.Min.y, window->ClipRect.Max.y) - ImClamp(nav_bb.Min.y, window->ClipRect.Min.y, window->ClipRect.Max.y) >= (nav_bb.Max.y - nav_bb.Min.y) * VISIBLE_RATIO)
8244  if (NavScoreItem(&g.NavMoveResultLocalVisibleSet, nav_bb))
8245  {
8246  result = &g.NavMoveResultLocalVisibleSet;
8247  result->Window = window;
8248  result->ID = id;
8249  result->FocusScopeId = window->DC.NavFocusScopeIdCurrent;
8250  result->RectRel = nav_bb_rel;
8251  }
8252  }
8253 
8254  // Update window-relative bounding box of navigated item
8255  if (g.NavId == id)
8256  {
8257  g.NavWindow = window; // Always refresh g.NavWindow, because some operations such as FocusItem() don't have a window.
8258  g.NavLayer = window->DC.NavLayerCurrent;
8259  g.NavFocusScopeId = window->DC.NavFocusScopeIdCurrent;
8260  g.NavIdIsAlive = true;
8261  g.NavIdTabCounter = window->DC.FocusCounterTabStop;
8262  window->NavRectRel[window->DC.NavLayerCurrent] = nav_bb_rel; // Store item bounding box (relative to window position)
8263  }
8264 }
8265 
8266 bool ImGui::NavMoveRequestButNoResultYet()
8267 {
8268  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8269  return g.NavMoveRequest && g.NavMoveResultLocal.ID == 0 && g.NavMoveResultOther.ID == 0;
8270 }
8271 
8272 void ImGui::NavMoveRequestCancel()
8273 {
8274  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8275  g.NavMoveRequest = false;
8276  NavUpdateAnyRequestFlag();
8277 }
8278 
8279 void ImGui::NavMoveRequestForward(ImGuiDir move_dir, ImGuiDir clip_dir, const ImRect& bb_rel, ImGuiNavMoveFlags move_flags)
8280 {
8281  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8282  IM_ASSERT(g.NavMoveRequestForward == ImGuiNavForward_None);
8283  NavMoveRequestCancel();
8284  g.NavMoveDir = move_dir;
8285  g.NavMoveClipDir = clip_dir;
8286  g.NavMoveRequestForward = ImGuiNavForward_ForwardQueued;
8287  g.NavMoveRequestFlags = move_flags;
8288  g.NavWindow->NavRectRel[g.NavLayer] = bb_rel;
8289 }
8290 
8291 void ImGui::NavMoveRequestTryWrapping(ImGuiWindow* window, ImGuiNavMoveFlags move_flags)
8292 {
8293  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8294 
8295  // Navigation wrap-around logic is delayed to the end of the frame because this operation is only valid after entire
8296  // popup is assembled and in case of appended popups it is not clear which EndPopup() call is final.
8297  g.NavWrapRequestWindow = window;
8298  g.NavWrapRequestFlags = move_flags;
8299 }
8300 
8301 // FIXME: This could be replaced by updating a frame number in each window when (window == NavWindow) and (NavLayer == 0).
8302 // This way we could find the last focused window among our children. It would be much less confusing this way?
8303 static void ImGui::NavSaveLastChildNavWindowIntoParent(ImGuiWindow* nav_window)
8304 {
8305  ImGuiWindow* parent_window = nav_window;
8306  while (parent_window && (parent_window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) != 0 && (parent_window->Flags & (ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup | ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildMenu)) == 0)
8307  parent_window = parent_window->ParentWindow;
8308  if (parent_window && parent_window != nav_window)
8309  parent_window->NavLastChildNavWindow = nav_window;
8310 }
8311 
8312 // Restore the last focused child.
8313 // Call when we are expected to land on the Main Layer (0) after FocusWindow()
8314 static ImGuiWindow* ImGui::NavRestoreLastChildNavWindow(ImGuiWindow* window)
8315 {
8316  return window->NavLastChildNavWindow ? window->NavLastChildNavWindow : window;
8317 }
8318 
8319 static void NavRestoreLayer(ImGuiNavLayer layer)
8320 {
8321  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8322  g.NavLayer = layer;
8323  if (layer == 0)
8324  g.NavWindow = ImGui::NavRestoreLastChildNavWindow(g.NavWindow);
8325  ImGuiWindow* window = g.NavWindow;
8326  if (layer == 0 && window->NavLastIds[0] != 0)
8327  ImGui::SetNavIDWithRectRel(window->NavLastIds[0], layer, 0, window->NavRectRel[0]);
8328  else
8329  ImGui::NavInitWindow(window, true);
8330 }
8331 
8332 static inline void ImGui::NavUpdateAnyRequestFlag()
8333 {
8334  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8335  g.NavAnyRequest = g.NavMoveRequest || g.NavInitRequest || (IMGUI_DEBUG_NAV_SCORING && g.NavWindow != NULL);
8336  if (g.NavAnyRequest)
8337  IM_ASSERT(g.NavWindow != NULL);
8338 }
8339 
8340 // This needs to be called before we submit any widget (aka in or before Begin)
8341 void ImGui::NavInitWindow(ImGuiWindow* window, bool force_reinit)
8342 {
8343  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8344  IM_ASSERT(window == g.NavWindow);
8345  bool init_for_nav = false;
8346  if (!(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavInputs))
8347  if (!(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) || (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup) || (window->NavLastIds[0] == 0) || force_reinit)
8348  init_for_nav = true;
8349  //IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG("[Nav] NavInitWindow() init_for_nav=%d, window=\"%s\", layer=%d\n", init_for_nav, window->Name, g.NavLayer);
8350  if (init_for_nav)
8351  {
8352  SetNavID(0, g.NavLayer, 0);
8353  g.NavInitRequest = true;
8354  g.NavInitRequestFromMove = false;
8355  g.NavInitResultId = 0;
8356  g.NavInitResultRectRel = ImRect();
8357  NavUpdateAnyRequestFlag();
8358  }
8359  else
8360  {
8361  g.NavId = window->NavLastIds[0];
8362  g.NavFocusScopeId = 0;
8363  }
8364 }
8365 
8366 static ImVec2 ImGui::NavCalcPreferredRefPos()
8367 {
8368  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8369  if (g.NavDisableHighlight || !g.NavDisableMouseHover || !g.NavWindow)
8370  {
8371  // Mouse (we need a fallback in case the mouse becomes invalid after being used)
8372  if (IsMousePosValid(&g.IO.MousePos))
8373  return g.IO.MousePos;
8374  return g.LastValidMousePos;
8375  }
8376  else
8377  {
8378  // When navigation is active and mouse is disabled, decide on an arbitrary position around the bottom left of the currently navigated item.
8379  const ImRect& rect_rel = g.NavWindow->NavRectRel[g.NavLayer];
8380  ImVec2 pos = g.NavWindow->Pos + ImVec2(rect_rel.Min.x + ImMin(g.Style.FramePadding.x * 4, rect_rel.GetWidth()), rect_rel.Max.y - ImMin(g.Style.FramePadding.y, rect_rel.GetHeight()));
8381  ImRect visible_rect = GetViewportRect();
8382  return ImFloor(ImClamp(pos, visible_rect.Min, visible_rect.Max)); // ImFloor() is important because non-integer mouse position application in back-end might be lossy and result in undesirable non-zero delta.
8383  }
8384 }
8385 
8386 float ImGui::GetNavInputAmount(ImGuiNavInput n, ImGuiInputReadMode mode)
8387 {
8388  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8389  if (mode == ImGuiInputReadMode_Down)
8390  return g.IO.NavInputs[n]; // Instant, read analog input (0.0f..1.0f, as provided by user)
8391 
8392  const float t = g.IO.NavInputsDownDuration[n];
8393  if (t < 0.0f && mode == ImGuiInputReadMode_Released) // Return 1.0f when just released, no repeat, ignore analog input.
8394  return (g.IO.NavInputsDownDurationPrev[n] >= 0.0f ? 1.0f : 0.0f);
8395  if (t < 0.0f)
8396  return 0.0f;
8397  if (mode == ImGuiInputReadMode_Pressed) // Return 1.0f when just pressed, no repeat, ignore analog input.
8398  return (t == 0.0f) ? 1.0f : 0.0f;
8399  if (mode == ImGuiInputReadMode_Repeat)
8400  return (float)CalcTypematicRepeatAmount(t - g.IO.DeltaTime, t, g.IO.KeyRepeatDelay * 0.72f, g.IO.KeyRepeatRate * 0.80f);
8401  if (mode == ImGuiInputReadMode_RepeatSlow)
8402  return (float)CalcTypematicRepeatAmount(t - g.IO.DeltaTime, t, g.IO.KeyRepeatDelay * 1.25f, g.IO.KeyRepeatRate * 2.00f);
8403  if (mode == ImGuiInputReadMode_RepeatFast)
8404  return (float)CalcTypematicRepeatAmount(t - g.IO.DeltaTime, t, g.IO.KeyRepeatDelay * 0.72f, g.IO.KeyRepeatRate * 0.30f);
8405  return 0.0f;
8406 }
8407 
8408 ImVec2 ImGui::GetNavInputAmount2d(ImGuiNavDirSourceFlags dir_sources, ImGuiInputReadMode mode, float slow_factor, float fast_factor)
8409 {
8410  ImVec2 delta(0.0f, 0.0f);
8411  if (dir_sources & ImGuiNavDirSourceFlags_Keyboard)
8412  delta += ImVec2(GetNavInputAmount(ImGuiNavInput_KeyRight_, mode) - GetNavInputAmount(ImGuiNavInput_KeyLeft_, mode), GetNavInputAmount(ImGuiNavInput_KeyDown_, mode) - GetNavInputAmount(ImGuiNavInput_KeyUp_, mode));
8413  if (dir_sources & ImGuiNavDirSourceFlags_PadDPad)
8414  delta += ImVec2(GetNavInputAmount(ImGuiNavInput_DpadRight, mode) - GetNavInputAmount(ImGuiNavInput_DpadLeft, mode), GetNavInputAmount(ImGuiNavInput_DpadDown, mode) - GetNavInputAmount(ImGuiNavInput_DpadUp, mode));
8415  if (dir_sources & ImGuiNavDirSourceFlags_PadLStick)
8416  delta += ImVec2(GetNavInputAmount(ImGuiNavInput_LStickRight, mode) - GetNavInputAmount(ImGuiNavInput_LStickLeft, mode), GetNavInputAmount(ImGuiNavInput_LStickDown, mode) - GetNavInputAmount(ImGuiNavInput_LStickUp, mode));
8417  if (slow_factor != 0.0f && IsNavInputDown(ImGuiNavInput_TweakSlow))
8418  delta *= slow_factor;
8419  if (fast_factor != 0.0f && IsNavInputDown(ImGuiNavInput_TweakFast))
8420  delta *= fast_factor;
8421  return delta;
8422 }
8423 
8424 static void ImGui::NavUpdate()
8425 {
8426  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8427  g.IO.WantSetMousePos = false;
8428  g.NavWrapRequestWindow = NULL;
8429  g.NavWrapRequestFlags = ImGuiNavMoveFlags_None;
8430 #if 0
8431  if (g.NavScoringCount > 0) IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG("NavScoringCount %d for '%s' layer %d (Init:%d, Move:%d)\n", g.FrameCount, g.NavScoringCount, g.NavWindow ? g.NavWindow->Name : "NULL", g.NavLayer, g.NavInitRequest || g.NavInitResultId != 0, g.NavMoveRequest);
8432 #endif
8433 
8434  // Set input source as Gamepad when buttons are pressed (as some features differs when used with Gamepad vs Keyboard)
8435  // (do it before we map Keyboard input!)
8436  bool nav_keyboard_active = (g.IO.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableKeyboard) != 0;
8437  bool nav_gamepad_active = (g.IO.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableGamepad) != 0 && (g.IO.BackendFlags & ImGuiBackendFlags_HasGamepad) != 0;
8438  if (nav_gamepad_active)
8439  if (g.IO.NavInputs[ImGuiNavInput_Activate] > 0.0f || g.IO.NavInputs[ImGuiNavInput_Input] > 0.0f || g.IO.NavInputs[ImGuiNavInput_Cancel] > 0.0f || g.IO.NavInputs[ImGuiNavInput_Menu] > 0.0f)
8440  g.NavInputSource = ImGuiInputSource_NavGamepad;
8441 
8442  // Update Keyboard->Nav inputs mapping
8443  if (nav_keyboard_active)
8444  {
8445  #define NAV_MAP_KEY(_KEY, _NAV_INPUT) do { if (IsKeyDown(g.IO.KeyMap[_KEY])) { g.IO.NavInputs[_NAV_INPUT] = 1.0f; g.NavInputSource = ImGuiInputSource_NavKeyboard; } } while (0)
8446  NAV_MAP_KEY(ImGuiKey_Space, ImGuiNavInput_Activate );
8447  NAV_MAP_KEY(ImGuiKey_Enter, ImGuiNavInput_Input );
8448  NAV_MAP_KEY(ImGuiKey_Escape, ImGuiNavInput_Cancel );
8449  NAV_MAP_KEY(ImGuiKey_LeftArrow, ImGuiNavInput_KeyLeft_ );
8450  NAV_MAP_KEY(ImGuiKey_RightArrow,ImGuiNavInput_KeyRight_);
8451  NAV_MAP_KEY(ImGuiKey_UpArrow, ImGuiNavInput_KeyUp_ );
8452  NAV_MAP_KEY(ImGuiKey_DownArrow, ImGuiNavInput_KeyDown_ );
8453  if (g.IO.KeyCtrl)
8454  g.IO.NavInputs[ImGuiNavInput_TweakSlow] = 1.0f;
8455  if (g.IO.KeyShift)
8456  g.IO.NavInputs[ImGuiNavInput_TweakFast] = 1.0f;
8457  if (g.IO.KeyAlt && !g.IO.KeyCtrl) // AltGR is Alt+Ctrl, also even on keyboards without AltGR we don't want Alt+Ctrl to open menu.
8458  g.IO.NavInputs[ImGuiNavInput_KeyMenu_] = 1.0f;
8459  #undef NAV_MAP_KEY
8460  }
8461  memcpy(g.IO.NavInputsDownDurationPrev, g.IO.NavInputsDownDuration, sizeof(g.IO.NavInputsDownDuration));
8462  for (int i = 0; i < IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.IO.NavInputs); i++)
8463  g.IO.NavInputsDownDuration[i] = (g.IO.NavInputs[i] > 0.0f) ? (g.IO.NavInputsDownDuration[i] < 0.0f ? 0.0f : g.IO.NavInputsDownDuration[i] + g.IO.DeltaTime) : -1.0f;
8464 
8465  // Process navigation init request (select first/default focus)
8466  // In very rare cases g.NavWindow may be null (e.g. clearing focus after requesting an init request, which does happen when releasing Alt while clicking on void)
8467  if (g.NavInitResultId != 0 && (!g.NavDisableHighlight || g.NavInitRequestFromMove) && g.NavWindow)
8468  {
8469  // Apply result from previous navigation init request (will typically select the first item, unless SetItemDefaultFocus() has been called)
8470  //IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG("[Nav] Apply NavInitRequest result: 0x%08X Layer %d in \"%s\"\n", g.NavInitResultId, g.NavLayer, g.NavWindow->Name);
8471  if (g.NavInitRequestFromMove)
8472  SetNavIDWithRectRel(g.NavInitResultId, g.NavLayer, 0, g.NavInitResultRectRel);
8473  else
8474  SetNavID(g.NavInitResultId, g.NavLayer, 0);
8475  g.NavWindow->NavRectRel[g.NavLayer] = g.NavInitResultRectRel;
8476  }
8477  g.NavInitRequest = false;
8478  g.NavInitRequestFromMove = false;
8479  g.NavInitResultId = 0;
8480  g.NavJustMovedToId = 0;
8481 
8482  // Process navigation move request
8483  if (g.NavMoveRequest)
8484  NavUpdateMoveResult();
8485 
8486  // When a forwarded move request failed, we restore the highlight that we disabled during the forward frame
8487  if (g.NavMoveRequestForward == ImGuiNavForward_ForwardActive)
8488  {
8489  IM_ASSERT(g.NavMoveRequest);
8490  if (g.NavMoveResultLocal.ID == 0 && g.NavMoveResultOther.ID == 0)
8491  g.NavDisableHighlight = false;
8492  g.NavMoveRequestForward = ImGuiNavForward_None;
8493  }
8494 
8495  // Apply application mouse position movement, after we had a chance to process move request result.
8496  if (g.NavMousePosDirty && g.NavIdIsAlive)
8497  {
8498  // Set mouse position given our knowledge of the navigated item position from last frame
8499  if ((g.IO.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableSetMousePos) && (g.IO.BackendFlags & ImGuiBackendFlags_HasSetMousePos))
8500  {
8501  if (!g.NavDisableHighlight && g.NavDisableMouseHover && g.NavWindow)
8502  {
8503  g.IO.MousePos = g.IO.MousePosPrev = NavCalcPreferredRefPos();
8504  g.IO.WantSetMousePos = true;
8505  }
8506  }
8507  g.NavMousePosDirty = false;
8508  }
8509  g.NavIdIsAlive = false;
8510  g.NavJustTabbedId = 0;
8511  IM_ASSERT(g.NavLayer == 0 || g.NavLayer == 1);
8512 
8513  // Store our return window (for returning from Layer 1 to Layer 0) and clear it as soon as we step back in our own Layer 0
8514  if (g.NavWindow)
8515  NavSaveLastChildNavWindowIntoParent(g.NavWindow);
8516  if (g.NavWindow && g.NavWindow->NavLastChildNavWindow != NULL && g.NavLayer == ImGuiNavLayer_Main)
8517  g.NavWindow->NavLastChildNavWindow = NULL;
8518 
8519  // Update CTRL+TAB and Windowing features (hold Square to move/resize/etc.)
8520  NavUpdateWindowing();
8521 
8522  // Set output flags for user application
8523  g.IO.NavActive = (nav_keyboard_active || nav_gamepad_active) && g.NavWindow && !(g.NavWindow->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavInputs);
8524  g.IO.NavVisible = (g.IO.NavActive && g.NavId != 0 && !g.NavDisableHighlight) || (g.NavWindowingTarget != NULL);
8525 
8526  // Process NavCancel input (to close a popup, get back to parent, clear focus)
8527  if (IsNavInputTest(ImGuiNavInput_Cancel, ImGuiInputReadMode_Pressed))
8528  {
8529  if (g.ActiveId != 0)
8530  {
8531  if (!IsActiveIdUsingNavInput(ImGuiNavInput_Cancel))
8532  ClearActiveID();
8533  }
8534  else if (g.NavWindow && (g.NavWindow->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) && !(g.NavWindow->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup) && g.NavWindow->ParentWindow)
8535  {
8536  // Exit child window
8537  ImGuiWindow* child_window = g.NavWindow;
8538  ImGuiWindow* parent_window = g.NavWindow->ParentWindow;
8539  IM_ASSERT(child_window->ChildId != 0);
8540  FocusWindow(parent_window);
8541  SetNavID(child_window->ChildId, 0, 0);
8542  // Reassigning with same value, we're being explicit here.
8543  g.NavIdIsAlive = false; // -V1048
8544  if (g.NavDisableMouseHover)
8545  g.NavMousePosDirty = true;
8546  }
8547  else if (g.OpenPopupStack.Size > 0)
8548  {
8549  // Close open popup/menu
8550  if (!(g.OpenPopupStack.back().Window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Modal))
8551  ClosePopupToLevel(g.OpenPopupStack.Size - 1, true);
8552  }
8553  else if (g.NavLayer != ImGuiNavLayer_Main)
8554  {
8555  // Leave the "menu" layer
8556  NavRestoreLayer(ImGuiNavLayer_Main);
8557  }
8558  else
8559  {
8560  // Clear NavLastId for popups but keep it for regular child window so we can leave one and come back where we were
8561  if (g.NavWindow && ((g.NavWindow->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup) || !(g.NavWindow->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow)))
8562  g.NavWindow->NavLastIds[0] = 0;
8563  g.NavId = g.NavFocusScopeId = 0;
8564  }
8565  }
8566 
8567  // Process manual activation request
8568  g.NavActivateId = g.NavActivateDownId = g.NavActivatePressedId = g.NavInputId = 0;
8569  if (g.NavId != 0 && !g.NavDisableHighlight && !g.NavWindowingTarget && g.NavWindow && !(g.NavWindow->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavInputs))
8570  {
8571  bool activate_down = IsNavInputDown(ImGuiNavInput_Activate);
8572  bool activate_pressed = activate_down && IsNavInputTest(ImGuiNavInput_Activate, ImGuiInputReadMode_Pressed);
8573  if (g.ActiveId == 0 && activate_pressed)
8574  g.NavActivateId = g.NavId;
8575  if ((g.ActiveId == 0 || g.ActiveId == g.NavId) && activate_down)
8576  g.NavActivateDownId = g.NavId;
8577  if ((g.ActiveId == 0 || g.ActiveId == g.NavId) && activate_pressed)
8578  g.NavActivatePressedId = g.NavId;
8579  if ((g.ActiveId == 0 || g.ActiveId == g.NavId) && IsNavInputTest(ImGuiNavInput_Input, ImGuiInputReadMode_Pressed))
8580  g.NavInputId = g.NavId;
8581  }
8582  if (g.NavWindow && (g.NavWindow->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavInputs))
8583  g.NavDisableHighlight = true;
8584  if (g.NavActivateId != 0)
8585  IM_ASSERT(g.NavActivateDownId == g.NavActivateId);
8586  g.NavMoveRequest = false;
8587 
8588  // Process programmatic activation request
8589  if (g.NavNextActivateId != 0)
8590  g.NavActivateId = g.NavActivateDownId = g.NavActivatePressedId = g.NavInputId = g.NavNextActivateId;
8591  g.NavNextActivateId = 0;
8592 
8593  // Initiate directional inputs request
8594  if (g.NavMoveRequestForward == ImGuiNavForward_None)
8595  {
8596  g.NavMoveDir = ImGuiDir_None;
8597  g.NavMoveRequestFlags = ImGuiNavMoveFlags_None;
8598  if (g.NavWindow && !g.NavWindowingTarget && !(g.NavWindow->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavInputs))
8599  {
8600  const ImGuiInputReadMode read_mode = ImGuiInputReadMode_Repeat;
8601  if (!IsActiveIdUsingNavDir(ImGuiDir_Left) && (IsNavInputTest(ImGuiNavInput_DpadLeft, read_mode) || IsNavInputTest(ImGuiNavInput_KeyLeft_, read_mode))) { g.NavMoveDir = ImGuiDir_Left; }
8602  if (!IsActiveIdUsingNavDir(ImGuiDir_Right) && (IsNavInputTest(ImGuiNavInput_DpadRight, read_mode) || IsNavInputTest(ImGuiNavInput_KeyRight_, read_mode))) { g.NavMoveDir = ImGuiDir_Right; }
8603  if (!IsActiveIdUsingNavDir(ImGuiDir_Up) && (IsNavInputTest(ImGuiNavInput_DpadUp, read_mode) || IsNavInputTest(ImGuiNavInput_KeyUp_, read_mode))) { g.NavMoveDir = ImGuiDir_Up; }
8604  if (!IsActiveIdUsingNavDir(ImGuiDir_Down) && (IsNavInputTest(ImGuiNavInput_DpadDown, read_mode) || IsNavInputTest(ImGuiNavInput_KeyDown_, read_mode))) { g.NavMoveDir = ImGuiDir_Down; }
8605  }
8606  g.NavMoveClipDir = g.NavMoveDir;
8607  }
8608  else
8609  {
8610  // Forwarding previous request (which has been modified, e.g. wrap around menus rewrite the requests with a starting rectangle at the other side of the window)
8611  // (Preserve g.NavMoveRequestFlags, g.NavMoveClipDir which were set by the NavMoveRequestForward() function)
8612  IM_ASSERT(g.NavMoveDir != ImGuiDir_None && g.NavMoveClipDir != ImGuiDir_None);
8613  IM_ASSERT(g.NavMoveRequestForward == ImGuiNavForward_ForwardQueued);
8614  g.NavMoveRequestForward = ImGuiNavForward_ForwardActive;
8615  }
8616 
8617  // Update PageUp/PageDown/Home/End scroll
8618  // FIXME-NAV: Consider enabling those keys even without the master ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableKeyboard flag?
8619  float nav_scoring_rect_offset_y = 0.0f;
8620  if (nav_keyboard_active)
8621  nav_scoring_rect_offset_y = NavUpdatePageUpPageDown();
8622 
8623  // If we initiate a movement request and have no current NavId, we initiate a InitDefautRequest that will be used as a fallback if the direction fails to find a match
8624  if (g.NavMoveDir != ImGuiDir_None)
8625  {
8626  g.NavMoveRequest = true;
8627  g.NavMoveRequestKeyMods = g.IO.KeyMods;
8628  g.NavMoveDirLast = g.NavMoveDir;
8629  }
8630  if (g.NavMoveRequest && g.NavId == 0)
8631  {
8632  //IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG("[Nav] NavInitRequest from move, window \"%s\", layer=%d\n", g.NavWindow->Name, g.NavLayer);
8633  g.NavInitRequest = g.NavInitRequestFromMove = true;
8634  // Reassigning with same value, we're being explicit here.
8635  g.NavInitResultId = 0; // -V1048
8636  g.NavDisableHighlight = false;
8637  }
8638  NavUpdateAnyRequestFlag();
8639 
8640  // Scrolling
8641  if (g.NavWindow && !(g.NavWindow->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavInputs) && !g.NavWindowingTarget)
8642  {
8643  // *Fallback* manual-scroll with Nav directional keys when window has no navigable item
8644  ImGuiWindow* window = g.NavWindow;
8645  const float scroll_speed = IM_ROUND(window->CalcFontSize() * 100 * g.IO.DeltaTime); // We need round the scrolling speed because sub-pixel scroll isn't reliably supported.
8646  if (window->DC.NavLayerActiveMask == 0x00 && window->DC.NavHasScroll && g.NavMoveRequest)
8647  {
8648  if (g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Left || g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Right)
8649  SetScrollX(window, ImFloor(window->Scroll.x + ((g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Left) ? -1.0f : +1.0f) * scroll_speed));
8650  if (g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Up || g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Down)
8651  SetScrollY(window, ImFloor(window->Scroll.y + ((g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Up) ? -1.0f : +1.0f) * scroll_speed));
8652  }
8653 
8654  // *Normal* Manual scroll with NavScrollXXX keys
8655  // Next movement request will clamp the NavId reference rectangle to the visible area, so navigation will resume within those bounds.
8656  ImVec2 scroll_dir = GetNavInputAmount2d(ImGuiNavDirSourceFlags_PadLStick, ImGuiInputReadMode_Down, 1.0f / 10.0f, 10.0f);
8657  if (scroll_dir.x != 0.0f && window->ScrollbarX)
8658  {
8659  SetScrollX(window, ImFloor(window->Scroll.x + scroll_dir.x * scroll_speed));
8660  g.NavMoveFromClampedRefRect = true;
8661  }
8662  if (scroll_dir.y != 0.0f)
8663  {
8664  SetScrollY(window, ImFloor(window->Scroll.y + scroll_dir.y * scroll_speed));
8665  g.NavMoveFromClampedRefRect = true;
8666  }
8667  }
8668 
8669  // Reset search results
8670  g.NavMoveResultLocal.Clear();
8671  g.NavMoveResultLocalVisibleSet.Clear();
8672  g.NavMoveResultOther.Clear();
8673 
8674  // When we have manually scrolled (without using navigation) and NavId becomes out of bounds, we project its bounding box to the visible area to restart navigation within visible items
8675  if (g.NavMoveRequest && g.NavMoveFromClampedRefRect && g.NavLayer == ImGuiNavLayer_Main)
8676  {
8677  ImGuiWindow* window = g.NavWindow;
8678  ImRect window_rect_rel(window->InnerRect.Min - window->Pos - ImVec2(1, 1), window->InnerRect.Max - window->Pos + ImVec2(1, 1));
8679  if (!window_rect_rel.Contains(window->NavRectRel[g.NavLayer]))
8680  {
8681  float pad = window->CalcFontSize() * 0.5f;
8682  window_rect_rel.Expand(ImVec2(-ImMin(window_rect_rel.GetWidth(), pad), -ImMin(window_rect_rel.GetHeight(), pad))); // Terrible approximation for the intent of starting navigation from first fully visible item
8683  window->NavRectRel[g.NavLayer].ClipWith(window_rect_rel);
8684  g.NavId = g.NavFocusScopeId = 0;
8685  }
8686  g.NavMoveFromClampedRefRect = false;
8687  }
8688 
8689  // For scoring we use a single segment on the left side our current item bounding box (not touching the edge to avoid box overlap with zero-spaced items)
8690  ImRect nav_rect_rel = (g.NavWindow && !g.NavWindow->NavRectRel[g.NavLayer].IsInverted()) ? g.NavWindow->NavRectRel[g.NavLayer] : ImRect(0, 0, 0, 0);
8691  g.NavScoringRect = g.NavWindow ? ImRect(g.NavWindow->Pos + nav_rect_rel.Min, g.NavWindow->Pos + nav_rect_rel.Max) : GetViewportRect();
8692  g.NavScoringRect.TranslateY(nav_scoring_rect_offset_y);
8693  g.NavScoringRect.Min.x = ImMin(g.NavScoringRect.Min.x + 1.0f, g.NavScoringRect.Max.x);
8694  g.NavScoringRect.Max.x = g.NavScoringRect.Min.x;
8695  IM_ASSERT(!g.NavScoringRect.IsInverted()); // Ensure if we have a finite, non-inverted bounding box here will allows us to remove extraneous ImFabs() calls in NavScoreItem().
8696  //GetForegroundDrawList()->AddRect(g.NavScoringRectScreen.Min, g.NavScoringRectScreen.Max, IM_COL32(255,200,0,255)); // [DEBUG]
8697  g.NavScoringCount = 0;
8698 #if IMGUI_DEBUG_NAV_RECTS
8699  if (g.NavWindow)
8700  {
8701  ImDrawList* draw_list = GetForegroundDrawList(g.NavWindow);
8702  if (1) { for (int layer = 0; layer < 2; layer++) draw_list->AddRect(g.NavWindow->Pos + g.NavWindow->NavRectRel[layer].Min, g.NavWindow->Pos + g.NavWindow->NavRectRel[layer].Max, IM_COL32(255,200,0,255)); } // [DEBUG]
8703  if (1) { ImU32 col = (!g.NavWindow->Hidden) ? IM_COL32(255,0,255,255) : IM_COL32(255,0,0,255); ImVec2 p = NavCalcPreferredRefPos(); char buf[32]; ImFormatString(buf, 32, "%d", g.NavLayer); draw_list->AddCircleFilled(p, 3.0f, col); draw_list->AddText(NULL, 13.0f, p + ImVec2(8,-4), col, buf); }
8704  }
8705 #endif
8706 }
8707 
8708 // Apply result from previous frame navigation directional move request
8709 static void ImGui::NavUpdateMoveResult()
8710 {
8711  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8712  if (g.NavMoveResultLocal.ID == 0 && g.NavMoveResultOther.ID == 0)
8713  {
8714  // In a situation when there is no results but NavId != 0, re-enable the Navigation highlight (because g.NavId is not considered as a possible result)
8715  if (g.NavId != 0)
8716  {
8717  g.NavDisableHighlight = false;
8718  g.NavDisableMouseHover = true;
8719  }
8720  return;
8721  }
8722 
8723  // Select which result to use
8724  ImGuiNavMoveResult* result = (g.NavMoveResultLocal.ID != 0) ? &g.NavMoveResultLocal : &g.NavMoveResultOther;
8725 
8726  // PageUp/PageDown behavior first jumps to the bottom/top mostly visible item, _otherwise_ use the result from the previous/next page.
8727  if (g.NavMoveRequestFlags & ImGuiNavMoveFlags_AlsoScoreVisibleSet)
8728  if (g.NavMoveResultLocalVisibleSet.ID != 0 && g.NavMoveResultLocalVisibleSet.ID != g.NavId)
8729  result = &g.NavMoveResultLocalVisibleSet;
8730 
8731  // Maybe entering a flattened child from the outside? In this case solve the tie using the regular scoring rules.
8732  if (result != &g.NavMoveResultOther && g.NavMoveResultOther.ID != 0 && g.NavMoveResultOther.Window->ParentWindow == g.NavWindow)
8733  if ((g.NavMoveResultOther.DistBox < result->DistBox) || (g.NavMoveResultOther.DistBox == result->DistBox && g.NavMoveResultOther.DistCenter < result->DistCenter))
8734  result = &g.NavMoveResultOther;
8735  IM_ASSERT(g.NavWindow && result->Window);
8736 
8737  // Scroll to keep newly navigated item fully into view.
8738  if (g.NavLayer == ImGuiNavLayer_Main)
8739  {
8740  ImVec2 delta_scroll;
8741  if (g.NavMoveRequestFlags & ImGuiNavMoveFlags_ScrollToEdge)
8742  {
8743  float scroll_target = (g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Up) ? result->Window->ScrollMax.y : 0.0f;
8744  delta_scroll.y = result->Window->Scroll.y - scroll_target;
8745  SetScrollY(result->Window, scroll_target);
8746  }
8747  else
8748  {
8749  ImRect rect_abs = ImRect(result->RectRel.Min + result->Window->Pos, result->RectRel.Max + result->Window->Pos);
8750  delta_scroll = ScrollToBringRectIntoView(result->Window, rect_abs);
8751  }
8752 
8753  // Offset our result position so mouse position can be applied immediately after in NavUpdate()
8754  result->RectRel.TranslateX(-delta_scroll.x);
8755  result->RectRel.TranslateY(-delta_scroll.y);
8756  }
8757 
8758  ClearActiveID();
8759  g.NavWindow = result->Window;
8760  if (g.NavId != result->ID)
8761  {
8762  // Don't set NavJustMovedToId if just landed on the same spot (which may happen with ImGuiNavMoveFlags_AllowCurrentNavId)
8763  g.NavJustMovedToId = result->ID;
8764  g.NavJustMovedToFocusScopeId = result->FocusScopeId;
8765  g.NavJustMovedToKeyMods = g.NavMoveRequestKeyMods;
8766  }
8767  SetNavIDWithRectRel(result->ID, g.NavLayer, result->FocusScopeId, result->RectRel);
8768  g.NavMoveFromClampedRefRect = false;
8769 }
8770 
8771 // Handle PageUp/PageDown/Home/End keys
8772 static float ImGui::NavUpdatePageUpPageDown()
8773 {
8774  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8775  if (g.NavMoveDir != ImGuiDir_None || g.NavWindow == NULL)
8776  return 0.0f;
8777  if ((g.NavWindow->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavInputs) || g.NavWindowingTarget != NULL || g.NavLayer != ImGuiNavLayer_Main)
8778  return 0.0f;
8779 
8780  ImGuiWindow* window = g.NavWindow;
8781  const bool page_up_held = IsKeyDown(g.IO.KeyMap[ImGuiKey_PageUp]) && !IsActiveIdUsingKey(ImGuiKey_PageUp);
8782  const bool page_down_held = IsKeyDown(g.IO.KeyMap[ImGuiKey_PageDown]) && !IsActiveIdUsingKey(ImGuiKey_PageDown);
8783  const bool home_pressed = IsKeyPressed(g.IO.KeyMap[ImGuiKey_Home]) && !IsActiveIdUsingKey(ImGuiKey_Home);
8784  const bool end_pressed = IsKeyPressed(g.IO.KeyMap[ImGuiKey_End]) && !IsActiveIdUsingKey(ImGuiKey_End);
8785  if (page_up_held != page_down_held || home_pressed != end_pressed) // If either (not both) are pressed
8786  {
8787  if (window->DC.NavLayerActiveMask == 0x00 && window->DC.NavHasScroll)
8788  {
8789  // Fallback manual-scroll when window has no navigable item
8790  if (IsKeyPressed(g.IO.KeyMap[ImGuiKey_PageUp], true))
8791  SetScrollY(window, window->Scroll.y - window->InnerRect.GetHeight());
8792  else if (IsKeyPressed(g.IO.KeyMap[ImGuiKey_PageDown], true))
8793  SetScrollY(window, window->Scroll.y + window->InnerRect.GetHeight());
8794  else if (home_pressed)
8795  SetScrollY(window, 0.0f);
8796  else if (end_pressed)
8797  SetScrollY(window, window->ScrollMax.y);
8798  }
8799  else
8800  {
8801  ImRect& nav_rect_rel = window->NavRectRel[g.NavLayer];
8802  const float page_offset_y = ImMax(0.0f, window->InnerRect.GetHeight() - window->CalcFontSize() * 1.0f + nav_rect_rel.GetHeight());
8803  float nav_scoring_rect_offset_y = 0.0f;
8804  if (IsKeyPressed(g.IO.KeyMap[ImGuiKey_PageUp], true))
8805  {
8806  nav_scoring_rect_offset_y = -page_offset_y;
8807  g.NavMoveDir = ImGuiDir_Down; // Because our scoring rect is offset up, we request the down direction (so we can always land on the last item)
8808  g.NavMoveClipDir = ImGuiDir_Up;
8809  g.NavMoveRequestFlags = ImGuiNavMoveFlags_AllowCurrentNavId | ImGuiNavMoveFlags_AlsoScoreVisibleSet;
8810  }
8811  else if (IsKeyPressed(g.IO.KeyMap[ImGuiKey_PageDown], true))
8812  {
8813  nav_scoring_rect_offset_y = +page_offset_y;
8814  g.NavMoveDir = ImGuiDir_Up; // Because our scoring rect is offset down, we request the up direction (so we can always land on the last item)
8815  g.NavMoveClipDir = ImGuiDir_Down;
8816  g.NavMoveRequestFlags = ImGuiNavMoveFlags_AllowCurrentNavId | ImGuiNavMoveFlags_AlsoScoreVisibleSet;
8817  }
8818  else if (home_pressed)
8819  {
8820  // FIXME-NAV: handling of Home/End is assuming that the top/bottom most item will be visible with Scroll.y == 0/ScrollMax.y
8821  // Scrolling will be handled via the ImGuiNavMoveFlags_ScrollToEdge flag, we don't scroll immediately to avoid scrolling happening before nav result.
8822  // Preserve current horizontal position if we have any.
8823  nav_rect_rel.Min.y = nav_rect_rel.Max.y = -window->Scroll.y;
8824  if (nav_rect_rel.IsInverted())
8825  nav_rect_rel.Min.x = nav_rect_rel.Max.x = 0.0f;
8826  g.NavMoveDir = ImGuiDir_Down;
8827  g.NavMoveRequestFlags = ImGuiNavMoveFlags_AllowCurrentNavId | ImGuiNavMoveFlags_ScrollToEdge;
8828  }
8829  else if (end_pressed)
8830  {
8831  nav_rect_rel.Min.y = nav_rect_rel.Max.y = window->ScrollMax.y + window->SizeFull.y - window->Scroll.y;
8832  if (nav_rect_rel.IsInverted())
8833  nav_rect_rel.Min.x = nav_rect_rel.Max.x = 0.0f;
8834  g.NavMoveDir = ImGuiDir_Up;
8835  g.NavMoveRequestFlags = ImGuiNavMoveFlags_AllowCurrentNavId | ImGuiNavMoveFlags_ScrollToEdge;
8836  }
8837  return nav_scoring_rect_offset_y;
8838  }
8839  }
8840  return 0.0f;
8841 }
8842 
8843 static void ImGui::NavEndFrame()
8844 {
8845  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8846 
8847  // Show CTRL+TAB list window
8848  if (g.NavWindowingTarget != NULL)
8849  NavUpdateWindowingOverlay();
8850 
8851  // Perform wrap-around in menus
8852  ImGuiWindow* window = g.NavWrapRequestWindow;
8853  ImGuiNavMoveFlags move_flags = g.NavWrapRequestFlags;
8854  if (window != NULL && g.NavWindow == window && NavMoveRequestButNoResultYet() && g.NavMoveRequestForward == ImGuiNavForward_None && g.NavLayer == ImGuiNavLayer_Main)
8855  {
8856  IM_ASSERT(move_flags != 0); // No points calling this with no wrapping
8857  ImRect bb_rel = window->NavRectRel[0];
8858 
8859  ImGuiDir clip_dir = g.NavMoveDir;
8860  if (g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Left && (move_flags & (ImGuiNavMoveFlags_WrapX | ImGuiNavMoveFlags_LoopX)))
8861  {
8862  bb_rel.Min.x = bb_rel.Max.x =
8863  ImMax(window->SizeFull.x, window->ContentSize.x + window->WindowPadding.x * 2.0f) - window->Scroll.x;
8864  if (move_flags & ImGuiNavMoveFlags_WrapX)
8865  {
8866  bb_rel.TranslateY(-bb_rel.GetHeight());
8867  clip_dir = ImGuiDir_Up;
8868  }
8869  NavMoveRequestForward(g.NavMoveDir, clip_dir, bb_rel, move_flags);
8870  }
8871  if (g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Right && (move_flags & (ImGuiNavMoveFlags_WrapX | ImGuiNavMoveFlags_LoopX)))
8872  {
8873  bb_rel.Min.x = bb_rel.Max.x = -window->Scroll.x;
8874  if (move_flags & ImGuiNavMoveFlags_WrapX)
8875  {
8876  bb_rel.TranslateY(+bb_rel.GetHeight());
8877  clip_dir = ImGuiDir_Down;
8878  }
8879  NavMoveRequestForward(g.NavMoveDir, clip_dir, bb_rel, move_flags);
8880  }
8881  if (g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Up && (move_flags & (ImGuiNavMoveFlags_WrapY | ImGuiNavMoveFlags_LoopY)))
8882  {
8883  bb_rel.Min.y = bb_rel.Max.y =
8884  ImMax(window->SizeFull.y, window->ContentSize.y + window->WindowPadding.y * 2.0f) - window->Scroll.y;
8885  if (move_flags & ImGuiNavMoveFlags_WrapY)
8886  {
8887  bb_rel.TranslateX(-bb_rel.GetWidth());
8888  clip_dir = ImGuiDir_Left;
8889  }
8890  NavMoveRequestForward(g.NavMoveDir, clip_dir, bb_rel, move_flags);
8891  }
8892  if (g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Down && (move_flags & (ImGuiNavMoveFlags_WrapY | ImGuiNavMoveFlags_LoopY)))
8893  {
8894  bb_rel.Min.y = bb_rel.Max.y = -window->Scroll.y;
8895  if (move_flags & ImGuiNavMoveFlags_WrapY)
8896  {
8897  bb_rel.TranslateX(+bb_rel.GetWidth());
8898  clip_dir = ImGuiDir_Right;
8899  }
8900  NavMoveRequestForward(g.NavMoveDir, clip_dir, bb_rel, move_flags);
8901  }
8902  }
8903 }
8904 
8905 static int ImGui::FindWindowFocusIndex(ImGuiWindow* window) // FIXME-OPT O(N)
8906 {
8907  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8908  for (int i = g.WindowsFocusOrder.Size - 1; i >= 0; i--)
8909  if (g.WindowsFocusOrder[i] == window)
8910  return i;
8911  return -1;
8912 }
8913 
8914 static ImGuiWindow* FindWindowNavFocusable(int i_start, int i_stop, int dir) // FIXME-OPT O(N)
8915 {
8916  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8917  for (int i = i_start; i >= 0 && i < g.WindowsFocusOrder.Size && i != i_stop; i += dir)
8918  if (ImGui::IsWindowNavFocusable(g.WindowsFocusOrder[i]))
8919  return g.WindowsFocusOrder[i];
8920  return NULL;
8921 }
8922 
8923 static void NavUpdateWindowingHighlightWindow(int focus_change_dir)
8924 {
8925  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8926  IM_ASSERT(g.NavWindowingTarget);
8927  if (g.NavWindowingTarget->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Modal)
8928  return;
8929 
8930  const int i_current = ImGui::FindWindowFocusIndex(g.NavWindowingTarget);
8931  ImGuiWindow* window_target = FindWindowNavFocusable(i_current + focus_change_dir, -INT_MAX, focus_change_dir);
8932  if (!window_target)
8933  window_target = FindWindowNavFocusable((focus_change_dir < 0) ? (g.WindowsFocusOrder.Size - 1) : 0, i_current, focus_change_dir);
8934  if (window_target) // Don't reset windowing target if there's a single window in the list
8935  g.NavWindowingTarget = g.NavWindowingTargetAnim = window_target;
8936  g.NavWindowingToggleLayer = false;
8937 }
8938 
8939 // Windowing management mode
8940 // Keyboard: CTRL+Tab (change focus/move/resize), Alt (toggle menu layer)
8941 // Gamepad: Hold Menu/Square (change focus/move/resize), Tap Menu/Square (toggle menu layer)
8942 static void ImGui::NavUpdateWindowing()
8943 {
8944  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8945  ImGuiWindow* apply_focus_window = NULL;
8946  bool apply_toggle_layer = false;
8947 
8948  ImGuiWindow* modal_window = GetTopMostPopupModal();
8949  if (modal_window != NULL)
8950  {
8951  g.NavWindowingTarget = NULL;
8952  return;
8953  }
8954 
8955  // Fade out
8956  if (g.NavWindowingTargetAnim && g.NavWindowingTarget == NULL)
8957  {
8958  g.NavWindowingHighlightAlpha = ImMax(g.NavWindowingHighlightAlpha - g.IO.DeltaTime * 10.0f, 0.0f);
8959  if (g.DimBgRatio <= 0.0f && g.NavWindowingHighlightAlpha <= 0.0f)
8960  g.NavWindowingTargetAnim = NULL;
8961  }
8962 
8963  // Start CTRL-TAB or Square+L/R window selection
8964  bool start_windowing_with_gamepad = !g.NavWindowingTarget && IsNavInputTest(ImGuiNavInput_Menu, ImGuiInputReadMode_Pressed);
8965  bool start_windowing_with_keyboard = !g.NavWindowingTarget && g.IO.KeyCtrl && IsKeyPressedMap(ImGuiKey_Tab) && (g.IO.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableKeyboard);
8966  if (start_windowing_with_gamepad || start_windowing_with_keyboard)
8967  if (ImGuiWindow* window = g.NavWindow ? g.NavWindow : FindWindowNavFocusable(g.WindowsFocusOrder.Size - 1, -INT_MAX, -1))
8968  {
8969  g.NavWindowingTarget = g.NavWindowingTargetAnim = window->RootWindow; // FIXME-DOCK: Will need to use RootWindowDockStop
8970  g.NavWindowingTimer = g.NavWindowingHighlightAlpha = 0.0f;
8971  g.NavWindowingToggleLayer = start_windowing_with_keyboard ? false : true;
8972  g.NavInputSource = start_windowing_with_keyboard ? ImGuiInputSource_NavKeyboard : ImGuiInputSource_NavGamepad;
8973  }
8974 
8975  // Gamepad update
8976  g.NavWindowingTimer += g.IO.DeltaTime;
8977  if (g.NavWindowingTarget && g.NavInputSource == ImGuiInputSource_NavGamepad)
8978  {
8979  // Highlight only appears after a brief time holding the button, so that a fast tap on PadMenu (to toggle NavLayer) doesn't add visual noise
8980  g.NavWindowingHighlightAlpha = ImMax(g.NavWindowingHighlightAlpha, ImSaturate((g.NavWindowingTimer - NAV_WINDOWING_HIGHLIGHT_DELAY) / 0.05f));
8981 
8982  // Select window to focus
8983  const int focus_change_dir = (int)IsNavInputTest(ImGuiNavInput_FocusPrev, ImGuiInputReadMode_RepeatSlow) - (int)IsNavInputTest(ImGuiNavInput_FocusNext, ImGuiInputReadMode_RepeatSlow);
8984  if (focus_change_dir != 0)
8985  {
8986  NavUpdateWindowingHighlightWindow(focus_change_dir);
8987  g.NavWindowingHighlightAlpha = 1.0f;
8988  }
8989 
8990  // Single press toggles NavLayer, long press with L/R apply actual focus on release (until then the window was merely rendered top-most)
8991  if (!IsNavInputDown(ImGuiNavInput_Menu))
8992  {
8993  g.NavWindowingToggleLayer &= (g.NavWindowingHighlightAlpha < 1.0f); // Once button was held long enough we don't consider it a tap-to-toggle-layer press anymore.
8994  if (g.NavWindowingToggleLayer && g.NavWindow)
8995  apply_toggle_layer = true;
8996  else if (!g.NavWindowingToggleLayer)
8997  apply_focus_window = g.NavWindowingTarget;
8998  g.NavWindowingTarget = NULL;
8999  }
9000  }
9001 
9002  // Keyboard: Focus
9003  if (g.NavWindowingTarget && g.NavInputSource == ImGuiInputSource_NavKeyboard)
9004  {
9005  // Visuals only appears after a brief time after pressing TAB the first time, so that a fast CTRL+TAB doesn't add visual noise
9006  g.NavWindowingHighlightAlpha = ImMax(g.NavWindowingHighlightAlpha, ImSaturate((g.NavWindowingTimer - NAV_WINDOWING_HIGHLIGHT_DELAY) / 0.05f)); // 1.0f
9007  if (IsKeyPressedMap(ImGuiKey_Tab, true))
9008  NavUpdateWindowingHighlightWindow(g.IO.KeyShift ? +1 : -1);
9009  if (!g.IO.KeyCtrl)
9010  apply_focus_window = g.NavWindowingTarget;
9011  }
9012 
9013  // Keyboard: Press and Release ALT to toggle menu layer
9014  // FIXME: We lack an explicit IO variable for "is the imgui window focused", so compare mouse validity to detect the common case of back-end clearing releases all keys on ALT-TAB
9015  if (IsNavInputTest(ImGuiNavInput_KeyMenu_, ImGuiInputReadMode_Pressed))
9016  g.NavWindowingToggleLayer = true;
9017  if ((g.ActiveId == 0 || g.ActiveIdAllowOverlap) && g.NavWindowingToggleLayer && IsNavInputTest(ImGuiNavInput_KeyMenu_, ImGuiInputReadMode_Released))
9018  if (IsMousePosValid(&g.IO.MousePos) == IsMousePosValid(&g.IO.MousePosPrev))
9019  apply_toggle_layer = true;
9020 
9021  // Move window
9022  if (g.NavWindowingTarget && !(g.NavWindowingTarget->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMove))
9023  {
9024  ImVec2 move_delta;
9025  if (g.NavInputSource == ImGuiInputSource_NavKeyboard && !g.IO.KeyShift)
9026  move_delta = GetNavInputAmount2d(ImGuiNavDirSourceFlags_Keyboard, ImGuiInputReadMode_Down);
9027  if (g.NavInputSource == ImGuiInputSource_NavGamepad)
9028  move_delta = GetNavInputAmount2d(ImGuiNavDirSourceFlags_PadLStick, ImGuiInputReadMode_Down);
9029  if (move_delta.x != 0.0f || move_delta.y != 0.0f)
9030  {
9031  const float NAV_MOVE_SPEED = 800.0f;
9032  const float move_speed = ImFloor(NAV_MOVE_SPEED * g.IO.DeltaTime * ImMin(g.IO.DisplayFramebufferScale.x, g.IO.DisplayFramebufferScale.y)); // FIXME: Doesn't code variable framerate very well
9033  SetWindowPos(g.NavWindowingTarget->RootWindow, g.NavWindowingTarget->RootWindow->Pos + move_delta * move_speed, ImGuiCond_Always);
9034  g.NavDisableMouseHover = true;
9035  MarkIniSettingsDirty(g.NavWindowingTarget);
9036  }
9037  }
9038 
9039  // Apply final focus
9040  if (apply_focus_window && (g.NavWindow == NULL || apply_focus_window != g.NavWindow->RootWindow))
9041  {
9042  ClearActiveID();
9043  g.NavDisableHighlight = false;
9044  g.NavDisableMouseHover = true;
9045  apply_focus_window = NavRestoreLastChildNavWindow(apply_focus_window);
9046  ClosePopupsOverWindow(apply_focus_window, false);
9047  FocusWindow(apply_focus_window);
9048  if (apply_focus_window->NavLastIds[0] == 0)
9049  NavInitWindow(apply_focus_window, false);
9050 
9051  // If the window only has a menu layer, select it directly
9052  if (apply_focus_window->DC.NavLayerActiveMask == (1 << ImGuiNavLayer_Menu))
9053  g.NavLayer = ImGuiNavLayer_Menu;
9054  }
9055  if (apply_focus_window)
9056  g.NavWindowingTarget = NULL;
9057 
9058  // Apply menu/layer toggle
9059  if (apply_toggle_layer && g.NavWindow)
9060  {
9061  // Move to parent menu if necessary
9062  ImGuiWindow* new_nav_window = g.NavWindow;
9063  while (new_nav_window->ParentWindow
9064  && (new_nav_window->DC.NavLayerActiveMask & (1 << ImGuiNavLayer_Menu)) == 0
9065  && (new_nav_window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) != 0
9066  && (new_nav_window->Flags & (ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup | ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildMenu)) == 0)
9067  new_nav_window = new_nav_window->ParentWindow;
9068  if (new_nav_window != g.NavWindow)
9069  {
9070  ImGuiWindow* old_nav_window = g.NavWindow;
9071  FocusWindow(new_nav_window);
9072  new_nav_window->NavLastChildNavWindow = old_nav_window;
9073  }
9074  g.NavDisableHighlight = false;
9075  g.NavDisableMouseHover = true;
9076 
9077  // When entering a regular menu bar with the Alt key, we always reinitialize the navigation ID.
9078  const ImGuiNavLayer new_nav_layer = (g.NavWindow->DC.NavLayerActiveMask & (1 << ImGuiNavLayer_Menu)) ? (ImGuiNavLayer)((int)g.NavLayer ^ 1) : ImGuiNavLayer_Main;
9079  NavRestoreLayer(new_nav_layer);
9080  }
9081 }
9082 
9083 // Window has already passed the IsWindowNavFocusable()
9084 static const char* GetFallbackWindowNameForWindowingList(ImGuiWindow* window)
9085 {
9086  if (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup)
9087  return "(Popup)";
9088  if ((window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_MenuBar) && strcmp(window->Name, "##MainMenuBar") == 0)
9089  return "(Main menu bar)";
9090  return "(Untitled)";
9091 }
9092 
9093 // Overlay displayed when using CTRL+TAB. Called by EndFrame().
9094 void ImGui::NavUpdateWindowingOverlay()
9095 {
9096  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9097  IM_ASSERT(g.NavWindowingTarget != NULL);
9098 
9099  if (g.NavWindowingTimer < NAV_WINDOWING_LIST_APPEAR_DELAY)
9100  return;
9101 
9102  if (g.NavWindowingListWindow == NULL)
9103  g.NavWindowingListWindow = FindWindowByName("###NavWindowingList");
9104  SetNextWindowSizeConstraints(ImVec2(g.IO.DisplaySize.x * 0.20f, g.IO.DisplaySize.y * 0.20f), ImVec2(FLT_MAX, FLT_MAX));
9105  SetNextWindowPos(g.IO.DisplaySize * 0.5f, ImGuiCond_Always, ImVec2(0.5f, 0.5f));
9106  PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_WindowPadding, g.Style.WindowPadding * 2.0f);
9107  Begin("###NavWindowingList", NULL, ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoFocusOnAppearing | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoResize | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMove | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoInputs | ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoSavedSettings);
9108  for (int n = g.WindowsFocusOrder.Size - 1; n >= 0; n--)
9109  {
9110  ImGuiWindow* window = g.WindowsFocusOrder[n];
9111  if (!IsWindowNavFocusable(window))
9112  continue;
9113  const char* label = window->Name;
9114  if (label == FindRenderedTextEnd(label))
9115  label = GetFallbackWindowNameForWindowingList(window);
9116  Selectable(label, g.NavWindowingTarget == window);
9117  }
9118  End();
9119  PopStyleVar();
9120 }
9121 
9122 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
9123 // [SECTION] DRAG AND DROP
9124 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
9125 
9126 void ImGui::ClearDragDrop()
9127 {
9128  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9129  g.DragDropActive = false;
9130  g.DragDropPayload.Clear();
9131  g.DragDropAcceptFlags = ImGuiDragDropFlags_None;
9132  g.DragDropAcceptIdCurr = g.DragDropAcceptIdPrev = 0;
9133  g.DragDropAcceptIdCurrRectSurface = FLT_MAX;
9134  g.DragDropAcceptFrameCount = -1;
9135 
9136  g.DragDropPayloadBufHeap.clear();
9137  memset(&g.DragDropPayloadBufLocal, 0, sizeof(g.DragDropPayloadBufLocal));
9138 }
9139 
9140 // Call when current ID is active.
9141 // When this returns true you need to: a) call SetDragDropPayload() exactly once, b) you may render the payload visual/description, c) call EndDragDropSource()
9142 bool ImGui::BeginDragDropSource(ImGuiDragDropFlags flags)
9143 {
9144  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9145  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
9146 
9147  bool source_drag_active = false;
9148  ImGuiID source_id = 0;
9149  ImGuiID source_parent_id = 0;
9150  ImGuiMouseButton mouse_button = ImGuiMouseButton_Left;
9151  if (!(flags & ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceExtern))
9152  {
9153  source_id = window->DC.LastItemId;
9154  if (source_id != 0 && g.ActiveId != source_id) // Early out for most common case
9155  return false;
9156  if (g.IO.MouseDown[mouse_button] == false)
9157  return false;
9158 
9159  if (source_id == 0)
9160  {
9161  // If you want to use BeginDragDropSource() on an item with no unique identifier for interaction, such as Text() or Image(), you need to:
9162  // A) Read the explanation below, B) Use the ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceAllowNullID flag, C) Swallow your programmer pride.
9163  if (!(flags & ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceAllowNullID))
9164  {
9165  IM_ASSERT(0);
9166  return false;
9167  }
9168 
9169  // Early out
9170  if ((window->DC.LastItemStatusFlags & ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HoveredRect) == 0 && (g.ActiveId == 0 || g.ActiveIdWindow != window))
9171  return false;
9172 
9173  // Magic fallback (=somehow reprehensible) to handle items with no assigned ID, e.g. Text(), Image()
9174  // We build a throwaway ID based on current ID stack + relative AABB of items in window.
9175  // THE IDENTIFIER WON'T SURVIVE ANY REPOSITIONING OF THE WIDGET, so if your widget moves your dragging operation will be canceled.
9176  // We don't need to maintain/call ClearActiveID() as releasing the button will early out this function and trigger !ActiveIdIsAlive.
9177  source_id = window->DC.LastItemId = window->GetIDFromRectangle(window->DC.LastItemRect);
9178  bool is_hovered = ItemHoverable(window->DC.LastItemRect, source_id);
9179  if (is_hovered && g.IO.MouseClicked[mouse_button])
9180  {
9181  SetActiveID(source_id, window);
9182  FocusWindow(window);
9183  }
9184  if (g.ActiveId == source_id) // Allow the underlying widget to display/return hovered during the mouse release frame, else we would get a flicker.
9185  g.ActiveIdAllowOverlap = is_hovered;
9186  }
9187  else
9188  {
9189  g.ActiveIdAllowOverlap = false;
9190  }
9191  if (g.ActiveId != source_id)
9192  return false;
9193  source_parent_id = window->IDStack.back();
9194  source_drag_active = IsMouseDragging(mouse_button);
9195 
9196  // Disable navigation and key inputs while dragging
9197  g.ActiveIdUsingNavDirMask = ~(ImU32)0;
9198  g.ActiveIdUsingNavInputMask = ~(ImU32)0;
9199  g.ActiveIdUsingKeyInputMask = ~(ImU64)0;
9200  }
9201  else
9202  {
9203  window = NULL;
9204  source_id = ImHashStr("#SourceExtern");
9205  source_drag_active = true;
9206  }
9207 
9208  if (source_drag_active)
9209  {
9210  if (!g.DragDropActive)
9211  {
9212  IM_ASSERT(source_id != 0);
9213  ClearDragDrop();
9214  ImGuiPayload& payload = g.DragDropPayload;
9215  payload.SourceId = source_id;
9216  payload.SourceParentId = source_parent_id;
9217  g.DragDropActive = true;
9218  g.DragDropSourceFlags = flags;
9219  g.DragDropMouseButton = mouse_button;
9220  }
9221  g.DragDropSourceFrameCount = g.FrameCount;
9222  g.DragDropWithinSource = true;
9223 
9224  if (!(flags & ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceNoPreviewTooltip))
9225  {
9226  // Target can request the Source to not display its tooltip (we use a dedicated flag to make this request explicit)
9227  // We unfortunately can't just modify the source flags and skip the call to BeginTooltip, as caller may be emitting contents.
9228  BeginTooltip();
9229  if (g.DragDropAcceptIdPrev && (g.DragDropAcceptFlags & ImGuiDragDropFlags_AcceptNoPreviewTooltip))
9230  {
9231  ImGuiWindow* tooltip_window = g.CurrentWindow;
9232  tooltip_window->SkipItems = true;
9233  tooltip_window->HiddenFramesCanSkipItems = 1;
9234  }
9235  }
9236 
9237  if (!(flags & ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceNoDisableHover) && !(flags & ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceExtern))
9238  window->DC.LastItemStatusFlags &= ~ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HoveredRect;
9239 
9240  return true;
9241  }
9242  return false;
9243 }
9244 
9245 void ImGui::EndDragDropSource()
9246 {
9247  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9248  IM_ASSERT(g.DragDropActive);
9249  IM_ASSERT(g.DragDropWithinSource && "Not after a BeginDragDropSource()?");
9250 
9251  if (!(g.DragDropSourceFlags & ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceNoPreviewTooltip))
9252  EndTooltip();
9253 
9254  // Discard the drag if have not called SetDragDropPayload()
9255  if (g.DragDropPayload.DataFrameCount == -1)
9256  ClearDragDrop();
9257  g.DragDropWithinSource = false;
9258 }
9259 
9260 // Use 'cond' to choose to submit payload on drag start or every frame
9261 bool ImGui::SetDragDropPayload(const char* type, const void* data, size_t data_size, ImGuiCond cond)
9262 {
9263  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9264  ImGuiPayload& payload = g.DragDropPayload;
9265  if (cond == 0)
9266  cond = ImGuiCond_Always;
9267 
9268  IM_ASSERT(type != NULL);
9269  IM_ASSERT(strlen(type) < IM_ARRAYSIZE(payload.DataType) && "Payload type can be at most 32 characters long");
9270  IM_ASSERT((data != NULL && data_size > 0) || (data == NULL && data_size == 0));
9271  IM_ASSERT(cond == ImGuiCond_Always || cond == ImGuiCond_Once);
9272  IM_ASSERT(payload.SourceId != 0); // Not called between BeginDragDropSource() and EndDragDropSource()
9273 
9274  if (cond == ImGuiCond_Always || payload.DataFrameCount == -1)
9275  {
9276  // Copy payload
9277  ImStrncpy(payload.DataType, type, IM_ARRAYSIZE(payload.DataType));
9278  g.DragDropPayloadBufHeap.resize(0);
9279  if (data_size > sizeof(g.DragDropPayloadBufLocal))
9280  {
9281  // Store in heap
9282  g.DragDropPayloadBufHeap.resize((int)data_size);
9283  payload.Data = g.DragDropPayloadBufHeap.Data;
9284  memcpy(payload.Data, data, data_size);
9285  }
9286  else if (data_size > 0)
9287  {
9288  // Store locally
9289  memset(&g.DragDropPayloadBufLocal, 0, sizeof(g.DragDropPayloadBufLocal));
9290  payload.Data = g.DragDropPayloadBufLocal;
9291  memcpy(payload.Data, data, data_size);
9292  }
9293  else
9294  {
9295  payload.Data = NULL;
9296  }
9297  payload.DataSize = (int)data_size;
9298  }
9299  payload.DataFrameCount = g.FrameCount;
9300 
9301  return (g.DragDropAcceptFrameCount == g.FrameCount) || (g.DragDropAcceptFrameCount == g.FrameCount - 1);
9302 }
9303 
9304 bool ImGui::BeginDragDropTargetCustom(const ImRect& bb, ImGuiID id)
9305 {
9306  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9307  if (!g.DragDropActive)
9308  return false;
9309 
9310  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
9311  if (g.HoveredWindow == NULL || window->RootWindow != g.HoveredWindow->RootWindow)
9312  return false;
9313  IM_ASSERT(id != 0);
9314  if (!IsMouseHoveringRect(bb.Min, bb.Max) || (id == g.DragDropPayload.SourceId))
9315  return false;
9316  if (window->SkipItems)
9317  return false;
9318 
9319  IM_ASSERT(g.DragDropWithinTarget == false);
9320  g.DragDropTargetRect = bb;
9321  g.DragDropTargetId = id;
9322  g.DragDropWithinTarget = true;
9323  return true;
9324 }
9325 
9326 // We don't use BeginDragDropTargetCustom() and duplicate its code because:
9327 // 1) we use LastItemRectHoveredRect which handles items that pushes a temporarily clip rectangle in their code. Calling BeginDragDropTargetCustom(LastItemRect) would not handle them.
9328 // 2) and it's faster. as this code may be very frequently called, we want to early out as fast as we can.
9329 // Also note how the HoveredWindow test is positioned differently in both functions (in both functions we optimize for the cheapest early out case)
9330 bool ImGui::BeginDragDropTarget()
9331 {
9332  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9333  if (!g.DragDropActive)
9334  return false;
9335 
9336  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
9337  if (!(window->DC.LastItemStatusFlags & ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HoveredRect))
9338  return false;
9339  if (g.HoveredWindow == NULL || window->RootWindow != g.HoveredWindow->RootWindow)
9340  return false;
9341 
9342  const ImRect& display_rect = (window->DC.LastItemStatusFlags & ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HasDisplayRect) ? window->DC.LastItemDisplayRect : window->DC.LastItemRect;
9343  ImGuiID id = window->DC.LastItemId;
9344  if (id == 0)
9345  id = window->GetIDFromRectangle(display_rect);
9346  if (g.DragDropPayload.SourceId == id)
9347  return false;
9348 
9349  IM_ASSERT(g.DragDropWithinTarget == false);
9350  g.DragDropTargetRect = display_rect;
9351  g.DragDropTargetId = id;
9352  g.DragDropWithinTarget = true;
9353  return true;
9354 }
9355 
9356 bool ImGui::IsDragDropPayloadBeingAccepted()
9357 {
9358  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9359  return g.DragDropActive && g.DragDropAcceptIdPrev != 0;
9360 }
9361 
9362 const ImGuiPayload* ImGui::AcceptDragDropPayload(const char* type, ImGuiDragDropFlags flags)
9363 {
9364  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9365  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
9366  ImGuiPayload& payload = g.DragDropPayload;
9367  IM_ASSERT(g.DragDropActive); // Not called between BeginDragDropTarget() and EndDragDropTarget() ?
9368  IM_ASSERT(payload.DataFrameCount != -1); // Forgot to call EndDragDropTarget() ?
9369  if (type != NULL && !payload.IsDataType(type))
9370  return NULL;
9371 
9372  // Accept smallest drag target bounding box, this allows us to nest drag targets conveniently without ordering constraints.
9373  // NB: We currently accept NULL id as target. However, overlapping targets requires a unique ID to function!
9374  const bool was_accepted_previously = (g.DragDropAcceptIdPrev == g.DragDropTargetId);
9375  ImRect r = g.DragDropTargetRect;
9376  float r_surface = r.GetWidth() * r.GetHeight();
9377  if (r_surface < g.DragDropAcceptIdCurrRectSurface)
9378  {
9379  g.DragDropAcceptFlags = flags;
9380  g.DragDropAcceptIdCurr = g.DragDropTargetId;
9381  g.DragDropAcceptIdCurrRectSurface = r_surface;
9382  }
9383 
9384  // Render default drop visuals
9385  payload.Preview = was_accepted_previously;
9386  flags |= (g.DragDropSourceFlags & ImGuiDragDropFlags_AcceptNoDrawDefaultRect); // Source can also inhibit the preview (useful for external sources that lives for 1 frame)
9387  if (!(flags & ImGuiDragDropFlags_AcceptNoDrawDefaultRect) && payload.Preview)
9388  {
9389  // FIXME-DRAG: Settle on a proper default visuals for drop target.
9390  r.Expand(3.5f);
9391  bool push_clip_rect = !window->ClipRect.Contains(r);
9392  if (push_clip_rect) window->DrawList->PushClipRect(r.Min - ImVec2(1, 1), r.Max + ImVec2(1, 1));
9393  window->DrawList->AddRect(r.Min, r.Max, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_DragDropTarget), 0.0f, ~0, 2.0f);
9394  if (push_clip_rect) window->DrawList->PopClipRect();
9395  }
9396 
9397  g.DragDropAcceptFrameCount = g.FrameCount;
9398  payload.Delivery = was_accepted_previously && !IsMouseDown(g.DragDropMouseButton); // For extern drag sources affecting os window focus, it's easier to just test !IsMouseDown() instead of IsMouseReleased()
9399  if (!payload.Delivery && !(flags & ImGuiDragDropFlags_AcceptBeforeDelivery))
9400  return NULL;
9401 
9402  return &payload;
9403 }
9404 
9405 const ImGuiPayload* ImGui::GetDragDropPayload()
9406 {
9407  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9408  return g.DragDropActive ? &g.DragDropPayload : NULL;
9409 }
9410 
9411 // We don't really use/need this now, but added it for the sake of consistency and because we might need it later.
9412 void ImGui::EndDragDropTarget()
9413 {
9414  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9415  IM_ASSERT(g.DragDropActive);
9416  IM_ASSERT(g.DragDropWithinTarget);
9417  g.DragDropWithinTarget = false;
9418 }
9419 
9420 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
9421 // [SECTION] LOGGING/CAPTURING
9422 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
9423 // All text output from the interface can be captured into tty/file/clipboard.
9424 // By default, tree nodes are automatically opened during logging.
9425 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
9426 
9427 // Pass text data straight to log (without being displayed)
9428 void ImGui::LogText(const char* fmt, ...)
9429 {
9430  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9431  if (!g.LogEnabled)
9432  return;
9433 
9434  va_list args;
9435  va_start(args, fmt);
9436  if (g.LogFile)
9437  {
9438  g.LogBuffer.Buf.resize(0);
9439  g.LogBuffer.appendfv(fmt, args);
9440  ImFileWrite(g.LogBuffer.c_str(), sizeof(char), (ImU64)g.LogBuffer.size(), g.LogFile);
9441  }
9442  else
9443  {
9444  g.LogBuffer.appendfv(fmt, args);
9445  }
9446  va_end(args);
9447 }
9448 
9449 // Internal version that takes a position to decide on newline placement and pad items according to their depth.
9450 // We split text into individual lines to add current tree level padding
9451 void ImGui::LogRenderedText(const ImVec2* ref_pos, const char* text, const char* text_end)
9452 {
9453  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9454  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
9455 
9456  if (!text_end)
9457  text_end = FindRenderedTextEnd(text, text_end);
9458 
9459  const bool log_new_line = ref_pos && (ref_pos->y > g.LogLinePosY + 1);
9460  if (ref_pos)
9461  g.LogLinePosY = ref_pos->y;
9462  if (log_new_line)
9463  g.LogLineFirstItem = true;
9464 
9465  const char* text_remaining = text;
9466  if (g.LogDepthRef > window->DC.TreeDepth) // Re-adjust padding if we have popped out of our starting depth
9467  g.LogDepthRef = window->DC.TreeDepth;
9468  const int tree_depth = (window->DC.TreeDepth - g.LogDepthRef);
9469  for (;;)
9470  {
9471  // Split the string. Each new line (after a '\n') is followed by spacing corresponding to the current depth of our log entry.
9472  // We don't add a trailing \n to allow a subsequent item on the same line to be captured.
9473  const char* line_start = text_remaining;
9474  const char* line_end = ImStreolRange(line_start, text_end);
9475  const bool is_first_line = (line_start == text);
9476  const bool is_last_line = (line_end == text_end);
9477  if (!is_last_line || (line_start != line_end))
9478  {
9479  const int char_count = (int)(line_end - line_start);
9480  if (log_new_line || !is_first_line)
9481  LogText(IM_NEWLINE "%*s%.*s", tree_depth * 4, "", char_count, line_start);
9482  else if (g.LogLineFirstItem)
9483  LogText("%*s%.*s", tree_depth * 4, "", char_count, line_start);
9484  else
9485  LogText(" %.*s", char_count, line_start);
9486  g.LogLineFirstItem = false;
9487  }
9488  else if (log_new_line)
9489  {
9490  // An empty "" string at a different Y position should output a carriage return.
9491  LogText(IM_NEWLINE);
9492  break;
9493  }
9494 
9495  if (is_last_line)
9496  break;
9497  text_remaining = line_end + 1;
9498  }
9499 }
9500 
9501 // Start logging/capturing text output
9502 void ImGui::LogBegin(ImGuiLogType type, int auto_open_depth)
9503 {
9504  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9505  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
9506  IM_ASSERT(g.LogEnabled == false);
9507  IM_ASSERT(g.LogFile == NULL);
9508  IM_ASSERT(g.LogBuffer.empty());
9509  g.LogEnabled = true;
9510  g.LogType = type;
9511  g.LogDepthRef = window->DC.TreeDepth;
9512  g.LogDepthToExpand = ((auto_open_depth >= 0) ? auto_open_depth : g.LogDepthToExpandDefault);
9513  g.LogLinePosY = FLT_MAX;
9514  g.LogLineFirstItem = true;
9515 }
9516 
9517 void ImGui::LogToTTY(int auto_open_depth)
9518 {
9519  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9520  if (g.LogEnabled)
9521  return;
9522  IM_UNUSED(auto_open_depth);
9523 #ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_TTY_FUNCTIONS
9524  LogBegin(ImGuiLogType_TTY, auto_open_depth);
9525  g.LogFile = stdout;
9526 #endif
9527 }
9528 
9529 // Start logging/capturing text output to given file
9530 void ImGui::LogToFile(int auto_open_depth, const char* filename)
9531 {
9532  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9533  if (g.LogEnabled)
9534  return;
9535 
9536  // FIXME: We could probably open the file in text mode "at", however note that clipboard/buffer logging will still
9537  // be subject to outputting OS-incompatible carriage return if within strings the user doesn't use IM_NEWLINE.
9538  // By opening the file in binary mode "ab" we have consistent output everywhere.
9539  if (!filename)
9540  filename = g.IO.LogFilename;
9541  if (!filename || !filename[0])
9542  return;
9543  ImFileHandle f = ImFileOpen(filename, "ab");
9544  if (!f)
9545  {
9546  IM_ASSERT(0);
9547  return;
9548  }
9549 
9550  LogBegin(ImGuiLogType_File, auto_open_depth);
9551  g.LogFile = f;
9552 }
9553 
9554 // Start logging/capturing text output to clipboard
9555 void ImGui::LogToClipboard(int auto_open_depth)
9556 {
9557  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9558  if (g.LogEnabled)
9559  return;
9560  LogBegin(ImGuiLogType_Clipboard, auto_open_depth);
9561 }
9562 
9563 void ImGui::LogToBuffer(int auto_open_depth)
9564 {
9565  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9566  if (g.LogEnabled)
9567  return;
9568  LogBegin(ImGuiLogType_Buffer, auto_open_depth);
9569 }
9570 
9571 void ImGui::LogFinish()
9572 {
9573  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9574  if (!g.LogEnabled)
9575  return;
9576 
9577  LogText(IM_NEWLINE);
9578  switch (g.LogType)
9579  {
9580  case ImGuiLogType_TTY:
9581 #ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_TTY_FUNCTIONS
9582  fflush(g.LogFile);
9583 #endif
9584  break;
9585  case ImGuiLogType_File:
9586  ImFileClose(g.LogFile);
9587  break;
9588  case ImGuiLogType_Buffer:
9589  break;
9590  case ImGuiLogType_Clipboard:
9591  if (!g.LogBuffer.empty())
9592  SetClipboardText(g.LogBuffer.begin());
9593  break;
9594  case ImGuiLogType_None:
9595  IM_ASSERT(0);
9596  break;
9597  }
9598 
9599  g.LogEnabled = false;
9600  g.LogType = ImGuiLogType_None;
9601  g.LogFile = NULL;
9602  g.LogBuffer.clear();
9603 }
9604 
9605 // Helper to display logging buttons
9606 // FIXME-OBSOLETE: We should probably obsolete this and let the user have their own helper (this is one of the oldest function alive!)
9607 void ImGui::LogButtons()
9608 {
9609  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9610 
9611  PushID("LogButtons");
9612 #ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_TTY_FUNCTIONS
9613  const bool log_to_tty = Button("Log To TTY"); SameLine();
9614 #else
9615  const bool log_to_tty = false;
9616 #endif
9617  const bool log_to_file = Button("Log To File"); SameLine();
9618  const bool log_to_clipboard = Button("Log To Clipboard"); SameLine();
9619  PushAllowKeyboardFocus(false);
9620  SetNextItemWidth(80.0f);
9621  SliderInt("Default Depth", &g.LogDepthToExpandDefault, 0, 9, NULL);
9622  PopAllowKeyboardFocus();
9623  PopID();
9624 
9625  // Start logging at the end of the function so that the buttons don't appear in the log
9626  if (log_to_tty)
9627  LogToTTY();
9628  if (log_to_file)
9629  LogToFile();
9630  if (log_to_clipboard)
9631  LogToClipboard();
9632 }
9633 
9634 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
9635 // [SECTION] SETTINGS
9636 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
9637 // - UpdateSettings() [Internal]
9638 // - MarkIniSettingsDirty() [Internal]
9639 // - CreateNewWindowSettings() [Internal]
9640 // - FindWindowSettings() [Internal]
9641 // - FindOrCreateWindowSettings() [Internal]
9642 // - FindSettingsHandler() [Internal]
9643 // - ClearIniSettings() [Internal]
9644 // - LoadIniSettingsFromDisk()
9645 // - LoadIniSettingsFromMemory()
9646 // - SaveIniSettingsToDisk()
9647 // - SaveIniSettingsToMemory()
9648 // - WindowSettingsHandler_***() [Internal]
9649 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
9650 
9651 // Called by NewFrame()
9652 void ImGui::UpdateSettings()
9653 {
9654  // Load settings on first frame (if not explicitly loaded manually before)
9655  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9656  if (!g.SettingsLoaded)
9657  {
9658  IM_ASSERT(g.SettingsWindows.empty());
9659  if (g.IO.IniFilename)
9660  LoadIniSettingsFromDisk(g.IO.IniFilename);
9661  g.SettingsLoaded = true;
9662  }
9663 
9664  // Save settings (with a delay after the last modification, so we don't spam disk too much)
9665  if (g.SettingsDirtyTimer > 0.0f)
9666  {
9667  g.SettingsDirtyTimer -= g.IO.DeltaTime;
9668  if (g.SettingsDirtyTimer <= 0.0f)
9669  {
9670  if (g.IO.IniFilename != NULL)
9671  SaveIniSettingsToDisk(g.IO.IniFilename);
9672  else
9673  g.IO.WantSaveIniSettings = true; // Let user know they can call SaveIniSettingsToMemory(). user will need to clear io.WantSaveIniSettings themselves.
9674  g.SettingsDirtyTimer = 0.0f;
9675  }
9676  }
9677 }
9678 
9679 void ImGui::MarkIniSettingsDirty()
9680 {
9681  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9682  if (g.SettingsDirtyTimer <= 0.0f)
9683  g.SettingsDirtyTimer = g.IO.IniSavingRate;
9684 }
9685 
9686 void ImGui::MarkIniSettingsDirty(ImGuiWindow* window)
9687 {
9688  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9689  if (!(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoSavedSettings))
9690  if (g.SettingsDirtyTimer <= 0.0f)
9691  g.SettingsDirtyTimer = g.IO.IniSavingRate;
9692 }
9693 
9694 ImGuiWindowSettings* ImGui::CreateNewWindowSettings(const char* name)
9695 {
9696  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9697 
9698 #if !IMGUI_DEBUG_INI_SETTINGS
9699  // Skip to the "###" marker if any. We don't skip past to match the behavior of GetID()
9700  // Preserve the full string when IMGUI_DEBUG_INI_SETTINGS is set to make .ini inspection easier.
9701  if (const char* p = strstr(name, "###"))
9702  name = p;
9703 #endif
9704  const size_t name_len = strlen(name);
9705 
9706  // Allocate chunk
9707  const size_t chunk_size = sizeof(ImGuiWindowSettings) + name_len + 1;
9708  ImGuiWindowSettings* settings = g.SettingsWindows.alloc_chunk(chunk_size);
9709  IM_PLACEMENT_NEW(settings) ImGuiWindowSettings();
9710  settings->ID = ImHashStr(name, name_len);
9711  memcpy(settings->GetName(), name, name_len + 1); // Store with zero terminator
9712 
9713  return settings;
9714 }
9715 
9716 ImGuiWindowSettings* ImGui::FindWindowSettings(ImGuiID id)
9717 {
9718  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9719  for (ImGuiWindowSettings* settings = g.SettingsWindows.begin(); settings != NULL; settings = g.SettingsWindows.next_chunk(settings))
9720  if (settings->ID == id)
9721  return settings;
9722  return NULL;
9723 }
9724 
9725 ImGuiWindowSettings* ImGui::FindOrCreateWindowSettings(const char* name)
9726 {
9727  if (ImGuiWindowSettings* settings = FindWindowSettings(ImHashStr(name)))
9728  return settings;
9729  return CreateNewWindowSettings(name);
9730 }
9731 
9732 ImGuiSettingsHandler* ImGui::FindSettingsHandler(const char* type_name)
9733 {
9734  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9735  const ImGuiID type_hash = ImHashStr(type_name);
9736  for (int handler_n = 0; handler_n < g.SettingsHandlers.Size; handler_n++)
9737  if (g.SettingsHandlers[handler_n].TypeHash == type_hash)
9738  return &g.SettingsHandlers[handler_n];
9739  return NULL;
9740 }
9741 
9742 void ImGui::ClearIniSettings()
9743 {
9744  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9745  g.SettingsIniData.clear();
9746  for (int handler_n = 0; handler_n < g.SettingsHandlers.Size; handler_n++)
9747  if (g.SettingsHandlers[handler_n].ClearAllFn)
9748  g.SettingsHandlers[handler_n].ClearAllFn(&g, &g.SettingsHandlers[handler_n]);
9749 }
9750 
9751 void ImGui::LoadIniSettingsFromDisk(const char* ini_filename)
9752 {
9753  size_t file_data_size = 0;
9754  char* file_data = (char*)ImFileLoadToMemory(ini_filename, "rb", &file_data_size);
9755  if (!file_data)
9756  return;
9757  LoadIniSettingsFromMemory(file_data, (size_t)file_data_size);
9758  IM_FREE(file_data);
9759 }
9760 
9761 // Zero-tolerance, no error reporting, cheap .ini parsing
9762 void ImGui::LoadIniSettingsFromMemory(const char* ini_data, size_t ini_size)
9763 {
9764  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9765  IM_ASSERT(g.Initialized);
9766  //IM_ASSERT(!g.WithinFrameScope && "Cannot be called between NewFrame() and EndFrame()");
9767  //IM_ASSERT(g.SettingsLoaded == false && g.FrameCount == 0);
9768 
9769  // For user convenience, we allow passing a non zero-terminated string (hence the ini_size parameter).
9770  // For our convenience and to make the code simpler, we'll also write zero-terminators within the buffer. So let's create a writable copy..
9771  if (ini_size == 0)
9772  ini_size = strlen(ini_data);
9773  g.SettingsIniData.Buf.resize((int)ini_size + 1);
9774  char* const buf = g.SettingsIniData.Buf.Data;
9775  char* const buf_end = buf + ini_size;
9776  memcpy(buf, ini_data, ini_size);
9777  buf_end[0] = 0;
9778 
9779  // Call pre-read handlers
9780  // Some types will clear their data (e.g. dock information) some types will allow merge/override (window)
9781  for (int handler_n = 0; handler_n < g.SettingsHandlers.Size; handler_n++)
9782  if (g.SettingsHandlers[handler_n].ReadInitFn)
9783  g.SettingsHandlers[handler_n].ReadInitFn(&g, &g.SettingsHandlers[handler_n]);
9784 
9785  void* entry_data = NULL;
9786  ImGuiSettingsHandler* entry_handler = NULL;
9787 
9788  char* line_end = NULL;
9789  for (char* line = buf; line < buf_end; line = line_end + 1)
9790  {
9791  // Skip new lines markers, then find end of the line
9792  while (*line == '\n' || *line == '\r')
9793  line++;
9794  line_end = line;
9795  while (line_end < buf_end && *line_end != '\n' && *line_end != '\r')
9796  line_end++;
9797  line_end[0] = 0;
9798  if (line[0] == ';')
9799  continue;
9800  if (line[0] == '[' && line_end > line && line_end[-1] == ']')
9801  {
