9802  // Parse "[Type][Name]". Note that 'Name' can itself contains [] characters, which is acceptable with the current format and parsing code.
9803  line_end[-1] = 0;
9804  const char* name_end = line_end - 1;
9805  const char* type_start = line + 1;
9806  char* type_end = (char*)(void*)ImStrchrRange(type_start, name_end, ']');
9807  const char* name_start = type_end ? ImStrchrRange(type_end + 1, name_end, '[') : NULL;
9808  if (!type_end || !name_start)
9809  continue;
9810  *type_end = 0; // Overwrite first ']'
9811  name_start++; // Skip second '['
9812  entry_handler = FindSettingsHandler(type_start);
9813  entry_data = entry_handler ? entry_handler->ReadOpenFn(&g, entry_handler, name_start) : NULL;
9814  }
9815  else if (entry_handler != NULL && entry_data != NULL)
9816  {
9817  // Let type handler parse the line
9818  entry_handler->ReadLineFn(&g, entry_handler, entry_data, line);
9819  }
9820  }
9821  g.SettingsLoaded = true;
9822 
9823  // [DEBUG] Restore untouched copy so it can be browsed in Metrics (not strictly necessary)
9824  memcpy(buf, ini_data, ini_size);
9825 
9826  // Call post-read handlers
9827  for (int handler_n = 0; handler_n < g.SettingsHandlers.Size; handler_n++)
9828  if (g.SettingsHandlers[handler_n].ApplyAllFn)
9829  g.SettingsHandlers[handler_n].ApplyAllFn(&g, &g.SettingsHandlers[handler_n]);
9830 }
9831 
9832 void ImGui::SaveIniSettingsToDisk(const char* ini_filename)
9833 {
9834  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9835  g.SettingsDirtyTimer = 0.0f;
9836  if (!ini_filename)
9837  return;
9838 
9839  size_t ini_data_size = 0;
9840  const char* ini_data = SaveIniSettingsToMemory(&ini_data_size);
9841  ImFileHandle f = ImFileOpen(ini_filename, "wt");
9842  if (!f)
9843  return;
9844  ImFileWrite(ini_data, sizeof(char), ini_data_size, f);
9845  ImFileClose(f);
9846 }
9847 
9848 // Call registered handlers (e.g. SettingsHandlerWindow_WriteAll() + custom handlers) to write their stuff into a text buffer
9849 const char* ImGui::SaveIniSettingsToMemory(size_t* out_size)
9850 {
9851  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9852  g.SettingsDirtyTimer = 0.0f;
9853  g.SettingsIniData.Buf.resize(0);
9854  g.SettingsIniData.Buf.push_back(0);
9855  for (int handler_n = 0; handler_n < g.SettingsHandlers.Size; handler_n++)
9856  {
9857  ImGuiSettingsHandler* handler = &g.SettingsHandlers[handler_n];
9858  handler->WriteAllFn(&g, handler, &g.SettingsIniData);
9859  }
9860  if (out_size)
9861  *out_size = (size_t)g.SettingsIniData.size();
9862  return g.SettingsIniData.c_str();
9863 }
9864 
9865 static void WindowSettingsHandler_ClearAll(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiSettingsHandler*)
9866 {
9867  ImGuiContext& g = *ctx;
9868  for (int i = 0; i != g.Windows.Size; i++)
9869  g.Windows[i]->SettingsOffset = -1;
9870  g.SettingsWindows.clear();
9871 }
9872 
9873 static void* WindowSettingsHandler_ReadOpen(ImGuiContext*, ImGuiSettingsHandler*, const char* name)
9874 {
9875  ImGuiWindowSettings* settings = ImGui::FindOrCreateWindowSettings(name);
9876  ImGuiID id = settings->ID;
9877  *settings = ImGuiWindowSettings(); // Clear existing if recycling previous entry
9878  settings->ID = id;
9879  settings->WantApply = true;
9880  return (void*)settings;
9881 }
9882 
9883 static void WindowSettingsHandler_ReadLine(ImGuiContext*, ImGuiSettingsHandler*, void* entry, const char* line)
9884 {
9885  ImGuiWindowSettings* settings = (ImGuiWindowSettings*)entry;
9886  int x, y;
9887  int i;
9888  if (sscanf(line, "Pos=%i,%i", &x, &y) == 2) settings->Pos = ImVec2ih((short)x, (short)y);
9889  else if (sscanf(line, "Size=%i,%i", &x, &y) == 2) settings->Size = ImVec2ih((short)x, (short)y);
9890  else if (sscanf(line, "Collapsed=%d", &i) == 1) settings->Collapsed = (i != 0);
9891 }
9892 
9893 // Apply to existing windows (if any)
9894 static void WindowSettingsHandler_ApplyAll(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiSettingsHandler*)
9895 {
9896  ImGuiContext& g = *ctx;
9897  for (ImGuiWindowSettings* settings = g.SettingsWindows.begin(); settings != NULL; settings = g.SettingsWindows.next_chunk(settings))
9898  if (settings->WantApply)
9899  {
9900  if (ImGuiWindow* window = ImGui::FindWindowByID(settings->ID))
9901  ApplyWindowSettings(window, settings);
9902  settings->WantApply = false;
9903  }
9904 }
9905 
9906 static void WindowSettingsHandler_WriteAll(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiSettingsHandler* handler, ImGuiTextBuffer* buf)
9907 {
9908  // Gather data from windows that were active during this session
9909  // (if a window wasn't opened in this session we preserve its settings)
9910  ImGuiContext& g = *ctx;
9911  for (int i = 0; i != g.Windows.Size; i++)
9912  {
9913  ImGuiWindow* window = g.Windows[i];
9914  if (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoSavedSettings)
9915  continue;
9916 
9917  ImGuiWindowSettings* settings = (window->SettingsOffset != -1) ? g.SettingsWindows.ptr_from_offset(window->SettingsOffset) : ImGui::FindWindowSettings(window->ID);
9918  if (!settings)
9919  {
9920  settings = ImGui::CreateNewWindowSettings(window->Name);
9921  window->SettingsOffset = g.SettingsWindows.offset_from_ptr(settings);
9922  }
9923  IM_ASSERT(settings->ID == window->ID);
9924  settings->Pos = ImVec2ih((short)window->Pos.x, (short)window->Pos.y);
9925  settings->Size = ImVec2ih((short)window->SizeFull.x, (short)window->SizeFull.y);
9926  settings->Collapsed = window->Collapsed;
9927  }
9928 
9929  // Write to text buffer
9930  buf->reserve(buf->size() + g.SettingsWindows.size() * 6); // ballpark reserve
9931  for (ImGuiWindowSettings* settings = g.SettingsWindows.begin(); settings != NULL; settings = g.SettingsWindows.next_chunk(settings))
9932  {
9933  const char* settings_name = settings->GetName();
9934  buf->appendf("[%s][%s]\n", handler->TypeName, settings_name);
9935  buf->appendf("Pos=%d,%d\n", settings->Pos.x, settings->Pos.y);
9936  buf->appendf("Size=%d,%d\n", settings->Size.x, settings->Size.y);
9937  buf->appendf("Collapsed=%d\n", settings->Collapsed);
9938  buf->append("\n");
9939  }
9940 }
9941 
9942 
9943 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
9944 // [SECTION] VIEWPORTS, PLATFORM WINDOWS
9945 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
9946 
9947 // (this section is filled in the 'docking' branch)
9948 
9949 
9950 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
9951 // [SECTION] DOCKING
9952 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
9953 
9954 // (this section is filled in the 'docking' branch)
9955 
9956 
9957 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
9958 // [SECTION] PLATFORM DEPENDENT HELPERS
9959 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
9960 
9961 #if defined(_WIN32) && !defined(IMGUI_DISABLE_WIN32_FUNCTIONS) && !defined(IMGUI_DISABLE_WIN32_DEFAULT_CLIPBOARD_FUNCTIONS)
9962 
9963 #ifdef _MSC_VER
9964 #pragma comment(lib, "user32")
9965 #pragma comment(lib, "kernel32")
9966 #endif
9967 
9968 // Win32 clipboard implementation
9969 // We use g.ClipboardHandlerData for temporary storage to ensure it is freed on Shutdown()
9970 static const char* GetClipboardTextFn_DefaultImpl(void*)
9971 {
9972  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9973  g.ClipboardHandlerData.clear();
9974  if (!::OpenClipboard(NULL))
9975  return NULL;
9976  HANDLE wbuf_handle = ::GetClipboardData(CF_UNICODETEXT);
9977  if (wbuf_handle == NULL)
9978  {
9979  ::CloseClipboard();
9980  return NULL;
9981  }
9982  if (const WCHAR* wbuf_global = (const WCHAR*)::GlobalLock(wbuf_handle))
9983  {
9984  int buf_len = ::WideCharToMultiByte(CP_UTF8, 0, wbuf_global, -1, NULL, 0, NULL, NULL);
9985  g.ClipboardHandlerData.resize(buf_len);
9986  ::WideCharToMultiByte(CP_UTF8, 0, wbuf_global, -1, g.ClipboardHandlerData.Data, buf_len, NULL, NULL);
9987  }
9988  ::GlobalUnlock(wbuf_handle);
9989  ::CloseClipboard();
9990  return g.ClipboardHandlerData.Data;
9991 }
9992 
9993 static void SetClipboardTextFn_DefaultImpl(void*, const char* text)
9994 {
9995  if (!::OpenClipboard(NULL))
9996  return;
9997  const int wbuf_length = ::MultiByteToWideChar(CP_UTF8, 0, text, -1, NULL, 0);
9998  HGLOBAL wbuf_handle = ::GlobalAlloc(GMEM_MOVEABLE, (SIZE_T)wbuf_length * sizeof(WCHAR));
9999  if (wbuf_handle == NULL)
10000  {
10001  ::CloseClipboard();
10002  return;
10003  }
10004  WCHAR* wbuf_global = (WCHAR*)::GlobalLock(wbuf_handle);
10005  ::MultiByteToWideChar(CP_UTF8, 0, text, -1, wbuf_global, wbuf_length);
10006  ::GlobalUnlock(wbuf_handle);
10007  ::EmptyClipboard();
10008  if (::SetClipboardData(CF_UNICODETEXT, wbuf_handle) == NULL)
10009  ::GlobalFree(wbuf_handle);
10010  ::CloseClipboard();
10011 }
10012 
10013 #elif defined(__APPLE__) && TARGET_OS_OSX && defined(IMGUI_ENABLE_OSX_DEFAULT_CLIPBOARD_FUNCTIONS)
10014 
10015 #include <Carbon/Carbon.h> // Use old API to avoid need for separate .mm file
10016 static PasteboardRef main_clipboard = 0;
10017 
10018 // OSX clipboard implementation
10019 // If you enable this you will need to add '-framework ApplicationServices' to your linker command-line!
10020 static void SetClipboardTextFn_DefaultImpl(void*, const char* text)
10021 {
10022  if (!main_clipboard)
10023  PasteboardCreate(kPasteboardClipboard, &main_clipboard);
10024  PasteboardClear(main_clipboard);
10025  CFDataRef cf_data = CFDataCreate(kCFAllocatorDefault, (const UInt8*)text, strlen(text));
10026  if (cf_data)
10027  {
10028  PasteboardPutItemFlavor(main_clipboard, (PasteboardItemID)1, CFSTR("public.utf8-plain-text"), cf_data, 0);
10029  CFRelease(cf_data);
10030  }
10031 }
10032 
10033 static const char* GetClipboardTextFn_DefaultImpl(void*)
10034 {
10035  if (!main_clipboard)
10036  PasteboardCreate(kPasteboardClipboard, &main_clipboard);
10037  PasteboardSynchronize(main_clipboard);
10038 
10039  ItemCount item_count = 0;
10040  PasteboardGetItemCount(main_clipboard, &item_count);
10041  for (ItemCount i = 0; i < item_count; i++)
10042  {
10043  PasteboardItemID item_id = 0;
10044  PasteboardGetItemIdentifier(main_clipboard, i + 1, &item_id);
10045  CFArrayRef flavor_type_array = 0;
10046  PasteboardCopyItemFlavors(main_clipboard, item_id, &flavor_type_array);
10047  for (CFIndex j = 0, nj = CFArrayGetCount(flavor_type_array); j < nj; j++)
10048  {
10049  CFDataRef cf_data;
10050  if (PasteboardCopyItemFlavorData(main_clipboard, item_id, CFSTR("public.utf8-plain-text"), &cf_data) == noErr)
10051  {
10052  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10053  g.ClipboardHandlerData.clear();
10054  int length = (int)CFDataGetLength(cf_data);
10055  g.ClipboardHandlerData.resize(length + 1);
10056  CFDataGetBytes(cf_data, CFRangeMake(0, length), (UInt8*)g.ClipboardHandlerData.Data);
10057  g.ClipboardHandlerData[length] = 0;
10058  CFRelease(cf_data);
10059  return g.ClipboardHandlerData.Data;
10060  }
10061  }
10062  }
10063  return NULL;
10064 }
10065 
10066 #else
10067 
10068 // Local Dear ImGui-only clipboard implementation, if user hasn't defined better clipboard handlers.
10069 static const char* GetClipboardTextFn_DefaultImpl(void*)
10070 {
10071  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10072  return g.ClipboardHandlerData.empty() ? NULL : g.ClipboardHandlerData.begin();
10073 }
10074 
10075 static void SetClipboardTextFn_DefaultImpl(void*, const char* text)
10076 {
10077  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10078  g.ClipboardHandlerData.clear();
10079  const char* text_end = text + strlen(text);
10080  g.ClipboardHandlerData.resize((int)(text_end - text) + 1);
10081  memcpy(&g.ClipboardHandlerData[0], text, (size_t)(text_end - text));
10082  g.ClipboardHandlerData[(int)(text_end - text)] = 0;
10083 }
10084 
10085 #endif
10086 
10087 // Win32 API IME support (for Asian languages, etc.)
10088 #if defined(_WIN32) && !defined(__GNUC__) && !defined(IMGUI_DISABLE_WIN32_FUNCTIONS) && !defined(IMGUI_DISABLE_WIN32_DEFAULT_IME_FUNCTIONS)
10089 
10090 #include <imm.h>
10091 #ifdef _MSC_VER
10092 #pragma comment(lib, "imm32")
10093 #endif
10094 
10095 static void ImeSetInputScreenPosFn_DefaultImpl(int x, int y)
10096 {
10097  // Notify OS Input Method Editor of text input position
10098  ImGuiIO& io = ImGui::GetIO();
10099  if (HWND hwnd = (HWND)io.ImeWindowHandle)
10100  if (HIMC himc = ::ImmGetContext(hwnd))
10101  {
10102  COMPOSITIONFORM cf;
10103  cf.ptCurrentPos.x = x;
10104  cf.ptCurrentPos.y = y;
10105  cf.dwStyle = CFS_FORCE_POSITION;
10106  ::ImmSetCompositionWindow(himc, &cf);
10107  ::ImmReleaseContext(hwnd, himc);
10108  }
10109 }
10110 
10111 #else
10112 
10113 static void ImeSetInputScreenPosFn_DefaultImpl(int, int) {}
10114 
10115 #endif
10116 
10117 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
10118 // [SECTION] METRICS/DEBUG WINDOW
10119 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
10120 
10121 #ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_METRICS_WINDOW
10122 // Avoid naming collision with imgui_demo.cpp's HelpMarker() for unity builds.
10123 static void MetricsHelpMarker(const char* desc)
10124 {
10125  ImGui::TextDisabled("(?)");
10126  if (ImGui::IsItemHovered())
10127  {
10128  ImGui::BeginTooltip();
10129  ImGui::PushTextWrapPos(ImGui::GetFontSize() * 35.0f);
10130  ImGui::TextUnformatted(desc);
10131  ImGui::PopTextWrapPos();
10132  ImGui::EndTooltip();
10133  }
10134 }
10135 
10136 void ImGui::ShowMetricsWindow(bool* p_open)
10137 {
10138  if (!ImGui::Begin("Dear ImGui Metrics", p_open))
10139  {
10140  ImGui::End();
10141  return;
10142  }
10143 
10144  // Debugging enums
10145  enum { WRT_OuterRect, WRT_OuterRectClipped, WRT_InnerRect, WRT_InnerClipRect, WRT_WorkRect, WRT_Content, WRT_ContentRegionRect, WRT_Count }; // Windows Rect Type
10146  const char* wrt_rects_names[WRT_Count] = { "OuterRect", "OuterRectClipped", "InnerRect", "InnerClipRect", "WorkRect", "Content", "ContentRegionRect" };
10147  enum { TRT_OuterRect, TRT_WorkRect, TRT_HostClipRect, TRT_InnerClipRect, TRT_BackgroundClipRect, TRT_ColumnsRect, TRT_ColumnsClipRect, TRT_ColumnsContentHeadersUsed, TRT_ColumnsContentHeadersIdeal, TRT_ColumnsContentRowsFrozen, TRT_ColumnsContentRowsUnfrozen, TRT_Count }; // Tables Rect Type
10148  const char* trt_rects_names[TRT_Count] = { "OuterRect", "WorkRect", "HostClipRect", "InnerClipRect", "BackgroundClipRect", "ColumnsRect", "ColumnsClipRect", "ColumnsContentHeadersUsed", "ColumnsContentHeadersIdeal", "ColumnsContentRowsFrozen", "ColumnsContentRowsUnfrozen" };
10149 
10150  // State
10151  static bool show_windows_rects = false;
10152  static int show_windows_rect_type = WRT_WorkRect;
10153  static bool show_windows_begin_order = false;
10154  static bool show_tables_rects = false;
10155  static int show_tables_rect_type = TRT_WorkRect;
10156  static bool show_drawcmd_mesh = true;
10157  static bool show_drawcmd_aabb = true;
10158 
10159  // Basic info
10160  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10161  ImGuiIO& io = ImGui::GetIO();
10162  ImGui::Text("Dear ImGui %s", ImGui::GetVersion());
10163  ImGui::Text("Application average %.3f ms/frame (%.1f FPS)", 1000.0f / io.Framerate, io.Framerate);
10164  ImGui::Text("%d vertices, %d indices (%d triangles)", io.MetricsRenderVertices, io.MetricsRenderIndices, io.MetricsRenderIndices / 3);
10165  ImGui::Text("%d active windows (%d visible)", io.MetricsActiveWindows, io.MetricsRenderWindows);
10166  ImGui::Text("%d active allocations", io.MetricsActiveAllocations);
10167  ImGui::Separator();
10168 
10169  // Helper functions to display common structures:
10170  // - NodeDrawList()
10171  // - NodeColumns()
10172  // - NodeWindow()
10173  // - NodeWindows()
10174  // - NodeTabBar()
10175  // - NodeStorage()
10176  struct Funcs
10177  {
10178  static ImRect GetWindowRect(ImGuiWindow* window, int rect_type)
10179  {
10180  if (rect_type == WRT_OuterRect) { return window->Rect(); }
10181  else if (rect_type == WRT_OuterRectClipped) { return window->OuterRectClipped; }
10182  else if (rect_type == WRT_InnerRect) { return window->InnerRect; }
10183  else if (rect_type == WRT_InnerClipRect) { return window->InnerClipRect; }
10184  else if (rect_type == WRT_WorkRect) { return window->WorkRect; }
10185  else if (rect_type == WRT_Content) { ImVec2 min = window->InnerRect.Min - window->Scroll + window->WindowPadding; return ImRect(min, min + window->ContentSize); }
10186  else if (rect_type == WRT_ContentRegionRect) { return window->ContentRegionRect; }
10187  IM_ASSERT(0);
10188  return ImRect();
10189  }
10190 
10191  static void NodeDrawCmdShowMeshAndBoundingBox(ImGuiWindow* window, const ImDrawList* draw_list, const ImDrawCmd* draw_cmd, int elem_offset, bool show_mesh, bool show_aabb)
10192  {
10193  IM_ASSERT(show_mesh || show_aabb);
10194  ImDrawList* fg_draw_list = GetForegroundDrawList(window); // Render additional visuals into the top-most draw list
10195  ImDrawIdx* idx_buffer = (draw_list->IdxBuffer.Size > 0) ? draw_list->IdxBuffer.Data : NULL;
10196 
10197  // Draw wire-frame version of all triangles
10198  ImRect clip_rect = draw_cmd->ClipRect;
10199  ImRect vtxs_rect(FLT_MAX, FLT_MAX, -FLT_MAX, -FLT_MAX);
10200  ImDrawListFlags backup_flags = fg_draw_list->Flags;
10201  fg_draw_list->Flags &= ~ImDrawListFlags_AntiAliasedLines; // Disable AA on triangle outlines is more readable for very large and thin triangles.
10202  for (unsigned int base_idx = elem_offset; base_idx < (elem_offset + draw_cmd->ElemCount); base_idx += 3)
10203  {
10204  ImVec2 triangle[3];
10205  for (int n = 0; n < 3; n++)
10206  {
10207  ImVec2 p = draw_list->VtxBuffer[idx_buffer ? idx_buffer[base_idx + n] : (base_idx + n)].pos;
10208  triangle[n] = p;
10209  vtxs_rect.Add(p);
10210  }
10211  if (show_mesh)
10212  fg_draw_list->AddPolyline(triangle, 3, IM_COL32(255, 255, 0, 255), true, 1.0f); // In yellow: mesh triangles
10213  }
10214  // Draw bounding boxes
10215  if (show_aabb)
10216  {
10217  fg_draw_list->AddRect(ImFloor(clip_rect.Min), ImFloor(clip_rect.Max), IM_COL32(255, 0, 255, 255)); // In pink: clipping rectangle submitted to GPU
10218  fg_draw_list->AddRect(ImFloor(vtxs_rect.Min), ImFloor(vtxs_rect.Max), IM_COL32(0, 255, 255, 255)); // In cyan: bounding box of triangles
10219  }
10220  fg_draw_list->Flags = backup_flags;
10221  }
10222 
10223  static void NodeDrawList(ImGuiWindow* window, ImDrawList* draw_list, const char* label)
10224  {
10225  bool node_open = ImGui::TreeNode(draw_list, "%s: '%s' %d vtx, %d indices, %d cmds", label, draw_list->_OwnerName ? draw_list->_OwnerName : "", draw_list->VtxBuffer.Size, draw_list->IdxBuffer.Size, draw_list->CmdBuffer.Size);
10226  if (draw_list == ImGui::GetWindowDrawList())
10227  {
10228  ImGui::SameLine();
10229  ImGui::TextColored(ImVec4(1.0f, 0.4f, 0.4f, 1.0f), "CURRENTLY APPENDING"); // Can't display stats for active draw list! (we don't have the data double-buffered)
10230  if (node_open) ImGui::TreePop();
10231  return;
10232  }
10233 
10234  ImDrawList* fg_draw_list = GetForegroundDrawList(window); // Render additional visuals into the top-most draw list
10235  if (window && IsItemHovered())
10236  fg_draw_list->AddRect(window->Pos, window->Pos + window->Size, IM_COL32(255, 255, 0, 255));
10237  if (!node_open)
10238  return;
10239 
10240  if (window && !window->WasActive)
10241  ImGui::TextDisabled("Warning: owning Window is inactive. This DrawList is not being rendered!");
10242 
10243  unsigned int elem_offset = 0;
10244  for (const ImDrawCmd* pcmd = draw_list->CmdBuffer.begin(); pcmd < draw_list->CmdBuffer.end(); elem_offset += pcmd->ElemCount, pcmd++)
10245  {
10246  if (pcmd->UserCallback == NULL && pcmd->ElemCount == 0)
10247  continue;
10248  if (pcmd->UserCallback)
10249  {
10250  ImGui::BulletText("Callback %p, user_data %p", pcmd->UserCallback, pcmd->UserCallbackData);
10251  continue;
10252  }
10253 
10254  ImDrawIdx* idx_buffer = (draw_list->IdxBuffer.Size > 0) ? draw_list->IdxBuffer.Data : NULL;
10255  char buf[300];
10256  ImFormatString(buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf), "DrawCmd:%5d triangles, Tex 0x%p, ClipRect (%4.0f,%4.0f)-(%4.0f,%4.0f)",
10257  pcmd->ElemCount / 3, (void*)(intptr_t)pcmd->TextureId,
10258  pcmd->ClipRect.x, pcmd->ClipRect.y, pcmd->ClipRect.z, pcmd->ClipRect.w);
10259  bool pcmd_node_open = ImGui::TreeNode((void*)(pcmd - draw_list->CmdBuffer.begin()), "%s", buf);
10260  if (ImGui::IsItemHovered() && (show_drawcmd_mesh || show_drawcmd_aabb) && fg_draw_list)
10261  NodeDrawCmdShowMeshAndBoundingBox(window, draw_list, pcmd, elem_offset, show_drawcmd_mesh, show_drawcmd_aabb);
10262  if (!pcmd_node_open)
10263  continue;
10264 
10265  // Calculate approximate coverage area (touched pixel count)
10266  // This will be in pixels squared as long there's no post-scaling happening to the renderer output.
10267  float total_area = 0.0f;
10268  for (unsigned int base_idx = elem_offset; base_idx < (elem_offset + pcmd->ElemCount); base_idx += 3)
10269  {
10270  ImVec2 triangle[3];
10271  for (int n = 0; n < 3; n++)
10272  triangle[n] = draw_list->VtxBuffer[idx_buffer ? idx_buffer[base_idx + n] : (base_idx + n)].pos;
10273  total_area += ImTriangleArea(triangle[0], triangle[1], triangle[2]);
10274  }
10275 
10276  // Display vertex information summary. Hover to get all triangles drawn in wire-frame
10277  ImFormatString(buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf), "Mesh: ElemCount: %d, VtxOffset: +%d, IdxOffset: +%d, Area: ~%0.f px", pcmd->ElemCount, pcmd->VtxOffset, pcmd->IdxOffset, total_area);
10278  ImGui::Selectable(buf);
10279  if (ImGui::IsItemHovered() && fg_draw_list)
10280  NodeDrawCmdShowMeshAndBoundingBox(window, draw_list, pcmd, elem_offset, true, false);
10281 
10282  // Display individual triangles/vertices. Hover on to get the corresponding triangle highlighted.
10283  ImGuiListClipper clipper(pcmd->ElemCount / 3); // Manually coarse clip our print out of individual vertices to save CPU, only items that may be visible.
10284  while (clipper.Step())
10285  for (int prim = clipper.DisplayStart, idx_i = elem_offset + clipper.DisplayStart * 3; prim < clipper.DisplayEnd; prim++)
10286  {
10287  char* buf_p = buf, *buf_end = buf + IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf);
10288  ImVec2 triangle[3];
10289  for (int n = 0; n < 3; n++, idx_i++)
10290  {
10291  ImDrawVert& v = draw_list->VtxBuffer[idx_buffer ? idx_buffer[idx_i] : idx_i];
10292  triangle[n] = v.pos;
10293  buf_p += ImFormatString(buf_p, buf_end - buf_p, "%s %04d: pos (%8.2f,%8.2f), uv (%.6f,%.6f), col %08X\n",
10294  (n == 0) ? "Vert:" : " ", idx_i, v.pos.x, v.pos.y, v.uv.x, v.uv.y, v.col);
10295  }
10296 
10297  ImGui::Selectable(buf, false);
10298  if (fg_draw_list && ImGui::IsItemHovered())
10299  {
10300  ImDrawListFlags backup_flags = fg_draw_list->Flags;
10301  fg_draw_list->Flags &= ~ImDrawListFlags_AntiAliasedLines; // Disable AA on triangle outlines is more readable for very large and thin triangles.
10302  fg_draw_list->AddPolyline(triangle, 3, IM_COL32(255,255,0,255), true, 1.0f);
10303  fg_draw_list->Flags = backup_flags;
10304  }
10305  }
10306  ImGui::TreePop();
10307  }
10308  ImGui::TreePop();
10309  }
10310 
10311  static void NodeColumns(const ImGuiColumns* columns)
10312  {
10313  if (!ImGui::TreeNode((void*)(uintptr_t)columns->ID, "Columns Id: 0x%08X, Count: %d, Flags: 0x%04X", columns->ID, columns->Count, columns->Flags))
10314  return;
10315  ImGui::BulletText("Width: %.1f (MinX: %.1f, MaxX: %.1f)", columns->OffMaxX - columns->OffMinX, columns->OffMinX, columns->OffMaxX);
10316  for (int column_n = 0; column_n < columns->Columns.Size; column_n++)
10317  ImGui::BulletText("Column %02d: OffsetNorm %.3f (= %.1f px)", column_n, columns->Columns[column_n].OffsetNorm, GetColumnOffsetFromNorm(columns, columns->Columns[column_n].OffsetNorm));
10318  ImGui::TreePop();
10319  }
10320 
10321  static void NodeWindows(ImVector<ImGuiWindow*>& windows, const char* label)
10322  {
10323  if (!ImGui::TreeNode(label, "%s (%d)", label, windows.Size))
10324  return;
10325  for (int i = 0; i < windows.Size; i++)
10326  {
10327  ImGui::PushID(windows[i]);
10328  Funcs::NodeWindow(windows[i], "Window");
10329  ImGui::PopID();
10330  }
10331  ImGui::TreePop();
10332  }
10333 
10334  static void NodeWindow(ImGuiWindow* window, const char* label)
10335  {
10336  if (window == NULL)
10337  {
10338  ImGui::BulletText("%s: NULL", label);
10339  return;
10340  }
10341  bool open = ImGui::TreeNode(label, "%s '%s', %d @ 0x%p", label, window->Name, (window->Active || window->WasActive), window);
10342  if (ImGui::IsItemHovered() && window->WasActive)
10343  ImGui::GetForegroundDrawList()->AddRect(window->Pos, window->Pos + window->Size, IM_COL32(255, 255, 0, 255));
10344  if (!open)
10345  return;
10346 
10347  if (!window->WasActive)
10348  ImGui::TextDisabled("Note: window is not currently visible.");
10349  if (window->MemoryCompacted)
10350  ImGui::TextDisabled("Note: some memory buffers have been compacted/freed.");
10351 
10352  ImGuiWindowFlags flags = window->Flags;
10353  NodeDrawList(window, window->DrawList, "DrawList");
10354  ImGui::BulletText("Pos: (%.1f,%.1f), Size: (%.1f,%.1f), ContentSize (%.1f,%.1f)", window->Pos.x, window->Pos.y, window->Size.x, window->Size.y, window->ContentSize.x, window->ContentSize.y);
10355  ImGui::BulletText("Flags: 0x%08X (%s%s%s%s%s%s%s%s%s..)", flags,
10356  (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) ? "Child " : "", (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip) ? "Tooltip " : "", (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup) ? "Popup " : "",
10357  (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Modal) ? "Modal " : "", (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildMenu) ? "ChildMenu " : "", (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoSavedSettings) ? "NoSavedSettings " : "",
10358  (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMouseInputs)? "NoMouseInputs":"", (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavInputs) ? "NoNavInputs" : "", (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize) ? "AlwaysAutoResize" : "");
10359  ImGui::BulletText("Scroll: (%.2f/%.2f,%.2f/%.2f) Scrollbar:%s%s", window->Scroll.x, window->ScrollMax.x, window->Scroll.y, window->ScrollMax.y, window->ScrollbarX ? "X" : "", window->ScrollbarY ? "Y" : "");
10360  ImGui::BulletText("Active: %d/%d, WriteAccessed: %d, BeginOrderWithinContext: %d", window->Active, window->WasActive, window->WriteAccessed, (window->Active || window->WasActive) ? window->BeginOrderWithinContext : -1);
10361  ImGui::BulletText("Appearing: %d, Hidden: %d (CanSkip %d Cannot %d), SkipItems: %d", window->Appearing, window->Hidden, window->HiddenFramesCanSkipItems, window->HiddenFramesCannotSkipItems, window->SkipItems);
10362  ImGui::BulletText("NavLastIds: 0x%08X,0x%08X, NavLayerActiveMask: %X", window->NavLastIds[0], window->NavLastIds[1], window->DC.NavLayerActiveMask);
10363  ImGui::BulletText("NavLastChildNavWindow: %s", window->NavLastChildNavWindow ? window->NavLastChildNavWindow->Name : "NULL");
10364  if (!window->NavRectRel[0].IsInverted())
10365  ImGui::BulletText("NavRectRel[0]: (%.1f,%.1f)(%.1f,%.1f)", window->NavRectRel[0].Min.x, window->NavRectRel[0].Min.y, window->NavRectRel[0].Max.x, window->NavRectRel[0].Max.y);
10366  else
10367  ImGui::BulletText("NavRectRel[0]: <None>");
10368  if (window->RootWindow != window) NodeWindow(window->RootWindow, "RootWindow");
10369  if (window->ParentWindow != NULL) NodeWindow(window->ParentWindow, "ParentWindow");
10370  if (window->DC.ChildWindows.Size > 0) NodeWindows(window->DC.ChildWindows, "ChildWindows");
10371  if (window->ColumnsStorage.Size > 0 && ImGui::TreeNode("Columns", "Columns sets (%d)", window->ColumnsStorage.Size))
10372  {
10373  for (int n = 0; n < window->ColumnsStorage.Size; n++)
10374  NodeColumns(&window->ColumnsStorage[n]);
10375  ImGui::TreePop();
10376  }
10377  NodeStorage(&window->StateStorage, "Storage");
10378  ImGui::TreePop();
10379  }
10380 
10381  static void NodeWindowSettings(ImGuiWindowSettings* settings)
10382  {
10383  ImGui::Text("0x%08X \"%s\" Pos (%d,%d) Size (%d,%d) Collapsed=%d",
10384  settings->ID, settings->GetName(), settings->Pos.x, settings->Pos.y, settings->Size.x, settings->Size.y, settings->Collapsed);
10385  }
10386 
10387  static void NodeTabBar(ImGuiTabBar* tab_bar)
10388  {
10389  // Standalone tab bars (not associated to docking/windows functionality) currently hold no discernible strings.
10390  char buf[256];
10391  char* p = buf;
10392  const char* buf_end = buf + IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf);
10393  p += ImFormatString(p, buf_end - p, "TabBar (%d tabs)%s", tab_bar->Tabs.Size, (tab_bar->PrevFrameVisible < ImGui::GetFrameCount() - 2) ? " *Inactive*" : "");
10394  IM_UNUSED(p);
10395  if (ImGui::TreeNode(tab_bar, "%s", buf))
10396  {
10397  for (int tab_n = 0; tab_n < tab_bar->Tabs.Size; tab_n++)
10398  {
10399  const ImGuiTabItem* tab = &tab_bar->Tabs[tab_n];
10400  ImGui::PushID(tab);
10401  if (ImGui::SmallButton("<")) { TabBarQueueChangeTabOrder(tab_bar, tab, -1); } ImGui::SameLine(0, 2);
10402  if (ImGui::SmallButton(">")) { TabBarQueueChangeTabOrder(tab_bar, tab, +1); } ImGui::SameLine();
10403  ImGui::Text("%02d%c Tab 0x%08X '%s'", tab_n, (tab->ID == tab_bar->SelectedTabId) ? '*' : ' ', tab->ID, (tab->NameOffset != -1) ? tab_bar->GetTabName(tab) : "");
10404  ImGui::PopID();
10405  }
10406  ImGui::TreePop();
10407  }
10408  }
10409 
10410  static void NodeStorage(ImGuiStorage* storage, const char* label)
10411  {
10412  if (!ImGui::TreeNode(label, "%s: %d entries, %d bytes", label, storage->Data.Size, storage->Data.size_in_bytes()))
10413  return;
10414  for (int n = 0; n < storage->Data.Size; n++)
10415  {
10416  const ImGuiStorage::ImGuiStoragePair& p = storage->Data[n];
10417  ImGui::BulletText("Key 0x%08X Value { i: %d }", p.key, p.val_i); // Important: we currently don't store a type, real value may not be integer.
10418  }
10419  ImGui::TreePop();
10420  }
10421  };
10422 
10423  // Tools
10424  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Tools"))
10425  {
10426  // The Item Picker tool is super useful to visually select an item and break into the call-stack of where it was submitted.
10427  if (ImGui::Button("Item Picker.."))
10428  ImGui::DebugStartItemPicker();
10429  ImGui::SameLine();
10430  MetricsHelpMarker("Will call the IM_DEBUG_BREAK() macro to break in debugger.\nWarning: If you don't have a debugger attached, this will probably crash.");
10431 
10432  ImGui::Checkbox("Show windows begin order", &show_windows_begin_order);
10433  ImGui::Checkbox("Show windows rectangles", &show_windows_rects);
10434  ImGui::SameLine();
10435  ImGui::SetNextItemWidth(ImGui::GetFontSize() * 12);
10436  show_windows_rects |= ImGui::Combo("##show_windows_rect_type", &show_windows_rect_type, wrt_rects_names, WRT_Count, WRT_Count);
10437  if (show_windows_rects && g.NavWindow)
10438  {
10439  ImGui::BulletText("'%s':", g.NavWindow->Name);
10440  ImGui::Indent();
10441  for (int rect_n = 0; rect_n < WRT_Count; rect_n++)
10442  {
10443  ImRect r = Funcs::GetWindowRect(g.NavWindow, rect_n);
10444  ImGui::Text("(%6.1f,%6.1f) (%6.1f,%6.1f) Size (%6.1f,%6.1f) %s", r.Min.x, r.Min.y, r.Max.x, r.Max.y, r.GetWidth(), r.GetHeight(), wrt_rects_names[rect_n]);
10445  }
10446  ImGui::Unindent();
10447  }
10448  ImGui::Checkbox("Show mesh when hovering ImDrawCmd", &show_drawcmd_mesh);
10449  ImGui::Checkbox("Show bounding boxes when hovering ImDrawCmd", &show_drawcmd_aabb);
10450  ImGui::TreePop();
10451  }
10452 
10453  // Contents
10454  Funcs::NodeWindows(g.Windows, "Windows");
10455  //Funcs::NodeWindows(g.WindowsFocusOrder, "WindowsFocusOrder");
10456  if (ImGui::TreeNode("DrawLists", "Active DrawLists (%d)", g.DrawDataBuilder.Layers[0].Size))
10457  {
10458  for (int i = 0; i < g.DrawDataBuilder.Layers[0].Size; i++)
10459  Funcs::NodeDrawList(NULL, g.DrawDataBuilder.Layers[0][i], "DrawList");
10460  ImGui::TreePop();
10461  }
10462 
10463  // Details for Popups
10464  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Popups", "Popups (%d)", g.OpenPopupStack.Size))
10465  {
10466  for (int i = 0; i < g.OpenPopupStack.Size; i++)
10467  {
10468  ImGuiWindow* window = g.OpenPopupStack[i].Window;
10469  ImGui::BulletText("PopupID: %08x, Window: '%s'%s%s", g.OpenPopupStack[i].PopupId, window ? window->Name : "NULL", window && (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) ? " ChildWindow" : "", window && (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildMenu) ? " ChildMenu" : "");
10470  }
10471  ImGui::TreePop();
10472  }
10473 
10474  // Details for TabBars
10475  if (ImGui::TreeNode("TabBars", "Tab Bars (%d)", g.TabBars.GetSize()))
10476  {
10477  for (int n = 0; n < g.TabBars.GetSize(); n++)
10478  Funcs::NodeTabBar(g.TabBars.GetByIndex(n));
10479  ImGui::TreePop();
10480  }
10481 
10482  // Details for Tables
10483  IM_UNUSED(trt_rects_names);
10484  IM_UNUSED(show_tables_rects);
10485  IM_UNUSED(show_tables_rect_type);
10486 #ifdef IMGUI_HAS_TABLE
10487  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Tables", "Tables (%d)", g.Tables.GetSize()))
10488  {
10489  for (int n = 0; n < g.Tables.GetSize(); n++)
10490  Funcs::NodeTable(g.Tables.GetByIndex(n));
10491  ImGui::TreePop();
10492  }
10493 #endif // #ifdef IMGUI_HAS_TABLE
10494 
10495  // Details for Docking
10496 #ifdef IMGUI_HAS_DOCK
10497  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Docking"))
10498  {
10499  ImGui::TreePop();
10500  }
10501 #endif // #ifdef IMGUI_HAS_DOCK
10502 
10503  // Settings
10504  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Settings"))
10505  {
10506  if (ImGui::SmallButton("Clear"))
10507  ImGui::ClearIniSettings();
10508  ImGui::SameLine();
10509  if (ImGui::SmallButton("Save to disk"))
10510  ImGui::SaveIniSettingsToDisk(g.IO.IniFilename);
10511  ImGui::SameLine();
10512  if (g.IO.IniFilename)
10513  ImGui::Text("\"%s\"", g.IO.IniFilename);
10514  else
10515  ImGui::TextUnformatted("<NULL>");
10516  ImGui::Text("SettingsDirtyTimer %.2f", g.SettingsDirtyTimer);
10517  if (ImGui::TreeNode("SettingsHandlers", "Settings handlers: (%d)", g.SettingsHandlers.Size))
10518  {
10519  for (int n = 0; n < g.SettingsHandlers.Size; n++)
10520  ImGui::TextUnformatted(g.SettingsHandlers[n].TypeName);
10521  ImGui::TreePop();
10522  }
10523  if (ImGui::TreeNode("SettingsWindows", "Settings packed data: Windows: %d bytes", g.SettingsWindows.size()))
10524  {
10525  for (ImGuiWindowSettings* settings = g.SettingsWindows.begin(); settings != NULL; settings = g.SettingsWindows.next_chunk(settings))
10526  Funcs::NodeWindowSettings(settings);
10527  ImGui::TreePop();
10528  }
10529 
10530 #ifdef IMGUI_HAS_TABLE
10531  if (ImGui::TreeNode("SettingsTables", "Settings packed data: Tables: %d bytes", g.SettingsTables.size()))
10532  {
10533  for (ImGuiTableSettings* settings = g.SettingsTables.begin(); settings != NULL; settings = g.SettingsTables.next_chunk(settings))
10534  Funcs::NodeTableSettings(settings);
10535  ImGui::TreePop();
10536  }
10537 #endif // #ifdef IMGUI_HAS_TABLE
10538 
10539 #ifdef IMGUI_HAS_DOCK
10540 #endif // #ifdef IMGUI_HAS_DOCK
10541 
10542  if (ImGui::TreeNode("SettingsIniData", "Settings unpacked data (.ini): %d bytes", g.SettingsIniData.size()))
10543  {
10544  char* buf = (char*)(void*)(g.SettingsIniData.Buf.Data ? g.SettingsIniData.Buf.Data : "");
10545  ImGui::InputTextMultiline("##Ini", buf, g.SettingsIniData.Buf.Size, ImVec2(-FLT_MIN, 0.0f), ImGuiInputTextFlags_ReadOnly);
10546  ImGui::TreePop();
10547  }
10548  ImGui::TreePop();
10549  }
10550 
10551  // Misc Details
10552  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Internal state"))
10553  {
10554  const char* input_source_names[] = { "None", "Mouse", "Nav", "NavKeyboard", "NavGamepad" }; IM_ASSERT(IM_ARRAYSIZE(input_source_names) == ImGuiInputSource_COUNT);
10555  ImGui::Text("HoveredWindow: '%s'", g.HoveredWindow ? g.HoveredWindow->Name : "NULL");
10556  ImGui::Text("HoveredRootWindow: '%s'", g.HoveredRootWindow ? g.HoveredRootWindow->Name : "NULL");
10557  ImGui::Text("HoveredId: 0x%08X/0x%08X (%.2f sec), AllowOverlap: %d", g.HoveredId, g.HoveredIdPreviousFrame, g.HoveredIdTimer, g.HoveredIdAllowOverlap); // Data is "in-flight" so depending on when the Metrics window is called we may see current frame information or not
10558  ImGui::Text("ActiveId: 0x%08X/0x%08X (%.2f sec), AllowOverlap: %d, Source: %s", g.ActiveId, g.ActiveIdPreviousFrame, g.ActiveIdTimer, g.ActiveIdAllowOverlap, input_source_names[g.ActiveIdSource]);
10559  ImGui::Text("ActiveIdWindow: '%s'", g.ActiveIdWindow ? g.ActiveIdWindow->Name : "NULL");
10560  ImGui::Text("MovingWindow: '%s'", g.MovingWindow ? g.MovingWindow->Name : "NULL");
10561  ImGui::Text("NavWindow: '%s'", g.NavWindow ? g.NavWindow->Name : "NULL");
10562  ImGui::Text("NavId: 0x%08X, NavLayer: %d", g.NavId, g.NavLayer);
10563  ImGui::Text("NavInputSource: %s", input_source_names[g.NavInputSource]);
10564  ImGui::Text("NavActive: %d, NavVisible: %d", g.IO.NavActive, g.IO.NavVisible);
10565  ImGui::Text("NavActivateId: 0x%08X, NavInputId: 0x%08X", g.NavActivateId, g.NavInputId);
10566  ImGui::Text("NavDisableHighlight: %d, NavDisableMouseHover: %d", g.NavDisableHighlight, g.NavDisableMouseHover);
10567  ImGui::Text("NavWindowingTarget: '%s'", g.NavWindowingTarget ? g.NavWindowingTarget->Name : "NULL");
10568  ImGui::Text("DragDrop: %d, SourceId = 0x%08X, Payload \"%s\" (%d bytes)", g.DragDropActive, g.DragDropPayload.SourceId, g.DragDropPayload.DataType, g.DragDropPayload.DataSize);
10569  ImGui::TreePop();
10570  }
10571 
10572  // Overlay: Display windows Rectangles and Begin Order
10573  if (show_windows_rects || show_windows_begin_order)
10574  {
10575  for (int n = 0; n < g.Windows.Size; n++)
10576  {
10577  ImGuiWindow* window = g.Windows[n];
10578  if (!window->WasActive)
10579  continue;
10580  ImDrawList* draw_list = GetForegroundDrawList(window);
10581  if (show_windows_rects)
10582  {
10583  ImRect r = Funcs::GetWindowRect(window, show_windows_rect_type);
10584  draw_list->AddRect(r.Min, r.Max, IM_COL32(255, 0, 128, 255));
10585  }
10586  if (show_windows_begin_order && !(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow))
10587  {
10588  char buf[32];
10589  ImFormatString(buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf), "%d", window->BeginOrderWithinContext);
10590  float font_size = ImGui::GetFontSize();
10591  draw_list->AddRectFilled(window->Pos, window->Pos + ImVec2(font_size, font_size), IM_COL32(200, 100, 100, 255));
10592  draw_list->AddText(window->Pos, IM_COL32(255, 255, 255, 255), buf);
10593  }
10594  }
10595  }
10596 
10597 #ifdef IMGUI_HAS_TABLE
10598  // Overlay: Display Tables Rectangles
10599  if (show_tables_rects)
10600  {
10601  for (int table_n = 0; table_n < g.Tables.GetSize(); table_n++)
10602  {
10603  ImGuiTable* table = g.Tables.GetByIndex(table_n);
10604  }
10605  }
10606 #endif // #ifdef IMGUI_HAS_TABLE
10607 
10608 #ifdef IMGUI_HAS_DOCK
10609  // Overlay: Display Docking info
10610  if (show_docking_nodes && g.IO.KeyCtrl)
10611  {
10612  }
10613 #endif // #ifdef IMGUI_HAS_DOCK
10614 
10615  ImGui::End();
10616 }
10617 
10618 #else
10619 
10620 void ImGui::ShowMetricsWindow(bool*) { }
10621 
10622 #endif
10623 
10624 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
10625 
10626 // Include imgui_user.inl at the end of imgui.cpp to access private data/functions that aren't exposed.
10627 // Prefer just including imgui_internal.h from your code rather than using this define. If a declaration is missing from imgui_internal.h add it or request it on the github.
10628 #ifdef IMGUI_INCLUDE_IMGUI_USER_INL
10629 #include "imgui_user.inl"
10630 #endif
10631 
10632 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
10633 
10634 #endif // #ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE
